author: Tyree, Omar
description: A collection of short stories featuring African American preteen boys as central characters. These diverse characters are funny, serious, edgy, and studious.
title: 12 brown boys

author: Krasner, Barbara
description: Shares tips for creating and maintaining a blog. Includes a checklist, a glossary, resources for further information, and color photographs.
title: 12 great tips on writing a blog

author: Pearson, Yvonne
description: Shares twelve tips for writing poetry, discussing style, images, and revision. Includes a writer's checklist, a glossary, resources for further information, and color photographs.
title: 12 great tips on writing poetry

author: Keenan-Bolger, Andrew
description: Jack Goodrich starred in two Broadway shows before he turned twelve. However, when his voice starts changing, he is cut from what would have been his third show. Now living in Shaker Heights, Ohio, Jack meets Louisa, a neighbor girl and self-styled Musical Theater Nerd. Louisa can't believe she might get to act in a local showing of "Into the Woods" with a real Broadway star--but before that can happen, she will have to convince a humiliated Jack to get back on the stage.
title: Act 1

author: Winerip, Michae
description: While serving as co-editors of their school newspaper, middle-schoolers Adam and Jennifer uncover fraud and corruption in their school and in the city's government.
title: Adam Canfield of the Slash

author: Harkrader, Lisa
description: Wheaton, Kansas seventh-grader Tucker MacBean loves comic books, so when his favorite comic has a contest to create a sidekick, he is hopeful that he can win, thereby fixing his struggling family.
title: The adventures of Beanboy

author: Outcalt, Todd
description: Provides a biography of Martin Luther King, Jr. describing his early years, education, historic accomplishments, and last days. Includes illustrations, primary source quotes, a glossary, and timelines.
title: All about Martin Luther King, Jr.

author: Freeman, Shanno
description: When Emma Swanson begins posting more selfies and garnering more attention, her relationship with her best friends Mai and Carson suffers. Then she becomes a victim of an Internet prank and Emma needs her friends more than ever.
title: All about my selfie

author: Pearsall, Shelley
description: Five urban middle school students, their teacher, and other community members relate how a school project to build the world's largest tetrahedron affects the lives of everyone involved.
title: All of the above

author: Ashenburg, Katherine
description: Explores the history of the idea of cleanliness from ancient cultures, like Egypt and the Roman Empire, to modern day cleanliness and practices.
title: All the dirt

author: Matthews, Tom
description: A biography, with photographs and quotes from Bell himself, which follows this well known inventor from his childhood in Scotland through his life-long efforts to come up with ideas that would improve people's lives.
title: Always inventing

author: Meyer, Carolyn
description: A novel in diary form in which the youngest daughter of Czar Nicholas II describes the privileged life her family led up until the time of World War I and the tragic events that befell them.
title: Anastasia and her sisters

author: Collins, Terr
description: Contains a choose-your-own-path story describing the life and times of ancient China. The reader's choices reveal the historical details of life from the perspectives of several characters. Includes forty-three choices and twenty-four endings.
title: Ancient China

author: Buchanan, Shelly
description: Describes the different ways animals use their senses to learn about the world around them.
title: Animal senses

author: Morreale, Marie
description: Presents a biography of singer Ariana Grande, covering her early years, her path to stardom, and her goals for the future. Includes an index, a list of additional resources, and a glossary.
title: Ariana Grande

author: Phelan, Matt
description: Challenged with circling the world at the end of the nineteenth century, three very different adventurers--avid bicyclist Thomas Stevens, fearless reporter Nellie Bly, and retired sea captain Joshua Slocum--embark on epic journeys.
title: Around the world

author: Colfer, Eoin
description: When a twelve-year-old evil genius tries to restore his family fortune by capturing a fairy and demanding a ransom in gold, the fairies fight back with magic, technology, and a particularly nasty troll.
title: Artemis Fowl

author: Reynolds, Jason
description: Eleven-year-old Genie and his older brother Ernie reluctantly agree to leave Brooklyn and spend summer with their grandparents in Virginia. Genie quickly starts to discover his grandfather's many secrets, including one plan that scares even Ernie. His brother's fear makes Genie question his beliefs about courage and manhood, and together they discover what bravery really means.
title: As brave as you

author: Lâopez, Diana
description: Confused about all her emotions, Erica "Chia" Montenegro looks to her mood ring to figure out what she is feeling. She has not seen Blue for Peaceful in a long time, but she often sees Black for Stressful--especially since her mother's sickness keeps getting worse. Visiting a famous church, Erica makes a "promesa" to God to raise funds for research into her mother's condition, so long as God makes her mother better.
title: Ask my mood ring how I feel

author: Cottrell Boyce, Frank
description: Rory Rooney likes to be prepared for anything, but when he inexplicably turns green and finds himself in an experimental hospital ward with his nemesis, school bully Tommy-Lee "Grim" Komissky, everyone is baffled but Rory believes he and Grim have become superheroes.
title: The astounding broccoli boy

author: Lassieur, Allison
description: Contains a choose-your-own-path story involving the Civil War. Features three story paths, forty-six choices, and nineteen endings.
title: At battle in the Civil War

author: Lassieur, Allison
description: Contains a choose-your-own-path story involving World War I. Features three story paths, fifty-three choices, and twenty-three endings.
title: At battle in World War I

author: Burkhart, Kiersi
description: Winning has always been Ella's goal and when she attends Quartz Creek Ranch, she's sure that she'll ace horseback riding too. When she's paired with Figure Eight, a beautiful quarter horse who won't listen to a word that Ella says, Ella will have to learn to control her ego and temper in order to learn how to barrel race.
title: At top speed

author: Barron, T. A.
description: The young thief Promi and the forest girl Atlanta battle evil and in the process bring about the creation of Atlantis.
title: Atlantis rising

author: Yolen, Jane
description: Jane Yolen and her daughter Heidi E.Y. Stemple place themselves inside a story about their research into the real history of twenty-six infamous female girls, like Cleopatra or Bonnie--from Bonnie and Clyde--and debate amongst themselves whether or not these girls really were bad, or just did not fit into old time cultural norms.
title: Bad girls

author: Braun, Eric
description: Compares and contrasts basketball statistics of NBA players current and in history, such as LeBron James and Stephen Curry with the stats of Wilt Chamberlain and Michael Jordan.
title: Basketball stats and the stories behind them

author: Carson, Mary Kay
description: Follows Dr. Tuttle at Bat Conservation International as he studies various types of bats. Describes the physical characteristics, behavior, habitat, life cycle, and conservation status of bats. Also provides information on a deadly new disease called white-nose syndrome that's killing millions of hibernating bats in North America. Includes dozens of color photographs, a glossary of terms, and sources of further information.
title: The bat scientists

author: Falkner, Brian
description: In this alternate history, Napoleon wins at Waterloo by unleashing a secret battlefield weapon--a legion of giant, carnivorous dinosaurs imported from the wilds of the Americas--and only fifteen-year-old Willem Verheyen stands in the way of the emperor's plan for world domination.
title: Battlesauru

author: Fusco, Kimberly Newton
description: In 1942, when life turns sour at the carnival that has always been her home, eleven-year-old Bee takes her dog, Peabody, and piglet, Cordelia, and sets out to find a real home, aided by two women only Bee and her pets can see.
title: Beholding Bee

author: Smith, Roland
description: Pat O'Toole always idolized his older brother, Coop. One day after a fight with their parents, Coop ran away from their home outside Washington, D.C. Now a year later, Pat receives a package with a digital voice recorder and a cryptic message from his brother that leads Pat on a dangerous journey to a mysterious community living beneath the streets of New York City to bring his brother home.
title: Beneath

author: Patt, Beverly
description: Fourteen-year-old Louise keeps a scrapbook detailing the events in her life after her best friend, a Japanese-American girl, and her family are sent to a relocation camp during World War II.
title: Best friends forever

author: Hamill, Christine
description: Everything is going wrong for young Philip Wright, including a run-in with a yeti, and his mother who keeps baking healthy cupcakes. Desperate for advice, he writes his hero, the famous TV comedian Harry Hill, who doesn't write Philip back. As Philip's problems keep piling up, he begins to wonder if laughter really is the best medicine.
title: The best medicine

author: Pinkney, Andrea Davis
description: In 1936, three children meet at the Mercy Home for Negro Orphans in New York State, and while not all three are orphans, they are all dealing with grief and loss which together, along with the help of a sympathetic staff member and the boxing matches of Joe Louis, they manage to overcome.
title: Bird in a box

author: Nelson, S. D.
description: Native American medicine man Black Elk describes growing up in the nineteenth and twentieth centuries, his relationship to Crazy Horse, the battles he was involved in, and his time with Buffalo Bill's Wild West show. He also describes the vision he had as a child that shaped his whole life. Includes an author's note, a timeline, and historical photographs.
title: Black Elk's vision

author: Woods, Brend
description: Violet Diamond is biracial. Her mom is white, and her father, who was black, died before she was born. After feeling out of place in her mostly white school and neighborhood, Violet finally gets to meet the African American side of her family and get answers to questions she's always had about herself and her past.
title: The blossoming universe of Violet Diamond

author: Rose, Caroline Starr
description: After arriving in the New World in 1587 with her parents, twelve-year-old Alis befriends Kimi, a Roanoke Native girl. When tensions between the Roanokes and the English settlers erupt, Alis must make a difficult choice when her family decides to leave the area.
title: Blue birds

author: Hill, Kirkpatrick
description: It's the 1920s, and Bo was headed for an Alaska orphanage when she won the hearts of two tough gold miners who set out to raise her, enthusiastically helped by all the kind people of the nearby Eskimo village.
title: Bo at Ballard Creek

author: Murrie, Matthew
description: A collection of open-ended questions for young people encouraging creative exploration. Also features historical sidebars, activities, and quotes from real kids and teens.
title: The book of what if ... ?

author: Alexander, Kwame
description: Twelve-year-old Nick loves soccer and hates books, but soon learns the power of words as he wrestles with problems at home, stands up to a bully, and tries to impress the girl of his dreams.
title: Booked

author: Kade, J. V.
description: In a futuristic world where humans and robots are at war, a boy goes on a search to find his missing military father.
title: Bot Wars

author: Kamkwamba, William
description: Tells the true story of how fourteen-year-old William Kamkwamba of Malawi read science books and learned how to build a windmill out of junkyard scraps, giving electricity and a means for transporting water to his people and saving his family from a famine.
title: The boy who harnessed the wind

author: Almond, David
description: Young Stan runs away from his aunt and uncle with his pet goldfish and finds a new group of friends at the local fairground. Among them is the legend Pancho Pirelli, a man who swims with piranhas. Stan believes Pancho may hold the key to his destiny.
title: The boy who swam with piranhas

author: McGill, Leslie
description: Dwayne and his mom get a fresh start on life when they move to a new apartment and a new school. However, Dwayne misses his friends, and after having trouble connecting with new classmates, Dwayne decides to act out. He begins breaking and entering into other people's houses while he is supposed to be at school.
title: Break and enter

author: Westrick, Anne
description: In 1867 Reconstruction Era Richmond Virginia, Shadrach works as an apprentice to his father, a tailor. But before his workday begins, he sneaks off to Miss Rachel's secret school to learn to read with the other students. The problem is that his teacher and fellow students are all blacks and Shadrach is white -- and a member of the Ku Klux Klan. Somehow, the Klan learns about the school's existence and intends to close it -- forever.
title: Brotherhood

author: Bruchac, Joseph
description: Presents the story of Walking Coyote and his family's attempts to bring back the buffalo when they were nearly extinct. Describes how Walking Coyote found buffalo orphans and raised them on the Flathead Indian Reservation in Montana.
title: Buffalo song

author: Otfinoski, Steven
description: Presents a choose-your-own-adventure story about the building of the transcontinental railroad in the United States in the 1860s, where readers chose to work for either the Central Pacific or the Union Pacific railroad companies, traveling west to begin new lives.
title: Building the transcontinental railroad

author: Rutkoski, Marie
description: When the prince of Bohemia steals her father's eyes, enchants them, and wears them, Petra Kronos sets out to Salamander Castle in order to take her father's eyes back.
title: The Cabinet of Wonders

author: Raum, Elizabeth
description: Describes the California Gold Rush of 1849 focusing on traveling west by land or by sea. Discusses a series of hardships and the intense desire to find gold by thousands of people.
title: The California gold rush

author: Magoon, Kekla
description: Ella, a biracial girl with a patchy and uneven skin tone, and her friend Z, a boy who is very different, have been on the bottom of the social order at Caldera Junior High School in Las Vegas, but when the only other African-American student enters their sixth grade class, Ella longs to be friends with him and join the popular group, but does not want to leave Z all alone.
title: Camo girl

author: Vernon, Ursula
description: When twelve-year-old Molly arrives at Castle Hangnail to be its new wicked witch, the minions are dubious but give her the job. Molly at first appears to handle the job, but she has a few secrets up her sleeve that could cause trouble for everyone.
title: Castle Hangnail

author: Jonsberg, Barry
description: Candace is a twelve-year-old optimist, with a literal mind, good intentions, and a determination to fix all the problems of her family, friends, pets, and everyone else in her life.
title: The categorical universe of Candice Phee

author: Fox, Janet S.
description: When twelve-year-old Katherine Bateson's father goes off to war and the Nazis begin to bomb her hometown of London, her mother sends Katherine and her siblings to Rookskill Castle to attend school and stay safe from the war. But when her classmates begin to disappear, one by one, Katherine soon realizes that the Lady of the house is more than she seems, and all of the children, including herself and her siblings are in grave danger.
title: The charmed children of Rookskill Castle

author: Paige, D. M.
description: When Beth Thorne is given the opportunity to intern at a record label, she finds herself standing up for not only her beliefs, but also those of the label's star.
title: Chart topper

author: Erdrich, Louise
description: In 1866, Omakayas's son Chickadee is kidnapped by two ne'er-do-well brothers from his own tribe and must make a daring escape, forge unlikely friendships, and set out on an exciting and dangerous journey to get back home.
title: Chickadee

author: Hiaasen, Carl
description: When the difficult star of the reality television show "Expedition Survival" disappears while filming an episode in the Florida Everglades using animals from the wildlife refuge run by Wahoo Crane's family, Wahoo and classmate Tuna Gordon set out to find him while avoiding Tuna's gun-happy father.
title: Chomp

author: Hutchison, Patricia
description: Explores twelve key concepts related to the American Civil War. Includes a list of 12 key dates, a glossary, resources for further information, and color photographs.
title: The Civil War

author: Ford, Carin T.
description: Examines the lives and experiences of several African American soldiers who fought for the Union during the Civil War.
title: The Civil War's African-American soldiers through primary sources

author: Cherry, Alison
description: When twelve-year-old AJ goes to stay with her grandma Jo for the summer, AJ is less than thrilled. Her grandmother seems intent on making her summer as boring as possible. That is, until AJ learns the truth about her grandma's bridge club. Soon she finds herself helping a band of elderly thieves pull off their heists, and her summer becomes anything but boring.
title: The classy crooks club

author: Graff, Lis
description: At Camp Atropos, many of the children have superhuman abilities, otherwise known as "talents". Liliana isn't happy to be stuck spending the summer there with her stepsister Hannah and without her brother Max. But when a jar filled with a mysterious Talent drops to the bottom of the lake, things get weird. And the camp director's secret could take things from weird to dangerous.
title: A clatter of jars

author: Henneberg, Susan
description: Explains the history and process of cloning, and discusses the benefits, drawbacks, and controversies surrounding it. Includes fact boxes, color photographs, a glossary, and further resources.
title: Cloning

author: Kurlansky, Mark
description: Traces the role that the Atlantic cod has played in the history of North America and Europe. Watercolor-and-ink illustrations describe the changing eras.
title: The cod's tale

author: Conklin, Wendy
description: Documents the history of the Cold War, discussing how this conflict began and outlining the political ideologies that fueled its continuation for more than four decades. Details major world events that occurred during this era and how the Cold War was eventually resolved. Includes color photographs and a glossary.
title: The Cold War

author: Freeburg, Jessica
description: Highlights the effects of the 2010 earthquake on the residents of Haiti. Features the plight of a selection of people who were involved in the aftermath including the president of Haiti and several individuals buried in the rubble. Includes a glossary, text-related questions, resources for further information, and color photographs.
title: Collapse and chaos

author: Cuevas, Michelle
description: When Jacques Papier discovers he's imaginary, he sets off on a journey to find his true home.
title: Confessions of an imaginary friend

author: Alexander, Kwame
description: Josh Bell has a talent for composing raps, and he and his twin brother Jordan are kings of the basketball court. But when the twins' close relationship begins to unravel under the strain of changes in their lives, the brothers start to realize life isn't always about winning.
title: The crossover

author: Wright, Barbara
description: In 1898, Moses Thomas's summer vacation does not go exactly as planned as he contends with family problems and the ever-changing alliances among his friends at the same time as he is exposed to the escalating tension between the African-American and white communities of Wilmington, North Carolina.
title: Crow

author: Terrell, Brandon
description: When ghostly things begin happening at the Fleischman Middle School auditorium during practices for the school play, the kids of Snoops, Inc. investigate the mystery.
title: The cursed stage

author: Gantos, Jack
description: After being "grounded for life" by his parents, Jack Gantos is loaned out by his mother to help an old neighbor with the unusual task or writing obituaries. As Jack completes his task, he discovers the strange stories contained within the obituaries and stumbles upon what he believes may be a murder case.
title: Dead end in Norvelt

author: Turner, Matt
description: Presents color photographs and facts about various types of spiders, including how they hunt, spin webs, defend themselves from predators, and reproduce.
title: Deadly spiders

author: Tate, Nikki
description: When Ayla goes on a weekend climbing trip to Black Dog Mountain with her best friend, Lissy, and Lissy's friend Carlos, an accident forces her to face her greatest fears in order to save her friends.
title: Deadpoint

author: Spain, Susan Rosson
description: Considered "slow" by his father, Lonzo tries his best to help his family in Culpeper, Virginia, during the Civil War and, in the process, comes to some decisions about how to live his life.
title: The deep cut

author: Langston-George, Rebecca
description: Provides a brief overview of five spies and double agents operating during the Cold War. Includes a timeline, print and digital resources, and a glossary.
title: Deep-cover spies and double-crossers of the Cold War

author: Walliams, David
description: The toothfairy has been usurped, apparently, by some diabolical creature which leaves dead slugs, or live spiders, or gross earwigs under children's pillows at night in payment for their teeth. A boy named Alfie is the only hope for getting the tooth fairy back in action and ousting this usurper, who may in fact be the mean-looking new dentist in town.
title: Demon dentist

author: Senker, Cath
description: Presents photos and information about desert climates around the world. Discusses plant and animal life, people who live in desert climates, desert resources, and dangers to desert climates. Includes a glossary, index, and resources for further information.
title: Desert climates

author: Hunter, Nick
description: Takes readers on an exploration of the world's deserts. Lists the things to take on the trip, and includes color photographs, a map, a timeline, a glossary, fact boxes, conservation tips, additional resources, and interviews with experts.
title: Deserts

author: Forten, Charlotte L.
description: Presents the diary of Charlotte Forten, a free African American living in the North in the 1800s, describing her daily life. Includes illustrations, a glossary, and further resources.
title: Diary of Charlotte Forten

author: Bethea, Nikole Brooks
description: Explores the technology and science of bionics, which uses mechanical and electronic components to solve biological problems. Examines the current state of the technology and forecasts the advances that may be made in the future.
title: Discover bionics

author: Carmichael, L. E
description: Explores the work forensic scientists do in studying evidence to discover who committed a crime, the cause of death, and how they used trained dogs or electronic devices to track scents.
title: Discover forensic science

author: Kruesi, Liz
description: Explores recent advances scientists, astronomers, and astronauts have made in the study of our solar system, and also forecasts future projects, such as preparing for putting humans on Mars.
title: Discover space exploration

author: Black, Holly
description: Zach, Alice, and Poppy, friends from a Pennsylvania middle school who have long enjoyed acting out imaginary adventures with dolls and action figures, embark on a real-life quest to Ohio to bury a doll made from the ashes of a dead girl.
title: Doll bones

author: Catanese, P. W.
description: In a moment of desperation, Donny Taylor accepts an offer from a demon who will save his life if he works for her, and soon he finds himself in Hell but a new, kinder, gentler Hell where not everyone is happy about the changes and some will do anything to bring back the traditional ways.
title: Donny's inferno

author: Stoudemire, Amar'e
description: Eleven-year-old Amar'e and his friends Deuce and Mike are basketball stars in their school, but now that Amar'e is getting better the older boys are taking interest in him. Amar'e feels like basketball is in his future, but he does not want to leave his best friends behind, although it is looking like that's just what he will have to do to get better at his game.
title: Double team

author: Jenkins, Steve
description: Describes the many sea creatures one will see while moving from the surface to the bottom of the sea. Includes cut-out art of various sea animals.
title: Down, down, down

author: King, Wesley
description: After searching for some clue to his CIA analyst father's disappearance, computer genius Marcus Brimley breaks a complex code that actually transports him into a different universe on the planet Dracone. Secret military drones follow him and begin attacking him and every dragon they see there. Meeting Dree, a Draconian dragon rider girl, Marcus realizes he will have to unite the dragons and humans of Dracone in order to defeat the marauding drones and save the realm.
title: Dragons vs. drones

author: Shevah, Emma
description: An eleven-year-old half-Japanese and half-Italian girl named Amber worries about making friends at her new school, and misses her dad who left when she was little. So Amber creates an imaginary father who's a secret agent and writes letters from him to her younger sister, Bella. Things quickly spiral, and Amber's good intentions get her in trouble.
title: Dream on, Amber

author: Marquardt, Meg
description: Explores common myths and misconceptions about the Earth. Discusses how the Earth was proved to be round, the age of the Earth, earthquakes, the magnetic poles, and extinct volcanoes.
title: Earth myths, busted!

author: Airgood, Ellen
description: Ivy despairs when she has to leave her best friend Prairie's home, where she has been living, to move back in with her alcoholic mother. When Ivy's mother's behavior reaches a tipping point, Ivy must summon her strength and inner reserves to make the decision that is best for herself.
title: The education of Ivy Blake

author: Curtis, Christopher Paul
description: In 1859, eleven-year-old Elijah Freeman, the first free-born child in Buxton, Canada, which is a haven for slaves fleeing the American south, uses his wits and skills to try to bring to justice the lying preacher who has stolen money that was to be used to buy a family's freedom.
title: Elijah of Buxton

author: Jacobs, Evan
description: Travis is a skilled basketball player, and his life off the court is pretty awesome, too--however, one day he passes on forwarding a chain email, and everything seems to fall apart in an emoji of doom.
title: Emoji of doom

author: Hunter, Erin
description: Golden-haired mutt Lucky is a Lone Dog, roaming freely while other dogs have Packs. When the Big Growl strikes, the land splits, and suddenly Lucky is forced to search harder for food and clean water. In a desolate world, Lucky teams up with his littermate Bella, and forms a pack of his own in order to survive in the new, dark world.
title: The empty city

author: Johnson, Lois Walfrid
description: In 1857 twelve-year-old Libby joins her father aboard the Christina and proves that she can be trusted to assist in the escape of a fugitive slave.
title: Escape into the night

author: Thomson, Sarah L.
description: Sam (a puzzle master) and Martina (a history whiz) become involved in a dangerous quest to find seven keys left behind by Benjamin Franklin and a secret society of descendants, which, when gathered together, unlock a powerful weapon, so the middle schoolers must solve the puzzles, find the artifacts before the bad guy does, and save the nation.
title: The Eureka key

author: Kelly, Jacqueline
description: In central Texas in 1899, eleven-year-old Callie Vee Tate is instructed to be a lady by her mother, learns about love from the older three of her six brothers, and studies the natural world with her grandfather, the latter of which leads to an important discovery.
title: The evolution of Calpurnia Tate

author: Barber, Tiki
description: Tiki and Ronde Barber, in their childhoods, loved baseball. One game the two of them both call for a ball, but they run into each other and get hurt. Their team loses the next game, but Tiki and Ronde come back to help the team get into the play-offs, where they learn what it means to play as teammates.
title: Extra innings

author: Lupica, Mike
description: After a summer of working hard and getting into shape, Teddy is ready for football tryouts until his father returns after living in Oregon for most of Teddy's life. Then when Teddy makes the team, his dad becomes one of the coaches and Teddy wonders if he can forgive his dad for abandoning him.
title: The extra yard

author: Kostigen, Thomas
description: Discusses how extreme weather phenomena occur--like sandstorms, tornadoes, blizzards, hurricanes, and hailstorms--and how to survive them when they do.
title: Extreme weather

author: Losure, Mary
description: Relates the true story behind the creation of the fake photographs of fairies created by Elsie Wright and Frances Griffiths. Describes how these girls created the images, why they caused so many to believe they were genuine, and how Arthur Conan Doyle reacted when he saw them for the first time.
title: The fairy ring, or, Elsie and Frances fool the world

author: Watkins, Steve
description: When the dogs of the Dog and Suds pet-grooming shop won't stop barking, making band practice at the Kitchen Sink really hard, Anderson and his friends Greg and Julie investigate, and discover they have another ghost sighting on their hands. This time it is a teenage Union soldier from the Civil War, and he looks terrifying. The ghost's demand is that the three friends help him find out what happened to his brother.
title: Fallen in Fredericksburg

author: Strasser, Todd
description: In 1962 nuclear war begins and Scott's family races to their bomb shelter--the only one in town. Others fight to get in, and eventually ten people cram in the small space with scarce supplies hoping to survive the unthinkable.
title: Fallout

author: Lupica, Mike
description: Twelve-year-old Charlie "Brain" Gaines uses his fantasy football skills to help the real-life Los Angeles Bulldogs, the first professional football team Los Angeles has had in years.
title: Fantasy league

author: Woodson, Jacqueline
description: When a new, white student nicknamed "The Jesus Boy" joins her sixth grade class in the winter of 1971, Frannie's growing friendship with him makes her start to see some things in a new light.
title: Feathers

author: Grey, Jacob
description: Caw, a Feral teen with the power to command crows, comes to Blackstone, a city crushed by violence and chaos wrought by the evil Spinning Man. Caw must learn to master his new abilities so that he can free other Ferals like himself from Spinning Man's reign.
title: Ferals

author: Fletcher, Ralph J.
description: Cliff describes the excitement, conflict, and sudden tragedy experienced by his large and boisterous family during his eleventh year.
title: Fig pudding

author: Scandiffio, Laura
description: Highlights the struggles children face around the world to obtain an education from poverty stricken children in India to war torn Chile where students fight for their right to learn. Includes resources for further information and color photographs.
title: Fight to learn

author: Belpre, Pura
description: At a plantation in rural Puerto Rico around the turn of the century the foreman pursues the mystery surrounding his family.
title: Firefly summer

author: Seidler, Tor
description: Lamar, a young wolf in the Yellowstone pack led by Lamar's father, Blue Boy, struggles to balance his familial duties with his own destiny and his forbidden romance with a coyote.
title: Firstborn

author: Hunt, Lynda Mullaly
description: Ally has dyslexia, and can no more read like everyone else than a fish can climb a tree. Tired of being called slow and a loser, Ally finds that in her latest new school her teacher understands her limitations and actually sees in her a creative, intelligent side. New friends with their own learning disabilities help Ally see that she can achieve success and find happiness.
title: Fish in a tree

author: Marrin, Albert
description: Chronicles the origin, spread, and impact of the 1911 Triangle Shirtwaist Factory fire and discusses how it reflected upon and motivated changes for immigrants' rights and standards of life in the early twentieth century. Features black-and-white photographs throughout.
title: Flesh & blood so cheap

author: Pascoe, Elaine
description: Uncovers eleven hoaxes from the 1800s to present day. Explains how the stories were started and by whom as well as why people were fooled by their authenticity.
title: Fooled you!

author: Vaught, Susan
description: Eleven-year-old Footer and her friends investigate when a nearby farm is burned, the farmer murdered, and his children disappear, but as they follow the clues, Footer starts having flashbacks and wonders if she is going crazy like her mother, who is back in a mental institution near their Mississippi home.
title: Footer Davis probably is crazy

author: Holm, Jennifer L.
description: Ellie's scientist grandfather has discovered a way to reverse aging, and consequently has turned into a teenager--which makes for complicated relationships when he moves in with Ellie and her mother, his daughter.
title: The fourteenth goldfish

author: English, Karen
description: When the sixteen-year-old boy whom she tutors in reading is accused of attempting to murder a white man, Francie gets herself in serious trouble for her efforts at friendship.
title: Francie

author: Dooley, Sarah
description: Sasha's mother left when she was five. Three years later, her father was killed in a mining accident. And when her brother Michael, the only person she has left in the world, is killed in a fire, Sasha feels more lost, alone, and desperate than ever to escape the small mining town that has been the backdrop of so much tragedy. But when she connects with her extended family, makes a new friend at school, and begins writing poetry to express herself, she thinks she may be on the right path toward happiness. But when another mining accident strikes her extended family, she could find herself in a darker place than she was before.
title: Free verse

author: Bright, Michael
description: Explores the water cycle as well as the consumption and conservation of water. Discusses water-powered electricity, water use at work and home, storing water, natural water sources, and the importance of clean water access. Includes a glossary, index, and resources for further information.
title: From raindrop to tap

author: Hilton, Marilyn
description: As the Apollo 11 mission goes to the Moon, Mimi Yoshiko Oliver moves to Vermont, a mostly Caucasian state, a place to feel out of place for a half-black, half-Asian girl like her. Mimi does her best to follow her dreams, taking shop class instead of home ec in school, entering science competitions, and ultimately to become an astronaut.
title: Full cicada moon

author: Pashley, Hilton
description: After discovering that his mother is actually a demon and his father is an angel, twelve-year-old Jonathan Smith is drawn into a battle with the evil archdemon Belial, who is determined to take over both Heaven and Hell.
title: Gabriel's clock

author: Cervantes, Angela
description: Gaby Ramirez Howard works at the animal shelter, writing adoption advertisements to help nice animals find amazing homes. She feels like she ought to write one for herself now that her mother has been deported to Honduras. With no place to turn Gaby throws herself into school and her work, loving the attention she gets from one cat at the shelter named Feather. When Gaby does something rash--like sneaking Feather out--she forgot to factor in that she has no way of taking care of the cat like she should.
title: Gaby, lost and found

author: Fitzgerald, Laura Marx
description: In 1929 New York City, twelve-year-old housemaid Martha O'Doyle suspects that a wealthy recluse may be trying to communicate with the outside world through the paintings on her gallery walls.
title: The gallery

author: Haddix, Margaret Peterson
description: While playing in the championship softball game, star pitcher KT Sutton blacks out and awakes to a changed world where the roles of academics and sports at her middle school have flipped, making talented athletes, such as KT, outcasts and brainy nerds popular.
title: Game changer

author: Erdrich, Louise
description: Nine-year-old Omakayas, of the Ojibwe tribe, moves west with her family in 1849 following the death of her baby brother, Neewo, from smallpox that killed many villagers. Omakayas and her family learn of a new threat with the arrival of chimookomanag--white people. When the U.S. government orders removal of the Ojibwe westward, a small advance party leaves to gather information while the remaining tribe members adjust to the new villagers and prepare for their changing future. As the seasons pass, Omakayas matures toward adulthood.
title: The game of silence

author: Harkey, Faith
description: Twelve-year-old Genuine Sweet has the ability to grant everyone else's wishes but her own. After a troublesome upheaval in her life, she learns the importance of building a better life rather than just wishing for one.
title: Genuine Sweet

author: Gino, Alex
description: Though most of her peers see George as a boy, she thinks she is really a girl on the inside. When the class presents the play "Charlotte's Web," George isn't allowed to try out for the role of Charlotte, however George's best friend, Kelly, comes up with a plan for George to be Charlotte and show everyone who she really is.
title: George

author: Cooper, Susan
description: At the end of a winter-long journey into manhood, Little Hawk returns to find his village decimated by a white man's plague and soon, despite a fresh start, Little Hawk dies violently but his spirit remains trapped, seeing how his world changes.
title: Ghost Hawk

author: Diakitâe, Baba Waguâe
description: The artist, ceramicist, writer, and storyteller describes his experiences growing up in a small village in Mali with his grandparents, and discusses how the memories have stayed with him his whole life.
title: A gift from childhood

author: Gaiman, Neil
description: Follows a young boy named Nobody Owens as he is raised in a graveyard by a group of ghosts and avoids leaving the graveyard for fear that he will be killed by the man who has already murdered his family.
title: The graveyard book

author: Kuhlman, Evan
description: Thirteen-year-old Fiona North and her brother, Fenton, discover a mysterious ball of light in their backyard. When they figure out it can bring anything--bugs, trees, their old dog Scruffy--back to life, they plan to use it to bring back some of their family members, hopefully to help make their family whole again.
title: Great ball of light

author: Kadohata, Cynthia
description: At first, eleven-year-old Romanian-born Jaden is angry when his parents inform him that they will all be traveling to Kazakhstan to adopt another child. Jaden is plagued by feelings of inadequacy and struggles with attachment difficulties. But once they arrive at the orphanage, Jaden forms an unexpected bond with a special-needs toddler after he is able to feel empathy for the boy's situation, which reminds him of his own past.
title: Half a world away

author: Pinkney, Andrea Davis
description: Examines the lives of ten African American men who have had influence on American culture and society.
title: Hand in hand

author: Schroeder, Lisa
description: When it's Hannah's turn to wear the lucky charm bracelet that she shares with her three best friends, she wishes for a horse and instead gets a mule! Hannah learns to love the mule, but an unfortunate accident could ruin everything.
title: Hannah's bright star

author: Summers, Alex
description: Features a collection of ghost stories associated with haunted asylums and prisons. Includes a glossary, text-related questions, a map, and color photographs.
title: Haunted prisons and asylums

author: Florence, Melanie
description: When John stumbles into an indigenous peoples dance class at the local community cultural center, he decides to become a dancer. He faces ridicule from his soccer teammates and hostility from the dancers at the cultural center. In order to dance at the Pow Wow, he has to learn to balance his responsibilities, confront his fears, and embrace both the Irish and Cree sides of his heritage.
title: He who dreams

author: Hapka, Cathy
description: After freeing a dolphin trapped in fishing line, Annie and the dolphin become friends. The dolphin returns to the cove by her home to play and visit--the only thing right in Annie's life at the moment. She has to deal with best friend Emma, who doesn't feel like a friend much anymore; with her parents, who have no time for her it seems; and with her annoyance at her younger brother.
title: Heart of a dolphin

author: Lupica, Mike
description: Ben is just starting the season on the town's All-Star Baseball league when he gets hit by a pitch. The hit makes Ben nervous at the plate and his hitting suffers. Meanwhile, Ben's teammate Justin is struggling with problems at home that are affecting his performance on the field. Ben tries to help Justin with his problems, while Justin helps Ben face the next pitch.
title: Heavy hitters

author: Frost, Helen
description: When fourteen-year-olds Wren and Darra meet at a Michigan summer camp, both are overwhelmed by memories from six years earlier when Darra's father stole a car, unaware that Wren was hiding in the back.
title: Hidden

author: Lubar, David
description: When thirteen-year-old Martin arrives at an alternative school for misfits and problem students, he falls in with a group of boys with psychic powers and discovers something surprising about himself.
title: Hidden talents

author: Marino, Nan
description: When eleven-year-old musical prodigy Elvis Ruby completely freezes up on television, he is forced to hide out in the Pinelands of New Jersey and try to find his way back to the music once again with the help of a new friend.
title: Hiding out at the Pancake Palace

author: Gish, Melissa
description: Explores the characteristics, behavior, and habitat of a variety of hippopotamus species.
title: Hippopotamuses

author: Toksvig, Sandi
description: Bamse is an actor and the son of an actor and his best friend Anton is not afraid of anything. Bamse wonders whether he should join the Resistance in Denmark or take his father's advice and not stir up trouble. Every day in Denmark it's getting more difficult with the Nazi occupation in their country especially for Danish Jews.
title: Hitler's canary

author: Stoudemire, Amar'e
description: Between sports, school, and working for his father, eleven-year-old Amar'e's life is full and he is not yet ready to concentrate on basketball--but when a group of older boys start hogging the local basketball court he knows that he has to do something to help his friends.
title: Home court

author: Howling, Eric
description: Despite his small stature, Orlando O'Malley is determined to become a star basketball player. Through his determination, he finds an unexpected, but perfect, place for himself on the team.
title: Hoop magic

author: Hiaasen, Carl
description: Roy, who is new to his small Florida community, becomes involved in another boy's attempt to save a colony of burrowing owls from a proposed construction site.
title: Hoot

author: Eagar, Lindsay
description: Twelve-year-old Carolina meets her grandfather, Serge, when her family travels to Albuquerque to sell Serge's sheep ranch and help him move into a nursing home. Carol hates to miss part of her summer, but changes her mind when Grandpa begins telling her stories about her heritage, of the magic tree that heals, of a green-glass lake, of 100 years of no rain, and of the magical bees that brought the rain back.
title: Hour of the bees

author: Pratt, Mary K.
description: Offers practical strategies for reducing household waste including paper, plastic, metal, food, glass, and electronics. Includes fact boxes, color photographs, a glossary, and further resources.
title: How can we reduce household waste?

author: Nagelhout, Ryan
description: Explores a range of unique geological features, such as Death Valley, what makes them unique, and how they got their names.
title: How did Death Valley get its name?

author: Alvarez, Julia
description: Worried that Papa Espada cannot find a job, Tâia Lola, Juanita, Miguel, and the "Sword" sisters decide to start a bed and breakfast at Colonel Charlebois's Vermont house.
title: How Tâia Lola ended up starting over

author: Alvarez, Julia
description: When three girls and their father visit for a week in the summer, it takes Tâia Lola to make Miguel forget his unhappiness at the absence of any boys and embrace the adventures that ensue.
title: How Tâia Lola saved the summer

author: Tobin, Paul
description: Every Friday the thirteenth, inventor extraordinaire Nate Bannister comes up with three crazy ideas. This thirteenth, one of those ideas involved making his cat, Proton, giant and invisible, and he succeeded. Now the giant invisible cat is wreaking havoc, and only Nate and his only friend, Delphine, can stop it. There is a problem though--the Red Death Tea Society criminals want to capture Proton for their own nefarious ends.
title: How to capture an invisible cat

author: Romain, Trevor
description: Presents a collection of tips to help children master the art of doing homework without undue stress.
title: How to do homework without throwing up

author: Langley, Andrew
description: Examines Hurricane Sandy in 2012 from various perspectives including eyewitnesses, emergency workers, scientists, and the media. Includes color photographs, a timeline, a glossary, and further resources.
title: Hurricane

author: Korman, Gordon
description: Twelve-year-old Jackson Opus is descended from two powerful hypnotist bloodlines, but he has just begun to realize that he can control other peoples' actions with sometimes frightening results--especially when the head of the Sentia Institute plans to use Jackson for his own benefit.
title: The hypnotists

author: Gigliotti, Jim
description: Presents a faux first-person biography of Roberto Clemente, the first Latin American to be inducted into the National Baseball Hall of Fame.
title: I am Roberto Clemente

author: Cheaney, J. B.
description: Twelve-year-old Isobel is unhappy about spending the summer of 1918 at her aunt's home in Hollywood with her mother and sister until her cousin, Ranger, involves the girls in creating the perfect film and, when her father returns from the war, his serious injury becomes their inspiration.
title: I don't know how the story ends

author: Levine, Deborah A.
description: Liza's thirteenth birthday is hijacked by her Nana Silver, who wants to throw her granddaughter a party more suited for a society page than the low-key celebration Liza wants. However, Liza's best friends Frankie and Lillian create a plan to save Liza.
title: The icing on the cake

author: Farndon, John
description: Highlights the best athletes, escape artists, and builders in the insect world. Features color illustrations and photographs, fact boxes, and statistics.
title: Incredible bugs

author: King, Wesley
description: One second Jonah is doing his boring homework on his family's living room floor, but in the next second he wakes up on a cold, hard floor, the floor of a spaceship known as the "Flying Squirrel," to be precise. He has been recruited into the Incredible Space Radiers, a team of kids who must travel into the Dark Zone to fight the monstrous creatures that threaten the universe. Several Raiders have gone missing on the large ship--it is Jonah's responsibility to find them.
title: The Incredible Space Raiders from space!

author: Westmark, Jon
description: Presents facts and photos about the Iraq War. Discusses 9/11, tactics of President Bush, effects of the war on Iraqi civilians, efforts of U.S. troops, and the rise of ISIS. Includes photos, a glossary, index, and resources for further information.
title: The Iraq War

author: Black, Holly
description: After failing to fail out of the Iron Trial, Callum Hunt finds himself enrolled in the Magisterium. Warned by his father to stay away from magic, Callum is drawn into it instead when he learns the Magisterium has a dark connection with his past.
title: The Iron Trial

author: Doan, Lisa
description: With his parents' latest get-rich-quick scheme--which involves snorkeling--Jack finds himself in the Caribbean, shipwrecked on a tropical island, dodging a hungry whale shark.
title: Jack the castaway

author: Simmons, Matt J.
description: Provides a biography of Jackie Robinson, the first African American in Major League Baseball. Discusses his childhood and education, career, and work in the civil rights movement. Includes dozens of photographs and quotes, sidebars, a glossary, a chronology, and sources of further information.
title: Jackie Robinson

author: Marsh, Katherine
description: When Jepp, a teenage dwarf living in sixteen-century Europe, leaves home to seek his destiny, he is imprisoned, kidnapped, and sent to a man who studies the stars. There he meets a girl who helps him uncover secrets buried in his past.
title: Jepp, who defied the stars

author: Powell, Patricia Hruby
description: Picture-book biography of Josephine Baker, a singer and dancer from the 1920s and how she became famous for her style of the Charleston she performed in Paris.
title: Josephine

author: Baptiste, Tracey
description: Corinne La Mer knows that the jumbies are just fictional monsters the adults of her island home made up to scare children--so when a real jumbie chases her out of the woods, Corinne is in for quite the education. Then a mysterious and beautiful stranger named Severine turns up and makes Corinne's father dinner. That dinner is the start of a bewitchment, Severine's plan to claim the island for the jumbies. Corinne has to stop her, but she won't be able to without her courage, friends, and an ancient magic.
title: The jumbies

author: Pearsall, Shelley
description: In 1945, thirteen-year-old Levi is sent to find the father he has not seen in three years, going from Chicago, to segregated North Carolina, and finally to Pendleton, Oregon, where he learns that his father's unit, the all-Black 555th paratrooper battalion, will never see combat but finally has a mission. Includes historical notes.
title: Jump into the sky

author: Barber, Tiki
description: When the Tiki and Ronde make the junior high school basketball team, they see that they each have their own skills and the most important skill is teamwork.
title: Jump shot

author: McGovern, Cammie
description: When fourth-grader Benny Barrows's dad is in a serious accident that puts him in the hospital, Benny blames himself. It seems to the be icing on top of an already crummy year at school. Between that and his best friend moving away and his teacher acting strangely, he feels like he's lost control of his own happiness. In the midst of it all, he hopes that his mom's advice to focus on helping others will pull him out of the dumps.
title: Just my luck

author: Bryant, Jennifer
description: In 1968, with the Vietnam War raging, thirteen-year-old Lyza inherits a project from her deceased grandfather, who had been using his knowledge of maps and the geography of Lyza's New Jersey hometown to locate the lost treasure of Captain Kidd.
title: Kaleidoscope eyes

author: Marsico, Katie
description: Highlights key discoveries in physical science, and features timelines showing how these ideas developed over time. Illustrates the discovery of atoms, gravity, radiation, and electromagnetism. Includes color photographs, a glossary, and further resources.
title: Key discoveries in physical science

author: Booth, Coe
description: Eleven-year-old Jarrett is angered and dismayed when his mother fosters Kevon, a haughty kid Jarrett's own age with whom he is forced to share a room. But when Jared starts snooping around to uncover the secrets Kevon is hiding, what he finds forces him to see Kevon in a much more sympathetic light.
title: Kinda like brothers

author: Tooke, Wes
description: Twelve-year-old Nick loves baseball so after a year in the hospital fighting polio and with a brace on one leg, Nick takes a job with the team for which his father is catcher and gets to see the great pitcher, Satchel Paige, play during the 1935 season. Includes historical notes.
title: King of the mound

author: Gavin, Rohan
description: A father and son detective team investigates the mystery surrounding a book that that makes its readers commit terrible crimes, and a sinister organization known as the Combination.
title: Knightley & son

author: Kelly, Erin Entrada
description: Abandoned by their father and living in poverty with their heartless stepmother in Louisiana, two sisters from the Philippines, twelve-year-old Sol and six-year-old Ming, learn the true meaning of family.
title: The land of forgotten girls

author: Burg, Shana
description: Massachusetts thirteen-year-old Clare, grieving after her mother's recent death, reluctantly travels with her father to spend nine weeks in a remote village in Malawi, where new friends and experiences help open her mind and heart.
title: Laugh with the moon

author: James, LeBron
description: Presents a brief biography of LeBron James, from his trouble fitting in at school as a kid due to moving schools often, up to how he focused hard on sports and was drafted into the NBA in 2003.
title: LeBron Jame

author: Bryant, Howard
description: Highlights notable players, games, teams, and moments in the history of baseball including Babe Ruth and Hank Aaron, the 1998 Yankees, playoff rivalries, and Jackie Robinson breaking the color barrier. Includes photographs and Top Ten lists.
title: Legend

author: Levine, Kristi
description: In 1958 Little Rock, Arkansas, painfully shy twelve-year-old Marlee sees her city and family divided over school integration, but her friendship with Liz, a new student, helps her find her voice and fight against racism.
title: The lions of Little Rock

author: Bauer, Marion Dane
description: A little cat named Patches manages to push out a window screen and leave her house to chase a falling leaf. Once on her adventure, Patches finds friends and enemies, challenges and beauty, and possibly a place to call her own.
title: Little cat's luck

author: Peabody, Erin
description: Uses easy-to-read text and illustrations to discuss the facts and mythology behind the Loch Ness Monster. Features anecdotes, sidebars, and factual data using a scientific, myth-busting lens to examine historical sightings and evidence.
title: The Loch Ness monster

author: Green, Tim
description: After his mother is hospitalized following a near-fatal car accident on the way home from his baseball game, twelve-year-old Ryder attempts to locate his father to help pay for a needed operation using the only clues he has of his father's existence--a signed baseball and a letter.
title: Lost boy

author: Turner, Tracey
description: Lost in an African desert among lions, herds of stampeding gazelles, and a black rhino, the reader's decisions determine if survival is possible.
title: Lost in the crater of fear

author: Graff, Lis
description: As middle schooler Trent Zimmerman struggles to move past a traumatic event that took place several months earlier, he befriends class outcast Fallon Little, a girl with a scar across her face, who helps him understand that he can move on.
title: Lost in the sun

author: Curtis, Christopher Paul
description: Even though it is now 1901, the people of Buxton, Canada (originally a settlement of runaway slaves) and Chatham, Canada are still haunted by two events of half a century before--the American Civil War, and the Irish potato famine, and the lasting damage those events caused to the survivors.
title: The madman of Piney Woods

author: Korman, Gordon
description: Eli Frieden and his friends live in a community called Serenity, New Mexico, where there is no crime, unemployment, poverty, or homelessness. One day they discover that they were cloned from the DNA of some of the greatest criminal masterminds in history for a sociological experiment.
title: Masterminds

author: Appelt, Kathi
description: One day Jules's older sister and best friend Sylvie runs down to the river near their home to throw a wishing rock into the fast moving water, but she never returns. It seems clear that she slipped and fell into the river, and she is gone forever--just like their mother who died suddenly from a heart condition a few years before. At the same time, Senna, a fox is who is part spirit and part animal is born. As she grows, she finds herself inexplicably drawn to Jules, and soon the young girl and the fox find their fates linked to one another.
title: Maybe a fox

author: Curtis, Christopher Paul
description: With love and determination befitting the "world's greatest family," twelve-year-old Deza Malone, her older brother Jimmie, and their parents endure tough times in Gary, Indiana, and later Flint, Michigan, during the Great Depression.
title: The mighty Miss Malone

author: Nardo, Don
description: Explores the events surrounding the capture of a photograph depicting a woman in a migrant workers' camp near Nipomo, California, during the Great Depression. Discusses how the photograph came to symbolize the difficulties faced by many people during this era in American history.
title: Migrant mother

author: Yee, Lisa
description: Millicent Min is having a difficult time being an eleven-year-old because she is a very smart kid, but when Emily meets Millie she does not know what Millie's IQ is and a very "normal" friendship begins.
title: Millicent Min, girl genius

author: Dorisi-Winget, Dianna
description: After Poppy's guardian, her Grandma Beth, suffers a stroke and is sent to the hospital, and Poppy witnesses a crime, Poppy is placed with a detective's compassionate mother as part of a witness protection program. Poppy appreciates her new guardian, but worries how she will reunite with her grandmother, whose health is declining. She also seeks solace in a local animal shelter, where she successfully befriends a troubled German shepherd dog who is slated to be put to sleep.
title: A million ways home

author: Burgan, Michael
description: Highlights the journey of the American Olympic hockey team to defeat the Soviet team in the 1980 Winter Olympics. Highlights the effect of the Cold War on international sports and the lasting effects of the powerful upset on the ice that day. Includes a glossary, resources for further information, and color photographs.
title: Miracle on ice

author: Gutman, Dan
description: On a cross-country vacation with their parents, twins Coke and Pepsi, soon to be thirteen, fend off strange assassins as they try to come to terms with their being part of a top-secret government organization known as The Genius Files.
title: Mission unstoppable

author: Lewis, Gill
description: When twelve-year-old Tam discovers a young moon bear cub, he thinks his family fortune has been made. However, the mother shows up before he can get back to his village. When he does, empty handed, he discovers that everyone in the village is going to have to relocate due to a new high way going up, right through their village. Tam has to work in the city at a moon bear farm, where he sees how cruel they are treated--and he takes a stand.
title: Moon bear

author: Stoudemire, Amar'e
description: When Overtime Tanner gets hurt in a basketball game it falls to Amar'e and his friends to set up this year's ultimate streetball tournament. Quickly Amar'e is asked by his friends to play on their different teams and he is torn between them--he realizes that planning a tournament is harder than just playing ball.
title: Most valuable

author: Philbrick, W. R
description: Twelve-year-old Homer, a poor but clever orphan, has extraordinary adventures after running away from his evil uncle to rescue his brother, who has been sold into service in the Civil War.
title: The mostly true adventures of Homer P. Figg

author: Anderson, John David
description: When Topher, Brand, and Steve's favorite teacher Ms. Bixby announces unexpectedly that she's become sick and won't finish the school year, the three friends go to great lengths to show Ms. Bixby what she means to their class.
title: Ms. Bixby's last day

author: Tarshis, Lauren
description: After their father is taken by the Nazis, Polish Jews Max Rosen and Zena, his sister, escape their ghetto into the woods. There they find a safe camp of other Jewish resistance fighters--but this by no means makes them any safer.
title: The Nazi invasion, 1944

author: Senker, Cath
description: Presents a brief biography of Nelson Mandela, discussing how he helped end apartheid, became the first black president of South Africa, and his legacy of working against racism everywhere.
title: Nelson Mandela

author: Holyoke, Polly
description: No one asked Nere if she wanted to become a science experiment--they just went right ahead and bio-engineered her lungs to be able to breath water as well as air. She and a group of other genetically modified kids find out they are part of "The Neptune Project," which aims at creating a new human society in the ocean, far away from the dangers of land. However, the dangers of the sea are just as deadly.
title: The Neptune Project

author: Ehrlich, Esther
description: Eleven-year-old Chirp escapes from the worries of her everyday life, including her mother's serious disease, by exploring the salt marshes around her Cape Code home, bird watching, and going on adventures with her neighbor Joey, who is facing his own difficulties at home.
title: Nest

author: Myers, Walter Dean
description: Friends Zander, Kambui, LaShonda, and Bobbi, caught in the middle of a mock Civil War at DaVinci Academy, learn the true cost of freedom of speech when they use their alternative newspaper, The Cruiser, to try to make peace.
title: The news crew

author: Halpern, Jake
description: Marin and her twin brother Kana are preparing for a fourteen-year-long darkness when they discover their friend Line has gone missing. But as the tide goes out, Marin and Kana must decide if it's worth it to stay and risk it all to save their friend.
title: Nightfall

author: Oliver, Lauren
description: Philippa, Sam, Thomas, and Max, orphans with extraordinary abilities, must find out who stole a valuable artifact--an Amazonian shrunken head--in order to save their home, Dumfrey's Dime Museum of Freaks, Oddities, and Wonders.
title: The shrunken head

author: York, M. J.
description: Features twelve well-known archeological mysteries, from the supposed curse of King Tut's tomb to the statues on Easter Island. Includes a glossary, resources for further information, and photographs.
title: 12 ancient mysteries

author: Morey, Allan
description: Introduces twelve dangerous and scary animals including the electric eel, the short-horned lizard, and the green anaconda. Includes a glossary, resources for further information, and color photographs.
title: 12 scary animals

author: Korman, Gordon
description: Eleven-year-old best friends Jeff and Wiley, who like to give nicknames to their classmates, try to find the right one for the new girl Cassandra, while adjusting to the football coach who has become their new teacher.
title: The 6th grade nickname game

author: Graff, Lisa
description: Ten-year-old Albie has never been the smartest, tallest, best at gym, greatest artist, or most musical in his class, as his parents keep reminding him, but new nanny Calista helps him uncover his strengths and take pride in himself.
title: Absolutely almost

author: Trevayne, Emma
description: At age twelve, grave robber Thomas Marsden discovers a boy who looks just like him in an unmarked grave and begins a journey of discovery as he learns of faeries trapped in London and their hope that he can return them to their realm.
title: The accidental afterlife of Thomas Marsden

author: Roxburgh, Ellis
description: Explores the different backgrounds, leadership skills, and similarities between Adolf Hitler and Winston Churchill.
title: Adolf Hitler vs. Winston Churchill

author: Leck, James
description: Contains the many adventures of Jack Lime, a self-styled Private Investigator who solves problems for his fellow students at Iona High.
title: The adventures of Jack Lime

author: Hemphill, Helen
description: Thirteen-year-old Prometheus Jones and his eleven-year-old cousin Omer flee Tennessee and join a cattle drive that will eventually take them to Texas, where Prometheus hopes his father lives, and they find adventure and face challenges as African Americans in a land still recovering from the Civil War.
title: The adventurous deeds of Deadwood Jones

author: Edinger, Monica
description: Tells the story of nine-year-old Margru who is sold by her father for a bag of rice, captured by slave traders, and sent to America aboard the Amistad. After the mutiny aboard the ship, she is arrested and defended in court by John Quincy Adams. Eventually Margru is educated and returns to Africa as a teacher.
title: Africa is my home

author: Chambers, Catherine
description: Recounts various African myths and legends and examines how they pertain to the beliefs and culture of the region.
title: African myths and legends

author: Choldenko, Gennifer
description: A twelve-year-old boy named Moose moves to Alcatraz Island in 1935 when guards' families were housed there, and has to contend with his extraordinary new environment in addition to life with his autistic sister.
title: Al Capone does my shirts

author: Harper, Charise Mericle
description: Nine-year-old Morgan of the Pacific Northwest is fascinated with aliens and the sasquatch, but his real adventures begin when he meets Lewis, whose parents just bought a motel named the Sasquatch Inn.
title: Alien encounter

author: Burgan, Michael
description: Text and black-and-white photographs tell the story of the life and accomplishments of African American boxer Muhammad Ali, focusing on the famous photograph of his knockout punch against Sonny Liston. Includes a timeline, a glossary, and further resources.
title: Ali's knockout punch

author: Funaro, Gregory
description: In Victorian England, Grubb, an orphan about twelve years old, escapes his life of drudgery as a chimney sweep's apprentice and finds himself in a very strange house filled with magical objects and creatures, but soon he learns that there are dark forces seeking his new master.
title: Alistair Grim's Odditorium

author: Cavanaugh, Nancy J.
description: Sixth grader Abigail, assigned a different homeroom than her two best friends and made only the alternate on the pom-pom squad, learns a lot about popularity and true friendship when paired with unpopular Gabby for a year-long "Friendly Letter Assignment."
title: Always, Abigail

author: Farndon, John
description: Presents photos, illustrations, and information about unique and unusual land animals. Discusses animals with special intelligence, skills with tools, camouflage, senses, and communication skills. Includes an index.
title: Amazing land animals

author: Alexander, Willia
description: After becoming Earth's galaxy ambassador, eleven-year-old Gabe Fuentes sets out on a journey to the center of the galaxy, where he must contend with a destructive alien force and an assassination plot, as well as the threatened deportation of his immigrant parents back home on earth.
title: Ambassador

author: Lowry, Lois
description: Ready for romance, thirteen-year-old Anastasia answers an ad in the personals with an exaggerated description of herself but soon runs into trouble when the unknown man turns up at a friend's wedding.
title: Anastasia at this address

author: Johnston, Tony
description: Arturo and his family and friends share all kinds of experiences living in the barrio of East Los Angeles--reclaiming their names, playing basketball, championing the school librarian, and even starting their own gang.
title: Any small goodness

author: Temple, Teri
description: Introduces various characters and places in Greek mythology, and then profiles the character of Apollo, the god of the sun, offering several stories showcasing his origin, personality, and abilities. Includes a Greek mythology family tree and a list of key words.
title: Apollo

author: Fitzgerald, Sarah Moore
description: Oscar Dunleavy, a teenager who used to make incredible apple tarts, has gone missing and everyone thinks he is dead, but Oscar's best friend Meg and his little brother Stevie, form a band as they try to figure out what happened to him.
title: The apple tart of hope

author: Martin, Laura
description: More than a century into the future, an attempt to clone dinosaurs has left Earth overrun with prehistoric creatures, forcing all remaining humans to live underground. When Sky Mundy's father mysteriously flees their family's safe compound, he leaves her with a cryptic message and a mission to deliver a life-saving memory card to somebody above ground. Sky and her best friend Shawn will risk it all to navigate the dangerous, above-ground world and change the fate of the Earth for the better.
title: The ark plan

author: Tuck, Pamela M.
description: Little Mason Steele is his father's very willing amanuensis, writing dutifully all his father's thoughts about the civil rights developments of his day--the 1960s. When the civil rights group gifts him with a typewriter, Mason's father gives it to him. Now he can type better than anyone in his school, being self-taught, and participates in a typing contest in his newly desegregated school. However, it is not clear that any of the white students will cheer for him if he wins.
title: As fast as words could fly

author: Kelly, Mark E.
description: Sixth-grade twins Mark and Scott construct a functioning spaceship capable of launching into space and orbiting earth with the help of their friends.
title: Astrotwins

author: Doeden, Matt
description: Contains a choose-your-own-path story involving World War II. Features three story paths, forty-six choices, and seventeen endings.
title: At battle in World War II

author: Venditti, Robert
description: After starting at a new school, nerdy seventh-grader Miles Taylor becomes a reluctant superhero when he inherits a mysterious gold cape.
title: Attack of the alien horde

author: Lassieur, Allison
description: Describes the attack on Pearl Harbor on December 7, 1941, when Japanese forces surprised Americans at the U.S. military base, and explains the significance of the attack today. The reader's choices reveal the historical details from the perspective of a Japanese pilot, a U.S. sailor, and an American nurse.
title: The attack on Pearl Harbor

author: Lupica, Mike
description: When fourteen-year-old Brian gets a summer job as batboy for the Detroit Tigers, he gets excited to spend time on the inside and spend time with his Dad who is never around. But when Brian's hero Hank Bishop is drafted back onto the team, he discovers that all of the players are more human than he realized.
title: The batboy

author: Ryan, Pam Muänoz
description: When Naomi's absent mother resurfaces to claim her, Naomi runs away to Mexico with her great-grandmother and younger brother in search of her father.
title: Becoming Naomi Leon

author: Leonard, M. G
description: Darkus Cuttle has taken care of his father ever since his mother died, but one day his father vanished from a locked vault at the Natural History Museum, and now he lives with his eccentric uncle--but one day he finds a large and unusually intelligent and self-aware beetle, and soon he and his two friends are caught up in a struggle to protect an intelligent super species of beetles.
title: Beetle boy

author: Federle, Tim
description: An eighth-grader who dreams of performing in a Broadway musical concocts a plan to run away to New York and audition for the role of Elliot in the musical version of "E.T."
title: Better Nate than ever

author: Martin, Ann M.
description: In 1930 Abby Nichols is an eight-year-old girl growing up in Maine, but as the Depression deepens, and her mother dies, the responsibility of taking care of her family falls to her, and she has to put her dreams of going to college and becoming a writer on hold.
title: Better to wish

author: Peabody, Erin
description: Presents an overview of the science and mythology behind the cryptid Bigfoot. Explores the sightings and evidence people have used to prove its existence, and the historical impact of how Bigfoot became a major figure in popular culture. Features illustrations, sidebars, and suggestions for further reading.
title: Bigfoot

author: Erdrich, Louise
description: Omakayas, a seven-year-old Native American girl of the Ojibwa tribe, lives through the joys of summer and the perils of winter on an island in Lake Superior in 1847.
title: The birchbark house

author: Johnson, Angela
description: Devastated by the loss of a second father, thirteen-year-old Bird follows her stepfather from Cleveland to Alabama in hopes of convincing him to come home, and along the way helps two boys cope with their difficulties.
title: Bird

author: Tarshis, Lauren
description: Danny's mom moved their family to Hawaii away from dangerous New York City, but Danny desires to go back, boasting he is not afraid of crime and dark alleys. He stows away on a ship in Pearl Harbor, but when the Japanese Zeros fill the skies even Danny feels fear.
title: The bombing of Pearl Harbor, 1941

author: Raum, Elizabeth
description: A plot-your-own story of the Boston Massacre. Reader's choices may lead them to participate in protests, become a British soldier, or become a maid in the house of patriot John Hancock.
title: The Boston Massacre

author: Tesler, Monica
description: Twelve-year-old Jasper and his friends are the first group of cadets, called Bounders, to be trained as astronauts who use new spaceships to teleport, but soon are forced to go up against an alien society seeking revenge for stealing this brain-sync technology.
title: Bounders

author: Oppel, Kenneth
description: Aboard "The Boundless," the greatest train ever built, on its maiden voyage across Canada, teenaged Will enlists the aid of a traveling circus to save the train from villains.
title: The Boundless

author: Creech, Sharon
description: When John and Marta find a mute boy asleep on their porch, they take him in and begin to care for the boy like he's their own. As the weeks pass and the trio becomes an unlikely family, the couple is torn between finding the boy's parents, and hoping that they never return for him.
title: The boy on the porch

author: Mone, Gregory
description: In 1936 Berlin, an eight-oared rowing team of working-class young men from the American West faced off against teams from Germany and Italy in the Olympics. Discusses the personal challenges each one of them faced during the Great Depression, the odds they overcame in making the team, and their triumphant finish.
title: The boys in the boat

author: Engle, Margarita
description: Features a collection of poetry celebrating the accomplishments of notable Hispanics from religious leaders and scientists to activists and celebrities.
title: Bravo!

author: Ursu, Anne
description: Eleven-year-olds Hazel and Jack have been best friends since they were six. When Jack suddenly stops talking to Hazel, Hazel learns that Jack's heart has been frozen and he has been taken into the woods by a woman in white to live in an ice palace. Hazel braves the enchanted forest to rescue Jack.
title: Breadcrumbs

author: Jaimet, Kate
description: When several fundraisers at the tennis club where Connor works are sabotaged, the club faces the risk of having to shut down and lose its valuable property. While Connor and his friend Maddy investigate to determine whether someone is purposely threatening the fundraisers, Connor tries to win a tournament that may award him the prize money to keep the club going.
title: Break point

author: Yelchin, Eugene
description: In the Stalinist era of the Soviet Union, ten-year-old Sasha idolizes his father, a devoted Communist, but when police take his father away and leave Sasha homeless, he is forced to examine his own perceptions, values, and beliefs.
title: Breaking Stalin's nose

author: Jones, Patrick
description: Eighteen-year-old Josãae serves as the bridge between his non-English speaking family and the rest of the world, and because his parents are illegal immigrants and extended family lives with them, money is tight so Josãae works nights and arrives at school so tired that teachers at his alternative high school step in to help.
title: Bridge

author: Woodson, Jacqueline
description: Free verse autobiography of Jacqueline Woodson about her childhood growing up in the sixties and seventies in both the North and the South, from South Carolina to Brooklyn, New York.
title: Brown girl dreaming

author: Albee, Sarah
description: Takes a humorous look at the world's insects, and their impact on human history. Discusses how insects affected wars, human migrations, plagues, and daily life. Includes dozens of facts, black-and-white photographs, and cartoon illustrations.
title: Bugged

author: Lassieur, Allison
description: Presents a choose-your-own-adventure story about the building of the Empire State Building in New York, as readers follow the story of either a young assistant at the Shreve, Lamb, and Harmon firm designing the building, a construction worker high up on the girders, or as a water boy who brings water to the thirsty construction workers.
title: Building the Empire State Building

author: Hoena, B. A.
description: Presents a choose-your-own-adventure story about the building of the Golden Gate Bridge, as readers follow the story of either a designer of the bridge or as a crew member working in a dangerous environment.
title: Building the Golden Gate Bridge

author: Mooney, Carla
description: Presents various opinions about bullying from whether or not the internet has increased bullying behaviors and if schools are doing enough to prevent and stop bullying. Includes a text-related research project, a glossary, and color photographs.
title: Bullying

author: Bradford, Michael
