description: Living in Button Hill with his little sister Riley, life is boring until Dekker discovers a strange clock made of a skull and bones in the basement, which suddenly releases an evil doppelgèanger of Dekker. The dangerous double promptly steals Dekker's heart and vanishes into the Nightside, a shadowy realm of the dead, with Riley in pursuit. Dekker musters his strength and courage to go after her and hopefully find his stolen heart as well.
title: Button Hill

author: Schroeder, Lisa
description: Caitlin hopes that the lucky charm bracelet she bought with her best friends from summer camp will bring her some luck as she starts the year at a new school and deals with stress at home.
title: Caitlin's lucky charm

author: Karre, Elizabeth
description: Destiny Davis is given the opportunity to intern at a new blog syndicate and finds herself trying to get out of a sticky political situation.
title: The campaign

author: Lassieur, Allison
description: Presents an interactive story that places the reader in the middle of the ocean, struggling for survival. The reader can select from three story paths, thirty-six choices, and twenty-four different endings to the book.
tags: Survival after airplane accidents, shipwrecks, etc.
title: Can you survive being lost at sea?

author: Rundell, Katherine
description: Wilhelmina "Will" Silver's life is half-wild, living in Africa on a farm with her horse, monkey, and best friend nearby. Then the farm is sold and Will finds herself at an English boarding school, where the packs of screaming girls are scarier than lions or hyenas.
title: Cartwheeling in thunderstorms

author: Stratford, Jordan
description: Lady Ada Byron and Mary Godwin become best of friends and decide to form the Wollstonecraft Detective Agency. It is a secret agency because they know clients wouldn't trust their secrets to two young girls, and also so their parents don't find out. Their first case involves breaking into and out of a prison, dodging fez-wearing men, telling a few lies, and also pursuing a thief by air balloon.
title: The case of the missing moonstone

author: Haskell, Merrie
description: When Sand, a blacksmith's apprentice, wakes up in a broken castle, he must find a way to put it back together.
title: The castle behind thorns

author: Avi
description: In 1951 Brooklyn, New York, twelve-year-old Pete Collison spends his time following the Giants baseball team and trying to be a detective. Then the FBI shows up accusing Pete's father of being a Communist, and Pete's classmates turn against him. Pete decides to uncover the truth, but worries it could put his family's livelihood and freedom at risk.
title: Catch you later, traitor

author: Claybourne, Anna
description: Takes readers on an exploration of the world's caves. Lists the things to take on the trip, and includes color photographs, a map, a timeline, a glossary, fact boxes, conservation tips, additional resources, and interviews with experts.
title: Caves

author: Nakaya, Andrea C.
description: Explores the pros and cons of several issues related to cell phones including their effect on relationships, addictive nature, and use by children. Includes an essay activity, a glossary, and a bibliography.
title: Cell phones

author: Yolen, Jane
description: In 1965, a year after Arianne thinks she sees a shooting star land in the fields surrounding her family's horse farm, a baby centaur is born and the family, already under scrutiny because Arianne's six-year-old brother has birth defects, struggles to keep the colt a secret.
title: Centaur rising

author: Jeter, Derek
description: When young Derek Jeter's Little League team is struggling to win games, and Derek isn't getting as much time on the field as he'd like, he realizes he has lots to learn from his coaches, friends, and family. And through it all, he learns how to become a true team player.
title: Change up

author: Smith-Llera, Danielle
description: Examines the life of Che Guevara and the famous photograph of his face,a spur-of-the-moment snapshot in 1960, which was turned into a now-world famous poster.
title: Che Guevara's face

author: Myers, Walter Dean
description: Four middle-schoolers who publish an alternative newspaper at their Harlem academy for gifted students investigate why a classmate--one of the best chess players in New York City--was caught trying to buy drugs.
title: Checkmate

author: Myers, Walter Dean
description: Presents a graphic novel depicting the conditions for slaves in the years leading up to the Civil War, the Civil War itself, and the Reconstruction years following the war.
title: The Civil War, 1850-187

author: Brandes, Wendy L.
description: Besties Claire, Nina, and Emily's friendship has been torn apart by a fight. When the three split up on the overnight camping trip, Claire finds herself in danger and afraid, and she may need her friends to comeback together to help her.
title: Claire's cursed camping trip

author: Rylander, Chris
description: Thirteen-year-old Carson Fender discovers that a secret agency is operating a top secret office in his small North Dakota town when he is asked to deliver a package that could save the world.
title: Codename Zero

author: Jeter, Derek
description: In Kalamazoo, Michigan, eight-year-old Derek Jeter, who dreams of playing for the New York Yankees, learns what it takes to be a champion on and off the field.
title: The contract

author: Medearis, Angela Shelf
description: Presents a biography of civil rights worker Coretta Scott King, recounting her early years, her participation in the African American civil rights movement, and her lifelong activism.
title: Coretta Scott King, dare to dream

author: Sloan, Holly Goldberg
description: When twelve-year-old genius Willow Chance loses her parents in an accident, her journey to find and accept a new family leads her through unexpected turns in life and forces her to confront reality in new ways.
title: Counting by 7s

author: Rinehart, J. D.
description: The prophecy says that triplets will rise and remove the despotic King Brutan from the throne of Toronia. Separated at birth, Tarlan, Elodie, and Agulphus "Gulph" have grown up under very different circumstances--Tarlan with a frost witch and friendly forest animals, Elodie with a wealthy noble family with knowledge of her heritage, and Gulph with a troupe of traveling entertainers, who has recently ended up in King Brutan's court. The prophecy is coming to a head, but the triplets may not survive long enough for it to come to pass.
title: Crown of three

author: Myers, Walter Dean
description: Friends Zander, Kambui, LaShonda, and Bobbi, caught in the middle of a mock Civil War at DaVinci Academy, learn the true cost of freedom of speech when they use their alternative newspaper, The Cruiser, to try to make peace.
title: The Cruisers

author: Jeffrey, Gary
description: Uses a graphic novel format to trace the history of the Cuban Missile Crisis. Also includes a map, color photographs, and a glossary.
title: The Cuban Missile Crisis

author: Singleton, Linda Joy
description: The Curious Cat Spy Club is born when Kelsey Case--a girl who has taught herself to lip-read--is nearly trampled by a runaway zorse--half-zebra, half-horse--owned by animal expert Becca Morales. Soon after this the girls team up with robotics expert Leo Polanski and rescue some kittens. Now they go around town solving crimes related to pets and animals.
title: The Curious Cat Spy Club

author: DeStefano, Lauren
description: Bright, imaginative eleven-year-old Pram Bellamy lives with two aunts who run a retirement home, hiding the fact that she can talk with ghosts--but not the spirit of her mother--and after befriending Clarence, who also lost his mother, she decides to find her father in hopes he can answer her questions.
title: A curious tale of the in-between

author: Lassieur, Allison
description: Examines the 9/11 terrorist attacks and details how modern espionage has changed because of them. Discusses characteristics of a good spy, myths about becoming a spy, and how spies are recruited and trained. Also explores the future of espionage. Includes profiles of spies, a timeline, photographs, a glossary, and further resources.
title: Cyber spies and secret agents of modern times

author: Burgan, Michael
description: Presents an illustrated biography of Jackie Robinson chronicling his life, baseball career, and legacy. Includes a timeline, photographs, a glossary, and further resources.
title: Daring play

author: Nagelhout, Ryan
description: Presents a biography of professional baseball player David Ortiz, including his childhood and his path to professional success. Includes a timeline, glossary, and further reading.
title: David Ortiz

author: Bell, Cece
description: This graphic novel memoir chronicles the author's humorous and sometimes difficult childhood experiences after she loses most of her hearing ability from an illness and must wear a large hearing aid on her chest.
title: El deafo

author: Holt, Kimberly Willis
description: In Rippling Creek, Louisiana, in 1948, eleven-year-old Tate writes letters to her favorite country singer, sharing her dreams of becoming a singer and revealing that her mother is in prison.
title: Dear Hank Williams

author: Donnelly, Jennifer
description: Uncovering an ancient evil, Serafina, a mermaid of the Mediterranean Sea, searches for five other mermaid heroines who are scattered across the six seas, to save their hidden world.
title: Deep blue

author: Berry, Carrie
description: Briefly explores the life of Carrie Berry, a Confederate girl who was ten years old in 1864, when the Union bombarded Atlanta with cannon fire.
title: Diary of Carrie Berry

author: Oakes, Cory Putman
description: Sawyer's grandpa was part stegosaurus, and as everyone knows the dinosaur gene skips a generation, it is isn't surprising that Sawyer begins sprouting spikes and a tail in fifth grade. He will have to use them, too, as in a twist of the norm he will have to rescue the bullies from their horrible school principal.
title: Dinosaur boy

author: Hustad, Douglas
description: Examines a number of different types of drones and unmanned aircraft in use by the military and by civilians today, from the military's MQ-9 Reaper to Amazon's delivery drones.
title: Discover drones

author: Hustad, Douglas
description: Explores the field of robotics, examining its history, important inventors, the development of modern robots, and their various uses today and in the future. Includes color photographs, a glossary, and further resources.
title: Discover robotics

author: Hapka, Cathy
description: Avery visits a secret cove to see a dolphin and avoid thinking about her parents' divorce. Maria comes to the cove to draw pictures of the dolphin. Although the girls come from very different worlds, the dolphin brings them together in a tenuous friendship. When the dolphin is in trouble, the girls must overcome their differences and work together to save it.
title: Dolphin dreams

author: Rooney, Anne
description: Examines the 2010 Haiti earthquake from various perspectives including eyewitnesses, emergency workers, scientists, and the media. Includes color photographs, a timeline, a glossary, and further resources.
title: Earthquake

author: Lee, Jenny
description: All his life Benji, now ten, has been sickly and he has long been targeted by the school bully, but after a seizure Benji gets a therapy dog that is not only big enough to protect him, it can also talk.
title: Elvis and the underdogs

author: Engle, Margarita
description: Margarita Engle grew up a child of two worlds--Los Angeles during the school year, Cuba, her mother's island home, in the summers. However, when the Bay of Pigs event happens, Margarita finds her two worlds, the U.S. and Cuba, meeting in the worst way possible. In this memoir, Margarita Engle relates how she saw the events of these times and how they have shaped her as a poet.
title: Enchanted air

author: Riggs, Kate
description: Examines the events leading up to and surrounding the end of the Cold War and how the world has been affected since then.
title: The end of the Cold War

author: Barber, Tiki
description: Co-captains Tiki and Ronde Barber lead their junior high teammates to the Virginia state football championship.
title: End zone

author: Grabenstein, Chris
description: A group of kids are excited to spend a fun night at a lock-in at Mr. Lemoncello's newly opened library. However, the event is quite literal--now they will have to band together to find a way out before it is too late.
title: Escape from Mr. Lemoncello's library

author: Golden, Laura
description: A young girl fights to keep her mother out of the mental ward, her home away from the bank, and herself out of the orphanage after her father abandons her and her mother in depression-era Alabama.
title: Every day after

author: Hoena, B. A.
description: Examines the physical traits, behaviors, habitats, life cycles, and conservation status of several species of birds of prey. Features over 100 color photographs, fact boxes, maps, quizzes, an interactive glossary, and information from an ecologist.
title: Everything birds of prey

author: Thiessen, Mar
description: National Geographic photographer and wildland firefighter Mark Thiessen shares his experiences journeying around the world investigating extreme wildfires and the people who fight them. Discusses fire safety, the benefits of wildfires to nature, equipment and techniques to fight fires, and the science behind wildfires. Features color photographs, quotes, a glossary of terms, charts, further resources, and fact boxes.
title: Extreme wildfire

author: Buckley, Michael
description: Orphans Sabrina and Daphne Grimm are sent to live with an eccentric grandmother that they have always believed to be dead.
title: The fairy-tale detectives

author: Lupica, Mike
description: Since his mother's death, Jayson, twelve, has focused on basketball and surviving but he is found out and placed with an affluent foster family of a different race, and must learn to accept many changes, including facing his former teammates in a championship game.
title: Fast break

author: Perritano, John
description: Explores fault lines and how they affect the Earth, such as what happens with fault lines during an earthquake, how many fault lines we know about on Earth, and where the largest fault line is located.
title: Fault lines

author: Bolden, Tonya
description: Young Delana is brought up by her grandfather and Aunt Tilley, who keeps her from experiencing a normal life. After Aunt Tilley dies, Delana searches for answers in antique photographs and Tilley's ficticious stories about her unknown father and family. Includes black-and-white reproductions of antique photos.
title: Finding family

author: Ross, Joel N.
description: Hundreds of years in the future, a thick white mist covers the Earth, leaving only mountaintops habitable for humanity. The Five Families rule over the slums and junkyards, and the ruthless Lord Kodoc brings his harsh order to the skies. Ships sail the fog, like Hazel's salvage raft. Working for Hazel is Chess, the tetherboy, a boy who has a secret that Lord Kodoc, if he ever learned about it, could use for evil.
title: The Fog diver

author: Anderson, Laurie Halse
description: Separated from his friend Isabel after their daring escape from slavery, fifteen-year-old Curzon serves as a free man in the Continental Army at Valley Forge until he and Isabel are thrown together again, as slaves once more.
title: Forge

author: Prendergast, Gabrielle
description: Stell and her newly formed band must decide whether to change their edgy rock sound to get into a conservative summer music festival.
title: The frail days

author: Blakemore, Megan Frazer
description: When her former best friend gets popular and leaves her behind, sixth-grader Ruth prefers to be alone, studying for the school spelling bee, until she finds a riddle in an old book that sends her on an unexpected quest.
title: The friendship riddle

author: Lyttle, Alex
description: Having moved from the city to a small town, eleven-year-old Calvin Sinclair is bored the summer before his sixth-grade year. He passes the time by convincing his six-year-old brother, Sammy, to do silly things, like collecting ants, but when Cal meets Aleta, a new girl who loves "Goosebumps" and adventure, Cal leaves Sammy behind. Then, Sammy is diagnosed with something scary, and Cal worries he caused it.
title: From ant to eagle

author: Gantos, Jack
description: After an explosion, a new crime by an old murderer, and the sad passing of the founder of Norvelt, Pennsylvania, twelve-year-old Jack accompanies his slightly mental elderly mentor, Miss Volker, on a cross-country run as she pursues the oddest of outlaws.
title: From Norvelt to nowhere

author: Bright, Michael
description: Explores the relationship between solar energy and electricity. Discusses electricity use in the home, solar panels and heating, sunlight's journey to Earth, and the future of solar energy. Includes a glossary, index, and resources for further information.
title: From sunshine to light bulb

author: Grisham, John
description: Thirteen-year-old Theodore Boone is on a field trip to Washington, D.C. when he encounters his old enemy, accused murderer and fugitive Pete Duffy. Theo attempts to bring Duffy back to Strattenburg to stand trial, putting himself in grave danger.
title: The fugitive

author: Dower, Laura
description: Gabi, a girl allergic to peanuts and to social attention of any kind, is called upon to use her artistic talent to help her school on an important project. She finds encouragement and help from her best friend, a new boy, and a possibly-magical baker named Daisy.
title: Gabi and the great big bakeover

author: Quinn, Jason
description: Presents a biography of Mohandas "Mahatma" Gandhi in graphic novel format, from his birth in 1869 to his assassination in 1948.
title: Gandhi

author: Reynolds, Jason
description: When basketball player Castle Cranshaw--nicknamed Ghost--challenges an elite sprinter to a race and wins, he finds himself on the radar of an Olympic medalist track coach who wants to nurture his raw talent. But Ghost's anger and determination to outrun his past, could stand in the way of him making good use of his natural ability.
title: Ghost

author: Giff, Patricia Reilly
description: When her brother Rob, a Navy cook, goes missing in action during World War II, Jayna, desperate for family, leaves upstate New York and their cranky landlady, accompanied by a turtle and a ghost, to seek their grandmother, who Rob believes may live in Brooklyn. Includes soup recipes.
title: Gingersnap

author: Quirk, Katie
description: In 1967 Tanzania, when President Nyerere urges his people to work together as one extended family, the people of Litongo move to a new village which, to some, seems cursed, but where thirteen-year-old Shida, a healer, and her female cousins are allowed to attend school. Includes glossary and author's note.
title: A girl called Problem

author: Farmer, Nancy
description: While journeying to Zimbabwe, eleven-year-old Nhamo struggles to escape drowning and starvation and in so doing comes close to the luminous world of the African spirits.
title: A girl named Disaster

author: Coville, Bruce
description: When an accidental spell brings a mysterious stone toad to life, and it hops away with her human friend William between its jaws, Fauna must use her magic and her wits to save him, embarking on a journey through dangerous lands with fearsome giants, talking bears, and packs of rogue goblins.
title: Goblins on the prowl

author: Williams-Garcia, Rita
description: Three feisty sisters--Delphine, Vonetta, and Fern Gaither--help their eighty-two-year-old grandmother, Ma Charles, make peace with her half-sister, Miss Trotter, while visiting Ma Charles in Alabama during the summer of 1969.
title: Gone crazy in Alabama

author: Baxter, Roberta
description: Presents three viewpoints on the Great Depression, from a government worker, a member of the Civilian Conservation Corps, and a young girl. Includes photographs, a glossary, and further resources.
title: The Great Depression

author: Scanlon, Elizabeth Garton
description: Ivy Green's summer takes a turn for the confusing when her mama runs off with a charismatic preacher who calls himself, of all things, Hallelujah Dave. Left with her equally confused father, Ivy begins to lose faith in everything she used to depend on. Her friend, Paul, is having a crummy summer also, as the Space Shuttle program has been scrapped--but that gives Ivy the idea to set things right, for both herself and Paul.
title: The great good summer

author: Johnson, Varian
description: Jackson Greene has a reputation as a prankster at Maplewood Middle School, but after the last disaster he is trying to go straight--but when it looks like Keith Sinclair may steal the election for school president from Jackson's former best friend, Gabriela, he assembles a team of talented troublemakers to make sure Keith does not succeed.
title: The great Greene heist

author: Van Draanen, Wendelin
description: While evil Damien Black is holding people in the bank hostage, Dave enlists the aid of Sticky, a heroic Gecko, to put an end to the trouble.
title: The greatest power

author: Al-Mansour, Haifaa
description: In Riyadh, Saudi Arabia, eleven-year-old Wadjda dreams of having a bicycle to race her friend, Abdullah, but it is not proper for girls to own a bike. Wadjda attempts to earn money for a bike by passing notes in class and selling mixtapes of banned music but she is caught. Although Wadjda is forced to temporarily stop scheming, she is determined to buy a bicycle, and risks everything to make her dream come true.
title: The green bicycle

author: Milford, Kate
description: One winter at the Greenglass House, the innkeepers' adopted son Milo hears dozens of strange stories from secretive guests who are somehow or another connected with the history of the House. Things go missing from the house, prompting Milo and Meddy, the cook's daughter, to investigate.
title: Greenglass House

author: Milford, Kate
description: A collection of poems by Haitian schoolchildren about the nature they see all around them in their native country of Haiti. Includes portraits of the poets.
title: Haiti

author: Barwin, Steven
description: When baseball team captain and bully Wade starts hazing his cousin, Griffin stands up to Wade, possibly ruining his chances at a baseball scholarship. Steroids are found in Griffin's locker and he is going to be kicked off the team--unless he can prove they aren't his.
title: Hardball

author: Lassieur, Allison
description: A choose-your-own-adventure story that allows readers to experience what life was like in 1920s Harlem during the Harlem Renaissance. Allows readers to witness this era from various points of view and features dozens of choices and possible endings.
title: The Harlem Renaissance

author: Vernon, Ursula
description: Harriet Hamsterbone is trying to be the perfect princess, but life at the royal palace is dull. When she learns from her parents that she is cursed to prick her finger on a hamster wheel at the age of twelve and fall into a deep slumber, Harriet believes she is invincible until that age and sets off on an adventure with her friend Mumfrey the quail. However, when things go wrong at home, she must find a prince to help her set things right.
title: Harriet the invincible

author: Ramsey, Grace
description: Features a collection of ghost stories associated with hotels. Include a glossary, text-related questions, resources for further information, and color photographs.
title: Haunted hotels

author: Nelson, Kadir
description: An unnamed narrator tells the story of her Pap and the history of African Americans in America, including the Revolutionary War, the Civil War, the Civil Rights Movement, and finally the election of Barak Obama.
title: Heart and soul

author: Preus, Margi
description: After fourteen-year-old Manjiro and his friends are stranded on an island in 1841, they are picked up by an American whaling ship where Manjiro becomes eager to learn about this new culture and describes his ten-year journey to places he'd never seen, including America. But Manjiro longs to return to his home in Japan and become a samurai. Includes biographical information about Manjiro, black-and-white illustrations, a glossary, and sources for additional information.
title: Heart of a samurai

author: Shotz, Jennifer Li
description: Shortly after twelve-year-old Ben and his search-and-rescue dog Hero adopt Scout, a stray, Scout goes missing suddenly. Led down a dangerous path, it's up to Hero and his special skills to bring Scout home before it's too late.
title: Hero

author: Williams, Brian
description: Provides a brief overview of World War II, and profiles over a dozen courageous soldiers who fought in the air, at sea, and on the battlefield. Features photographs, fact boxes, maps, a timeline, a glossary, and further resources.
title: Heroes of the battlefield

author: Prins, Marcel
description: Collects true stories about Jewish children surviving the Holocaust, all of whom had to go into hiding after the manner of Anne Frank.
title: Hidden like Anne Frank

author: Jeter, Derek
description: In Kalamazoo, Michigan, young Derek Jeter, who dreams of playing for the New York Yankees, begins Little League season and finds himself on a new team. As the season progresses, Jeter learns about slumps, tries a new sport, helps his sister, meets a new friend, and suffers the consequences of breaking a contract with his parents.
title: Hit & miss

author: Applegate, Katherine
description: A young African named Kek is separated from his mother and sent to live in Minnesota. He doesn't like the snow and ice but he makes it through the winter with the help of new friends.
title: Home of the brave

author: Green, Tim
description: Josh learns that his father is quitting coaching his baseball team and is moving away, forcing his mom and little sister to move into a dingy apartment. Josh decides to enter a home-run derby in which the winner gets a new house, but first Josh must qualify by hitting twenty home runs during his baseball season. With his friends' help, Josh works to save his family before they lose everything.
title: Home run

author: Gemeinhart, Dan
description: After learning that his childhood cancer has returned, twelve-year-old Mark runs away with this dog to fulfill his dream of climbing Mount Rainier. In the meantime, his friend Jessie, who knows where Mark is, struggles with whether to alert Mark's parents or allow Mark to continue his journey.
title: The honest truth

author: Alvarez, Julia
description: When Juanita and Miguel's aunt, Tia Lola, travels to America from the Dominican Republic to help them with their parents' divorce, she becomes so wrapped up in things that she doesn't notice when her visa expires. It isn't long, however, before the entire community rallies their support to lend a helping hand.
title: How Tâia Lola learned to teach

author: Storey, Rita
description: Includes step-by-step, illustrated instructions for building a variety of aircraft from a homemade hot-air balloon to a rubber-band helicopter. Includes a timeline, a glossary, resources for further information, and color photographs.
title: How to build aircraft

author: Farndon, John
description: Follows a young boy who is taken aboard a pirate ship where he learns about pirate ships, clothing, weapons, and tactics. Includes a glossary, a list of ten key facts, and tips for how to live like a pirate throughout.
title: How to live like a Caribbean pirate

author: Farndon, John
description: Follows a young Egyptian boy who learns step-by-step how become a mummy maker. Includes a glossary, a list of ten key facts, and sidebars throughout.
title: How to live like an Egyptian mummy maker

author: Rorby, Ginny
description: When thirteen-year-old Joey Willis, deaf since the age of six, meets Dr. Charles Mansell and his chimpanzee Sukari, who use sign language, her world blooms with possibilities but that of the chimp begins to narrow.
title: Hurt go happy

author: Sayre, Justin
description: Davis is worried about starting high school and being defined by one adjective. Then his best friend Sophie starts doing "girl stuff," and he has problems with his mom, her new boyfriend, and his embarrassing grandmother. Davis copes by listening to opera, and tries to survive his most difficult year yet.
title: Husky

author: Patterson, James
description: Resolving to become the world's greatest stand-up comedian despite less-than-funny challenges in his life, wheelchair-bound middle school student Jamie Grimm endures bullying from his mean-spirited cousin and hopes he will be fairly judged when he enters a local comedy contest.
title: I funny

author: Garcâia, Cristina
description: Thirteen-year-old, clarinet-playing, Southern California surfer, Yumi Ruiz-Hirsch, comes from a complex family--her father is Jewish-Japanese, her mother is Cuban, and her parents are divorced--and when her grandfather Saul is diagnosed with terminal cancer, Yumi asks him to tell her his life story, which helps her to understand her own history and identity.
title: I wanna be your shoebox

author: Johnson, Terry Lynn
description: In this survival story set in Alaska, fourteen-year-old Vicky and her dog sled team find an injured sledder in the wilderness.
title: Ice dogs

author: Myers, Walter Dean
description: Presents the life of Ida Barnett-Wells, an activist, educator, jouralist, suffragette, and a strong voice against lynching. Deplored the unequal treatment of blacks in the United States.
title: Ida B. Wells

author: Reedy, Trent
description: High school student Mike Wilson has been struggling to be the man of the family for his mother and his younger sister Mary ever since Mike's father, a soldier, was killed in mysterious circumstances in Afghanistan when Mike was seven. But when Mike turns sixteen, he begins receiving letters from his father, written while his father was still alive and arranged to be sent to Mike when he turned sixteen. The letters provide wisdom and encouragement, and prompt Mike to begin living fully, as well as to discover who is sending the letters and how his father actually died.
title: If you're reading this

author: Blume, Judy
description: When a black family with three children moves into the white neighborhood, eleven-year-old Winnie learns the difference between being a good neighbor and being a good friend.
title: Iggie's house

author: Helfand, Lewis
description: Highlights key aspects of the Industrial Revolution from its roots in eighteenth-century Germany to the continued industrialization of less developed countries today.
title: The industrial revolution

author: Verstraete, Larry
description: Examines the history of technological innovation and invention that has led to items we live with and use everyday without thinking about it, such as microwaves, elevators, and umbrellas.
title: Innovations in everyday technologies

author: Lai, Thanhha
description: Through a series of poems, a young girl chronicles the life-changing year of 1975, when she, her mother, and her brothers leave Vietnam and resettle in Alabama.
title: Inside out & back again

author: Elkins, Elizabeth
description: Explores how dangerous floods can be and how much damage they can cause in a short time--sinkholes, mudslides, uprooted trees--and how to stay safe if caught in one.
title: Investigating floods

author: Grabenstein, Chris
description: Twelve-year-old Billy embarks on an adventure after discovering a library full of books on a remote island where fictional characters come to life.
title: The island of Dr. Libris

author: Brahmachari, Sita
description: Half British, half Indian fourteen-year-old Mira Levenson travels to India for the first time, where she uncovers secrets about her mother's past and comes to better understand her own identity.
title: Jasmine skies

author: Montgomery, Sy
description: Explores the work and findings of New Zealand's National Kakapo Recovery Team. Includes color photographs.
title: Kakapo rescue

author: Roberts, Willo Davis
description: No one believes eleven-year-old Joey, who has a reputation for telling tall tales, when he claims to have witnessed the kidnapping of the class bully outside their expensive New York City private school.
title: The kidnappers

author: Levine, Deborah A.
description: Three girls and their mothers sign up to take a cooking class together in Chef Antonio's San Francisco kitchen, but the drama that ensues may drive them apart rather than bring them closer together.
title: Kitchen chaos

author: Watts, Jeri Hanel
description: Shortly after the integration of public schools, Kizzy Ann Stamps is apprehensive about starting at a new school, worried she will not make any new friends, or that kids will make fun of her for her scar. While worrying about starting school, Kizzy Ann is also worried that she will not be able to enter a herding competition due to the color of her skin.
title: Kizzy Ann Stamps

author: Malone, Lee Gjertsen
description: Seventh-grader Jeremy Miner, the only boy in a school of 475 girls, unleashes a series of pranks in hopes of getting expelled.
title: The last boy at St. Edith's

author: Tyre, Lisa Lewis
description: Lou and Benzer prayed for their summer to be exciting, but not in the bad way that seems to be happening--the county wants to take Lou's house away from her family. To save it, Lou and Benzer try to solve a mystery about Lou's great-great-great-grandfather and the gold he stole during the Civil War. In the search she finds her great-great-great-grandmother's diary and learns a heap about her family's colorful past.
title: Last in a long line of rebels

author: Salane, Jeffrey
description: M Freeman, an only child and a home-schooler, realizes that her entire education has been to groom her to become a master criminal. She had no way of knowing her education was different from that of other kids, being home schooled and all. She is as good at picking pockets, counterfeiting, creating disguises, and hacking computer codes as any thief, and now her first real-world heist is on. When it goes wrong, M will have to figure out who she can trust, or soon all that education will be for nothing.
title: Lawless

author: Heldring, Thatcher
description: Fourteen-year-old Wyatt, hoping to impress a girl and ward off a bully, decides to join his older brother's summer football league, "The League of Pain," against the advice of his parents, who think golf is the right sport for him.
title: The league

author: Gutman, Dan
description: As they near the end of their wacky road trip, Coke and Pepsi McDonald realize their adventures are far from over, as they are abducted by aliens, caged with a venomous snake, fall into a volcano, and are pushed into a turbine--and, strangest of all, their parents might actually believe them.
title: License to thrill

author: Copeland, Misty
description: Presents a young reader's biography of Misty Copeland, the first female African American to dance solo for the American Ballet Theatre. Examines Copeland's childhood living in poverty, how she and her dancing talent were discovered, and how she has made history with the Theatre today.
title: Life in motion

author: Spilsbury, Louise
description: Discusses the life processes of all living things focusing on reproduction, growth, development, feeding, breathing, getting rid of waste, movement, and the senses.
title: Life processes

author: Lai, Thanhha
description: After a back-breaking straight-A school year filled with too many extracurricular activities to count, twelve-year-old Mai's parents "reward" her by sending her to Vietnam, so she can get in touch with her roots. At first miserable, not knowing the language or customs, Mai spends time with her grandmother and learns to love her heritage, and even discovers secrets about her family's past, such as what happened to her grandfather during the war.
title: Listen, slowly

author: Schmidt, Gary D.
description: In 1911, Turner Buckminster hates his new home of Phippsburg, Maine, but things improve when he meets Lizzie Bright Griffin, a girl from a poor, nearby island community founded by former slaves that the town fathers--and Turner's--want to change into a tourist spot.
title: Lizzie Bright and the Buckminster boy

author: Hepplewhite, Peter
description: Presents a humorous exploration of the origins and development of sewer systems throughout world history, beginning with the most ancient fossilized poop known to man and working up through Mesopotamian, Egyptian, Greek, Roman, and later civilizations and their innovations to deal with sewage.
title: Loos, poos, and number twos

author: Camper, Cathy
description: When the Aztec god of the Underworld steals the Lowriders' beloved cat, they embark on a wild road trip into the center of the earth in order to rescue their pet.
title: Lowriders to the center of the earth

author: Pyron, Bobbie
description: Nate Harlow has never been lucky--he has never won a prize, never gotten picked first for games, and never even called a coin toss right. Everything changes for him on his eleventh birthday when, on a mini-golf course, he is struck by lightning and survives. Ever since then Nate's luck has turned good, but now that Nate's popular, his best friend, Genesis "Gen" Beam, worries he has no time for her anymore.
title: Lucky strike

author: Abbott, Tony
description: Told from multiple points of view, a white family on a 1959 road trip between Ohio and Florida, visiting Civil War battlefields along the way, crosses paths with a black family near Atlanta, where one of their children has gone missing.
title: Lunch-box dream

author: Blake, Stephani
description: In 1959, Freedom Jane McKenzie hopes to participate in a local marble competition and show the other children in her town that she's the best at the game. Amidst her ongoing family problems, however, Freedom must decide how to proceed and how to handle issues of love, friendship, and family.
title: The marble queen

author: Nielsen, Jennifer A.
description: When Nic, a slave in the mines outside of Rome, is forced to enter a sealed cavern containing lost treasures of Julius Caesar, he finds himself in possession of an ancient amulet filled with magic once reserved for the Gods, and becomes the center of a conspiracy to overthrow the emperor and destroy Rome.
title: Mark of the thie

author: Jobling, Curtis
description: When Max van Helsing starts being attacked by monsters without reason, he discovers that an evil warlock has cursed him.
title: Max Helsing and the thirteenth curse

author: Garza, Xavier
description: Everybody is fighting in sixth-grader Maximilian's world as his elderly aunts battle for the Queen Bingo trophy, his masked uncles wrestle for the tag-team title of the world, and his sweetheart and the "new girl" battle for Max's heart.
title: Maximilian & the bingo rematch

author: Garza, Xavier
description: Max is asked to join the Lucha Libre Club, but because of strict secrecy, he cannot tell anyone of his royal wrestling blood: his uncle is the king of lucha libre, the Guardian Angel. Meanwhile, another match is on between Max's love Cecilia, and the new girl in town, Paloma, who has an edge because she knows about Max's secret life as a wrestler.
title: Maximilian & the Lucha Libre Club

author: Garza, Xavier
description: Eleven-year-old Margarito, a big fan of the form of wrestling known as lucha libre, begins to suspect that he has a close connection with his favorite luchador, El Angel de La Guardia, the Guardian Angel.
title: Maximilian & the mystery of the Guardian Angel

author: Whittemore, Jo
description: Though they are like best friends, sometimes Tori Porter wishes her mother acted more her age--especially when she finds out her mom's poor financial decisions could cost them their dress shop and home. The potential for financial freedom comes in the form of a challenge--whichever family member can last two weeks in recently-deceased great-aunt Muriel's colonial home, that member will inherit the property.
title: Me & mom vs. the world

author: Morpurgo, Michael
description: Based on a true story about the first black officer in the British Army, tells how a young boy named Michael receives a letter upon his aunt's passing that tells Michael about his grandfather Leroy, a black officer in WWI who saved the lives of many of his fellow soldiers. However, Leroy was never honored for his bravery because of the racial barrier, so Michael decides to do something about it.
title: A medal for Leroy

author: Roberts, Willo Davis
description: At first eleven-year-old Megan is astonished when her mother insists on taking her and her younger brother up to the lake cottage a week before school is out, but then they find mysterious strangers following them.
title: Megan's island

author: Dell, Pamela
description: Fifteen-year-old Tillie Pierce offers an eyewitness account of the Battle of Gettysburg. Features illustrations, background information on Pierce's life, a timeline, a glossary, critical thinking questions, and further resources.
title: Memoir of Tillie Pierce

author: Hamm, Mia
description: Features a collection of inspiration quotes from soccer player Mia Hamm. Includes tips for writing a biography, a glossary, a website for further information, and color photographs.
title: Mia Ham

author: Schroeder, Lisa
description: Mia becomes the subject of school gossip after she is befriended by a famous actress who hires Mia to be her photographer.
title: Mia's golden bird

author: Jordan, Michael
description: Features a collection of inspiration quotes from pro-basketball great Michael Jordan. Includes tips for writing a biography, a glossary, a website for further information, and color photographs.
title: Michael Jorda

author: Jackson, Linda Williams
description: Rose Lee Carter, a thirteen-year-old African-American girl, dreams of life beyond the Mississippi cotton fields during the summer of 1955, but when Emmett Till is murdered and his killers are unjustly acquitted, Rose is torn between seeking her destiny outside of Mississippi or staying and being a part of an important movement.
title: Midnight without a moon

author: Peebles, Alice
description: Examines ten mutants from mythology, describing each one's origin, characteristics, and weaknesses; and ranking them by their strength, repulsiveness, special powers, ferocity, and invincibility.
title: Mighty mutants

author: Rauf, Don
description: Presents a biography of professional baseball player Miguel Cabrera, including his childhood and his path to professional success. Includes a timeline, glossary, and further reading.
title: Miguel Cabrera

author: Blewett, Ashlee Brown
description: Presents a full-color magazine-type book from National Geographic on lions and their rescue. Describes their different breeds, natural history, physical and behavioral traits, habitat, and conservation status. Includes real-life stories, maps, field reports, fact files, activities, infographics, and resources.
title: Missio

author: Plaxton, Judith
description: Tells the stories of two African American girls. Flower, an escaped slave, travels north with her family on the Underground Railroad and nearly two centuries later, Felicia researches her ancestry for a class project and learns her family's history as slaves.
title: Morning star

author: Engle, Margarita
description: When his mother is sent to jail in Los Angeles, eleven-year-old Tony goes to live with his forest ranger great-uncle in the Sierra Nevada Mountains, where Tony experiences unconditional love for the first time through his friendship with a rescue dog.
title: Mountain dog

author: Primavera, Elise
description: Ms. Rapscott has a school for daughters of busy parents. When five boxes arrive in the mail, they bring four new students but one student is missing. The group sets off on an adventure to find the missing student that teaches them about courage, strength, bravery, and teamwork.
title: Ms. Rapscott's girls

author: Down, Susan Brophy
description: Discusses the life of Muhammad Ali, from his birth as Cassius Clay and his days beating up bullies in the school yard to the changing of his name and becoming a world championship boxer.
title: Muhammad Ali

author: Stevens, Robin
description: At an English boarding school in the 1930s, crime-solving friends Hazel Wong and Daisy Wells struggle to find an exciting mystery to investigate until Hazel discovers the dead body of Miss Bell, the science teacher.
title: Murder is bad manners

author: Solomons, David
description: Eleven-year-old Luke, a hardcore fan of comics and superheroes, is jealous when his undeserving older brother Zack is zapped by an alien and turned into a superhero, until a plot to destroy the Earth incapacitates Zack, and Luke, accompanied by Lara, the nosey girl next door, must come to the rescue.
title: My brother is a superhero

author: Buckley, Michael
description: Once more a team of "nerds" try to save the world from their secret headquarters in the basement of their school.
title: National Espionage, Rescue, and Defense Society

author: Soto, Gary
description: Twenty-one poems about growing up in an Hispanic neighborhood, highlighting the delights in such everyday items as sprinklers, the park, the library, and pomegranates.
title: Neighborhood odes

author: Lawson, Jessica
description: Eleven-year-old Tabitha Crum, whose parents were just about to abandon her, is invited to the country estate of a wealthy countess along with five other children and told that one of them will become her heir.
title: Nooks & crannies

author: Mulder, Michelle
description: Dian, who has been visiting the Dominican Republic for years with her doctor parents, is outraged when her fourteen-year-old Dominican friend, Aracely, announces that she is engaged to be married. Meanwhile, her friendship with a cute Haitian boy there inspires her to do something practical to help him and the other villagers.
title: Not a chance

author: Ventura, Marne
description: Explores twelve myths and misconceptions about nutrition. Discusses the differences between white and whole-grain bread, how much water a person needs, and if multivitamins are important.
title: Nutrition myths, busted!

author: Harrell, Rob
description: As a troll, Zarf Belford is at the bottom of the social ladder at Cotswin Middle School, but when the king goes missing and his insufferable son takes control, Zarf leads his friends Kevin and Chester on a rescue mission.
title: The trouble with weasels

author: Anderson, Laurie Halse
description: As the Revolutionary War gets underway, thirteen-year-old Isabel and her sister Ruth become the slaves of a New York City couple, despite being promised freedom upon the death of their old owner. When Isabel meets Curzon, a slave with ties to the Patriots, however, he persuades her to spy on her new owners, who have ties to the British and may know when and how the British are planning to invade.
title: Chains

author: Biskup, Agnieszka
description: Graphic novel chronicling Barack Obama's elections first as Illinois' state senator then as President of the United States.
title: Obama

author: Bates, Sonya Spreen
description: Dylan is thrilled to make the starting lineup for the basketball playoffs, but when his girlfriend Jenna starts getting anonymous threats, Dylan turns his energy and attention to keeping her safe.
title: Off the rim

author: Avi
description: When an old wolf named Nashoba tries to lead his starving pack to food before death sets in--or aggressive newcomer Garby manages to replace him as leader--Nashoba's and his raven friend Merla's lives are irrevocably changed when they encounter 13-year-old Casey, eager to try out his new longbow and demonstrate the skills he's honed on his favorite computer hunting game.
title: Old wolf

author: Williams-Garcia, Rita
description: In the summer of 1968, after traveling from Brooklyn to Oakland, California, to spend a month with the mother they barely know, eleven-year-old Delphine and her two younger sisters arrive to a cold welcome as they discover that their mother, a dedicated poet and printer, is resentful of the intrusion of their visit and wants them to attend a nearby Black Panther summer camp.
title: One crazy summer

author: Grimes, Nikki
description: A collection of illustrated poems from voices out of the Harlem Renaissance such as Langston Hughes, Georgia Douglas Johnson, Gwendolyn Bennett, and Countee Cullen. Also includes poetry by author Nikki Grimes inspired by the poems of the Harlem artists.
title: One last word

author: DeKeyser, Stacy
description: Rudi and Susanna Louisa take a journey to find the witch of Petz after Susanna Louisa sells Rudi's family cow for three magic beans.
title: One witch at a time

author: Levine, Kristi
description: In a small town near Chicago in 1953, cowboy-obsessed twelve-year-old Tommy deals with beatings at home, problems with his Catholic school friends, and a new paper route that he took over for his sister when she was badly burned in a fire. Then Tommy's own misbehavior gets the local store owner in trouble, and he decides to set things right. To his surprise, he finds new friends--and a communist--in the neighborhood.
title: The paper cowboy

author: Vawter, Vince
description: When an eleven-year-old boy takes over a friend's newspaper route in July, 1959, in Memphis, his debilitating stutter makes for a memorable month.
title: Paperboy

author: Crowder, Melanie
description: Told from three perspectives, Sarel, who just witnessed the brutal murder of her parents, Nandi, the leader of a pack of dogs who looks out for her pups and Sarel, and Musa, an escaped prisoner with the water song inside him, struggle to survive in a land without water.
title: Parched

author: Hamilton, Virginia
description: In this retelling of a folktale, a group of slaves, unable to bear their sadness and starvation any longer, calls upon the African magic that allows them to fly away.
title: The people could fly

author: Going, K. L
description: Twelve-year-old Tia lives in a white slum in New Orleans with her mother, and her whole life revolves around singing in the gospel choir with her best friend, Keisha. However, when there is a shooting outside the church, and a baby is killed, it triggers long-buried memories in Tia and she finds that she cannot sing until she confronts her feelings about her incarcerated father who killed a girl in a failed robbery years before.
title: Pieces of why

author: Magaziner, Lauren
description: Troublemaking George is kidnapped and brought to Pilfer Academy, where the teachers are kooky and the kids are trained to be professional thieves. In between disguise classes and escape-route obstacle courses, George and his new friend Tabitha become expert bandits--but everything is ruined when George and Tabitha realize they are too nice to be thieves. They will have to stage their biggest heist and escape yet to get out of the school.
title: Pilfer Academy

author: Farndon, John
description: Presents a look at plagues throughout history, including the Black Death, tuberculosis, and smallpox. Discusses how people thought these diseases spread and how doctors eventually discovered how to treat them.
title: Plague!

author: Grimes, Nikki
description: A series of poems describes all the baffling changes at home and at school in twelve-year-old Joylin's transition from tomboy basketball player to not-quite-girly girl.
title: Planet Middle School

author: Lupica, Mike
description: When basketball season starts up, point guard Ben McBain encounters competition in the form of new kid Chase Braggs, who also happens to be a point guard. When their rivalry ends up taking the fun out of the game, Ben has to find a way to step up his game while remembering to have a good time.
title: Play makers

author: Guillain, Charlotte
description: Takes readers on an exploration of the world's polar regions. Lists the things to take on the trip, and includes color photographs, a map, a timeline, a glossary, fact boxes, conservation tips, additional resources, and interviews with experts.
title: Polar regions

author: Erdrich, Louise
description: Twelve-year-old Omakayas travels with her family in 1852 by canoe in search of a new home near Lake Superior. During their journey they encounter danger and hardships but they survive. Omakayas learns from the land and the spirits that she has what she needs.
title: The porcupine year

author: Herrera, Juan Felipe
description: Profiles the struggles and triumphs of twenty past and present Hispanic Americans who have contributed to the arts, politics, science, humanitarianism, and athletics. Features portraits by artist Raâul Colâon, biographies by California poet laureate Juan Felipe Herrera, and famous quotes.
title: Portraits of Hispanic American heroes

author: Hale, Shannon
description: While attending a strict academy for potential princesses with the other girls from her mountain village, fourteen-year-old Miri discovers unexpected talents and connections to her homeland.
title: Princess Academy

author: Lupica, Mike
description: Jake Cullen, fourteen, lives in the shadows of his father and older brother until he becomes the starting quarterback for the high school football team and finally has his chance to shine.
title: QB 1

author: Gish, Melissa
description: Explores the physical characteristics, behavior, diet, life cycle, and habitat of raccoons. Features color photographs and a glossary of terms.
title: Raccoons

author: Lieb, Josh
description: Seventh-grader Joey is bitten by an old rat, and becomes a three-inch-tall rodent himself. Suddenly, Joey has all sorts of rat-like feelings, feeling the call of the city streets and the smells of garbage, like a scone with a spork in it--however, when Joey pulls out the spork, he enters an ancient, unfulfilled rat prophecy, for this spork is the legendary sword Ratscalibur. The problem is, when the going gets tough, Joey may not want to remain a rat to see the prophecy through.
title: Ratscalibur

author: Pinkney, Andrea Davis
description: While spending the summer with Aunt Ursa and her fourteen-year-old cousin Foley, twelve-year-old Nell is happy to be in the company of her cousin and his friend Slade until they ask her to hide a pistol in her old doll house.
title: Raven in a dove house

author: Sonnichsen, A. L.
description: In China, a foundling girl with a deformed hand raised in secret by an American woman must navigate China's strict adoption system when she is torn away from the only family she has ever known.
title: Red butterfly

author: Mulligan, Andy
description: At an unconventional English boarding school where the school motto is "Life is dangerous," students discover something sinister when they stumble into subterranean tunnels left over from World War II.
title: Ribblestrop

author: Zuckerman, Gregory
description: Examines the childhoods and inspirational stories of overcoming adversity and personal challenges of several famous athletes, including LeBron James, Tim Howard, and Stephen Curry.
title: Rising above

author: Bradbury, Jennife
description: In the 1840s, twelve-year-old Elias is sent to Mammoth Cave in Kentucky to fight a case of consumption--and ends up fighting for the lives of a secret community of escaped slaves traveling along the Underground Railroad.
title: River runs deep

author: Rosen, Jonathan
description: In 1920s Brooklyn, fourteen-year-old newsie James Abraham tries to save the kidnapped sister of the girl he loves from gangsters. Includes historical background information, websites, an author interview, and literacy activities.
title: Rockefeller caper

author: Taylor, Mildred D.
description: Young Cassie Logan endures humiliation and witnesses the horrors of a KKK cross-burning rampage before she fully understands the importance her family places on having land of their own.
title: Roll of thunder, hear my cry

author: Jamieson, Victoria
description: Twelve-year-old Astrid discovers roller derby just as she and her best friend, Nicole, begin growing apart. Now Astrid must learn who she is--and how to be a Roller Girl--without Nicole.
title: Roller girl

author: Jeffrey, Gary
description: Presents a graphic novel describing the life and accomplishments of civil rights activist Rosa Parks, detailing her stand against Alabama's segregation laws on a city bus and her involvement with the Montgomery bus boycott.
title: Rosa Parks and the Montgomery Bus Boycott

author: Lord, Cynthia
description: Frustrated at life with an autistic brother, twelve-year-old Catherine longs for a normal existence but her world is further complicated by a friendship with an young paraplegic.
title: Rules

author: Woods, Brend
description: As Hurricane Katrina bears down on New Orleans, Saint is stuck in the city after escaping evacuation to look for his dog, Shadow. Then Saint, Shadow, and an elderly neighbor, Miz Moran, are forced to take shelter in an attic.
title: Saint Louis Armstrong Beach

author: Paterson, Katherine
description: When Angel's self-absorbed mother leaves her and her younger brother with their poor great-grandmother, the eleven-year-old girl worries not only about her mother and brother, her imprisoned father, the frail old woman, but also about a mysterious man who begins sharing with her the wonder of the stars.
title: The same stuff as stars

author: Abdul-Jabbar, Kareem
description: Eighth-grader Theo Rollins' growth spurt has Coach Mandrake trying to transform him into a basketball star, but training time is hurting the science club's chances of winning the "Aca-lympics," and being accused of stealing could mean Theo is off both teams.
title: Sasquatch in the paint

author: Gutman, Dan
description: With his ability to travel through time using vintage baseball cards, Joe takes Flip with him to find out whether Satchel Paige really was the fastest pitcher ever.
title: Satch & me

author: Chainani, Soman
description: Beautiful Sophie and ugly Agatha, best friends, are taken by the School Master to the School for Good and Evil where children are trained to be fairy tale heroes and villains. But when Sophie is sent to the School for evil, and Agatha to princess classes, the shocked girls think it's a mistake and try to switch; but unseen forces work to reveal their true identities.
title: The school for good and evil

author: Stoudemire, Amar'e
description: Because of his talent playing basketball on the streets, eleven-year-old Amar'e Stoudemire is offered a spot on his school's team even though he is a year too young. This irks many of the other players on the team, forcing Amar'e to prove he deserves to be there and can play as well as anyone else.
title: Schooled

author: Carmichael, L. E
description: Presents a study of the physical forces at work during a gymnastics competition, exploring the science of how gymnasts jump, flip, and spin in their performances.
title: The science behind gymnastics

author: Garbe, Suzanne
description: Explores the science behind phenomenon related to the sun from sunspots and eclipses to solar flares and sun dogs. Includes a glossary, resources for further information, text-related questions, and color photographs.
title: The science behind wonders of the sun

author: Terrell, Brandon
description: When several students' projects turn up ruined on the day of the science fair, the kid detectives of Fleischman Middle School are on the case. Includes a glossary and discussion questions.
title: Science fair sabotage

author: Kortemeier, Todd
description: Examines how scientists have searched for alien life using different methods such as satellites, spaceships, and telescopes. Includes a glossary, a fact sheet, resources for further information, and color photographs.
title: Searching for alien life

author: Freeman, Martha
description: Four very different girls meet at Moonlight Ranch camp and decide to remain friends all year by exchanging letters and home-made cookies, using recipes their counselor's grandfather passed along.
title: The Secret Cookie Club

author: Wildavsky, Rachel
description: Twelve-year-old twins Katie and David Bowen evade foreign militants and make their way from Washington, D.C. to their uncle's Vermont home, hoping he can help rescue their parents, who were kidnapped because of their secret invention, Rover.
title: The secret of Rover

author: Richards, Jasmine
description: Buzz is the son of a mythology professor who thinks that Norse and Roman mythology is all hogwash. However, when he and his new friend, Mary, discover a famous weatherwoman bound by magic to a tree, he has to rethink his position--in fact, the weatherwoman is Sunna, Norse Goddess of the Sun and a day guardian, captured by Loki. If Buzz and Mary cannot free Sunna, then the world will become stuck in a perpetual loop on Saturday, and never make it to Sunday.
title: Secrets of Valhalla

author: Morpurgo, Michael
description: While Aman and his mother survive the Afghan War by surviving in a cave, Aman finds companionship in a spaniel that suddenly shows up alongside them. They eventually make their way to England, but the dog runs away during the journey, leaving Aman to wonder if he will ever see his friend again.
title: Shadow

author: Hahn, Rebecca
description: Chloe, Serena, and Xinot, the Fates, live on a secluded island spinning, measuring, and cutting the threads of human life but when Aglaia, a mortal, finds them Chloe must try to keep her sisters from getting attached to the girl and involved in her dark fate that could unravel the world.
title: The shadow behind the stars

author: Magoon, Kekla
description: Robyn Loxley's parents disappear one night, leaving her to fend for herself in Nott City. When Ignomus Crown takes over the city, Robyn must flee for her life, taking up with a band of teens with unique talents for evading problems. Robyn enlists their help to track down her parents and take back the city from Crown.
title: Shadows of Sherwood

author: Hunter, Erin
description: Includes three novellas from the "Warriors" series featuring the journeys of four Clans of wild cats living in one forest. "Mapleshade's Vengeance" features the back story of the Dark Forest's most insidious cat. "Goosefeather's Curse" shares the rise of the cat destined to become the greatest medicine cat the ThunderClan has ever known. "Ravenpaw's Farewell" highlights one cat's final journey back to being a warrior as he returns to a life he left behind to help kits in need.
title: Shadows of the clans

author: Hawke, Rosanne
description: Shahana and her young brother live alone in the woods near the Line of Control patrolled by Pakistani soldiers on one side and Indian soldiers on the other. They are barely surviving when they find an injured boy near the border. They take Zahid in and care for him, but learn he's from the other side of the border. Shahana is torn between sheltering him and risking their own safety, and turning him in, knowing he will be imprisoned.
title: Shahana

author: Weissman, Elissa Brent
description: Seventh grader Lindy Sachs is home sick from school. Given one hundred dollars and access to her father's trading account, Lindy soon finds that she is good at online trading--a little too good. Soon her money doubles, then continues to multiply, until she decides that she could make some serious dough if she started using her parents' money, too.
title: The short seller

author: Rivera, Raquel
description: Ninth-grader Adina is preparing for her school's fashion show, but her dreams are challenged when her friends accuse her of being too bossy, and the competition tries to sabotage her team.
title: Show mode

author: Cooner, Donna D
description: After undergoing gastric-bypass surgery, a self-loathing, obese teenaged girl loses weight and makes the brave decision to start participating in high school life, including pursuing her dream of becoming a singer and finding love.
title: Skinny

author: Hemsworth, Jade
description: When Prince Xander comes to town before his launch into outer space, the students of Maywood Glen Academy are understandably excited, but only the smartest girls in school--Adri, Bry, and Cam of Project Mc2--notice that the interesting and weird McKeyla has enrolled just before the big event. They find out McKeyla is part of NOV8, a top secret organization of smart women, assigned to keep the prince safe.
title: Smart is the new cool

author: Rex, Adam
description: Twelve-year-old Tip and her alien friend J.Lo take their spaceship Slushious and head to New Boovworld to clear J.Lo's name but J.Lo is received as an enemy and Captain Smek attempts to capture him to look good in the Boov's upcoming presidential election.
title: Smek for president!

author: Martinez, Claudia Guadalupe
description: When sixth-grader Chela Gonzalez's father has a stroke and her grandmother moves in to help take care of the family, her world is turned upside down.
title: The smell of old lady perfume

author: Lloyd, Natalie
description: Felicity Pickle is not like other people--where other people collect baseball cards or whatever, Felicity collects words. Words people say, think, and want. The word she wants, in all of her family's moving around, is "home." Finally, her mother's van called the "Pickled Jalapeno" rolls into Midnight Gulch, where she hopes maybe she has found the word "home," and maybe even "friend."
title: A snicker of magic

author: Cheaney, J. B.
description: Nine very different students who all ride the same bus decide to investigate why the bus stops each morning at an empty bus stop where no one ever gets on or off.
title: Somebody on this bus is going to be famous

author: Donwerth-Chikamatsu, Annie
description: Eleven-year-old Emma's life in Tokyo changes for the worse when she and her American mother, who is pregnant, must move in with her Japanese grandmother the summer before 9/11 changes the world.
title: Somewhere among

author: Gallagher, Brigid
description: Presents a brief biography of Sonia Sotomayor, discussing her childhood and the TV shows she watched which became her inspiration to become a judge to how she got her position on the Supreme Court.
title: Sonia Sotomayor

author: Schlitz, Laura Amy
description: When Clara vanishes after the puppeteer Grisini and two orphaned assistants were at her twelfth birthday party, suspicion of kidnapping chases the trio away from London and soon the two orphans are caught in a trap set by Grisini's ancient rival, a witch with a deadly inheritance to shed before it is too late.
title: Splendors and glooms

author: Burgan, Michael
description: Provides opposing viewpoints of World War I as seen by soldiers fighting for the Allies and Central Powers. Details the struggles these individuals had to endure and features black-and-white photographs throughout.
title: The split history of World War I

author: Gibbs, Stuart
description: Twelve-year-old Ben Ripley leaves his public middle school to attend the CIA's highly secretive Espionage Academy, which everyone is told is an elite science school.
title: Spy school

author: Myers, Walter Dean
description: When LaShonda's costume creations for the school play earns her stardom, the publicity soon gets in the way of her other responsibilities. Now, LaShonda must decide whether her fame or loyalty to her brother is more important.
title: A star is born

author: Draper, Sharon M
description: When a burning cross set by the Klan causes panic and fear in 1932 Bumblebee, North Carolina, fifth-grader Stella must face prejudice and find the strength to demand change in her segregated town.
title: Stella by starlight

author: Langston, Laura
description: Paige Larsson, YouTube comedy vlogger, has always used humor to cope with her disability, but an opportunity to compete in a stand-up comedy festival is a big step out of her comfort zone, and relying on her disability may not be enough.
title: Stepping out

author: Farndon, John
description: Explores the history of watercraft in a number of boats and ships, from old historical sail ships up to modern cruise ships and submarines. Stick figures in blueprint-like pictures provide a sense of scale.
title: Stickmen's guide to watercraft

author: Linnihan, Ellen
description: Presents stories of trouble at sea and describes their outcome.
title: Stranded at sea

author: Farndon, John
description: Presents ways in which people used to treat illness, from roots and plants to the medicine we use today, including the discovery of insulin and aspirin.
title: Strange medicine

author: Holm, Jennifer L.
description: When her brother Dale struggles with substance abuse, Sunny is sent to Florida to visit her grandfather for the summer. She meets a friend there and has some fun adventures, but Dale's problem threatens to overwhelm her.
title: Sunny side up

author: Keplinger, Kody
description: Nola Sutton has always been friends with the Swift boys, Canaan, Brian, and Kevin, but when their father leaves them without saying goodbye the boys start to change, and her long-time friends begin to pull away from her at a time when she needs them more than ever.
title: The Swift boys & me

author: Steveson, Nanci Turner
description: Annie and her parents head to their country house for the summer where Annie has been promised freedom from her overbearing mom's spreadsheets and schedules. There Annie meets a girl named California and the two embark on a real-life adventure to repair the relationship between California's mom and her grandfather. However, in the process Annie uncovers a big secret about California that changes everything.
title: Swing sideways

author: Conkling, Winifred
description: At the start of World War II, Japanese-American third-grader Aki and her family are sent to an internment camp in Poston, Arizona, while Mexican-American third-grader Sylvia's family leases their Orange County, California, farm and begins a fight to stop school segregation.
title: Sylvia & Aki

author: Hobbs, Will
description: When North Carolina fourteen-year-old Dylan Sands joins his fifteen-year-old cousin Rio in running the Rio Grande River, they face a tropical storm and a fugitive kidnapper.
title: Take me to the river

author: Benjamin, Ali
description: Twelve-year-old Suzy Swanson wades through her intense grief over the loss of her best friend by investigating the rare jellyfish she is convinced was responsible for her friend's death.
title: The thing about jellyfish

author: Kadohata, Cynthia
description: Just when twelve-year-old Summer thinks nothing else can possibly go wrong in a year of bad luck, an emergency takes her parents to Japan, leaving Summer to care for her little brother while helping her grandmother cook and do laundry for harvest workers.
title: The thing about luck

author: Hirsch, Rebecca E.
description: Explores the migration habits of different animals including wildebeests, leatherback sea turtles, and arctic terns. Includes color photographs, an index, and resources for further information.
title: Thousand-mile fliers and other amazing migrators

author: Turnage, Sheila
description: Washed ashore as a baby in tiny Tupelo Landing, North Carolina, Mo LoBeau, now eleven, and her best friend Dale turn detective when the amnesiac Colonel, owner of a cafâe and co-parent of Mo with his cook, Miss Lana, seems implicated in a murder.
title: Three times lucky

author: Bell, Ted
description: Nick McIver travels to colonial America to find his twelve-year-old sister, who has been kidnapped by a time-traveling pirate.
title: The time pirate

author: Hopkinson, Deborah
description: Describes the sinking of the Titanic based on the actual accounts of individuals who witnessed the disaster firsthand.
title: Titanic

author: Johnson, Varian
description: Life has been fairly smooth for Jackson Greene since the Great Greene Heist went down, and his friendship with his crush Gaby de la Cruz could be turning into something more. But when he gets blackmailed into stealing a copy of the school's toughest test, Jackson and the "Greene Gang" will have to think fast to outsmart the blackmailer and clear their names.
title: To catch a cheat

author: Flanagan, Joh
description: In this prequel to the Ranger's Apprentice series, Halt and Crowley travel north seeking Prince Duncan's royal warrant to stop Morgrath from corrupting the Corps, but if they are to prevent a coup that is nearing success, the young Rangers will have to tread a dangerous path toward the annual tournament at Gorlan.
title: The tournament at Gorlan

author: Terrell, Brandon
description: When Fleischman Middle School's mascot, Champ the dog, goes missing, it's up to the Snoops crew to track Champ down in time for the big game.
title: Tracking Champ

author: Appelt, Kathi
description: Twelve-year-old Chap Brayburn, ancient Sugar Man, and his raccoon-brother Swamp Scouts Bingo and J'miah try to save Bayou Tourterelle from feral pigs Clydine and Buzzie, greedy Sunny Boy Beaucoup, and world-class alligator wrestler and would-be land developer Jaeger Stitch.
title: The true blue scouts of Sugar Man Swamp

author: Rex, Adam
description: Twelve-year-old Gratuity Tucci has a hard time writing an essay on "The True Meaning of Smekday" due to her complex life after Earth was overtaken by aliens and her mother was kidnapped and taken to Happy Mouse Kingdom in Florida.
title: The true meaning of Smekday

author: George, Jessica Day
description: Follows young Princess Celie who lives with her parents, the king and queen, and her brothers and sister at Castle Glower, which magically grows rooms, stairways, or secret passageways most every Tuesday. When the king and queen are ambushed while traveling, it is up to Celie--the castle's favorite--with her secret knowledge of its never-ending twists and turns to protect their home and save their kingdom.
title: Tuesdays at the castle

author: Hoover, P. J
description: The Egyptian demigod Tut has been stuck in eighth grade for ages. He must find a way to break the infernal cycle of middle school while evading evil General Horemheb, the man who murdered Tut's father.
title: Tut

author: Jacobs, Evan
description: Jasmine Le takes on her whole town when she decides to play a tackle football game against the boys team.
title: The Underdogs

author: Appelt, Kathi
description: A calico cat about to have kittens befriends a hound dog, Ranger, who urges her to hide underneath the porch of his dilapidated house to raise her kittens. Ranger warns the cat about the man named Gar-Face who lives in the house will likely use the kittens as alligator bait. Soon one kitten becomes very curious and ventures out, setting off a chain of remarkable events.
title: The underneath

author: Korman, Gordon
description: Due to an administrative mix-up, troublemaker Donovan Curtis is sent to the Academy of Scholastic Distinction, a special program for gifted and talented students, after pulling a major prank at middle school.
title: Ungifted

author: Mabbitt, Will
description: Mabel Jones once picked her nose, ate the booger, and accidentally opened up a portal to a pirate world. She is captured and forced to serve aboard "The Feroshus Maggot" with a strange crew, captained by the wolf Idryss Ebenezer Split--who will not let her go free until Mabel helps them find some treasure.
title: The unlikely adventures of Mabel Jones

author: Kortemeier, Todd
description: Chronicles the lives of lesser-known figures important to the science world. Discusses people like archaeologist Mary Anning, chemist Marie Daly, nuclear researcher Chien-Shiung Wu, and entomologist Charles Henry Turner. Includes photos, a glossary, index, and resources for further information.
title: Unsung heroes of science

author: Lamana, Julie T.
description: At the end of August 2005, ten-year-old Armani is looking forward to her birthday party in the Lower Ninth Ward of New Orleans, where she and her extended family live, but Hurricane Katrina is on the way, bringing destruction and tragedy in its wake.
title: Upside down in the middle of nowhere

author: Wolverton, Barry
description: Life in the port town of Map has been anything but adventurous for young Bren Owen. But when he's sent to clean up the town's vomitorium as punishment for trying to run away, he meets a dying sailor who gives Bren a gift that will propel him into the life of adventure he always wanted. But as he sets out to break the code of the secret message hidden in the gift, he finds more danger than he ever imagined, and he'll need the help of a new friend named Mouse to survive.
title: The vanishing island

author: Terrell, Brandon
description: When Fleischman Middle School's math tournament trophies go missing, the Snoops crew takes the mystery into their own hands.
title: The vanishing treasure

author: Hakim, Joy
description: Describes the American Civil War, focusing on its causes, events, and consequences.
title: War, terrible war

author: Jeffrey, Gary
description: Provides information about the beginning of World War II war in Europe, discusses the goal of Adolf Hitler, and the impact of U.S. troops when they joined the Allies. Presents first-hand accounts of the battles by survivors describing the Battle of Britain, the Battle of Omaha Beach on D-Day, and the invasion of Germany at the Bridge of Remagen. Illustrates the devastation in Europe, the death of Hitler, the horrors of Nazi concentration camps, and the ultimate division of Germany itself. Includes graphic illustrations, photographs, a glossary, and an index.
title: The Western Front

author: Stine, Megan
description: Examines the history of dinosaurs, their extinction, and the discovery of their fossils. Includes timelines of the dinosaur age compared to a timeline of the world.
title: What was the age of the dinosaurs?

author: Pascal, Janet B.
description: Explores the history of the Great Depression from what led to the economic collapse to the effects it had on the nation. Includes a timeline and photographs.
title: What was the Great Depression?

author: Soup, Cuthbert
description: Ethan Cheeseman and his children, ages eight, twelve, and fourteen, hope to settle in a nice small town, at least long enough to complete work on a time machine, but spies and government agents have been pursuing them for two years and are about to catch up.
title: A whole nother story

author: Hunter, Dru
description: Examines the origins, advancements, and future of the social sciences, including anthropology and psychology, and the ways in which scientists utilize the scientific method to explore questions. Includes suggestions for activities, color photographs, a glossary, biographical profiles of scientists, and further resources.
title: Why do we behave like that?

author: London, C. Alexander
description: After his parents are killed, Kit, a young raccoon, sets off for the city with a stone that may be the key to finding the Bone of Contention, a legendary object that is proof of a deal giving the wild animals the rights to Ankle Snap Alley, which the dogs and cats--known as the Flealess--want back and are willing to kill for.
title: The wild ones

author: Myracle, Lauren
