description: Natasha, the oldest of three sisters, lives in the town of Willow Hill and participates in a fabled tradition of making three wishes shortly after her thirteenth birthday. What happens next takes Natasha by surprise and shows her the magic of traditions and the power of hope.
title: Wishing day

author: Rossell, Judith
description: Stella, eleven, gets her dreamed-of adventure when something she should not have seen in the damp, dull hotel where she lives with three dreadful aunts on a cliff above Withering-by-Sea sends her on the run from stage magician Professor Starke and his thugs, eluding danger, making new friends, and facing questions about herself.
title: Withering-by-Sea

author: Hobbs, Valerie
description: Jack has found a home and a purpose on a farm, keeping a flock of sheep safe from coyotes and training pups to do the same, but now he and his boy, Luke, must face a rabid wolf that threatens them all.
title: Wolf

author: Gitlin, Marty
description: Presents three viewpoints on the U.S. homefront during World War II, including a female bomber plant worker, an African American grocery clerk, and a Japanese American. Includes photographs, a glossary, and further resources.
title: World War II U.S. homefront

author: Krumgold, Joseph
description: Miguel lives with his family on a sheep ranch in New Mexico. More than anything else, he longs to go with the men to the Sangre de Christo Mountains.
title: --and now Miguel

author: Koch, Falynn
description: When Little Brown Bat injures his wing, he goes to an animal rehabilitation center where he meets other bats from around the world. Includes a glossary, information on related careers and volunteering, and resources for further reading.
title: Bats

author: Hughes, Devon
description: Castor the street dog is captured, injected with a DNA-changing serum, transformed into a dangerous hybrid, and forced to battle other "Unnaturals" in an underground fighting ring. It will take all his courage to save the other Unnaturals and shut down the fighting ring.
title: The battle begins

author: Lipsyte, Robert
description: A Harlem high school dropout escapes from a gang of punks into a boxing gym, where he learns that being a contender is hard and often discouraging work, but that you don't know anything until you try.
title: The contender

author: King, Wesley
description: Back-up punter for his high school football team, Daniel Leigh spends most of his time being water boy, imagining monster attacks, writing his novel, and hoping people don't notice his "Zaps," as he calls them--having to flip a light switch dozens of times over, for example. His OCD ensures he is a total no one at school, but when he gets a mysterious note from someone signed "Fellow Star Child," Daniel's life takes a dramatic turn.
title: OCDaniel

author: Joyce, William
description: In Toy World, there is magic to becoming a child's "favorite." Billy's mother handmade Ollie, a stuffed rabbit who became Billy's favorite toy very quickly. They did everything together. Then Zozo the clown came with his henchmen, the Creeps, outcast toys, jealous of Ollie and all toys who become children's favorites, and toynapped Ollie. Now Billy must rescue his beloved favorite from Zozo's Dark Carnival Place.
title: Ollie's odyssey

author: Applegate, Katherine
description: When Ivan, a gorilla who has lived for years in a down-and-out circus-themed mall, meets Ruby, a baby elephant that has been added to the mall, he decides that he must find her a better life.
title: The one and only Ivan

author: Timberlake, Amy
description: In 1871 Wisconsin, thirteen-year-old Georgia sets out to find her sister Agatha, presumed dead when remains are found wearing the dress she was last seen in, and before the end of the year gains fame as a sharpshooter and foiler of counterfeiters.
title: One came home

author: Lupica, Mike
description: Sixth grade is supposed to be the year that Jack Callahan would lead his team to the Little League World Series, but after the death of his brother, he loses interest in baseball and only Cassie, the star of the girls' softball team, seems to understand.
title: The only game

author: Maberry, Jonathan
description: In the future, bug-like aliens are taking over Earth and young Milo Silk learns through dreams and strange encounters that there are other, ancient monsters on the planet that are also threatened by the aliens, and that he may be the hero destined to lead his friends in saving the universe.
title: The orphan army

author: Frazier, Sundee Tucker
description: Twin daughters of interracial parents, eleven-year-olds Keira and Minna have very different skin tones and personalities, but it is not until their African American grandmother enters them in the Miss Black Pearl Pre-Teen competition in North Carolina that red-haired and pale-skinned Minna realizes what life in their small town in the Pacific Northwest has been like for her more outgoing, darker-skinned sister.
title: The other half of my heart

author: Draper, Sharon M
description: Considered by many to be mentally retarded, a brilliant, impatient fifth-grader with cerebral palsy discovers a technological device that will allow her to speak for the first time.
title: Out of my mind

author: Bowen, Fred
description: Eighth-grader Richie Mallon has always been his basketball team's shooter, but now he's facing tryouts for a tough new coach. His shooting technique may not be enough to keep him on the team when his shot falters, but maybe Richie can try being a team player with rebounds and assists instead.
title: Outside shot

author: Williams-Garcia, Rita
description: Amidst the changes overtaking her world in the 1960s, from the rise of the Jackson 5 to her father's new girlfriend, eleven-year-old Delphine struggles to keep her life in order. As she contends with one issue after another, writing letters to her mother to gain confidence, she gains the strength to push forward while trying to stay true to her mother's insistence that she not grow up too fast.
title: P.S. be eleven

author: Hunter, Erin
description: The world had been in chaos since the Big Growl, and Storm had fought to survive. But now she has found a place inside the Wild Pack, and things seem to be settling within and beyond their group. But as tensions begin to spike again, Storm worries the true threat might lie within her pack, or worse, within herself.
title: A pack divided

author: Prendergast, Gabrielle
description: Journey Song learns that two pandas are being held in a warehouse in her poverty-stricken neighborhood of the Eastside, and decides to make it her mission to save the two animals.
title: Pandas on the Eastside

author: Woodson, Jacqueline
description: Through letters to his little sister, who is living in a different foster home, sixth-grader Lonnie, also known as "Locomotion," keeps a record of their lives while they are apart, describing his own foster family, including his foster brother who returns home after losing a leg in the Iraq War.
title: Peace, Locomotion

author: Larson, M. A.
description: Evie, a girl from the forest, enlists at Pennyroyal Academy and undergoes a strenuous training regime to prepare her to be a princess and battle witches and dragons--a war that suddenly becomes personal.
title: Pennyroyal Academy

author: Harris, Teresa E.
description: Twelve-year-old Treasure Daniels and her younger sister must move in with Great-aunt Grace until their mother sorts herself out, but life in Black Lake, Virginia, where segregation lingers, is hard and Grace is a nightmare--at least on the surface.
title: The perfect place

author: Blair, Kelsey
description: Star player Jazz Smith-Mohapatra performs an offensive move on the basketball court that causes injury to another player, causing her position on the team to be called into question just before the championship game.
title: Pick and roll

author: Rake, Matthew
description: Presents an easy-to-read guide for young readers to learn about certain extinct animals and how big they were compared to modern standards. Features basic physiology, geography, artist renderings, and miscellaneous facts.
title: Prehistoric giants

author: Rake, Matthew
description: Presents facts and photos about U.S. presidents. Also includes historical portraits, coverage of the 2016 election, and introduction to the first ladies, and information about the branches of government and the electoral process.
title: Presidents of the United States

author: Micklos, John
description: Collects primary sources that provide a history of the American Civil War and its causes, battles, key persons, and end. Includes critical thinking questions, a glossary, and further resources.
title: A primary source history of the U.S. Civil War

author: Paquette, Ammi-Joan
description: Princess Juniper wants a country of her own for her thirteenth nameday, a place where she can rule a small group of people and train for being a fully crowned queen. Her father agrees and gives her her own little queendom--and it is nothing like Juniper expected, especially when not everyone wants her to be in charge.
title: Princess Juniper of the Hourglass

author: Park, Linda Sue
description: While working on a project for an after-school club, Julia, a Korean American girl, and her friend Patrick learn not just about silkworms, but also about tolerance, prejudice, friendship, patience, and more. Between the chapters are short dialogues between the author and main character about the writing of the book.
title: Project Mulberry

author: Hoena, B. A.
description: Gavin Cole is a black, inner-city kid being bused to a new middle school in the suburbs and he feels very out of place--but his skill at skateboarding helps him to make a connection to a group of other enthusiasts.
title: Raw

author: Holt, K. A.
description: Rae Darling lives with her family on a faraway moon. And when the natives of the planet kidnapped Rae and her sister Temple, they are surprised by the kindness of their captors. The girls are trained as warriors and when it comes time for Rae to go out on raids against her own people, her loyalties are put to the ultimate test.
title: Red moon rising

author: Pinkney, Andrea Davis
description: Twelve-year-old Amira, a resident of a Sudanese refugee camp following the murder of her parents in a Janjaweed attack, finds hope in the gift of a simple red pencil that allows her to express her creativity and formulate her hopes for the future.
title: The red pencil

author: Raum, Elizabeth
description: Allows readers to chose their own story as they learn about the American Revolution as viewed from the sides of the Patriots and the British. Features full-color illustrations throughout.
title: The Revolutionary War

author: Pinkney, Andrea Davis
description: Explores the history of the Motown Record Corporation, beginning with Berry Gordy and his {dollar}800 loan from family members to start a music label for young black musicians in Detroit. Gordy then recruited teens from his neighborhood--like Smokey Robinson, Marvin Gaye, and Stevie Wonder--to sing for his first record label, and history was made.
title: Rhythm ride

author: Davis, Kent
description: In a world ruled by alchemy--the mixing of magic and science--Ruby Teach has gotten by using only her sneakiness and skill as a thief and a pirate's daughter. However, after the bungled burglary of a young aristocrat in which her father gets caught, Ruby finds herself alone and on the run, deep in the heart of the city, surrounded by characters who genuinely mean well and those who would use her for their own ends. The trick is telling them apart.
title: A riddle in Ruby

author: Haydu, Corey Ann
description: Silly is the youngest sister in her broken family. She cannot remember a time when mother didn't drink and father didn't pretend things were okay, nor when her three older sisters weren't seeming to keep secrets from her. One day, though, Silly's sisters bring her into their secret--a hidden, magical place where they can escape from the troubles of home. However, Silly finds soon that this magic has its own dark truths to ponder.
title: Rules for stealing stars

author: Lovejoy, Sharon
description: Lark, a white girl suffering abuse at the hands of her family, and Zenobia, a slave girl, flee their homes together and join up with Brightwell, another escaped slave, to travel along the Underground Railroad to freedom.
title: Running out of night

author: Delacre, Lulu
description: A collection of stories within the story of a family celebration where the guests relate their memories of growing up in various Latin American countries. Also contains recipes.
title: Salsa stories

author: Castleman, Virginia
description: When their mother abandons them and their father ends up in jail again, ten-year-old Sara and her mentally troubled sister are thrust back into the foster care system.
title: Sara lost and found

author: Law, Ingrid
description: Recounts the adventures of Mibs Beaumont, who is excited as her thirteenth birthday approaches because that is when she will discover her "savvy," a magical power unique to each member of her family. Then her father is injured in a terrible accident just before her birthday, and Mibs will need her savvy as well as friends and family to make things right.
title: Savvy

author: Grisham, John
description: Thirteen-year-old aspiring lawyer Theodore Boone finds himself caught in the middle of a cheating scandal involving this year's state standardized tests. Theo must find a way to solve the case while keeping his own record clean.
title: The scandal

author: Berry, Julie
description: In 1890s England, seven Victorian young ladies conspire to hide the murder of their headmistress and her brother from authorities so their boarding school won't be closed. As the girls try to keep the school running without anyone knowing they are there alone, they also try to uncover the real killer before he strikes again.
title: The scandalous sisterhood of Prickwillow Place

author: Roberts, Willo Davis
description: When their mother disappears, two brothers go to stay with a great uncle in a mobile home park next to an abandoned amusement park and begin a search that puts them in danger.
title: Scared stiff

author: Korman, Gordon
description: When his grandmother falls and hurts herself, Capricorn Anderson is forced to leave his commune behind, move into a foster home, and attend the public school. At Claverage Middle School, Capricorn's name is put on the ballot for the election of class president.
title: Schooled

author: Jacobs, Evan
description: After Mia's phone is scratched, her account is hacked, and a fake photo is uploaded, she finds her position as the Queen Bee of her middle school in jeopardy.
title: Scratch n' snitch

author: Hunter, Nick
description: Takes readers on an exploration of the world's five oceans. Lists the things to take on the trip, and includes color photographs, a map, a timeline, a glossary, fact boxes, conservation tips, additional resources, and interviews with experts.
title: Seas

author: Peck, Richard
description: Relates the surprising gifts bestowed on twelve-year-old Bob Barnhart and his family, who have recently moved to a small Illinois town in 1958, by their larger-than-life neighbor, Mrs. Dowdel.
title: A season of gifts

author: Ruby, Lois
description: Thirteen-year-old Hannah Flynn befriends a mysterious girl named Cady in the wood behind her family's new house. Soon Cady is copying everything about Hannah leading Hannah to question the authenticity behind their friendship. But when Hannah discovers a tombstone with a familiar name, Hannah realizes that Cady's intentions may be more sinister than she thought.
title: The secret grave

author: Burg, Ann E.
description: In a poor village outside of Port-au-Prince, Haiti, Serafina works hard to help her family, but dreams of going to school and becoming a doctor--then the earthquake hits and Serafina must summon all her courage to find her father and still get medicine for her sick baby brother as she promised.
title: Serafina's promise

author: McHugh, Arianne
description: Presents brief descriptions and computer-generated images of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World: the Great Pyramids at Giza, the Statue of Zeus, the Temple of Artemis, the Hanging Gardens of Babylon, the Colossus of Rhodes, the Mausoleum of Halicarnassus, and the Lighthouse of Alexandria.
title: Seven wonders of the ancient world

author: Messner, Kate
description: Twelve-year old Charlie sometimes feels that she is less important than others in her family when she catches a fish that promises to grant her seven wishes if she'll release it back into the water. But every wish Charlie makes only leads to making matters worse instead of better. When it's revealed that her older sister is battling a heroin addiction, Charlie worries that using a wish to solve the problem could backfire.
title: The seventh wish

author: Simon, Seymour
description: Lists various records pertaining to Earth's geography and climate. Includes full-color photographs.
title: Seymour Simon's extreme earth records

author: Naylor, Phyllis Reynolds
description: In this conclusion to the Shiloh series, Matty and his best friend, Shiloh, embark on an adventure during which they learn when a secret is too dangerous to keep, and how hate can spread like fire.
title: A Shiloh Christmas

author: Anderson, John David
description: Thirteen-year-old superhero sidekick-in-training Drew "The Sensationalist" Bean must overcome his not-so-superpowers and become the hero everyone needs when a supervillain, The Dealer, returns to Justicia.
title: Sidekicked

author: Jones, Traci L.
description: After the death of her mother in an automobile accident, seventh-grader Serena, who has gotten the lead in her middle school play, is left to handle the day-to-day challenges of caring for herself and her younger brother when their father cannot pull himself out of his depression.
title: Silhouetted by the blue

author: Carter, Aimâee
description: After Simon's mom is kidnapped by a pack of rats, he learns that he and his family are Animalgams--humans who can change into animals. He discovers the Animalgam world is rife with ancient rivalries, feuding kingdoms, and deep buried secrets in their secret academy in New York's Central Park Zoo. The leader of the zoo wants to use Simon's power to gain supreme power for herself--but at the same time, Simon is the only one who could unite the five kingdoms.
title: Simon Thorn and the wolf's den

author: Trueit, Trudi Strain
description: Sammi Tremayne, neither popular nor unpopular, neither perfect nor a mess, is shocked when her genius little sister jumps up two grades and becomes her classmate. Sammi has always felt stuck in her little sister's shadow, and now her life is a positive social nightmare.
title: The sister solution

author: Vaughan, M. M.
description: Resentful that he and his father have moved back to the place where his mother died, Parker Banks is having a hard time adjusting to his new home. That problem seems little when his father, a technological genius, is kidnapped. Using a device that gives them both telepathy, Parker's father only has time to give him a man's name before the signal is lost. Now Parker must search New York for this man, and find his father before it is too late.
title: Six

author: Stoudemire, Amar'e
description: Despite being one of the best basketball players in his neighborhood, Amar'e Stoudemire receives criticism for not being able to dunk. When he resolves to achieve this goal, he soon realizes that perhaps he should focus on more than just basketball.
title: Slam dunk

author: Bauer, Joan
description: After receiving a heart transplant, twelve-year-old Jeremiah knows he can never play baseball, but his love for the game inspires him to try his hand at coaching the middle school baseball team in his new town. And when steroid use by the high school baseball team is revealed after the death of one of their star players, Jeremiah's determination and infectious positive attitude is just what the community needs to recover.
title: Soar

author: Barrington, Richard
description: Chronicles the life and career of Supreme Court Justice Sonia Sotomayor focusing on her inspiration to women, Hispanics, the poor, and law students. Includes color photographs, a timeline, a glossary, and further resources.
title: Sonia Sotomayor

author: Armstrong, William H
description: A young black boy learns the pain of humiliation and anger when his father is given an unjust jail sentence for stealing a ham from a white man.
title: Sounder

author: Smibert, Angie
description: Discusses twelve myths about science including why the myth exists, who discovered it was a myth, and what the truth really is.
title: Space myths, busted!

author: Allen, Crystal
description: Nine-year-old Mya is excited about participating in School Spirit Week, even making a pinky promise with her best friend Naomi to be her partner, but when she accidentally gets paired with the biggest bully in school, Mean Connie, Naomi is mad at Maya for breaking her promise, so she must learn to work with Mean Connie and try and get her friend back.
title: Spirit week showdown

author: Leatherdale, Mary Beth
description: Presents five true stories of young refugees who have used boats to escape their hostile homelands from World War II to the present. Describes how Ruth and her family escape the Nazis aboard the "St. Louis"; Phu goes it alone to escape the war in Vietnam; Josâe desperately sets out on a raft from Cuba; Najeeba tries to escape the Taliban in Afghanistan; and Mohamed, an orphan, is forced to flee his Ivory Coast home for safety. Includes information on where the refugees are today, photographs, a timeline, and resources for further information.
title: Stormy seas

author: Riley, James
description: Except for reading the Kiel Gnomenfoot magic adventure series, Owen's life is boring until he sees his classmate Bethany climb out of a book in the school library and he learns that Bethany is half-fictional and has been searching every book she can find for her missing father, a fictional character.
title: Story thieves

author: Dakers, Diane
description: When Brielle first stepped up to fill in her for her best friend, Tawni, as principal cellist after Tawni was injured, she's more than a little nervous. Soon she excels at the role. When Tawni returns wanting her position back, Brielle isn't sure she's ready to step aside. But not doing so will ruin their friendship.
title: Strings attached

author: Condie, Allyson Braithwaite
description: After losing her father and brother in a car accident, twelve-year-old Cedar struggles with her grief as she faces her first summer without them. When her mother moves what's left of their family to Iron Creek, Cedar meets a quirky boy named Leo. As the two enjoy the town's annual Summerlost Theater Festival, they become increasingly intrigued by the mysterious circumstances surrounding the death of a famous local actress. They mystery deepens as small gifts that remind Cedar of her deceased brother begin to show up on her windowsill.
title: Summerlost

author: Harrington, Karen
description: Twelve-year-old Sarah writes letters to her hero, To Kill a Mockingbird's Atticus Finch, for help understanding her mentally ill mother, her first real crush, and life in her small Texas town, all in the course of one momentous summer.
title: Sure signs of crazy

author: Law, Ingrid
description: Gypsy Beaumont's magical savvy switches to its opposite when she learns that her mean and decidedly non-magical grandma has Alzheimer's and is going to move in with her family.
title: Switch

author: Dhariwal, Radhika R.
description: Squirrel is the last slave in Bimmau and, along with his friends, must solve a series of riddles as they embark on a quest to find and protect the key needed to read the Map of Brittle, which has the power to both set Squirrel free and enslave all of Bimmmau.
title: The tale of a no-name squirrel

author: Graff, Lis
description: In a world where everyone is born with a fantastic Talent, Cady, at the age of eleven, discovers her Talent is for cake baking. When Cady and her family move to a new apartment in the Lost Luggage Emporium of New York City, she meets a host of characters that usher her into an adventure in which she will learn to look beyond her Talent and see real people with real lives, all because of a single powder-blue suitcase.
title: A tangle of knots

author: Hertz, Kellen
description: A young girl named Tenney Grant longs to share her heart through music, but when she is finally invited to perform solo in Nashville's famous Bluebird Cafe, her parents decide she is too young to perform professionally. Tenney must find a way to convince her parents to let her take this once-in-a-lifetime chance.
title: Tenney

author: Canales, Viola
description: Sofia grows up in the close-knit community of the barrio in McAllen, Texas, then finds that her experiences as a scholarship student at an Episcopal boarding school in Austin only strengthen her ties to family and her "comadres."
title: The tequila worm

author: Gebhart, Ryan
description: Tyson and his grandfather sneak off on an elk hunting trip and come across a grizzly bear who has killed two other hunters.
title: There will be bears

author: Burg, Shana
description: As the civil rights movement in the South gains momentum in 1963--and violence against African Americans intensifies--the black residents, including seventh-grader Addie Ann Pickett, in the small town of Kuckachoo, Mississippi, begin their own courageous struggle for racial justice.
title: A thousand never evers

author: Jones, Carrie
description: Foster child Annie Nobody discovers a new world of magic, power, and scary creatures in a hidden, magical town, Aurora, where she and her new best friend Jamie Hephastion Alexander learn it is up to them to protect their new home from those who want to misuse the great power, even if it means diving headfirst into magical danger.
title: Time Stoppers

author: Turner, Matt
description: Introduces different kinds of very small creatures, including fleas, ticks, parasites, and millipedes. Features simple text, photographs, a glossary, and an index.
title: Tiny creepy crawlers

author: Farndon, John
description: Explores early ideas about what made people sick to the modern understanding of the tiny but powerful bacteria all around us.
title: Tiny killers

author: Williams, Dav
description: Explains what daily life is like for astronauts in zero-gravity space, discussing eating, burping, exercising, sleeping, and using the toilet.
title: To burp or not to burp

author: Cervantes, Jennifer
description: Izzy finds an old baseball with mysterious markings and an obscure phrase that she thinks her deceased father might have written. She is curious about the word "magic" that is on the ball and, when she goes to visit her grandmother in New Mexico, she is determined to understand her past and reclaim her heritage.
title: Tortilla sun

author: Smith, Sherri L.
description: Journeyman toymaker Stefan Drosselmeyer is recruited by his mysterious cousin, Christian, to find a mythical nut that will save Boldavia's princess and his own kidnapped father from a fanatical Mouse Queen and her seven-headed Mouse Prince, who have sworn to destroy the Drosselmeyer family.
title: The toymaker's apprentice

author: Otfinoski, Steven
description: Presents a play-by-play narrative examination of the events leading up to, including, and following assassination of President John F. Kennedy.
title: Tragedy in Dallas

author: Nye, Naomi Shihab
description: When Aref, a third grader who lives in Muscat, Oman, refuses to pack his suitcase and prepare to move to Michigan, his mother asks for help from his grandfather, Sidi, who takes Aref around the countryside storing up memories he can carry with him to a new home.
title: The turtle of Oman

author: Perritano, John
description: Introduces the Tuskegee Airmen, discussing their role in the war, the prejudice they faced, the perseverance they showed, and their bravery.
title: Tuskegee airmen

author: Hoge, Robert
description: Memoir from writer Robert Hoge, born with a tumor in his face that left him looking different than everyone he knew. Discusses how Hoge dealt with bullying, accepting his appearance, and creating a positive identity for himself.
title: Ugly

author: Haddix, Margaret Peterson
description: Twelve-year-old twins Nick and Eryn investigate why their mother and new stepfather are keeping secrets, why they are forbidden to meet their stepsiblings, and, most important, why their lives are in danger.
title: Under their skin

author: Jones, Kell
description: Through a series of letters, Sophie Brown, age twelve, tells of her family's move to her Great Uncle Jim's farm, where she begins taking care of some unusual chickens with help from neighbors and friends.
title: Unusual chickens for the exceptional poultry farmer

author: McMann, Lisa
description: In a society that purges thirteen-year-olds who are creative, identical twins Aaron and Alex are separated, one to attend University while the other, supposedly Eliminated, finds himself in a wondrous place where youths hone their abilities and learn magic.
title: The Unwanteds

author: O'Hearn, Kate
description: When Freya takes up her position as a Valkyrie, she's not excited to reap the souls of fallen soldiers as required of her. She'd prefer to avoid humans and their wars altogether. And when she reaps her first soldier, she finds herself thrust into the mortal world where she begins to find friendship with the humans and realizes she could be wrong about them. But she'll soon have to choose between her immortal and mortal friends, and it won't be an easy choice.
title: Valkyrie

author: Shea, John M.
description: Explains what viruses are and why they make people ill. Details efforts to study viruses' structure in order to develop vaccines against them. Includes color photographs, a glossary, and additional reading sources.
title: Viruses up close

author: Nemeth, Jason D
description: Tells of the triumphs and defeats of individuals involved in the Civil War. Includes full-color illustrations, a glossary, and further reading sources.
title: Voices of the Civil War

author: Bradley, Kimberly Brubaker
description: A young disabled girl and her brother are evacuated from London to the English countryside during World War II, where they find life to be much sweeter away from their abusive mother.
title: The war that saved my life

author: McNeilly, Linden
description: It's 1969, and Cesar Cruz has just returned from the Vietnam War, hoping to blend back in to his normal life. Meanwhile, fourteen-year-old Kelsey's family has reached a breaking point, with her mom organizing anti-war protests and her veteran father furious about it. On top of it all, Kelsey has a huge school project to complete, but when her life intersects with Cesar's, what she learns from him could change everything she believes in. Includes historical information, an interview with the author, a writing prompt, and resources for information online.
title: War torn

author: Ormsbee, Katie
description: Lottie Fiske is a lonely twelve-year-old orphan, who lives in a boarding house, and her only friends in the world are Eliot, a boy who is very sick, and the mysterious letter-writer who sends her birthday gifts--so when a strange girl steps out of a closet and insists that Lottie follow her down the roots of the apple tree in the yard to another world, which may hold a cure for Eliot, Lottie has to go.
title: The water and the wild

author: Shang, Wendy Wan Long
description: In 1972, after his older brother is killed in a car crash, Peter Lee's mother is paralyzed by grief and his traditional Chinese father seems emotionally frozen--but Peter hopes that if he joins a Little League team in Pittsburgh he can reawaken the passion for baseball that all the members of his family used to share and bring them back to life.
title: The way home looks now

author: Nelson, Kadir
description: Presents a history of Negro League baseball from its early days in the 1920s through its decline in the late 1940s after Jackie Robinson joined the majors.
title: We are the ship

author: Nelson, Kadir
description: Presents 300 gross facts about animals, the human body, plants, and food accompanied by color photographs.
title: Weird but true

author: McCarthy, Tom
description: Collects stories of mysterious disappearances around the world and throughout history, such as Virginia Dare and the colonists of the lost colony of Roanoke, Anastasia Romanov, and Amelia Earhart.
title: Weird disappearances

author: Preus, Margi
description: In nineteenth-century Norway, fourteen-year-old Astri, whose aunt has sold her to a mean goatherder, dreams of joining her father in America.
title: West of the moon

author: Eamer, Claire
description: Explores what happens to garbage after its thrown away. Highlights the history of garbage disposal throughout history, and presents ideas for reducing the enormous amount of waste produced by society today. Includes diagrams, a text-related activity, and resources for further information.
title: What a waste!

author: Clarke, Ginjer L.
description: Examines the geography, wildlife, and people of the Gobi Desert. Also discusses ways to save the area from desertification. Includes color photographs, fact boxes, and further resources.
title: What's up in...the Gobi Desert

author: Gutman, Dan
description: Stosh travels back in time to determine if a home run that won the National League pennant for the New York Giants in 1951 was the result of cheating. Once he arrives in New York in 1951, he has the opportunity to learn about the early career of soon-to-be baseball legend Willie Mays.
title: Willie & me

author: Macceca, Stephanie
description: Presents a brief biography of Wilma Rudolph, revealing how she overcame polio to become an Olympic athlete and winner of three gold medals. Features full-color and black-and-white photographs, a timeline, and a glossary.
title: Wilma Rudolph

author: Gunderson, Jessica
description: Uses a graphic novel format to chart the life and death of Malcolm X, spotlighting his views on race and civil rights and how they transformed his life.
title: X

author: Philbrick, W. R
description: A twelve-year-old boy and his dog become trapped in New Orleans during the horrors of Hurricane Katrina.
title: Zane and the hurricane

author: Bass, Patrik Henry
description: After finding a ring with magical powers, fourth grader Bakari Katari Johnson and his best friend Wardell have to elude mysterious beings from another world who want the ring back.
title: The zero degree zombie zone

author: Bacigalupi, Paolo
description: While practicing for their next baseball game, thirteen-year-old friends Rabi, Miguel, and Joe discover that the nefarious activities of the Delbe, Iowa, meatpacking plant have caused cows to turn into zombies.
title: Zombie baseball beatdown

author: Savage, J. Scot
description: Follows the adventures of three boys as they explore their unusual, spooky hometown, encountering an assortment of monsters and hilarious situations along the way.
title: Zombie kid

author: Swanson, Jennifer
description: Introduces the field of zoology through the biographies of three contemporary women scientists including zookeeper Elise Newman, graduate student Stephanie Kim, and sea turtle researcher Erin Seney. Includes discussion questions, inserts discussing various terms in zoology, color photographs, in-text QR codes linking to various websites, additional print and digital resources, and a linear zoological timeline.
title: Zoology

author: Bond, Victoria
description: A fictionalized account of Zora Neale Hurston's childhood with her best friend Carrie, in Eatonville, Florida, as they learn about life, death, and the differences between truth, lies, and pretending. Includes an annotated bibliography of the works by Zora Neale Hurston along with a brief biography.
title: Zora and me

author: Rhuday-Perkovich, Olugbemisola
description: After half-heartedly joining his church youth group's project at a homeless shelter near his Brooklyn middle school, eighth-grade "loser" Reggie McKnight is inspired to run for school office on a platform of making a real difference in the community.
title: 8th grade super zero

author: Murray, Laura K.
description: Explores the history of the 9/11 terrorist attacks on the World Trade Center and the U.S. Pentagon, discussing the origins of Osama bin Laden and his al Qaeda organization, why the Islamic radicals planned and executed the attacks, and what has happened in the world since then.
title: The 9/11 attacks

author: Bodden, Valerie
description: Highlights events leading up to the terrorist attacks on September 11, 2001 through full-color photographs and detailed text. Examines the events that unfolded that day and the impact of the attacks in the days and years to follow.
title: The 9/11 terror attacks

author: Flores-Galbis, Enrique
description: Two young brothers are sent by their mother from Cuba to escape the revolution there. After they arrive in Miami they enter a strange world where they feel isolated and confused and miss their homeland.
title: 90 miles to Havana

author: Johnson, Robi
description: Presents advice for learning how to be a better communicator through active listening, finding better ways to express opinions in oral, written, and digital mediums, and how to self-identify and work through communication roadblocks.
title: Above and beyond with communication

author: Rupp, Rebecca
description: After the death of his older brother, Daniel Anderson became engrossed in recording details about dead people, how they died, and whether their deaths mattered but he is eventually drawn back into interaction with the living.
title: After Eli

author: Dakers, Diane
description: Presents a biography of Amelia Earhart, including her early years, personal successes and obstacles, and important contributions to the field of aviation and women's rights. Includes a chronology, glossary, and further resources.
title: Amelia Earhart

author: Niver, Heather Moore
description: Examines the life and adventures of Amerigo Vespucci, voyager and explorer of South America and the West Indies. Discusses Vespucci's connection to Christopher Columbus, his first voyage, and his legacy. Includes a glossary, index, and resources for further information.
title: Amerigo Vespucci

author: Niver, Heather Moore
description: Presents information about daily life in the Inca Empire. Discusses Inca government, royalty and nobility, diet, marriage, clothing and craftwork, religion, and the mystery of Machu Picchu. Includes glossary, index, and resources for further reading.
title: Ancient Inca daily life

author: Niver, Heather Moore
description: Presents information about daily life in the Maya empire. Discusses kings and nobles, priests, commoner life, artisans and farmers, cultural body modification, architecture, diet, and rituals. Includes glossary, index, and resources for further reading.
title: Ancient Maya daily life

author: Alban, Andrea
description: At the beginning of World War II, a Jewish family leaves Odessa for Shanghai thinking it will be a safe haven but it becomes all too clear that there is no safe place for them to hide.
title: Anya's war

author: Bodden, Valerie
description: Present a history of the Apache tribe in North America, chronicling key events and people, and describing the Apache way of life. Includes past and present photographs, an Apache story, and suggestions for further information.
title: Apache

author: Karst, Ken
description: Examines the history of media attention, public awareness, tall tales, and conspiracy theories surrounding Area 51 and the aliens and alien technology said to be there.
title: Area 51

author: Wiseman, Blaine
description: Explores some of the beautiful landscape of argentina, including its long coastline, rugged mountains, and wide plains, as well as some of the arts and culture of the people of Argentina.
title: Argentina

author: Perkins, Lynne Rae
description: A tale of a boy's travels by walking, train, car, plane, and boat.
title: As easy as falling off the face of the earth

author: Mack, W. C.
description: When their two worlds collide in seventh grade, fraternal twins and opposites Owen and Russell find themselves in direct competition at school, on the court, and at home.
title: Athlete vs. mathlete

author: Carroll, Michael Owen
description: Ten years after the disappearance of superhumans--both heroes and villains--thirteen-year-olds Danny and Colin begin to develop super powers, making them the object of much unwanted attention.
title: The awakening

author: Chandler, Matt
description: Presents a graphic novel retelling of how Lieutenant Robert Grimes was shot down behind enemy lines during World War II and escaped the Nazis with the help of a resistance group called the Comet Line.
title: Behind enemy lines

author: Stanley, Diane
description: A young peasant girl, Belle, learns that she is really the daughter of a knight who abandoned her years earlier and now wants to reclaim her. She is upset when she is compelled to leave her kind foster family, and soon Belle is victimized by a plot that will change her life forever.
title: Bella at midnight

author: Lupica, Mike
description: When fourteen-year-old baseball player Hutch feels threatened by the arrival of a new teammate named Darryl, he tries to work through his insecurities about both Darryl and his remote and silent father, who was once a great ballplayer too.
title: The big field

author: Murphy, Jim
description: Presents a history, based on personal accounts and newspaper articles, of the massive snow storm that hit the Northeast in 1888, focusing on the events in New York City.
title: Blizzard!

author: Hamilton, Virginia
description: Ten-year-old Dreenie feels both intrigued and frightened when she thinks about the girl nicknamed Bluish, whose leukemia is making her pale and causing her to use a wheelchair.
title: Bluish

author: Leyson, Leon
description: Leon Leyson, a Holocaust survivor and one of the youngest Jewish boys saved by Oskar Schindler due to his list--made famous by the movie "Schindler's List"--offers his own words on his childhood and his experiences in Nazi-held Europe.
title: The boy on the wooden box

author: Gallagher, Diana G.
description: When Brad asks Claudia for help with his homework, she is very excited because has had a crush on him for a long time. Now that she is meeting with him regularly, the new cute boy in town asks Claudia for a date and she doesn't know what to do. Includes discussion questions and writing prompts.
title: Boy trouble

author: Walters, Eric
description: While Ian's school is in an uproar about new school uniforms, Ian is more concerned with kids in the world who are unable to attend school. Then he discovers how the two issues might be related.
title: Branded

author: Herlong, M. H.
description: Twelve-year-old Li'l T and his family face great losses caused by Hurricane Katrina, including leaving Buddy, their very special, three-legged dog, behind when they must evacuate.
title: Buddy

author: Prose, Francine
description: After the death of his estranged father in the World Trade Center on 9/11, thirteen-year-old Bart, still struggling with his feelings of guilt, sorrow and loss, wins a scholarship to the local preparatory school and there encounters a vicious bully whose cruelty compounds the aftermath of the tragedy.
title: Bullyville

author: Fantaskey, Beth
description: Seventeen-year-old Millie joins forces with her classmate, gorgeous but mysterious Chase Colton, to try to uncover who murdered head football coach "Hollerin' Hank" Killdare--and why.
title: Buzz kill

author: Schlosser, Eric
description: Investigates the practices of fast food restaurants. Describes the additives found in soft drinks, French fries, and hamburgers and explores the effects of fast food on the human body. Also examines the origins of the fast food industry.
title: Chew on this

author: Gish, Melissa
description: Explores the behavior, physical characteristics, habitat, and life cycle of chimpanzees. Also discusses their relationship with humans, evolutionary lineage, role in scientific research, and conservation status. Includes a West African folktale about why chimps don't have tails, color photographs and a glossary.
title: Chimpanzees

author: Whelan, Gloria
description: In order to save her baby sister, fourteen-year-old Chu Ju leaves her rural home in modern China and earns food and shelter by working on a sampan, tending silk worms, and planting rice seedlings, while wondering if she will ever see her family again.
title: Chu Ju's house

author: DuPrau, Jeanne
description: In the year 241, twelve-year-old Lina trades jobs on Assignment Day to be a Messenger to run to new places in her decaying but beloved city, perhaps even to glimpse Unknown Regions.
title: The city of Ember

author: Hahn, Mary Downing
description: When thirteen-year-old Logan and his family move into a run-down old house in rural Virginia, he discovers that a woman was murdered there and becomes involved with his neighbor Arthur in a dangerous investigation to try to uncover the killer.
title: Closed for the season

author: Cooney, Caroline B.
description: While conducting research for a school paper on smallpox, Mitty finds an envelope containing 100-year-old smallpox scabs and fears that he has infected himself and all of New York City.
title: Code Orange

author: Woodcock, Jon
description: Features step-by-step directions for building simple games and puzzles using Scratch. Also explains how to share them online with family and friends. Includes a glossary and screenshots.
title: Coding games in Scratch

author: Johnson, Angela
description: Nine-year-old Lila, born with xeroderma pigmentosum, a skin disease that make her sensitive to sunlight, makes secret plans to feel the sun's rays on her tenth birthday.
title: A cool moonlight

author: Wiles, Deborah
description: Set in the fear-laden sixties when duck-and-cover drills sent kids cowering under their desks, this novel follows Franny as she tries to make sense of the pervading threat of nuclear devastation, sibling tension, and her place in this complex world. Contains photos, news clips, and songs from the time.
title: Countdown

author: Pearsall, Shelley
description: When twelve-year old Rebecca Carter's father brings a Native American accused of murder into their 1812 Ohio settlement town, Rebecca, witnessing the town's reaction to the Indian, struggles with the idea that an innocent man may be convicted and sentenced to death.
title: Crooked river

author: Krossing, Karen
description: After Briar is chosen as the director of an one-act play, she discovers that it takes more than just her vision to make the play a success.
title: Cut the lights

author: McCarthy, Tom
description: Provides five real-life stories of thievery including, D.B Cooper stealing {dollar}200,000 and then disappearing, the Great Train Robbery in 1963, and the 1990 heist of thirteen works of art from a museum in Boston. Includes sources for further reading and glossary.
title: Daring heists

author: Barrett, Tracy
description: Retells the story of the Minotaur through the eyes of his fifteen-year-old sister, Ariadne, a lonely girl destined to become a goddess of the moon, and her new friend, Theseus, the son of Athens' king who was sent to Crete as a sacrifice to her misshapen brother.
title: Dark of the moon

author: Malley, G. R
description: In 2140 England, where drugs enable people to live forever and children are illegal, teenaged Anna, an obedient "Surplus" training to become a house servant, discovers that her birth parents are trying to find her.
title: The Declaration

author: Haddix, Margaret Peterson
description: In the journal she is keeping for English class, sixteen-year-old Tish chronicles the changes in her life when her abusive father returns home after a two-year absence.
title: Don't you dare read this, Mrs. Dunphrey

author: Draper, Sharon M
description: Three eighth-grade friends, preparing for the International Double Dutch Championship jump rope competition in their home town of Cincinnati, Ohio, cope with Randy's missing father, Delia's inability to read, and Yo Yo's encounter with the class bullies.
title: Double Dutch

author: Shusterman, Neal
description: When fourteen-year-old Lindsay meets Talon and discovers the Downsiders world which had evolved from the subway built in New York in 1867 by Alfred Ely Beach, she and her new friend experience the clash of their two cultures.
title: Downsiders

author: Hynson, Colin
description: Explores careers in math from cryptology and transit planning to aerodynamics and music data analysis. Includes a glossary and color photographs.
title: Dream jobs in math

author: Christopher, Nick
description: Explores the American belief in "Manifest Destiny" - the idea that it was their destiny to expand the country from one ocean to the other. Features key conflicts, well-known explorers, typical life on a western homestead, and the expansion of the railroad. Includes a glossary, resources for further information, and photographs.
title: The dream of Manifest Destiny

author: Peck, Dale
description: Sent to stay with their uncle in a ship-like home called Drift House, twelve-year-old Susan and her two younger stepbrothers embark on an unexpected adventure involving duplicitous mermaids, pirates, and an attempt to stop time forever.
title: Drift House

author: Fox, Helen
description: Unlike Grumps, their old-fashioned robot, the Bell family's new robot, Eager, is programmed to not merely obey but to question, reason, and exercise free will.
title: Eager

author: Schwartz, Heather E.
description: Examines medieval exploration and how it led to the Age of Discovery and the expeditions of various early explorers such as Bartolomeu Dias, Christopher Columbus, Amerigo Vespucci, Ponce de Leon, Ferdinand Magellan, and Francis Drake. Includes color photographs, a glossary, and further resources.
title: Early explorers

author: Smelcer, John E.
description: Seth and Tucker, his dog, are washed overboard from Seth's father's fishing boat and assumed dead, even though Seth's father never stops looking for them. Seth and Tucker miraculously end up on one of Alaska's many islands, and through tough survival situations make their way back home.
tags: Survival after airplane accidents, shipwrecks, etc.
title: Edge of nowhere

author: Glatstein, Jacob
description: Describes the dilemmas faced by two nine-year-old boys, one Jewish, the other Aryan, when they are left without families or homes in Vienna just before World War II. The two best friends fight to survive and escape the Nazi occupation.
title: Emil and Karl

author: Nixon, Jonathan
description: Highlights how energy engineers work to ensure we have adequate energy supplies to run and heat our homes and power transportation. Includes a text-related activity, a glossary, resources for further information, and color photographs.
title: Energy engineering and powering the future

author: Stuckey, Rachel
description: Describes the history and characteristics of biomass, and discusses its benefits, drawbacks, and future. Includes an activity, color photographs, a glossary, and further resources.
title: Energy from living things

author: Dickmann, Nancy
description: Describes the history and characteristics of nuclear energy, and discusses its benefits, drawbacks, and future. Includes an activity, color photographs, a glossary, and further resources.
title: Energy from nuclear fission

author: Avi
description: Driven from their impoverished Irish village, fifteen-year-old Maura and her younger brother meet their landlord's runaway son in Liverpool while all three wait for a ship to America.
title: Escape from home

author: Warren, Andrea
description: Chronicles the experiences of an orphaned Amerasian boy from his birth and early childhood in Saigon through his departure from Vietnam in the 1975 Operation Babylift and his subsequent life as the adopted son of an American family in Ohio.
title: Escape from Saigon

author: Jacobs, Thomas A.
description: Explains the election process, and examines fifteen landmark Supreme Court cases that were decided by one vote, and that affect young people today including students' right to free speech, prison terms for young people, public education for all, and search and seizure in the digital age. Includes dozens of court cases as examples, examples of teens who have taken action, activity ideas, facts and statistics, a glossary of legal terms, resources for legal research, and tips for expressing your ideas and getting your voice heard.
title: Every vote matters

author: Snedden, Robert
description: Explores the development of space science from the first telescope to the newest spacecraft. Includes sidebars, a timeline, color photographs, and a review.
title: Exploring space

author: Fleischman, Paul
description: Draws on politics, psychology, and history to examine the background of current environmental problems, focusing on population, consumption, energy, food, and climate. Also discusses what the future holds for Earth's environment. Includes a glossary of terms and suggested resources.
title: Eyes wide open

author: Fleischman, Paul
description: A collection of eleven short stories which reflects themes of racism, bigotry, and diversity.
title: Face relations

author: Freeburg, Jessica
description: Explores the tragedy of the Holocaust through a collection of firsthand accounts. Includes black-and-white photographs, a timeline, a glossary, critical thinking questions, and further resources.
title: Fight for survival

author: Draper, Sharon M
description: In 1957, Sylvia Patterson's life--that of a normal African American teenager--is disrupted by the impending integration of Little Rock's Central High when she is selected to be one of the first black students to attend the previously all white school. Includes author's note and related websites.
title: Fire from the rock

author: Hayes, Daniel
description: While filming a movie for a school project, Gabe and his friends discover mysterious activities at a supposedly vacant house.
title: Flyers

author: Sherman, Delia
description: During the 1960s civil rights movement, thirteen-year-old Sophie explores a maze at her grandmother's old house in the Bayou and discovers its secret. Sophie makes a wish and finds herself back in the year 1860 where she is mistaken for a slave on her family's Louisiana sugar plantation.
title: The freedom maze

author: Gallagher, Diana G.
description: When cheerleading tryouts begin, Claudia Cortez, upset over the fact that only popular girls get chosen for the squad, sets out to change the way tryouts work. Unfortunately, her friend doesn't agree with her actions, as she also wishes to become a cheerleader.
title: Friends forever?

author: Otfinoski, Steven
description: Uses narrative storytelling to chronicle the development of the Underground Railroad and the activism of Harriet Tubman. Includes photos and documents, a timeline, glossary, index, Common Core connection, and resources for further information.
title: From fugitive to freedom

author: Woodson, Jacqueline
description: Almost-fourteen-year-old Melanin Sun's comfortable, quiet life is shattered when his mother reveals she has fallen in love with a woman.
title: From the notebooks of Melanin Sun

author: Hart, Alison
description: Young African-American Gabriel dreams of becoming a famous jockey some day. Meanwhile he assists his father with caring for Master Giles's thoroughbred horses. But when war breaks out, Confederate raiders threaten local farmers destroying their homes and land and stealing their horses, Gabriel's father Isaac decides to join a black union army battlion in order to buy Gabriel and his mother's freedom.
title: Gabriel's horses

author: Markle, Sandra
description: Mourning his brother's death, twelve-year-old Gus goes exploring and finds a pirate's map on a Florida island. A cute, feisty girl and a loony movie-prop creator team up with Gus to search for the treasure, but instead of gold they find an endangered Florida panther cub in danger from poachers.
title: Gasparilla's gold

author: Smith, Jennifer E.
description: Lucy and Owen come from opposite backgrounds, but after they spend a romantic night together during a power outage, they wonder if their very different paths might meet again in the future.
title: The geography of you and me

author: Sedgwick, Marcus
description: Four linked stories of discovery and survival begin with a Paleolithic-era girl who makes the first written signs, continue with Anna, who people call a witch, then a mad twentieth-century poet who watches the ocean knowing the horrors it hides, and concluding with an astronaut on the first spaceship from Earth sent to colonize another world.
title: Ghosts of heaven

author: Allison, Jennifer
description: During the summer before ninth grade, intrepid Gilda Joyce invites herself to the San Francisco mansion of distant cousin Lester Splinter and his thirteen-year-old daughter, where she uses her purported psychic abilities and detective skills to solve the mystery of the mansion's boarded-up tower.
title: Gilda Joyce, psychic investigator

author: Forester, Victori
description: Piper McCloud can fly and that frightens her town. She is sent from her parents' farm to a top-secret school for kids with special abilities. Piper likes her new friends but she finds out that, even at this special school, her ability brings awful consequences.
title: The girl who could fly

author: Freitas, Donna
description: Esperanza Flores's place on the United States Olympic figure skating team has come at the expense of an injured skater, so in addition to the pressure of sudden fame and outsized expectations, Espi has to deal with the resentment of her teammates--and their efforts to sabotage her routine.
title: Gold medal winter

author: Barnham, Kay
description: Examines some history of ancient Roman individuals, emperors, military leaders, and important citizens, such as some of the brutal ways a few of the emperors died. Includes history on the founding of Rome, the myth, legend, and what is known of the actual historical founding.
title: Gory gladiators, savage centurions, and Caesar's sticky end

author: Frisch, Nate
description: Explores the history, natural habitat, and wildlife of the Grand Teton National Park. Includes a glossary, a map, resources for further information, and color photographs.
title: Grand Teton National Park

author: Strand, Jeff
description: Justin and his filmmaking friends decide to film an epic zombie movie with Justin's crush, the beautiful Alicia Howtz, as the lead. As Justin races to get the film done in one month, he struggles with pressures from Alicia, uncooperative extras, and incompetent production assistants.
title: The greatest zombie movie ever

author: Cooper, Susan
description: Twelve-year-old Trey and his seven-year-old brother Lou, who does not speak, cross the barrier between two worlds, that of their island in the Bahamas, and a land called Pangaia, and play a mysterious role in restoring the natural environment in both places.
title: Green boy

author: Cooper, Susan
description: Twelve-year-old Trey and his seven-year-old brother Lou, who does not speak, cross the barrier between two worlds, that of their island in the Bahamas, and a land called Pangaia, and play a mysterious role in restoring the natural environment in both places.
title: Green boy

author: Klages, Ellen
description: In 1943, eleven-year-old Dewey Kerrigan goes to live with her father in New Mexico where he and others are working on a secret project that will change the course of World War II.
title: The green glass sea

author: Flores, Mina
description: Discusses how American cities grew due to industrialization and the need for more workers.
title: The growth of the American city

author: Jones, Patrick
description: Since her mother went to prison to await execution, eleventh-grader Camila Hernandez has been shuffled from one aunt to another, avoiding friendships and keeping to herself in hopes no one will learn her secret, and worrying that she will turn out to be a criminal, too.
title: Guarding secrets

author: Myers, Walter Dean
description: Recounts the heroic actions of the African American soldiers of the 369th Infantry Regiment of World War I, also known as the "Harlem Hellfighers." Features vintage photographs and images of letters, notes, and documents from World War I.
title: The Harlem Hellfighters

author: Bouchard, Hervâe
description: While playing with friends out in the street, Harvey and his younger brother return home to find that their father has died of a heart attack. As Harvey works through his grief, he feels himself becoming invisible to everyone around him.
title: Harvey

author: Burgan, Michael
description: Features the iconic black-and-white image of the explosion of the "Hindenburg" airship in 1937 that sparked emotion around the world. Discusses the history of airships, what caused the disaster, and how the tragedy ended the further use of airships. Includes photographs, a timeline, a glossary, and further resources.
title: The Hindenburg in flames

author: Burns, Loree Griffin
description: Follows several scientists as they study colony collapse disorder (CCD) in honey bee colonies across the country. Discusses the technology and techniques scientists use to uncover why honey bees are dying by the thousands. Includes color photographs, a glossary of terms, and sources of additional information.
title: The hive detectives

author: Mooney, Carla
description: Provides a history of the Holocaust, discussing the roots of anti-Semitism in Europe, the events before and during the Nazi Party's Final Solution, and the repercussions of the Holocaust. Includes a glossary, further resources, and index.
title: The holocaust

author: Jordan, Dream
description: Kate, a fourteen-year-old Brooklyn girl and former gang member, risks losing her first good foster family when she adopts the risquâe ways of her flirtatious new friend, Naleejah.
title: Hot girl

author: Dunkle, Clare B
description: Eleven-year-old Tabby Aykroyd, who would later serve as housekeeper for thirty years to the Brontèe sisters, is taken from an orphanage to a ghost-filled house, where she and a wild young boy are needed for a pagan ritual.
title: The house of dead maids

author: Hunter, Dru
description: Examines the origins, advancements, and future of the physical sciences, including chemistry and physics, and the ways in which scientists utilize the scientific method to explore how things work. Includes suggestions for activities, color photographs, a glossary, biographical profiles of scientists, and further resources.
title: How does it work?

author: Bragg, Georgia
description: Contains the gruesome details of the deaths of nineteen famous people including Julius Caesar, Galileo, Napoleon, and Albert Einstein.
title: How they croaked

author: Storey, Rita
description: Presents step-by-step, illustrated instructions for building a variety of homemade cars from common materials such as rubber bands, batteries, and balloons. Includes templates, a timeline, a glossary, resources for further information, and color photographs.
title: How to build cars

author: Derrington, Louise
description: Presents step-by-step, illustrated instructions for building a variety of homemade robots. Includes templates, a timeline, a glossary, resources for further information, and color photographs.
title: How to build robots

author: Alifirenka, Caitlin
description: Presents a true story of how twelve-year-old Caitlin Alifirenka from Pennsylvania became a pen pal with Martin Ganda, who lives in Zimbabwe. Describes how the letters they exchanged changed both of their lives and led to a lifelong friendship.
title: I will always write back

author: Treviäno, Elizabeth Borton de
description: Juan is a slave to a famous painter named Diego, but since he is a slave he must keep his own artistic ambitions and activities secret because slaves aren't allowed to participate in his culture's high artistic endeavors.
title: I, Juan de Pareja

author: Anniss, Matt
description: Explores how technology and science have helped musicians over the years from making, recording, and performing music to selling and marketing it. Includes a timeline, a glossary, resources for further information, and color photographs.
title: The impact of technology in music

author: Rud, Jeff
description: Matt has dreamed of playing basketball since he was a little kid. When he tries out for the middle school team, he is surprised by how much more competitive the game has gotten. Matt battles a demanding coach and bullying teammates as he works to master the game.
title: In the paint

author: Clinton, Chelsea
description: Combining facts, charts, photographs, and stories, describes how readers can enact change in the world around them and find solutions for such global problems as climate change, poverty, gender inequality, and homelessness.
title: It's your world

author: Lairamore, Dawn
description: Fourteen-year-old Ivy, a most unroyal princess, befriends Elridge, the dragon sent to imprison Ivy in a tower until a prince is able to slay Elridge and rescue Ivy, thereby winning her hand in marriage. Instead, Ivy and Elridge set out on a perilous quest to find Ivy's fairy godmother, who may be able to save both from their dire fates.
title: Ivy's ever after

author: Ritter, William
description: When she arrives in new England in 1892, Abigail Rook lands a job with R.F. Jackaby, an investigator who insists the supernatural is real. Their first case is tracking down a serial killer the police refuse to say is an inhuman creature, except for handsome detective Charlie Cane, who joins them in the investigation.
title: Jackaby

author: Bradley, Kimberly Brubaker
description: Chronicles the lives of the Jeffersons, told from the points of view of three of Jefferson's slaves -- Beverly and Madison, the children of Sally Hemings, and a third boy close to the Hemings.
title: Jefferson's sons

author: Gish, Melissa
description: Explores the behaviors, anatomy, and habitats of jellyfish. Also discusses their controversial relationship with humans due to their invasive nature. Features color photographs and a glossary.
title: Jellyfish

author: Naidoo, Beverley
description: Separated from their mother by the harsh social and economic conditions prevalent among blacks in South Africa, thirteen-year-old Naledi and her younger brother make a journey of over 300 kilometers to find her in Johannesburg.
title: Journey to Jo'burg

author: Green, D. L
description: When the Sweet family decides to replace their regular babysitter Kaitlyn with a new boy named Doc, Kaitlyn is determined to win back the families business. But she might discover that she could learn a thing or two about being a great sitter from Doc.
title: Kaitlyn and the competition

author: Smith, Hope Anita
description: A thirteen-year-old African American boy chronicles what happens to his family when his father, who temporarily left, returns home and they all must deal with their feelings of anger, hope, abandonment, and fear.
title: Keeping the night watch

author: Kuhlman, Evan
description: In the wake of his father's sudden death, twelve-year-old Finn feels he is becoming invisible as his hair and skin become whiter by the day, and so he writes and illustrates a book to try to understand what is happening and to hold on to himself and his father.
title: The last invisible boy

author: Woodson, Jacqueline
description: Eleven-year-old Margaret tries to accept the inevitable changes that come one summer when her father dies and her best friend Maizon goes away to a private boarding school.
title: Last summer with Maizon

author: Bryant, Howard
description: Examines twenty pivotal games in Super Bowl history, highlighting the greatest players, coaches, and teams. Includes photographs, top ten lists, and a timeline of key moments in football history.
title: Legend

author: Paulsen, Gary
description: Fourteen-year-old Kevin is very good at lying and doing so makes life easier, but when he finds himself in big trouble with his friends, family, and teachers, he must find a way to end his lies forever.
title: Liar, liar

author: Hartman, Eve
description: Explores the properties of light and sound, and describes how they travel as waves and move through different types of matter. Includes color photographs, science activities and projects, quizzes, a timeline, a glossary, and sources of additional information.
title: Light and sound

author: Kraus, Stephanie
description: Presents a brief biography of Lin-Manuel Miranda, a writer, singer, actor, rapper, and songwriter best known for his Broadway musicals "In the Heights" and "Hamilton: An American Musical."
title: Lin-Manuel Miranda

author: Marrin, Albert
description: Discusses parasites that live on or in the human body, including head lice, mites, fleas, and tapeworms.
title: Little monsters

author: Beddor, Frank
description: When she is cast out of Wonderland by her evil aunt Redd, young Alyss Heart finds herself living in Victorian Oxford as Alice Liddell and struggles to keep memories of her kingdom intact until she can return and claim her rightful throne.
title: The Looking Glass Wars

author: Sage, Angie
description: After learning that she is the Princess, Jenna is whisked from her home and carried toward safety by the Extraordinary Wizard, those she always believed were her father and brother, and a young guard known only as Boy 412--pursued by agents of those who killed her mother ten years earlier.
title: Magyk

author: Hillman, Robert
description: During Sri Lanka's civil war, Malini and her family are captured by soldiers to be human shields. Malini and her sister Banni escape and begin a dangerous journey to safety in their grandfather's village. Includes an author's note, a glossary, resources, and a timeline.
title: Malini

author: Gish, Melissa
description: Explores the habitat, life cycle, physical characteristics, behavior, and legends of manatees.
title: Manatees

author: Barnham, Kay
description: Presents a humorous look at what daily life was like for people living in ancient Egypt, discussing mummies, pyramids, Tutankhamun, slave life, and Egyptian beliefs about the afterlife.
title: Mangy mummies, menacing pharaohs, and the awful afterlife

author: Dashner, James
description: Sixteen-year-old Thomas wakes up with no memory in the middle of a maze and realizes he must work with the community in which he finds himself if he is to escape.
title: The maze runner

author: Myers, Walter Dean
description: Although adoption has taken them out of the New Jersey institution where they grew up, eleven-year-old T.J. and his younger brother Moondance remain involved with their friend Mop's relentless attempts to become adopted herself and to wreak revenge on their baseball rivals the obnoxious Eagles.
title: Me, Mop, and the Moondance Kid

author: Cushman, Karen
description: In medieval England, a nameless, homeless girl is taken in by a sharp-tempered midwife and eventually gains the three things she most wants.
title: The midwife's apprentice

author: Silberberg, Alan
description: In love with the girl he sneezed on the first day of school and best pals with Marshall, the "One Eyed Jack" of friends, seventh-grader Milo Cruikshank misses his mother whose death has changed everything at home.
title: Milo

author: Lupica, Mike
description: After her mother's death, twelve-year-old Molly learns that her father is a basketball star for the Boston Celtics.
title: Miracle on 49th Street

author: DeFelice, Cynthia C
description: While coping with his parents' separation, eleven-year-old Skeet spends most of Spring Break in his skiff on a Florida river, where he finds a manatee shot to death and begins looking for the killer.
title: The missing manatee

author: White, Ruth
description: In the summer of 1956 while her mother is in Florida searching for a job, fourteen-year-old April Garnet Rose, who has never met her father, stays with her terminally ill aunt in Virginia and accompanies her as she visits different churches, looking for God.
title: A month of Sundays

author: Greathead, Helen
description: Highlights how chocolate bars, bananas, tea, peanuts, sugar, and honey are produced and sold around the world in a manner that promotes better working conditions and fair prices. Includes a map, a glossary, resources for further information, and color photographs.
title: My chocolate bar and other foods

author: Greathead, Helen
description: Explores the impact of Fair Trade in the production and distribution of clothing. Features specific case studies of families and companies around the world that make clothing, showing both good and bad production conditions. Includes a glossary, resources for further information, and color photographs.
title: My T-shirt and other clothing

author: Runholt, Susan
description: While traveling in London, Paris, and Amsterdam, fourteen-year-old best friends Kari and Lucas solve an international art forgery mystery.
title: The mystery of the third Lucretia

author: Denenberg, Barry
description: Provides a biography of Nelson Mandela, the man who spent twenty-six years in jail for trying to end apartheid in South Africa.
title: Nelson Mandela

author: Thompson, Kate
description: When J.J.'s mother requests more time in her day for her birthday, J.J. sets his mind to finding some for her. J.J. has no idea how he will accomplish the task until a neighbor discloses a secret about a place where time stands still. Soon J.J. embarks on a journey that will make him disappear from his own life.
title: The new policeman

author: Wiseman, Blaine
description: Presents an introduction to Nigeria's people, geography, wildlife, industries, government, culture, and daily life. Includes color photographs, a quiz, a map, a glossary, and a list of additional resources.
title: Nigeria

author: Kidd, Ronald
description: Thirteen-year-old Billie Sims, a white girl in 1960s Alabama, and her black friend Jarmaine, get caught up in the Freedom Rides passing through her town on the way to Birmingham. Along the way, change comes to Billie, her family, and her town in big and small ways.
title: Night on fire

author: Hauge, Lesley
description: A post-apocalyptic novel in which an island in the north is populated solely by women. A group of teen Trackers are in training to protect the island from the enemy--men. Then the girls come upon the ruins of a home with remnants of twentieth-century teen magazines and fashions and considers their meaning.
title: Nomansland

author: Rinaldi, Ann
description: When thirteen-year-old Eulinda, a house slave on a Georgia plantation, has a chance to go North and find freedom, she decides to stay and face the challenges around her.
title: Numbering all the bones

author: Kallen, Stuart A.
description: Examines a number of conflicting opinions on the problem of obesity in the United States, such as whether or not the food industry is to blame, or if exercising and dieting are truly effective treatments of obesity. Discusses how opinions can influence society, culture, and the legal system.
title: Obesity

author: Gunderson, Jessica
description: As part of a complex plan to win back her former best friend, Olivia Bitter agrees to babysit four kids who just moved into a house thought to be haunted for extra cash.
title: Olivia Bitter, spooked-out sitter

author: Gish, Melissa
description: Presents an in-depth, illustrated exploration of the origins, behaviors, anatomy, life cycle, and habitat of ostriches. Also discusses their relationship with humans, and their conservation status. Features dozens of color photographs, a glossary, and a myth about the ostrich.
title: Ostriches

author: Lee, Stacey
description: In 1906 San Francisco, fifteen-year-old Mercy Lee talks her way into the elite, all-white St. Clare's School for Girls by posing as a Chinese heiress. Determined to make a better life for herself and her sickly little brother, Jack, Mercy tries to fit in. And when a major earthquake hits, Mercy uses her quick wits to pull the survivors together in the aftermath of the tragedy.
tags: San Francisco Earthquake and Fire, Calif., 1906
title: Outrun the moon

author: Lawrence, Caroline
description: In 1862 Nevada Territory, after finding his foster parents murdered and scalped, twelve-year-old P.K. Pinkerton, son of a railroad detective and a Sioux Indian, inherits a valuable deed and must hide from dangerous Whittlin Walt and his gang of desperados.
title: P.K. Pinkerton and the deadly desperados

author: Soto, Gary
description: A collection of poems describing first love from the perspective of both a boy and a girl.
title: Partly cloudy

author: Heneghan, James
description: Charley Callaghan is adjusting to a move from Ireland to Vancouver after his mother's death. He fends off the class bullies till they find a new target, Benny Mason. Charley doesn't intervene in the bullying and the situation takes a tragic turn. Then he considers his part in the situation and seeks atonement.
title: Payback

author: Bryant, Jennifer
description: In journal entries to her mother, a gifted artist who died suddenly, thirteen-year-old Georgia McCoy reveals how her life changes after she receives an anonymous gift membership to a nearby art museum.
title: Pieces of Georgia

author: Martinez, Claudia Guadalupe
description: Seventeen-year-old Masi Burciaga's barrio becomes more like a ghost town every day, but when she and other youths are recruited to erect a giant pyramid in hopes of attracting tourists, she wonders about the entrepreneur behind the scheme--and his attractive son.
title: Pig Park

author: Engle, Margarita
description: Presents the life of  eighteenth-century Cuban poet Juan Francisco Manzano in the children's poems of Margareta Engle. Accompanied by black-and-white drawings.
title: The poet slave of Cuba

author: Murdock, Catherine Gilbert
description: A girl is transformed, through instruction in life at court, determination, and magic, from sullen, pudgy, graceless Ben into Crown Princess Benevolence, a fit ruler of the kingdom of Montagne as it faces war with neighboring Drachensbett.
title: Princess Ben

author: Wright, Bil.
description: Sixteen-year-old Carlos Duarte is on the verge of realizing his dream of becoming a famous make-up artist, but first he must face his jealous boss at a Macy's cosmetics counter, his sister's abusive boyfriend, and his crush on a punk-rocker classmate.
title: Putting makeup on the fat boy

author: Hoose, Phillip M.
description: Tells the story of the ivory-billed woodpecker's extinction in the United States, describing the encounters between this species and humans, and discussing what these encounters have taught us about preserving endangered creatures.
title: The race to save the Lord God Bird

author: Deans, Sis Boulos
