description: After the death of his abusive father, eleven-year-old Ricky tries to help his younger brother deal with his residual fears and discovers that running helps him deal with his own anger and the taunts of a bullying classmate.
title: Racing the past

author: Bodeen, S. A
description: En route to the Midway Atoll from Hawaii, the airplane Robie is flying on experiences technical difficulties and she and the co-pilot, Max, are stranded on an island as they await rescue that may never come.
tags: Survival after airplane accidents, shipwrecks, etc.
title: The raft

author: Arnold, Tedd
description: After developing an unusual friendship with a young Vietnam War veteran in 1972, fourteen-year-old Todd discovers his writing talent and solves a murder mystery.
title: Rat life

author: Mooney, Carla
description: Discusses several topics of contention concerning recycling, such as whether or not it is truly good for the environment and how economically efficient it is.
title: Recycling

author: Alvarez, Julia
description: After his family hires migrant Mexican workers to help save their Vermont farm from foreclosure, eleven-year-old Tyler befriends the oldest daughter, but when he discovers they may not be in the country legally, he realizes that real friendship knows no borders.
title: Return to sender

author: Manzano, Sonia
description: It is 1969 in Spanish Harlem, and fourteen-year-old Evelyn Serrano is trying hard to break free from her conservative Puerto Rican surroundings, but when her activist grandmother comes to stay and the neighborhood protests start, things get a lot more complicated--and dangerous.
title: The revolution of Evelyn Serrano

author: Jobling, Curtis
description: When a vicious beast invades his father's farm and sixteen-year-old Drew suddenly transforms into a werewolf, he runs away from his family, seeking refuge in the most out of the way parts of Lyssia, only to be captured by Lord Bergan's men and forced to battle numerous werecreatures while trying to prove that he is not the enemy.
title: Rise of the wolf

author: Flanagan, Joh
description: When fifteen-year-old Will is rejected by battleschool, he becomes the reluctant apprentice to the mysterious Ranger Halt, and winds up protecting the kingdom from danger.
title: The ruins of Gorlan

author: Montgomery, Sy
description: Color photographs and easy-to-follow text follow the journey of scientist Tom McCarthy, conservation director of the Seattle-based Snow Leopard Trust, as he--along with author Sy Montgomery and photographer Nic Bishop--trek to Mongolia to learn more about the rarely-seen snow leopard.
title: Saving the ghost of the mountain

author: Morey, Allan
description: Examines a variety of things that can be seen in the sky from auroras and moonbows to various cloud formations. Includes a glossary, resources for further information, text-related questions, diagrams, and color photographs.
title: The science behind wonders of the sky

author: Swinburne, Stephen R.
description: Follows sea turtle scientist Kimberly Stewart who works in St. Kitts to educate people about sea turtles and save the turtles from endangerment. Contains large, color photographs documenting the turtles' natural history, nesting behavior, endangerment, and helpers. Includes a glossary, tips for helping sea turtles, and further resources.
title: Sea turtle scientist

author: Cheng, Jack
description: Eleven-year-old Alex Petroski records his thoughts into his iPod in the hopes that one day aliens will listen to it and have a true perspective of what life on Earth was really like. Determined to help the iPod fall into the hands of extraterrestrials, Alex sets off alone with his dog to travel from Colorado to New Mexico where he plans to send it into space at the Southwest High-Altitude Rocket Festival. The people he encounters along the way help him learn more about himself and life than he ever imagined.
title: See you in the cosmos

author: Smith-Llera, Danielle
description: Text and photographs tell the story of sisters Serena and Venus Williams and their accomplishments for women and African Americans in the sport of tennis, focusing on the famous photograph of them after the historic 2001 U.S. Open. Includes a timeline, a glossary, and further resources.
title: Serena vs. Venus

author: Pearsall, Shelley
description: In 1963, thirteen-year-old Arthur is sentenced to community service helping the neighborhood Junk Man after he throws a brick at the old man's head in a moment of rage, but the junk he collects might be more important than Arthur suspects. Inspired by the work of American folk artist James Hampton.
title: The seventh most important thing

author: Staples, Suzanne Fisher
description: When eleven-year old Shabanu, the daughter of a nomad in Pakistan, is pledged in marriage to an older man, she must either accept the decision or defy her father's wishes.
title: Shabanu

author: Nix, Garth
description: In a savage post-nuclear world, four young fugitives attempt to overthrow the bloodthirsty rule of the Overlords with the help of Shade, their mysterious mentor.
title: Shade's children

author: Hardy, Janice
description: Nya, a fifteen-year-old war orphan, becomes a pawn in a bigger political game when her uncanny--and dangerous--ability to draw out people's pain and then give it to someone else turns out to be the only weapon she has to save her sister.
title: The shifter

author: Paulsen, Gary
description: Six misfit children who find themselves stuck in a middle school bathroom during a horrible storm with a stuffed cat find unexpected friendship.
title: Six kids and a stuffed cat

author: Whelan, Gloria
description: In 1919, independent-minded fifteen-year-old Rosalind lives in India with her English parents, and when they fear she has fallen in with some rebellious types who believe in Indian self-government, she is sent "home" to London, where she has never been before and where her older brother died, to stay with her two aunts. Her courage influences one of her aunts who longs for her own kind of independence.
title: Small acts of amazing courage

author: Sachar, Louis
description: Three years after being released from Camp Green Lake, Armpit is trying hard to keep his life on track, but when his old pal X-Ray shows up with a tempting plan to make some easy money scalping concert tickets, Armpit reluctantly goes along.
title: Small steps

author: Latta, Sara L.
description: Nick and Sophie, two cousins, visit CERN and learn about the Large Hadron Collider, hidden particles, forces, and dark matter.
title: Smash!

author: Johnson, Lindsay Lee
description: After her father leaves and Phoebe and her mother struggle to survive in the city, Phoebe finally goes to the country to live with her grandmother, where she learns family secrets and hopes her mother will return for her.
title: Soul moon soup

author: Bauer, Joan
description: As sixteen-year-old Ellie pursues her two goals, growing the biggest pumpkin in Iowa and losing twenty pounds herself, she strengthens her relationship with her father and meets a young man with interests similar to her own.
title: Squashed

author: Atwood, Megan
description: Desperate for money to pay for an experimental treatment that could save his ill grandfather's life, high school senior James enters a mysterious contest that will award the winner ten million dollars if he completes ten secret tasks assigned by the Benefactor.
title: Stay in the game

author: Reyes, Ra
description: Examines the skills, job duties, and educational requirements of different STEAM jobs in the field of photography. Includes color photographs, a glossary, a quiz, and further resources.
title: STEAM jobs in photography

author: Ganeshram, Ramin
description: Thirteen-year-old Anjali dreams of hosting a televised cooking show featuring foods based on her Hindu and Trinidadian heritage, but when an opportunity presents itself, she will have to defy her family to go to the audition. Includes recipes.
title: Stir it up!

author: Aretha, David
description: Uses primary source photographs to discuss the Freedom Rides, an important event in the civil rights movement, including the riders who risked their lives, the violence the riders faced, and the successful integration of interstate buses and terminals. Includes a timeline and further resources.
title: The story of the civil rights freedom rides in photographs

author: Strand, Jeff
description: Fifteen-year-old Marcus tries to uphold the honor of his beloved great-grandfather, aka Zachary the Stupendous, by performing a daring magic trick involving a disappearing shark.
title: Stranger things have happened

author: Lowry, Lois
description: Thirteen-year-old Meg envys her sister's beauty and popularity. Her feelings don't make it any easier for her to cope with Molly's strange illness and eventual death.
title: A summer to die

author: Montgomery, Sy
description: Describes the research that Samuel Marshall and his students are doing on tarantulas, including the largest spider on earth, the Goliath bird-eating tarantula.
title: The tarantula scientist

author: Jarvis, Robin
description: The werlings, a peaceful group of forgotten forest creatures whose only magic is the ability to change shapes, are unwittingly drawn into the search for a valuable item stolen from an evil queen many years before.
title: Thorn Ogres of Hagwood

author: Michaelis, Antonia
description: Sold to be the eighth wife of a rich and cruel merchant, Safia, also called Raka, tries to escape her fate by telling stories of Farhad the thief, his companion Nitish the white tiger, and their travels across India to retrieve a famous jewel that will save a kidnapped princess from becoming the bride of a demon king.
title: Tiger moon

author: Taylor, Theodore
description: After being blinded and shipwrecked on a tiny Caribbean island, twelve-year-old Phillip is rescued and hopes to regain his sight with an operation.
tags: Survival after airplane accidents, shipwrecks, etc.
title: Timothy of the cay

author: Hunter-Gault, Charlayne
description: Charlayne Hunter-Gault chronicles her efforts to gain entry to the all-white University of Georgia and places her struggles within the greater context of the Civil Rights Movement. Hunter-Gault also discusses how her and others' efforts during this period paved the way for modern African-American achievements.
title: To the mountaintop

author: Burgan, Michael
description: Briefly explores stories of people who experienced and survived the 2005 disaster of Hurricane Katrina and how it hit New Orleans.
title: Total devastation

author: Smelcer, John E.
description: In alternating chapters, seventeen-year-old Johnny Least-Weasel, who is better known for brains than brawn, worries about his missing grandfather, and the grandfather, Albert Least-Weasel, struggles to survive, caught in his own steel trap in the Alaskan winter.
title: The trap

author: White, Ruth
description: In 1954, when mine closings bring an economic crisis to Way Down Deep, West Virginia, foundling Ruby Jolene Hurley makes a thirteenth-birthday wish to find the treasure rumored to have been buried by one of the town's founders.
title: The treasure of Way Down Deep

author: Sturtevant, Katherine
description: In London in the 1680s, Meg--now sixteen years old--tries to decide whether to marry either of the two men who court her, taking into account both love and her writing ambitions.
title: A true and faithful narrative

author: Yomtov, Nelson
description: Presents a graphic novel retelling of the men who tunneled out to escape a German prisoner-of-war camp describing the task leaders, the planners, and the key soldiers of the escape.
title: Tunneling to freedom

author: Smith, Charles R.
description: A biography of champion boxer Muhammad Ali featuring rap-inspired verse and collage artwork. Describe's Ali's successes as an Olympian and a professional boxer, his protest against the Vietnam war, and his battle with Parkinson's disease.
title: Twelve rounds to glory

author: Green, Dan
description: Offers profiles of all the U.S. presidents and little-known facts about each one. Features a portrait gallery, cartoon illustrations, and a glossary of terms.
title: U.S. presidents

author: Lupica, Mike
description: Small but fast twelve-year-old Will Tyler, an avid football player in the down-and-out town of Forbes, Pennsylvania, takes matters into his own hands to try and finance the city's football team, giving the whole community hope in the process.
title: The underdogs

author: Maxwell, Lisa
description: Gwendolyn Allister has always moved around, never having a home, because her mother believed that monsters were hunting them. Then one day Gwen and her friend, Olivia, are kidnapped and brought to a world of sea hags, dangerous Fey, and an island that physically changes before their eyes. To stay safe, Gwen will have to figure out who to trust--the charming fairy-tale hero who says all the right things, or the roguish young pirate who says he can keep her safe.
title: Unhooked

author: Williams, Venus
description: Features a collection of inspiration quotes from tennis players Venus and Serena Williams. Includes tips for writing a biography, a glossary, a website for further information, and color photographs.
title: Venus and Serena William

author: Cooper, Susan
description: Alternating chapters follow the mysterious connection between a homesick English girl living in present-day America and an eleven-year-old boy serving in the British Royal Navy in 1803, aboard the H.M.S. Victory, commanded by Admiral Horatio Nelson.
title: Victory

author: Haugen, Hayley Mitchell
description: Examines the history of thought on violent video games and discusses whether or not violent games cause gamers to become violent, as well as how constitutional it might be to ban sales of certain games.
title: Video games

author: Richardson, Gillian
description: Highlights the history of human and animal migration across continents and countries from the land bridge known as Beringia to to the creation of roads and railway systems. Includes resources for further information and color photographs.
title: 10 routes that crossed the world

author: Hyde, Natalie
description: Offers students a simple, step-by-step guide to effective group collaboration. Discusses the skills and benefits of collaboration, the differences between teamwork and collaboration, and the importance of rules and roles in collaboration. Includes hands-on activities, real-world examples of collaboration, color photographs, a glossary, and further resources.
title: Above and beyond with collaboration

author: Winerip, Michael
description: A much-welcomed snow day turns into an embarrassing nightmare for middle-grader Adam Canfield when, after being mugged by high school bullies for his snow-shoveling money, he becomes the focus of major media attention just as his co-editors at The Slash are launching a contest to out bullies at their school.
title: Adam Canfield watch your back!

author: Farrant, Natasha
description: Three years ago, Blue Gadsby's twin sister Iris died. Ever since, her family has been falling apart, with her melodramatic older sister Flora going off the deep end, and her younger siblings Jasmine and Twig beginning to care more about their pet rats than their parents--and Blue doesn't blame them, since their parents sometimes spend weeks away from the family. When Zoran the caretaker is hired, and troublemaker Joss moves in next door, Blue sees her life taking a turn for the even stranger.
title: After Iris

author: Johnson, Peter
description: Thirteen-year-old John "Houdini" Smith tries to write a book about what is happening in his life, from his parents' worries about money and his brother in Iraq, to his new understandings of people while he and his friends rake lawns in their East Side Providence, Rhode Island neighborhood.
title: The amazing adventures of John Smith, Jr., aka Houdini

author: Hanson-Harding, Brian
description: Explores the beliefs, philosophy, and teachings of ancient Chinese religions, including Confucianism and religions following numerous gods and goddesses.
title: Ancient Chinese religion and beliefs

author: Honders, Christine
description: Presents information about the culture of the Maya Empire. Discusses Maya architecture and pyramids, religion and gods, mathematics and writing practices, and the Maya calendar. Examines the mysterious end of the Maya civilization and the descendants of Maya people who are connected to the culture today. Includes glossary, index, and resources for further reading.
title: Ancient Maya culture

author: Dowell, Frances O'Roark
description: In a series of letters to her cousin, twelve-year-old Arie Mae relates her life in a mountain valley of North Carolina in the 1920s.
title: Anybody shining

author: Hoffman, Alice
description: A love-struck mermaid named Aquamarine supplies adventure and insights to two twelve-year-old girls, life-long friends who are spending their last summer together before one of them moves away.
title: Aquamarine

author: Reynolds, Jason
description: Eleven-year-old Genie and his older brother Ernie reluctantly agree to leave Brooklyn and spend summer with their grandparents in Virginia. Genie quickly starts to discover his grandfather's many secrets, including one plan that scares even Ernie. His brother's fear makes Genie question his beliefs about courage and manhood, and together they discover what bravery really means.
title: As brave as you

author: Anderson, Laurie Halse
description: Isabel is on the run from southern slavery, determined to find her younger sister Ruth and make a new life as a free person with her own land. But the American Revolution is raging, and Isabel must make it safely through Patriot and British encampments with bounty hunters following her every turn.
title: Ashes

author: Bodden, Valerie
description: Examines the events leading up to and surrounding the assassination of Martin Luther King, Jr., discussing how King's life and legacy changed America.
title: The assassination of Martin Luther King Jr.

author: O'Dell, Kathleen
description: In late nineteenth-century Maine, isolated, eleven-year-old Clara Dooley gains a friend and uncovers a magical secret that changes her life when she learns to care for the once-feared birds in the aviary attached to the Glendoveer mansion where she lives.
title: The aviary

author: Snicket, Lemony
description: After the sudden death of their parents, the three Baudelaire children must depend on each other and their wits when it turns out that the distant relative who is appointed their guardian is determined to use any means necessary to get their fortune.
title: The bad beginning

author: Croll, Jennifer
description: Showcases female alternative fashion icons from throughout history, primarily focusing on the twentieth and twenty-first centuries--women Queen Cleopatra, Elizabeth I, Marilyn Monroe, Yoko Ono, and Rihanna, who have used clothing to make statements.
title: Bad girls of fashion

author: Lemke, Christina
description: Describes the history, rules, course, and equipment of the sport of basketball. Explains the physics behind the game, and includes math activities, color photographs, a quiz, a glossary, and further resources.
title: Basketball

author: Atwood, Megan
description: Trying to find money so that she and her little sister can escape their abusive foster parents, Ana enters a mysterious contest that will award the winner ten million dollars if she completes ten secret tasks assigned by the Benefactor. Ana doesn't realize that the contest could be more dangerous than the situation she's in currently.
title: Beat the odds

author: Flake, Sharon
description: Teenaged Raspberry Hill tries to sort out her confused feelings of disgust, shame, and love for her homeless, drug addicted father and worries that she may have inherited his lying and stealing ways.
title: Begging for change

author: Danticat, Edwidge
description: Writing in the notebook which her teacher gave her, thirteen-year-old Celiane describes life with her mother and brother in Haiti as well as her experiences in Brooklyn after the family moves there to be reunited with her father.
title: Behind the mountains

author: Smith-Llera, Danielle
description: Examines the story behind the photographs of American athletes Tommie Smith and John Carlos with their heads bowed and fists raised in silent protest of racial injustice during the 1968 Olympic medal ceremony for their gold and bronze medals in the 200-meter sprint. Includes a timeline, resources for further information, text-related questions, and color photographs.
title: Black power salute

author: Sutcliff, Rosemary
description: Retells the story of the Trojan War, from the quarrel for the golden apple, and the flight of Helen with Paris, to the destruction of Troy.
title: Black ships before Troy

author: Taylor, Laini
description: Magpie Windwitch, faerie, devil hunter, and granddaughter of the West Wind, must defeat an ancient evil creature, the Blackbringer, who has escaped from his bottle and threatens to unmake all of creation.
title: Blackbringer

author: Grant, K. M
description: A special horse named Hosanna changes the lives of two English brothers and those around them as they fight with King Richard I against Saladin's armies during the Third Crusades.
title: Blood red horse

author: McNish, Cliff
description: When he and his mother move into an old farmhouse in the English countryside, asthmatic, twelve-year-old Jack discovers that he can communicate with the ghosts inhabiting the house and inadvertently establishes a relationship with a tormented, malevolent spirit that threatens to destroy both his mother and himself.
title: Breathe

author: Polak, Monique
description: Daniel Abel always liked kidding around, but one day an incident in the schoolyard gets out of hand, and he is forced to confront the idea that he might be a bully. The principal then assigns him to work side by side with Jeff Kover, a real, strong, mean bully, to make things right.
title: Bullies rule

author: Withers, Pam
description: Thirteen-year-old Chris plans on setting up a commercial bungee jump on the bridge connecting his backyard to a historical island that was once the site of a hospital for children with leprosy. However, mysterious accidents on the bridge and rumors of hauntings on the island threaten to derail Chris's business venture and bankrupt his family.
title: Bungee jump

author: Messner, Kate
description: When the original Star Spangled Banner is stolen, seventh-graders Anne, Josâe, and Henry, all descendants of the Silver Jaguar Society, pursue suspects on airport carts and through baggage handling tunnels while stranded at a Washington, D.C., airport during a snowstorm.
title: Capture the flag

author: Thayer, Ernest Lawrence
description: Presents an urban, multi-racial artistic interpretation of the classic "Casey at the Bat" poem.
title: Casey at the bat

author: Choldenko, Gennifer
description: Thirteen-year-old Lizzie and her secret friend Noah, who is hiding in her house, plan to rescue Noah's father from the quarantined Chinatown, and save everyone they love from contracting the plague that is spreading in 1900 San Francisco.
title: Chasing secrets

author: Williams-Garcia, Rita
description: After his grandfather, Cool Papa Byrd, dies and his mother forbids him from playing the blues, Clayton runs away to find his grandfather's blues group, the "Bluesmen," to join them on the road. While on his journey through New York City, Clayton learns things that surprise him and help him find his way home.
title: Clayton Byrd goes underground

author: Hall, Maggie
description: After discovering she is part of a secret family called the Circle of Twelve, sixteen-year-old Avery West learns the Circle believes her to be the key to an ancient prophecy. Two boys--handsome Stellan and mysterious Jack--accompany her on a world-wide adventure from Paris to Istanbul, searching for clues to unravel the prophecy. What they find is a conspiracy that will certainly destroy Avery, if not the whole world, before the prophecy can be fulfilled.
title: The conspiracy of us

author: Lassieur, Allison
description: Profiles the lives and actions of real-life spies active during World War I, including the Black Hand, Mata Hari, and the nurse, Edith Cavell. Includes a timeline, a glossary, resources for further information, and archival photographs.
title: Courageous spies and international intrigue of World War I

author: Gish, Melissa
description: Explores the behavior, anatomy, and habitat of crabs. Also discusses their relationship with humans and conservation status. Features color photographs and a glossary.
title: Crabs

author: Hobbs, Will
description: Fifteen-year-old Victor Flores journeys north in a desperate attempt to cross the Arizona border and find work in the United States to support his family in central Mexico.
title: Crossing the wire

author: Osa, Nancy
description: Violet Paz, a Chicago high school student, reluctantly prepares for her upcoming "quince," a Spanish nickname for the celebration of an Hispanic girl's fifteenth birthday.
title: Cuba 15

author: Hale, Marian
description: While salvaging and rebuilding in the aftermath of the Galveston flood of 1900, sixteen-year-old Seth proves himself in a way that his previous efforts never could, but he still must face his father man-to-man.
title: Dark water rising

author: Lester, Julius
description: The Butler household is torn apart by differing beliefs regarding slavery. The mother and one daughter oppose slavery while the father, Pierce Butler, and another daughter believe in the Southern lifestyle. To pay off gambling debts, Pierce decides to host the largest slave auction in American history and breaks his word not to sell the family's slave Emma.
title: Day of tears

author: Rodkey, Geoff
description: Thirteen-year-old Egg lives on the pirate island of Deadweather with two siblings who make his life awful. One day his father takes them on a mysterious errand to the luxurious Sunrise Island, and then disappears along with Egg's siblings. Egg can't believe his luck--now he gets to stay in the wealthy Pembroke family in their mansion, and their beautiful daughter, Millicent. Just when his life is looking up, someone tries to push him off a cliff.
title: Deadweather and Sunrise

author: Woodson, Jacqueline
description: Twelve-year-old Feni has to adjust when the pregnant young daughter of an old friend of her mother's comes to stay with them.
title: The dear one

author: Lane, Andy
description: In 1868, with his army officer father suddenly posted to India, and his mother mysteriously "unwell," fourteen-year-old Sherlock Holmes is sent to stay with his eccentric uncle and aunt in their vast house in Hampshire, where he uncovers his first murder and a diabolical villain.
title: Death cloud

author: Dowell, Frances O'Roark
description: When accused of murder in her North Carolina mountain town in 1928, Dovey Coe, a stronged-willed twelve-year-old girl, comes to a new understanding of others, including her deaf brother.
title: Dovey Coe

author: Abrahams, Peter
description: Like her idol Sherlock Holmes, eighth grader Ingrid Levin-Hill uses her intellect to solve a murder case in her home town of Echo Falls.
title: Down the rabbit hole

author: George, Jessica Day
description: Orphaned after a fever epidemic, Creel befriends a dragon and unknowingly inherits an object that can either save or destroy her kingdom.
title: Dragon slippers

author: Ibbotson, Eva
description: Tally, a twelve-year-old English girl, and her classmates at Delderton, a progressive boarding school, help Karil, the young prince of Bergania, escape into England after the Nazis invade Bergania and kill the king.
title: The dragonfly pool

author: Hynson, Colin
description: Explores careers in engineering from renewable energy and race engineering to aeronautical and bridge engineering. Includes a glossary and color photographs.
title: Dream jobs in engineering

author: Oxlade, Chris
description: Explores careers in science from astrobiology and forensic anthropology to seismology and genetic engineering. Includes a glossary and color photographs.
title: Dream jobs in science

author: Hynson, Colin
description: Explores a variety of careers available today in the field of technology, such as designing smart objects--like a fridge that tells you what groceries are inside it--or creating better Internet security to protect online privacy.
title: Dream jobs in technology

author: Anstey, Cindy
description: In 1800s London, a young heiress and her law clerk are caught up in a kidnapping plot to steal her fortune, but as their investigation delves deeper and their affections for each other grow, Lydia starts to wonder what she truly wants.
title: Duels & deception

author: Bow, James
description: Describes global climate change, the greenhouse effect, and the role energy plays in climate change. Also examines the Industrial Revolution, the Agricultural Revolution, and the developing world. Includes an activity, color photographs, a glossary, and further resources.
title: Earth's climate change

author: Kopp, Megan
description: Describes the benefits and drawbacks of wind energy, and its use around the world. Includes an activity, color photographs, a glossary, and further resources.
title: Energy from wind

author: Vanhee, Jason
description: In a rural village far distant from the dead and dying cities, twelve-year-old Merciful discovers horrible secrets and must make decisions that may save or doom her world.
title: Engines of the broken world

author: Ogden, Charlie
description: Examines the concepts of equality and diversity, and highlights why they're important to a healthy and happy society. Includes a case study of Ruby Bridges, text-related questions, a glossary, and color photographs.
title: Equality & diversity

author: Jackson, Donna M.
description: Presents a look at twenty-four hours in an animal emergency room. Follows veterinarians, veterinary nurses, and specialists, including anesthesiologists and cardiologists, as they perform emergency healing to small and large animals. Provides color photographs and text capturing the drama of various emergency situations, such as a dog hit by a car, a snake in hypothermia, and a frail newborn foal.
title: ER vets

author: Ehrenberg, Pamela
description: After a school suspension and his parents' separation, Ethan is sent to live with his grandparents in Washington, D.C., which is worlds apart from his home in a Philadelphia suburb.
title: Ethan, suspended

author: Cherry, Kathleen
description: Alice's behavior at her new school lands her in detention, but there she makes a new friend in Megan, a girl who seems fearless--but also sad, or maybe angry. Alice can't decide which, but she may be the only person who can keep her safe.
title: Everyday hero

author: Kyi, Tanya Lloyd
description: Highlights ten true stories of battles that were waged under formidable forces of nature from the 119 BCE battle fought in a sandstorm to the tunnels and caves in Afghanistan used to throw off the search for Osama bin Laden. Includes resources for further information and color photographs.
title: Extreme battlefields

author: Mull, Brandon
description: When Kendra and Seth go to stay at their grandparents' estate, they discover that it is a sanctuary for magical creatures and that a battle between good and evil is looming.
title: Fablehaven

author: Langston-George, Rebecca
description: Surveys the lives and exploits of some of the most famous spies that operated during World War II, including a beauty queen spy, a spy who actually was dead while counter-spies were looking for him, and a spy who actually had to get his mother's permission to go on missions.
title: Fearless spies and daring deeds of World War II

author: Reeve, Philip
description: Orphan Fever, the only girl to serve in the Order of Engineers, is assigned to assist archaeologist Kit Solent to discover the secrets of a mysterious locked room that belonged to the Scriven overlords before the people's uprising. As Fever works, she begins to experience memories that are not her own and discovers that she is being hunted.
title: Fever Crumb

author: Patrick, Denise Lewis
description: Thirteen-year-old aspiring fashion designer Reesie Boone is eagerly anticipating her birthday when she can finally sew her first outfit on Ma Maw's sewing machine. But Hurricane Katrina hits her city of New Orleans while Reesie is home alone, and she is forced to escape in a boat along with her elderly neighbor, Miss Martine. Although Reesie is finally rejoined with her family, they still have a long journey to undertake before they can return home.
title: Finding someplace

author: D'Lacey, Chris
description: When college student David Rain rents a room in an unusual boardinghouse full of clay dragons, he has no idea that they, along with some lively squirrels, will help jump start his writing career.
title: The fire within

author: Matthews, L. S
description: As fighting closes in on the village where Tiger's parents have been working, the three of them and a mysterious guide set out on a difficult journey to safety.
title: Fish

author: Joseph, Lynn
description: After leaving the Dominican Republic to live with her brother in New York, fifteen-year-old Nina Perez looks for a way to acclimate herself in this new and strange world. She gradually finds the strength to discover her place in the world, but her new self-confidence is put to the test when she learns about the ugly truth behind her brother's business.
title: Flowers in the sky

author: Lorenzi, Natalie Dias
description: When Skye's cousin Hiroshi and his family move to Virginia from Japan, the cultural differences lead to misunderstandings and both children are unhappy at the changes in their lives--will flying the dragon kite finally bring them together?
title: Flying the dragon

author: James, Ryan
description: Describes the history, rules, course, and equipment of the sport of football. Explains the physics behind the game, and includes math activities, color photographs, a quiz, a glossary, and further resources.
title: Football

author: Green, Tim
description: Troy, a sixth-grader with an unusual gift for predicting football plays before they occur, attempts to use his ability to help his favorite team, the Atlanta Falcons, but he must first prove himself to the coach and players.
title: Football genius

author: Gish, Melissa
description: Explores the world of foxes, discussing the different species of foxes in the world, where they live, what they eat, how fox kits are born and grow up, and the status of foxes as a species, whether or not they are endangered.
title: Foxes

author: Steele, Philip
description: Explores the events that led up to the global financial crisis and recession of 2008, how the world economies have more or less stabilized by now, and muses on whether or not the world is headed for another financial crash.
title: Global financial crisis

author: Duhaime, Darla
description: Examines a range of gross things the human body does naturally, such as secret mucus and ear wax, burp and pass gas, and also work with trillions of beneficial microbes in the stomach and gut to keep the body healthy.
title: Gross body stuff

author: Nardo, Don
description: Examines the events of the September 11 terrorist attacks and how a single photo of three firefighters raising an American flag at Ground Zero in New York City became a symbol of hope.
title: Ground Zero

author: Levine, Karen
description: A biography of a Czech girl named Hana Brady who died in the Holocaust, told in alternating chapters with an account of how the curator of a Japanese Holocaust center learned about her life after Hana's suitcase was sent to her. Features bonus content and photographs.
title: Hana's suitcase

author: Summers, Alex
description: Examines a number of battlefield graveyards throughout the United States said to be haunted by ghosts, such as Gettysburg. Discusses why some people believe ghosts stick around places where violent deaths occurred.
title: Haunted battlefields and cemeteries

author: Lupica, Mike
description: Pitching prodigy Michael Arroyo is on the run from social services after being banned from playing Little League baseball because rival coaches doubt he is only twelve years old and he has no parents to offer them proof.
title: Heat

author: Johnson, Angela
description: Fourteen-year-old Marley's seemingly perfect life in the small town of Heaven is disrupted when she discovers that her father and mother are not her real parents.
title: Heaven

author: Lee Shetterly, Margot
description: Explores the true story of four African American female mathematicians recruited by the U.S. government during World War II to work at the Langley Memorial Aeronautical Laboratory. Their job involved being "human computers," using pencils, slide rulers, and adding machines to calculate the numbers that would allow rockets and astronauts to be launched out of the atmosphere.
title: Hidden figures

author: Wedekind, Annie
description: Fourteen-year-old Jane Ryan desperately wants her own horse, preferably Beau, the older horse she has grown to love at Sunny Acres farm. But at the beginning of horse camp, Jane learns Beau has been sold and she is forced to train with a horse named Lancelot who used to belong to one of the wealthy girls at camp. As Jane's confidence in Lancelot and in her own skills grows, so do her feelings for the grandson of the barn's manager who comes to visit Sunny Acres.
title: A horse of her own

author: Steele, Philip
description: Takes a look beyond what is covered in the news and social media to examine hostage takers and discuss what a hostage is, the history and motivation of hostage taking, specific acts of terrorism, negotiations, and the effects of hostage taking on victims and the community. Includes color photographs, "News Flash" fact boxes, case studies of hostage situations around the world, quotes, debate sidebars, and a glossary.
title: Hostage takers

author: Staples, Suzanne Fisher
description: An unexpected death brings Shabanu's daughter, Mumtaz, and nephew, Jameel, both aged fifteen, to the forefront of an attempt to modernize Pakistan, but the teens must both sacrifice their own dreams if they are to meet family and tribal expectations.
title: The house of djinn

author: Allen, Crystal
description: When thirteen-year-old, bowling-obsessed Lamar Washington finds out that his idol is coming to town, he finds himself involved in some unsavory activities as he tries to change his image to impress people.
title: How Lamar's bad prank won a Bubba-sized trophy

author: Engle, Margarita
description: Quebrado, half islander, half outsider, toils under the pirate captain Bernardino de Talavera as a translator to navigate the Caribbean. When a hurricane destroys the ship, Quebrado finds safety on an island but now the tides have turned and he is responsible for the fate of his former captors.
title: Hurricane dancers

author: Woodson, Jacqueline
description: Twelve-year-old Toswiah finds her life changed when her family enters the witness protection program.
title: Hush

author: Yousafzai, Malala
description: Describes the life of the young Pakistani student who advocated for women's rights and education in the Taliban-controlled Swat Valley, survived an assassination attempt, and became the youngest nominee for the Nobel Peace Prize.
title: I am Malala

author: Medina, Tony
description: A biography of reggae musician Bob Marley presented in rhymes accompanied by colorful illustrations.
title: I and I

author: Wilson, Diane L.
description: In early fourteenth-century China, Oyuna tells her granddaughter of her girlhood in Mongolia and how love for her horse enabled her to win an important race and bring good luck to her family.
title: I rode a horse of milk white jade

author: Choldenko, Gennifer
description: Kirsten and Walk, seventh-graders at an elite private school, take turns discussing issues that affect their lives such as race, wealth, weight, and bullies. Then Kirsten and Walk discover a long-kept secret about themselves that changes their lives forever.
title: If a tree falls at lunch period

author: Woolf, Alex
description: Explores the technological innovations that have been used in the world of art to aid in creation and display. Includes information about digital painting through computer software, sculptures of complex mathematical shapes, and the use of Raman spectroscopy to find art forgeries.
title: The impact of technology in art

author: Hyde, Natalie
description: Explores the history of internment camps during World War II through historical documents, photographs, and first-person interviews.
title: Internment camps

author: Gardner, Lyn
description: Pursued by the sinister Dr. DeWilde and his ravenous wolves, three sisters, Storm, the inheritor of a special musical pipe, the elder Aurora, and the baby Any, flee into the woods and begin a treacherous journey filled with many dangers as they try to find a way to defeat their pursuer and keep him from taking the pipe and control of the entire land.
title: Into the woods

author: Elkins, Elizabeth
description: Presents photos and information about earthquakes, discussing causes of earthquakes, the aftermaths, famous earthquakes, staying safe, and studying and measuring earthquakes. Includes a glossary, index, Common Core connection, and resources for further information.
title: Investigating earthquakes

author: Myers, Walter Dean
description: A young black boy must decide whether to go along with his father, who is a thief, or reject his father's way of life and risk losing him.
title: It ain't all for nothin'

author: Bruchac, Joseph
description: Narrates the life story of Native American Jim Thorpe chronicling his childhood, education, and his athletic career. Covers his days in various Indian boarding schools to the Carlisle School in Pennsylvania where coach Pop Warner recognized Jim's athletic abilities.
title: Jim Thorpe

author: Barratt, Mark
description: In the dark, dank sewers of Victorian London, a boy known as Joe Rat scrounges for valuables which he gives to "Mother," a criminal mastermind who considers him a favorite, but a chance meeting with a runaway girl and "the Madman" transforms all their lives.
title: Joe Rat

author: Gantos, Jack
description: To the constant disappointment of his mother and his teachers, Joey has trouble paying attention or controlling his mood swings when his prescription meds wear off and he starts getting worked up and acting wired.
title: Joey Pigza swallowed the key

author: Gantos, Jack
description: When both his parents go AWOL, young Joey Pigza is forced to become like a dad to his months-old baby brother, Carter Junior. Hilarity ensues as he tries, even with the help of a friend, until the real man of the house returns and Joey sees a ray of hope for fixing his family.
title: The key that swallowed Joey Pigza

author: Cooper, Susan
description: While in London as part of an all-boy acting company preparing to perform in a replica of the famous Globe Theatre, Nat Field suddenly finds himself transported back to 1599 and performing in the original theater under the tutelage of Shakespeare himself.
title: King of shadows

author: Testa, Dom
description: After the tail of a comet tracks a virus into Earth's atmosphere, a renowned scientist comes up with a plan to save the human race by sending 251 teenagers to a distant solar system to restart the human race. The crew of the "Galahad" are all under sixteen. Two years into their voyage, the crew discovers a stowaway and saboteur. Then, when they find a metal pod in space, they accidentally trigger a new unknown disease.
title: Leaving Earth

author: Paulsen, Gary
description: Traces the life of U.S. Marshal Bass Reeves. Details how he learned to hunt and care for himself after running from the law and hiding out in Indian territory. Discusses the myths about heroes Wyatt Earp, Billy the Kid, and Wild Bill Hickock. Explains how Bass became a marshal who brought in hundreds of criminals without drawing his gun first.
title: The legend of Bass Reeves

author: Pinkney, Andrea Davis
description: Contains ten biographies of African American women civil rights workers including Rosa Parks, Harriet Tubman, Fannie Lou Hamer, and Sojourner Truth.
tags: African American women civil rights workers
title: Let it shine

author: Mann, Elizabeth
description: Albert is short, and he hates it. On the first day of middle school, the older kids on the bus make fun of how short Albert is. Albert's bus driver overhears, and invites Albert to become part of a stiltwalker group. Albert jumps at a quick way to become tall--but first he must deal with his fear of heights.
title: Little man

author: Woodson, Jacqueline
description: In a series of poems, eleven-year-old Lonnie writes about his life after the death of his parents, separation from his younger sister, living in a foster home, and finding his poetic voice at school.
title: Locomotion

author: Bloor, Edward
description: Seventh-grader Martin Conway believes that his life is monotonous and dull until the night the antique radio he uses as a night-light transports him to the bombing of London in 1940.
title: London calling

author: Wilson, John
description: Sam and Annabel are excited to be on a cruise that will pass a site connected to the most famous mystery in Arctic history, the Franklin Expedition. But soon they realize there's more to the cruise than they ever imagined, and they find themselves trying to save a priceless artifact.
title: Lost

author: Dakers, Diane
description: Presents photos and information about the life of NBA star Magic Johnson. Discusses his professional basketball career with the Lakers, famous rivalry with Larry Bird, and his 1991 announcement that he had HIV, leading to his work as an activist for the cause.
title: Magic Johnson

author: Peters, Marilee
description: Examines the notion of restorative justice and social justice as championed by Nelson Mandela and offers advice for teenagers on getting involved in helping their communities understand the deeper causes of crime and how to make a better, less-violent society.
title: Making it right

author: Bow, James
description: Showcases how digital and satellite data is processed to create a variety of maps for use by business, government, or individuals. Includes information on how open-world sandbox games like Minecraft help programmers focus modalities to accurately change digital data to visual representation.
title: Mapping in a digital world

author: Dashner, James
description: Sixteen-year-old Thomas wakes up with no memory in the middle of a maze and realizes he must work with the community in which he finds himself if he is to escape.
title: The maze runner

author: Cornwell, Betsy
description: In this steampunk version of "Cinderella," Nicolette's mother, an inventor, dies and Nicolette is forced to move in with her stepfamily. Her mean stepsisters cruelly call her Mechanica, for her love of inventions. Nicolette secretly makes coal-powered contraptions in the basement, and when the prince of the land announces a Cultural Exposition Gala, Nicolette hopes she will win the prize and perhaps the attention of entrepreneurs who might buy her work.
title: Mechanica

author: Ruiz Zafâon, Carlos
description: When a mysterious threat reenters the lives of twins Ben and Sheere, separated as babies and reunited as teenagers in 1930s Calcutta, the siblings must confront an unspeakable terror, with the help of their secret society of fellow orphans.
title: The Midnight Palace

author: Howe, James
description: Four students who do not fit in at their small-town middle school decide to create a third party for the student council elections to represent all students who have ever been called names.
title: The misfits

author: Greathead, Helen
description: Focuses on where furniture comes from, how it's made, and the people involved in its production. Includes a glossary, websites with additional resources, and production case studies from different countries.
title: My bed and other home furniture

author: Halilbegovich, Nadja
description: The real diary of Nadja Halilbegovich, a twelve-year-old in Sarajevo, written during the siege of her city from 1992 to 1995. Discusses the everyday struggle of her community as they tried to live normal lives while forced to scrounge for basic necessities and safety. The diary includes her childhood journal, her artwork, photographs from the war, as well as comments from the author looking back as a young woman.
title: My childhood under fire

author: Greathead, Helen
description: Explores how smartphones, laptops, game consoles, tablets, and other digital items are sometimes made by people in dangerous conditions out of materials that damage the Earth. Discusses the concept of fair trade, and offers case studies of both good and bad working environments around the world. Includes ways you can help, color photographs, a glossary, and further resources.
title: My smartphone and other digital accessories

author: Bell, Ted
description: With the help of Lord Hawke, whose children have been taken by the evil pirate Captain Billy Blood, young Nick McIver uses a time machine to rescue the two children as well as change the course of events in two time periods, the Napoleonic Wars and World War II.
title: Nick of time

author: Lobel, Anita
description: The author, known as an illustrator of children's books, describes her experiences as a Polish Jew during World War II and for years in Sweden afterwards.
title: No pretty pictures

author: Friesner, Esther M.
description: Determined to fend for herself in a world where only men have real freedom, headstrong Helen, who will be called queen of Sparta and Helen of Troy one day, learns to fight, hunt, and ride horses while disguised as a boy, and goes on an adventure throughout the Mediterranean world.
title: Nobody's princess

author: Ibbotson, Eva
description: When the Hag of Dribble, an orphan boy, and a troll called Ulf are sent to rescue a princess from an ogre, it turns out to be far from the routine magical mission they expect.
title: The Ogre of Oglefort

author: Auch, Mary Jane
description: After losing his hand in an accident in his father's butcher shop in 1946, sixth-grader Norman uses hard work and humor to learn to live with his disability and to succeed at baseball, art, and other activities.
title: One-handed catch

author: Wimmer, Teresa
description: Examines the history, people, projects, and policies of the Peace Corps government agency from its founding in 1961 to the controversies and challenges it faces today.
title: Peace Corps

author: Gish, Melissa
description: Presents information about peacocks, discussing their common traits, history, and the threats to their existence and safety today. Includes a glossary and index.
title: Peacocks

author: Reid, Kim
description: Junior class valedictorian Andrea Faraday's perfect life falls apart when her parents disappear. Her solution to the problem only puts her in bigger trouble, landing her at Justice Academy, the place for juvenile delinquents, the last stop before jail. Andrea, she hates to admit, may have more in common with the delinquents than they think--and when they find they have a common enemy, Drea and the delinquents join forces to set things right.
title: Perfect liars

author: Soto, Gary
description: A collection of short stories about Mexican American youth growing up in California's Central Valley.
title: Petty crimes

author: Meyerhoff, Jenny
description: For a school project, Clara Martinez decides to start a matchmaking service for her classmates. But even though she's an expert for her friends' love lives, Clara can't figure out who keeps leaving notes and gifts in her locker.
title: Playing Cupid

author: Wagenen, Maya van
description: The author, seventh-grader Maya van Wagenen, decides to embark on a year-long social experiment and follow the advice of a 1950s popularity guide written by former teen model Betty Cornell. Describes the humorous, humiliating, and heartwarming results of the author's quest to become popular.
title: Popular

author: Bolden, Tonya
description: A collection of biographies of twenty African American heroes including Frederick Douglass, Paul Robeson, and Ruth Simmons.
title: Portraits of African-American heroes

author: Abbott, Tony
description: While in St. Petersburg, Florida, to help clean out his recently-deceased grandmother's house, thirteen-year-old Jason finds an old postcard which leads him on an adventure that blends figures from an old, unfinished detective story with his family's past.
title: The postcard

author: Ruiz Zafâon, Carlos
description: Max and Alicia Carver have just moved to a small coastal town with their family, but instead of the peace that they seek, they soon encounter all sorts of strange phenomena, and a mysterious being seeking to settle a score from years before.
title: The Prince of Mist

author: Paulsen, Gary
description: During World War II, while his father is in Europe fighting and his mother is working in Chicago, a five-year-old boy goes to live with his grandmother in a rural Norwegian American community in Minnesota. Based on events from the author's life.
title: The quilt

author: Gish, Melissa
description: Presents an in-depth, illustrated exploration of the origins, behaviors, anatomy, hunting tactics, and habitats of rays. Also discusses their relationship with humans, the work scientists have done to study them, and their protected or threatened status. Features dozens of color photographs, a glossary, and a myth about how the manta ray came to inhabit the Arabian Sea.
title: Rays

author: Sundem, Garth
description: Features thirty human-interest stories about remarkable kids from around the world. Discusses children who are athletes, activists, inventors, and artists. Includes an index.
title: Real kids, real stories, real character

author: Higgins, M. G.
description: After being kidnapped from school, Koji finds himself learning how to be a rebel soldier to fight the government of his country all while wishing he could go home to his village and family.
title: Rebel

author: Cummings, Priscilla
description: Living near the water on Maryland's Eastern Shore, thirteen-year-old Brady and his best friends J.T. and Digger become entangled in a tragedy which tests their friendship and their ideas about right and wrong.
title: Red kayak

author: Woods, Brend
description: In 1953, Leah Hopper dreams of leaving the poverty and segregation of her home in Sulphur, Louisiana, and when Aunt Olivia sends train tickets to Los Angeles as part of her tenth birthday present, Leah gets a first taste of freedom.
title: The red rose box

author: Sneideman, Joshua
description: Contains color photographs and step-by-step directions for making twenty projects that offer a look at the pros and cons of various renewable energy sources including solar, wind, biofuel, hydro, and geothermal.
title: Renewable energy

author: Wiles, Deborah
description: It is the summer of 1964, and Sunny is told that her Mississippi town is going to be invaded by people from the north. All they are there for is to help African Americans register to vote--a small thing to Sunny, whose life is turned upside down by a new stepmother, stepbrother, and stepsister. Further complicating things is the fact that she and her brother were caught sneaking into a public pool, where a mysterious boy enters and changes their lives.
title: Revolution

author: Peck, Richard
description: During the early days of the Civil War, the Pruitt family takes in two mysterious young ladies who have fled New Orleans to come north to Illinois.
title: The river between us

author: De los Santos, Marisa
description: When her father is given the death sentence by the cruel Judge Lucas Biggs, thirteen-year-old Margaret O'Malley uses her family's forbidden ability to time travel back to the past in order to change the character of Lucas Biggs, so that he will not become the kind of judge who would sentence her innocent father.
title: Saving Lucas Biggs

author: Daneshvari, Gitty
description: Twelve-year-olds Madeleine, Theo, and Lulu, and thirteen-year-old Garrison, are sent to a remote Massachusetts school to overcome their phobias, but tragedy strikes and the quartet must work together--with no adult assistance--to face their fears.
title: School of Fear

author: Wood, Matthew Brenden
description: Explores the science behind science fiction stories and ideas that have inspired scientists and inventors. Includes text-related questions and activities, a glossary, links to online primary sources, and color photographs.
title: The science of science fiction

author: Law, Ingrid
description: When Ledger Kale turns thirteen, he inherits an extraordinary family talent called savvy which manages to make a mess of most things around him. His troubles are complicated when Sarah Jane Cabot, a budding reporter, witnesses his uncontrolled savvy and Ledger must stop her from writing about them in the newspaper.
title: Scumble

author: Jurmain, Suzanne
description: Presents the true story of how four Americans and one Cuban tracked down the cause of yellow fever, one of the most vicious plagues in history. Reveals how this discovery forever changed mankind's understanding of the disease and features full-color and black-and-white photographs.
title: The secret of the yellow death

author: Schwartz, Virginia Frances
description: A young slave tries to hide the horrors of slavery from his younger cousin, a light-skinned slave who is the daughter of the plantation owner.
title: Send one angel down

author: Gish, Melissa
description: Highlights the habitat, typical behaviors, and physical characteristics of sloths. Includes maps, a glossary, and color photographs.
title: Sloths

author: Collard, Sneed B
description: Examines the features, mating habits, diet, and environment of a variety of lizards, from fence lizards to Komodo dragons.
title: Sneed B. Collard III's most fun book ever about lizards

author: Gish, Melissa
description: Examines the life cycle, habitat, and behaviors of snow leopards. Includes scientific research and mythology related to these large cats. Features a glossary and color photographs.
title: Snow leopards

author: Farrar, Josh
description: Seventh-grader Alex Schrader's life changes when he meets Bijou Doucet, a Haitian girl recently relocated to Brooklyn, and while he is determined to win her heart Alex also learns about dating rules and Haitian culture.
title: A song for Bijou

author: Craig, Jonathan
description: Follows a special effects make-up artist and describes his inspiration, training, and job duties. Also discusses the history of special effects makeup. Includes color photographs, a quiz, a glossary, and further resources.
title: Special effects make-up artist

author: Lupica, Mike
description: Thirteen-year-old Danny must prove himself all over again for a disapproving coach and against new rivals at a summer basketball camp.
title: Summer ball

author: Rissman, Rebecca
description: Highlights the effects of the 2011 Japanese tsunami through firsthand accounts. Features a timeline, a glossary, text-related questions, resources for further information, and color photographs.
title: Swept away

author: Temple, Frances
description: In the hospital after being beaten by Macoutes, seventeen-year-old Djo tells the story of his impoverished life to a young woman who, like him, has been working with the social reformer Father Aristide to fight the repression in Haiti.
title: Taste of salt

author: Tullson, Diane
description: Teenager Taz is a mess in the kitchen, but when her Food Science class enters a competition that her teammates want to win, she must find confidence in her cooking skills.
title: Taz's recipe

author: Thimmesh, Catherine
description: Contains a behind-the-scenes look at the numerous support roles instrumental in the success of the Apollo 11 moon landing. Includes selected quotations, photographs and reading suggestions.
title: Team Moon

author: Dowell, Frances O'Roark
description: Because living with "modern-hippy" parents on a goat farm means fourteen-year-old Janie Gorman cannot have a normal high school life, she tries joining Jam Band, making friends with Monster, and spending time with elderly former civil rights workers.
title: Ten miles past normal

author: Boyne, John
description: Barnaby Brocket, an eight year old, was born floating. He defies gravity, which is a horror to his parents who do not like attention. One day Barnaby gets away and floats into the sky, traveling the world and even into outer-space, to find who he really is.
title: The terrible thing that happened to Barnaby Brocket

author: Clements, Andrew
description: When fifteen-year-old Bobby wakes up and finds himself invisible, he and his parents and his new blind friend Alicia try to find out what caused his condition and how to reverse it.
title: Things not seen

author: Welford, Ross
description: On his twelfth birthday, Al Chaudhury gets a letter from his dead father, telling him to activate the time machine in the bunker of their old house in order to go back in time and stop the accident that eventually takes his father's life.
title: Time traveling with a hamster

author: Felin, M. Sindy
description: Karina immigrated from Haiti to the United States with her mother, stepfather, and sisters. When her father is arrested on charges of child abuse, Karina is hopeful that she can finally focus on improving her grades. Meanwhile, Karina makes a friend at the community center where her stepfather has been assigned to parenting classes.
title: Touching snow

author: Senker, Cath
description: Examines the plants, animals, people, and weather of tropical climates. Also discusses how climate change is threatening this environment. Includes fact boxes, sidebars, color photographs, a glossary, and further resources.
title: Tropical climates

author: Pearsall, Shelley
description: Samuel, an eleven-year-old Kentucky slave, and Harrison, the elderly slave who helped raise him, attempt to escape to Canada via the Underground Railroad.
title: Trouble don't last

author: Burg, Ann E.
description: After Grace gets called from the slave cabins to work in the Big House, she sees how truly heartless and hateful Master and Missus are, and for the first time, she can't hold in her pain and anger about the way she lives. Fleeing for their own safety, Grace's family find themselves deep in the wilderness in a hidden community called the Great Dismal Swamp, unsure if they'll ever reach freedom.
title: Unbound

author: Staples, Suzanne Fisher
description: During the 2001 Afghan War, the lives of Najmal, a young refugee from Kunduz, Afghanistan, and Nusrat, an American-Muslim teacher who is awaiting her husband's return from Mazar-i-Sharif, intersect at a school in Peshawar, Pakistan.
title: Under the persimmon tree

author: Danticat, Edwidge
description: Identical twin teenagers Giselle and Isabelle Boyer have always been inseparable, and expected to stay that way even though their Haitian American parents are separating--but when when the entire family is caught in a car crash, everyone's world is shattered forever.
title: Untwine

author: Hearst, Michael
description: Presents a humorous, alphabetically-arranged introduction to a variety of unusual creatures, from the axolotl to the yeti crab. Includes information about their physical traits, behavior, and habitat; maps and illustrations, and fact boxes.
title: Unusual creatures

author: McCowan, Patricia
description: Ellie loves musical theater and is used to getting leading roles, but after she moves to the big city, she has to share a part with a talented girl who seems determined to outshine her.
title: Upstaged

author: Marsico, Katie
description: Describes different types of credit and offers practical tips for using loans and credit cards. Includes real life math challenges, color photographs, a glossary, and further resources.
title: Using credit wisely

author: Horvath, Polly
description: When his parents go to Africa to work as missionaries, twelve-year-old Henry's eccentric aunts, Pigg and Mag, take him on a cross-country car trip, allowing him to gain insight into his family and himself.
title: The vacation

author: Gallagher, Diana G.
description: When Claudia's friend Peter runs for class president, Claudia agrees to be his campaign manager and is upset when Peter's opponents begin playing dirty.
title: Vote!

author: Schmidt, Gary D.
description: During the 1967 school year, on Wednesday afternoons when all his classmates go to either Catechism or Hebrew school, seventh-grader Holling Hoodhood stays in Mrs. Baker's classroom where they read the plays of William Shakespeare and Holling learns much of value about the world he lives in.
title: The Wednesday wars

author: Kadohata, Cynthia
description: After twelve-year-old Sumiko and her Japanese-American family are relocated from their flower farm in southern California to an internment camp on a Mojave Indian reservation in Arizona, she helps her family and neighbors, becomes friends with a local Indian boy, and tries to hold on to her dream of owning a flower shop.
title: Weedflower

author: Schmidt, Gary D.
description: In a desperate attempt for survival, a peaceful civilization on a faraway planet besieged by a dark lord sends its most precious gift across the cosmos into the lunchbox of Tommy Pepper, sixth grader, of Plymouth, Massachusetts.
title: What came from the stars

author: Sones, Sonya
description: Sophie describes her relationships with a series of boys as she searches for Mr. Right.
title: What my mother doesn't know

author: Golden, Christopher
description: Seventeen-year-old Jack London journeys to the Yukon Territory in search of gold but what he finds is kidnapping, slavery, and supernatural beasts that want to use Jack's personal demons against him.
title: The wild

author: Engle, Margarita
description: In early twentieth-century Cuba, bandits terrorize the countryside as a young farm girl struggles with dyslexia. Based on the life of the author's grandmother.
title: The wild book

author: Meloy, Colin
description: When her baby brother is kidnapped by crows, seventh-grader Prue McKeel ventures into the forbidden Impassable Wilderness--a dangerous and magical forest in the middle of Portland, Oregon--and soon finds herself involved in a war among the various inhabitants.
title: Wildwood

author: Murdock, Catherine Gilbert
description: Princess Wisdom, who yearns for a life of adventure beyond the kingdom of Montagne, Tips, a soldier keeping his true life secret from his family, Fortitude, an orphaned maid who longs for Tips, and Magic the cat form an uneasy alliance as they try to save the kingdom from certain destruction. Told through diaries, memoirs, encyclopedia entries, letters, biographies, and a stage play.
title: Wisdom's Kiss

author: Patterson, James
description: After Wisty and Whit Allgood, a sister and brother were torn from their beds in the middle of the night and slammed into prison, they were accused of being a witch and a wizard. Others may try to help them but Wisty and Whit soon discover they must set themselves free.
title: Witch & wizard

author: Patchin, Justin W.
description: Presents advice on practicing kindness on the Internet and offers strategies for combating and preventing cyberbullying.
title: Words wound

author: Peppas, Lynn
description: Examines the history of workers' rights and how today's modern labor laws came about.
title: Workers' rights

author: Anderson, Jennifer Joline
description: Offers students practical advice and techniques for writing fictional stories. Discusses choosing a story idea, developing characters and settings, making a writing map, drafting a piece, and revising the story. Includes quotes from writers, color photographs, a glossary, and further resources.
title: Writing fantastic fiction

author: Levine, Gail Carson
description: Prize-winning children's author Gail Carson Levine provides advice on writing. Discusses getting ideas, writing strong beginnings and endings, developing characters, and writing dialogue. Offers writing exercises to spark the imagination.
title: Writing magic

author: Kitchings, Taylor
description: In 1964 Mississippi,twelve-year-old Trip Westbrook has a black maid, Willie Jane, who is like a second mother to him. When he invites her son, Dee, to play football with him in the front yard, he sets off a chain of events in his town that challenge the residents to come to terms with the civil rights movement.
title: Yard war

author: Matson, Stacey
description: When Arthur Bean decides to win the yearly story-writing contest at his school, he gets into trouble with his English teacher, cool girl Kennedy, his nemesis Robbie Zack, and the school newspaper adviser as seen through a series of letters, emails, progress reports, and doodles.
title: A year in the life of a complete and total genius

author: Levy, Debbie
description: Based on Jutta Salzberg's autograph book that contained entries written by friends and family, it chronicles 1938, the last year Jutta and her Jewish family lived in Nazi Germany before their subsequent escape to Paris and, eventually, the United States. Includes black-and-white photos and provides an afterward depicting the fate of the people in Jutta's book.
title: The year of goodbyes

author: Marrin, Albert
description: A pictorial directory on great dust storms during the depression accompanied by substantial commentary which explains the harsh struggles of the people who migrated across the Great Plains. Also contains information on President Hoover, Native American tribes, dust pneumonia, and the Civilian Conservation Corp as well as farming and the ecosystem.
title: Years of dust

author: Thomas, Garen Eileen
description: A biography of president Barack Obama. Describes his multicultural heritage, his childhood in Hawaii and Indonesia, his education at Columbia and Harvard, his work as a community organizer, his election to the Senate, and his run for president. Includes details of the final moments of the 2008 campaign and his historic presidential win.
title: Yes we can

author: Ada, Alma Flor
description: A collection of poems representing thirteen young Latinos of diverse backgrounds and starting with "My name is..." Includes nonfictional interludes discussing issues pertinent to today's Latinos, and black-and-white illustrations.
title: Yes! we are Latinos

author: Arbuthnott, Gill
description: Provides an introduction to electricity and magnetism, discussing atoms, circuits, compasses, fossil fuels, and transistors. Includes activities, a timeline, color photographs, a glossary, and further resources.
title: Your guide to electricity and magnetism

author: Arbuthnott, Gill
description: Presents a graphic novel adaptation of the movie "Zootopia," along with additional stories with new adventures featuring Nick and Judy.
title: Zootopi

author: Sylvester, Kevin
description: Fourteen-year-old chef and budding detective Neil Flambâe helps the police in their investigation of the murders of some of the best chefs in town, a puzzle that seems to have something to do with a mysterious smell and Marco Polo.
title: Neil Flambâe and the Marco Polo murders

author: Segel, Jason
description: After moving into his step-mom's purple mansion--which surely must be haunted--Charlie Laird begins having sleep issues. Nightmares haunt all his sleep, until eventually they come out of his dreams to haunt real life. Only a kid like Charlie could deal with such problems.
title: Nightmares!

author: Magaziner, Lauren
description: Eleven-year-old Rupert cannot resist applying to an advertisement to be a witch's apprentice, but quickly finds himself over his head with the young witch-in-training who desperately needs his help.
title: The only thing worse than witches

author: West, Tracey
description: While Charlie Brown tries to find ways to impress the new kid in town, a smart red-haired girl, Snoopy, as the Flying Ace, tries to save a poodle named Fifi in the skies over Paris during World War I.
title: The Peanuts movie

author: Shurtliff, Liesl
description: Relates the tale of Rumpelstiltskin's childhood and youth, explaining why his name is so important, how he is able to spin straw into gold, and why a first-born child is his reward for helping the miller's daughter-turned-queen.
title: Rump

author: Walsh, Caroline E.
description: Carlos, a young boy, is fascinated by the large number of home runs achieved by Chicago Cubs baseball player, Sammy Sosa. While waiting outside the stadium one day he is able to retrieve one of Sosa's longest hits. Later he meets Sosa at a game.
title: Sosa's homers

author: Weyn, Suzanne
description: Samantha, her sister Jessica, and her parents visit the Haunted Museum in England to view an exhibit on the Titanic, and then board the ship "Titanic 2," a replica of the original, for a cruise. But when mysterious things keep happening, leading them to believe the ship is haunted, Samantha decides to get to the bottom of the ghostly occurrences.
title: The Titanic locket

author: Bruchac, Joseph
description: After falling in love with an Abenaki Indian woman, a white great horned owl named Wabi transforms into a human being and has several trials and adventures while learning to adapt to his new life.
title: Wabi

author: Connor, Leslie
description: Twelve-year-old Addie tries to cope with her mother's erratic behavior and being separated from her beloved stepfather and half-sisters when she and her mother go to live in a small trailer by the railroad tracks on the outskirts of Schenectady, New York.
title: Waiting for normal

author: Freedman, Russell
description: Drawn from eyewitness accounts and archival photographs to paint a picture of World War I.
title: The war to end all wars

author: Abdul-Jabbar, Kareem
description: While twins Ella and Herbie help the handyman Mr. Midal work on their new home, he tells them about such inventors as Granville Woods, Dr. Henry T. Sampson, and James West, giving them a new view of their heritage as African-Americans.
title: What color is my world?

author: Resau, Laura
description: Fourteen-year-old Clara Luna spends the summer with her grandparents in the tiny, remote village of Yucuyoo, Mexico, learning about her grandmother's life as a healer, her father's decision to leave home for the United States, and her own place in the world.
title: What the moon saw

author: Davies, Jacqueline
description: During World War II, a twelve-year-old girl is uprooted from her quiet, East coast life and moved to a secluded army post in the New Mexico desert where her father and other scientists are working on a top secret project.
title: Where the ground meets the sky

author: Richards, Jon
description: Presents a series of maps and infographics offering information on art, sports, and cultural topics around the world, such as the average daily calorie consumption, how many athletes are in the United States, and how many hours people use social media in a typical day.
title: Art, culture, and sports

author: Baskin, Nora Raleigh
description: Hank, Nathan, Jeremy, and Anabel deal with the realities of middle school basketball, including family pressure, a series of coaches with very different personalities and agendas, and what it means to be a team--and a friend.
title: Basketball (or something like it)

author: Feinstein, John
description: Teen reporters, Stevie and Susan, are covering the baseball world series and during an interview with a new pitcher, realize that he is not who he appears to be. They investigate the man's past and find incriminating evidence. Now the two reporters must decide whether or not to release the story.
title: Change-up

author: Myers, Walter Dean
description: Thirteen-year-old Darnell's twin sister and the other members of the Corner Crew have doubts about his work on the school newspaper, but the article he writes about a homeless man changes his attitude about school.
title: Darnell Rock reporting

author: Whelan, Gloria
description: Left an orphan after the influenza epidemic in British East Africa in 1918, thirteen-year-old Rachel is tricked into assuming a deceased neighbor's identity to travel to England, where her only dream is to return to Africa and rebuild her parents' mission hospital.
title: Listening for lions

author: Loftin, Nikki
description: Little John's family is in financial difficulties and are dealing with sorrow over the death of his sister when Little John meets Gayle, a girl singing in a tree who seems to have the power of healing in her songs. Little John's heart and mind become more able to deal with the sorrow when she sings, but soon a greedy businessman finds out about Gayle and makes Little John choose between her and his family.
title: Nightingale's nest

author: Lowry, Lois
description: In 1943, during the German occupation of Denmark, ten-year-old Annemarie learns how to be brave and courageous when she helps shelter her Jewish friend from the Nazis.
title: Number the stars

author: Foxlee, Karen
description: Ophelia, a timid eleven-year-old girl, is still grieving her mother when her father takes a job in a museum located in a city where it never stops snowing. Ophelia is forced to suspend her disbelief in things non-scientific when she finds a boy locked in the museum where her father works. The boy, a prisoner of the Snow Queen, asks Ophelia to help him complete an age-old mission and save the world.
title: Ophelia and the marvelous boy

author: Storm, Tallia
description: Scottish teen Storm Hall wants nothing more than a singing career, so she is devastated when she is forced to miss a national singing competition to go on a once-in-a-lifetime family vacation to Hawaii. There Storm meets a Hawaiian band that needs a singer to fill in and she is shocked to hear herself on the radio the next day. However, the band introduces its singer on air--and it's not Storm! Now Storm is more determined than ever to have her time in the spotlight.
title: Pop girl

author: Payne, C. C.
description: For Fizzy, a good Southern girl, dealing with her parents' divorce and remarriages has been hard. Her stepmom is too perfect, and her mom's boyfriend is a neat-freak, meaning Fizzy has to learn all sorts of new rules, straining her teaching not to make a fuss or hurt other people's feelings. The "Southern Living" Cook-Off competition helps to distract Fizzy, until she realizes that she has become like the leftovers of her parents' marriage--but she will come to realize that leftovers can still be good, too.
title: The thing about leftovers

author: Myers, Walter Dean
description: In 1863, fifteen-year-old Claire, the daughter of an Irish mother and a black father, faces ugly truths and great danger when Irish immigrants, enraged by the Civil War and a federal draft, lash out against blacks and wealthy "swells" of New York City.
title: [Riot]

author: Myers, Walter Dean
description: Ten stories portray life on a block in Harlem.
title: 145th Street

author: Johnson, Robi
