description: Explores the interconnected nature of creativity and innovation, and highlights how using both can advance personal development in the twenty-first century. Includes diagrams, a timeline, text-related activities and questions, a glossary, resources for further information, and color photographs.
title: Above and beyond with creativity and innovation

author: Alexie, Sherman
description: Budding cartoonist Junior leaves his troubled school on the Spokane Indian Reservation to attend an all-white farm town school where the only other Indian is the school mascot.
title: The absolutely true diary of a part-time Indian

author: Soto, Gary
description: After unexpectedly falling in love with a "nerdy" boy, fourteen-year-old Marisa works to change her life by transferring to another school, altering some of her behavior, and losing weight.
title: Accidental love

author: Deen, Natasha
description: Luc, a teenage boy who has his sights set on a career in football, is ordered by his coach to sign up for contemporary-dance classes to build up his flexibility and leg strength. Luc grudgingly agrees, and is surprised to find he really enjoys dance--possibly enough to give up his football dream for a new one.
title: Across the floor

author: Craig, Colleen
description: After thirteen-year-old Kim travels to South Africa with her mom, a journalist, she experiences the country's brutal history and its largely tragic past. But when she listens to the Truth and Reconciliation Hearings of post-apartheid South Africa her eyes are opened.
title: Afrika

author: Woodson, Jacqueline
description: In the New York City borough of Queens in 1996, three girls bond over their shared love of Tupac Shakur's music, as together they try to make sense of the unpredictable world in which they live.
title: After Tupac and D Foster

author: Abrams, Dennis
description: Presents the life of major league baseball player Albert Pujols focusing on his childhood in the Dominican Republic, growing up in poverty, early baseball games, and moving with his family to New York City. Also provides information on his minor league performance and later his contract with the St. Louis Cardinals as well as his marriage to Deidre Corona.
title: Albert Pujols

author: De la Cruz, Melissa
description: Presents a fictionalized love story involving Alexander Hamilton and Elizabeth Schuyler, one of America's first political power couples. When Alex meets Eliza, the American Revolution is in full-swing. And these two lovebirds will not only embrace the passions they feel for one another, but also for their country.
title: Alex & Eliza

author: Yang, Gene
description: A graphic novel which examines issues of self-image, cultural identity, transformation, and self acceptance as Jin Wang moves with his family from Chinatown to an upper class suburb in San Francisco.
title: American born Chinese

author: Mahoney, Emily Jankowski
description: Presents photos, illustrations, and information about technology in the Aztec age. Discusses topics such as terrace farming, education, the Aztec calendar, and medicine. Includes a glossary, index, and resources for further information.
title: Ancient Aztec technology

author: Culp, Jennifer
description: Describes the many technologies and inventions of ancient China including silk, hot tea, crossbows, gunpowder, paper, folding umbrellas, an early compass, and the mechanical clock. Includes color photographs and illustrations, a glossary, and further resources.
title: Ancient Chinese technology

author: Myers, Walter Dean
description: Jesse pours his heart and soul into his sketchbook to make sense of life in his troubled Harlem neighborhood and the loss of a close friend.
title: Autobiography of my dead brother

author: Aretha, David
description: Briefly outlines the lives and musical careers of African-American rock and soul musicians. Describes their modern legacies and includes photographs, a glossary, and further reading sources.
title: Awesome African-American rock and soul musicians

author: Alvarez, Julia
description: In the early 1960s in the Dominican Republic, twelve-year-old Anita learns that her family is involved in the underground movement to end the bloody rule of the dictator, General Trujillo.
title: Before we were free

author: Woodson, Jacqueline
description: After fifteen-year-old Jeremiah is mistakenly shot by police, the people who love him struggle to cope with their loss as they recall his life and death, unaware that 'Miah is watching over them.
title: Behind you

author: Moore, Stephanie Perry
description: Ansli Sharp struggles to determine where she fits in with her prosperous family, and tries to help her boyfriend, who has recently become homeless.
title: Better than picture perfect

author: Brouwer, Sigmund
description: Elle, a young country music singer and songwriter, struggles to maintain her authenticity and navigate the tricky world of the music industry.
title: Billboard express

author: Okorafor, Nnedi
description: When Binti is invited to attend Oomza University, she knows attending the finest higher learning facility in the galaxy will mean leaving behind her family and everyone who respects or understands her customs. And entering this world of higher education will mean putting herself into a war she did not create - one that could prove to be deadly. But her thirst for knowledge will lead her forward, and she can only hope to survive.
title: Binti

author: Wilson, Diane L
description: Twelve-year-old Colton, son of a black mother and a white father, takes a job with the Pony Express in 1860 after his father abandons the family on their California-bound wagon train, and risks his life to deliver an important letter that may affect the growing conflict between the North and South.
title: Black storm comin'

author: Dickinson, Peter
description: A female member of a prehistoric tribe helps to advance the lot of her people, and the daughter of a paleontologist is with her father when important fossil remains are discovered.
title: A bone from a dry sea

author: Karr, Kathleen
description: In 1887, as assistant to Henry Morton Stanley, renowned explorer of the African continent, sixteen-year-old Tom Ormsby makes a perilous trek to help rescue the kidnapped Emin Pasha, learning much about leadership, African people, and himself along the way.
title: Born for adventure

author: Reynolds, Jason
description: Soon after his mother's death, Matt takes a job at a funeral home in his tough Brooklyn neighborhood and, while attending and assisting with funerals, begins to accept her death and his responsibilities as a man.
title: Boy in the black suit

author: Williams, Lori Aurelia
description: China Cup Cameron, a fourteen-year-old single mother with only her paralyzed Uncle Simon for support, takes on tremendous personal debt in hopes of a beautiful funeral after her daughter dies.
title: Broken China

author: Combres, âElisabeth
description: A young Tutsi girl whose mother has been murdered is given refuge by an old woman. Though the girl is haunted by nightmares long after the war, she begins to heal through the support of an old man and a friendship with another orphan.
title: Broken memory

author: Grimes, Nikki
description: While studying the Harlem Renaissance, students at a Bronx high school read aloud poems they've written, revealing their innermost thoughts and fears to their formerly clueless classmates.
title: Bronx masquerade

author: Bair, Sheila
description: Presents the argument that a broken financial system and the greed of Wall Street big wigs are to blame for the 2008 financial crisis. Describes the decisions bank CEOs and heads of government regulatory committees made that contributed to the financial collapse.
title: The bullies of Wall St

author: McCoy, Mary
description: Twenty-five girls find themselves on an adventure after accepting the invitation to attend Camp So-and-So in the Starveling Mountains.
title: Camp So-and-So

author: Rud, Jeff
description: Jake Burnett must choose between advancing his basketball career and doing the right thing when he uncovers the truth about prestigious Centerville Prep.
title: Centerville

author: Jimenez, Francisco
description: Presents several intertwined stories of a family of Mexican American farm workers as they move from camp to camp, adding members to their family along the way.
title: The circuit

author: Joseph, Lynn
description: When life gets difficult for Ana Rosa, a twelve-year-old would-be writer living in a small village in the Dominican Republic, she can depend on her older brother to make her feel better--until the life-changing events on her thirteenth birthday.
title: The color of my words

author: Amateau, Gigi
description: Imagines the childhood and youth of "Prosser's Gabriel," a courageous and intelligent blacksmith in post-Revolutionary Richmond, Virginia, who roused thousands of African-American slaves like himself to rebel.
title: Come August, come freedom

author: Featherstone, Mark
description: Introduces what is involved in becoming a computer game designer.
title: Computer games designer

author: Carlson, Lori M.
description: Features poems in their original Spanish language and in translation that depict the pain and triumph of growing up as a Latino American. Focuses on themes of adolescence, family, parties, memories, food, learning two cultures, and speaking two languages. Includes work from poets Sandra Cisneros, Martâin Espada, Gary Soto, and Ed Vega.
title: Cool salsa

author: Draper, Sharon M
description: Two fifteen-year-old girls--one a slave and the other an indentured servant--escape their Carolina plantation and try to make their way to Fort Moses, Florida, a Spanish colony that gives sanctuary to slaves.
title: Copper sun

author: Meyer, Marissa
description: In this futuristic take on the fairy tale "Rapunzel," Cinder and her friends are fugitives trying to overthrow Queen Levana. They turn to Cress, a girl imprisoned on a satellite, for help. However, Cress, an excellent hacker, has been ordered by Levana to track down Cinder. As the clock ticks down to Queen Levana's marriage to Emperor Kai, Cinder, Scarlet, and Cress must join together to stop the wedding and save the world.
title: Cress

author: Rud, Jeff
description: Basketball player Kyle Evans decides to try out for a part in the school play at the encouragement of an old friend. Then his life takes a turn when an act of vandalism prompts him to take a stand.
title: Crossover

author: Divine, L.
description: Jayd discovers a love for drag racing and new sophomore Emilio.
title: Culture clash

author: Nichols, Susan
description: Presents photos, illustrations, and information about culture in ancient India. Discusses the economy and religion of the Indus Valley, rise and fall of dynasties, important figures, Buddhism, literature and art, and scientific and artistic achievements. Includes a glossary, index, and resources for further information.
title: The culture of ancient India

author: Patterson, James
description: A young boy named Daniel inherits a coveted list of Alien Outlaws and assumes his father's role as Alien Hunter. With his supreme abilities, Daniel tackles the next alien on the list--an insect that wants to take over Earth. But this outlaw is so powerful, Daniel needs the help of the alien's own son to defeat him.
title: Daniel X, alien hunter

author: Patterson, James
description: Daniel, an alien hunter, faces dastardly Number Two who has slowly been amassing an underground army of aliens to help him enslave Earth's population in preparation for the arrival of Number One, the most powerful alien in the universe and Daniel's arch-nemesis.
title: Daniel

author: Patterson, James
description: A vengeful villain lives in the town of Holliswood and threatens to destroy it along with all of its citizens. Only Daniel X can deal with this made-for-TV tyrant who assembles an all-star team of his own, but even Daniel is not prepared for the enormity of this man's evil plan.
title: Daniel

author: Stefoff, Rebecca
description: Presents stories from America's multicultural past which have been historically overlooked--from the first contact of Europeans with Native Americans to contemporary stories of young Mexican students who may or may not be illegal immigrants. Argues that America has always been multicultural even though that heritage has often been kept in the dark.
title: A different mirror for young people

author: Duncan, Lois
description: Seventeen-year-old April finds her comfortable life changed forever when death threats to her father, a witness in a federal case, force her family to go into hiding under assumed names and flee the pursuit of a hired killer.
title: Don't look behind you

author: Myers, Walter Dean
description: During a summer in Harlem, David relies on his mother and a close friend and on an old man he meets in the park to help him come to terms with his father's outbursts and unstable behavior.
title: The dream bearer

author: Hulick, Kathryn
description: Explores the way video game designers and companies make a profit on different kinds of games, from console and computer games to hand-held and app games.
title: The economics of a video game

author: Nazario, Sonia
description: Presents the true story of sixteen-year-old Enrique, who travels from Honduras to the United States, often receiving help from kind strangers, to find his mother, an illegal immigrant who left Enrique when he was a young boy to find work in America and better their lives.
title: Enrique's journey

author: LaCour, Nina
description: While working as a film production designer in Los Angeles, Emi finds a mysterious letter from a silver screen legend which leads Emi to Ava who is about to expand Emi's understanding of family, acceptance, and true romance.
title: Everything leads to you

author: Meyer, Marissa
description: Before she ever crossed paths with Cinder, Cress, and Scarlet, Queen Levana was not a ruthless queen who used her beauty to get power. Hers was a story of love and loss as well, and her outcome was different from theirs.
title: Fairest

author: McNeal, Tom
description: Jeremy Johnson Johnson is a shy boy who likes to study; he will never, ever admit in public that he hears the voice of one particular ghost--Jacob Grimm. When the wild girl Ginger Boultinghouse enters Jeremy's life, she plans on including him in her next wild adventure--breaking and entering. Jacob Grimm decides to help the two kids find what they are really seeking: a place far, far away from their troubles.
title: Far far away

author: Sharpe, Tess
description: When Sophie's best friend Mina is murdered after Sophie and Mina are attacked in the woods by a masked man, the cops partially blame Sophie, a recovering drug addict, for the circumstances. Alone in her belief that the murder had something to do with a discovery Mina was investigating for the local news, Sophie sets out to unmask the murderer on her own.
title: Far from you

author: Myers, Walter Dean
description: New to 116th Street in New York, a young boy soon makes friends and begins a year of unusual experiences.
title: Fast Sam, Cool Clyde, and Stuff

author: Weil, Ann
description: Examines disasters that occurred from fire. Features true stories about fire disasters at London Bridge, the Great Fire of London, the Morro Castle, the Great Fire of Chicago, Iroquois Theater, and Warwick.
title: Fire disasters

author: Magoon, Kekla
description: In the aftermath of Dr. King's assassination in 1968, Chicago fourteen-year-old Maxie longs to join the Black Panthers, whether or not her brother Raheem, ex-boyfriend Sam, or her friends like it, and is soon caught up in the violence of anti-war and civil rights demonstrations.
title: Fire in the streets

author: Johnson, Angela
description: Bobby's carefree teenage life changes forever when he becomes a father and must care for his adored baby daughter.
title: The first part last

author: Haydon, Elizabeth
description: Charles Magnus Ven Polypheme, also known as Ven, is chosen to direct the inspection of his family's latest shipbuilding endeavor and sets out on an incredible journey. After he is attacked by fire pirates, Ven winds up on the island of Serendair where the natives conspire for his help in finding the famed Floating Island.
title: The Floating Island

author: Smith, Sherri L.
description: During World War II, a light-skinned African American girl "passes" for white in order to join the Women Airforce Service Pilots.
title: Flygirl

author: Jones, Patrick
description: When Latrell Baker earns an internship with the NFL's LA Stars, he jumps at the opportunity to use his mathematical approach to the game to help the team win. He soon discovers the secrets and politics at the heart of the game, however, and must decide whether the internship is really worth it.
title: The franchise

author: Kurlansky, Mark
description: Presents a biography of Clarence Birdseye who invented frozen food. Describes his childhood, his development of the flash-freeze process, and his legacy today. Includes photographs.
title: Frozen in time

author: Quintero, Isabel
description: Gabi Hernandez chronicles her crushes, tensions with her Mexican American family, and the struggles she and her friends experience during her last year of high school.
title: Gabi, a girl in pieces

author: Myers, Walter Dean
description: If Harlem high school senior Drew Lawson is going to realize his dream of playing college, then professional, basketball, he will have to improve at being coached and being a team player, especially after a new white student threatens to take the scouts' attention away from him.
title: Game

author: Mooney, Carla
description: Introduces young students to the study of genetics, exploring why children look like their parents and how DNA is structured.
title: Genetics

author: Neri, Greg
description: Twelve-year-old Cole's behavior causes his mother to drive him from Detroit to Philadelphia to live with a father he has never known, but who soon has Cole involved with a group of African-American "cowboys" who rescue horses and use them to steer youths away from drugs and gangs.
title: Ghetto cowboy

author: Myers, Walter Dean
description: Follows a family's 200-year history, from the capture of an African boy in the 1750s through the lives of his descendants.
title: The Glory Field

author: Gunderson, Jessica
description: Examines the Gothic art movement from its beginnings in the twelfth century to its decline in the early 1400s. Introduces students to great artists and their works. Features full-color reproductions, sidebars, and a historical timeline.
title: Gothic art

author: Myers, Walter Dean
description: Details the life of boxer Muhammad Ali, including his rise to athletic fame, the hazards of his sport which permanently affected him, and his battle with Parkinson's disease.
title: The greatest

author: Staples, Suzanne Fisher
description: Having relented and married the rich older man to whom she was pledged, Shabanu is now the victim of his family's blood feud and the malice of his other wives.
title: Haveli

author: Johnson, Angela
description: Fourteen-year-old Marley's seemingly perfect life in the small town of Heaven is disrupted when she discovers that her father and mother are not her real parents.
title: Heaven

author: Tolkien, J. R. R
description: Bilbo Baggins, a respectable, well-to-do hobbit, lives comfortably in his hobbit-hole until the day the wandering wizard Gandalf chooses him to take part in an adventure from which he may never return.
title: The hobbit, or, There and back again

author: Divine, L
description: Even though Valentine's Day is around the corner, Jayd is having a hard time since her friends shooting. Exhausted by her friends death and the same old drama with Rah, Jayd suddenly begins ruining her client's hair and feels alienated from her friends. To make things worse, her nemesis, Misty, is plotting to ruin her. Jayd relies on her magical Mama and her gifted ancestors to protect her and bring her crew back together.
title: Holidaze

author: Myers, Walter Dean
description: A teenage basketball player from Harlem is befriended by a former professional player who, after being forced to quit because of a point shaving scandal, hopes to prevent other young athletes from repeating his mistake.
title: Hoops

author: Cisneros, Sandra
description: Esperanza is a young girl growing up in the Latino section of Chicago. She doesn't want to belong to her rundown neighborhood or the low expectations the world has for her. Esperanza finds the power within herself to become who she wants to be.
title: The house on Mango Street

author: Woodson, Jacqueline
description: When fourteen-year-old Staggerlee, the daughter of a racially mixed marriage, spends a summer with her cousin Trout, she begins to question her sexuality to Trout and catches a glimpse of her possible future self.
title: The house you pass on the way

author: Schraff, Anne E.
description: When Tyron singles out plain-looking Destini to be his girl, she is thrilled until he mocks her friends and her good grades.
title: If you really loved me

author: Restrepo, Bettina
description: Nora, a fifteen-year-old Mexican girl, faces the challenges of being an illegal immigrant in Texas when she and her mother cross the border in search of Nora's father.
title: Illegal

author: O'Dell, Scott
description: Left alone on a beautiful but isolated island off the coast of California, a young Indian girl spends eighteen years, not only merely surviving through her enormous courage and self-reliance, but also finding a measure of happiness in her solitary life.
title: Island of the Blue Dolphins

author: Teitelbaum, Michael
description: A biography of baseball player Jackie Robinson, who was the first African American in 1947 to play Major League Baseball. Describes the challenges he faced in the pre-Civil Rights era and how he helped lead the Brooklyn Dodgers to the World Series six times during his ten years with them. Also discusses his election to the Hall of Fame, his business success, and his work for civil rights.
title: Jackie Robinson

author: Torres, John Albert
description: Provides a biography of hip-hop artist Jay-Z, discussing his rise to fame, challenges and achievements, personal life, charity work, and future plans. Features color photographs, fact boxes, a discography, a list of honors and awards, and further resources.
title: Jay-Z

author: Grimes, Nikki
description: Jazmin, an African American teenager who lives with her older sister in a small Harlem apartment in the 1960s, finds strength in writing poetry and keeping a record of the events in her sometimes difficult life.
title: Jazmin's notebook

author: Soto, Gary
description: A biography of one of leaders of the United Farm Worker's Union.
title: Jessie De La Cruz

author: Moses, Shelia P
description: Fourteen-year-old Joseph tries to avoid trouble and keep in touch with his father, who is serving in Iraq, as he and his alcoholic, drug-addicted mother move from one homeless shelter to another.
title: Joseph

author: Myers, Walter Dean
description: Walter Dean Myers offers his own words on what it means to be a writer and walks readers through his writing process, giving advice for writing both fiction and non-fiction.
title: Just write

author: O'Connor, Sheila
description: In rural Minnesota in 1974, thirteen-year-old Pride Star, raised to be independent, must accept help from friends and neighbors to care for eleven-year-old Nightingale and six-year-old Baby when her grandfather is hospitalized with a brain infection.
title: Keeping safe the Stars

author: Câordova, Zoraida
description: Alex, a powerful witch, actually hates magic and tries to perform a spell on herself that will rid her of her powers but it backfires and makes her whole family vanish. Left with a boy she can't trust, the two must travel to a dark and mysterious land called Los Lagos to get her family back.
title: Labyrinth lost

author: O'Brien, Annemarie
description: In 1914 Russia, Lara is being groomed by her father to be the next kennel steward for the Count's borzoi dogs unless her mother bears a son, but her visions, although suppressed by her father, seem to suggest she has special bond with the dogs.
title: Lara's gift

author: Dickmann, Nancy
description: Explores the notion of a carbon footprint, describing what it is and why too big a carbon footprint left by individuals and countries can contribute to pollution, offering tips about conserving energy and living in such a way as to leave less of a footprint.
title: Leaving our mark

author: Talley, Robin
description: Sarah Dunbar, an honors student and one of the first black students admitted to a previously all-white high school, and Linda Hairston, a white classmate opposed to integration, are forced to reexamine their beliefs and perceptions when they experience a growing attraction to one another while working on a class project together.
title: Lies we tell ourselves

author: Pfeffer, Susan Beth
description: Through journal entries sixteen-year-old Miranda describes her family's struggle to survive after a meteor hits the moon, causing worldwide tsunamis, earthquakes, and volcanic eruptions.
title: Life as we knew it

author: Litwin, Laura Baskes
description: Provides a biography chronicling the life and achievements of African American astronomer and mathematician Benjamin Banneker. Includes illustrations, a chronology, and further resources.
title: The life of Benjamin Banneker

author: Schraff, Anne E.
description: A biography of the ex-slave who brought hundreds of other slaves to freedom in Canada through her work with the Underground Railroad.
title: The life of Harriet Tubman

author: Engle, Margarita
description: In free verse, evokes the voice of Gertrudis Gomez de Avellaneda, a book-loving writer, feminist, and abolitionist who courageously fought injustice in nineteenth-century Cuba. Includes historical notes, excerpts from her writings, biographical information, and source notes.
title: The lightning dreamer

author: Howson, Imogen
description: When Elissa's nightmarish visions and inexplicable bruises lead to the discovery of a battered twin sister on the run from government agents, Elissa enlists the help of an arrogant new graduate from the space academy.
title: Linked

author: Soto, Gary
description: The author describes his experiences growing up as a Mexican American in Fresno, California.
title: Living up the street

author: Duncan, Lois
description: Nore arrives at her stepmother's Louisiana plantation to find her new family odd and an aura of evil and mystery about the place.
title: Locked in time

author: Bodden, Valerie
description: Briefly explores the events of the first moon landing and all the steps it took NASA to put men on the moon in the first place.
title: Man walks on the moon

author: Bow, James
description: Presents information on mapping tools that can be used as predictive models. Also includes advances in technology that aid scientists and the general public alike.
title: Mapping the future

author: Lewis, John
description: Presents a graphic novel featuring the true story of Congressman John Lewis, who was a founder of the Nashville Student Movement and participated in the 1960s with the march on Washington in the civil rights movement.
title: Marc

author: Soto, Gary
description: At age thirteen, best friends Ronnie and Joey suddenly feel like chimps--long armed, big eared, and gangly--and when the coach humiliates Joey in front of a girl, he climbs up a tree and refuses to come down.
title: Mercy on these teenage chimps

author: Doak, Robin S
description: Presents a brief biography of Michelle Obama, discussing her early life up through her studying to become a lawyer, how she met her future husband Barack Obama, and how she has lived since becoming the First Lady of the United States.
title: Michelle Obama

author: Brahmachari, Sita
description: Almost-twelve Mira Levenson is challenged to keep a diary for just one month, the month of her birth, in which time she has to learn how to deal with a lot of huge changes in life--like her dying Nana painting her own casket, her best friend seeming to drift away, her own new and strange feelings for a boy in her writing class, and the search for a special gift Nana gave her that may or may not be lost forever.
title: Mira in the present tense

author: Blewett, Ashlee Brown
description: Presents a full-color magazine-type book from National Geographic on elephants and their rescue. Describes their different breeds, natural history, physical and behavioral traits, habitat, and conservation status. Includes real-life stories, maps, field reports, fact files, activities, infographics, and resources.
title: Mission: elephant rescue

author: Castaldo, Nancy F
description: Presents a full-color magazine-type book from National Geographic on polar bears and their rescue. Describes their different breeds, natural history, physical and behavioral traits, habitat, and conservation status. Includes real-life stories, maps, field reports, fact files, activities, infographics, and resources.
title: Mission: polar bear rescue

author: Wilson, G. Willow
description: Kamala Khan, the new Ms. Marvel, meets her hero, Wolverine; finds a companion in the dog Lockjaw; learns more about her past; and takes on the Inventor with the help of a group of unlikely allies.
title: Ms. Marve

author: Wilson, G. Willow
description: While fighting alongside her personal hero, Captain Marvel, Kamala finds herself trying to come to terms with the end of the Marvel Universe.
title: Ms. Marve

author: Richards, Jon
description: Kid-friendly atlas featuring infographics about global climate, biodiversity, animal populations, and natural disasters. Includes a glossary, index, and resources for further information.
title: The natural world

author: Soto, Gary
description: A humorous play in which Martin, a Chicano nerd, undergoes a transformation with the help of his friends and experiences true love. Includes a glossary of Spanish words and phrases used in the dialogue.
title: Nerdlandia

author: Nelson, Vaunda Micheaux
description: Presents a biographical novel of Harlem bookseller Lewis H. Michaux who built his bookstore with five books and one hundred dollars creating the literary center of Harlem.
title: No crystal stair

author: Moskowitz, Hannah
description: Auditioning for a New York City performing arts high school could help Etta escape from her Nebraska all-girl school, where she is not gay enough for her former friends, not sick enough for her eating disorders group, and not thin enough for ballet, but it may also mean real friendships.
title: Not otherwise specified

author: Woolf, Alex
description: Presents a hypothetical scenario in which a nuclear disaster affects the entire world sometime in 2020. Discusses the probable reactions of world governments and societies and how humanity might best adapt to and survive such a scenario.
title: Nuclear disaster

author: Hyppolite, Joanne
description: Nine-year-old Ola and her family are the first black people to move into Walcott Corners, a stuffy, suburban Massachusetts community that Ola wishes were a little bit more like the lively old Roxbury neighborhood she sorely misses.
title: Ola shakes it up

author: Schraff, Anne E.
description: Caught up in a poor neighborhood, Denique focuses on school and finding a job so her parents can earn the money to move to a better home. As focused as she is on herself and her problems, however, she fails to notice the potential for love lying right in front of her -- and the impact it may have on her entire life.
title: The one for me

author: Naidoo, Beverley
description: Smuggled out of Nigeria after their mother's murder, Sade and her younger brother are abandoned in London when their uncle fails to meet them at the airport and they are fearful of their new surroundings and of what may have happened to their journalist father back in Nigeria.
title: The other side of truth

author: Padian, Maria
description: When popular and well-to-do high school student Tom Bouchard meets refugees fleeing violent conflict in their homeland, his perspective on life begins to shift and he is propelled toward a new future he never saw coming.
title: Out of nowhere

author: St. John, Warren
description: Tells the story of how a Muslim Jordinian woman named Luma Mufleh organized a youth soccer team in Clarkston, Georgia to unify the town's refugee children who came from war-town countries such as Liberia, Sudan, Iraq, and Afghanistan.
title: Outcasts united

author: Schraff, Anne E
description: Jaris Spain has been in love with Sereeta Prince since junior high and his feelings for her are growing stronger. But when she doesn't even notice him, he has a hard time believing that she ever will.
title: Outrunning the darkness

author: Richards, Jon
description: Presents a range of maps illustrating different statistics and facts about the world's human population, from how many people are part of different religions to how many don't have access to sanitary plumbing.
title: People on earth

author: Watson, Renâee
description: Every day, Jade rides a bus out of her poor, black neighborhood and to a private school where she feels out of place. When she's assigned a mentor as a part of a school program, Jade doesn't think the adult she's paired with understands her at all, and she learns she has more to teach the other adults than she thought.
title: Piecing me together

author: Watson, Renâee
description: Presents a collection of poems about nature from different times and places, and provides guidance for exploring the meaning behind the poem and understanding the techniques poets use to create an effect.
title: Poems about the natural world

author: Senker, Cath
description: Presents photos and information about polar climates. Discusses climate zones, polar plants and animals, human populations in polar zones, oil and other resources, and effects of climate change. Includes a glossary, index, and resources for further information.
title: Polar climates

author: Cohn, Rachel
description: Yearning to escape the small Massachusetts town where her family retreated after her sister's death, Wonder Blake gets her chance when her sister's manager offers Wonder a record contract on her sixteenth birthday.
title: Pop princess

author: Sheinkin, Steve
description: Investigates the true story of the Port Chicago Navy base, which in World War II was used as a bomb-loading base for the Navy in the Pacific. Segregation was in effect, and every serviceman loading the bombs was black. When an explosion due to unsafe working conditions killed over three hundred servicemen, fifty black sailors refused to return to work until the unsafe conditions were dealt with, launching an early event in the civil rights movement.
tags: Port Chicago Mutiny Trial, San Francisco (Calif.), 1944.
title: The Port Chicago 50

author: Cain, Susan
description: Explores the introverted personality and offers introverted teenagers advice and encouragement for recognizing and using the personality strengths that come with being an introvert--such as deep thinking, listening skills, and a calm demeanor.
title: Quiet power

author: Tarbox, A. D
description: Large color photographs and informative text present the various parts of a rainforest food chain.
title: A rainforest food chain

author: Jones, Patrick
description: Seventeen years after she was born to a prison inmate, Deja agrees to raise her newest half-sister for the first six months, until their mother's next release, but despite the help of friends and relatives and a support program at school, caring for a baby proves to be a monumental task.
title: Raising Heaven

author: Resau, Laura
description: Sixteen-year-old Sophie has been frail and delicate since her premature birth, but discovers her true strength during a journey through Mexico, where the six-year-old orphan her family hopes to adopt was born, and to Guatemala, where her would-be boyfriend hopes to find his mother and plans to remain.
title: Red glass

author: Resau, Laura
description: A collection of poetry in English and Spanish that explains what it is like to be a young Latino in the United States.
title: Red hot salsa

author: Colfer, Eoin
description: In Victorian London, Albert Garrick, an assassin-for-hire, and his reluctant young apprentice, Riley, are transported via wormhole to modern London, where Riley teams up with a young FBI agent to stop Garrick from returning to his own time and using his newly acquired scientific knowledge and power to change the world forever.
title: The reluctant assassin

author: Walker, Paul Robert
description: Traces the efforts of the "Little Rock Nine" to attend a formerly all-white high school in Little Rock, Arkansas, in September of 1957. Outlines the views and motivations of everyone involved in the desegregation of Central High School and discusses how it became a pivotal event in the progression of the Civil Rights Movement. Includes black-and-white photographs.
title: Remember Little Rock

author: Schraff, Anne E
description: Going into her freshman year, Chelsea realizes that she and her friends working at the shelter needed to be rescuers just like her hero, Shadrach, who rescues animals and also teaches kids to respect one another.
title: The rescuers

author: Eulberg, Elizabeth
description: Lexi is a girl with a great personality, and she hates that label. She is well-liked, smart, and can be funny in a pinch, but she has never been considered one of "those" girls--the hotties always getting the attention of guys. Lexi thinks it is time for the girls with great personalities to strike back.
title: Revenge of the girl with the great personality

author: Taylor, Mildred D.
description: In 1941 a black youth, sadistically teased by two white boys in rural Mississippi, severely injures one of them with a tire iron and enlists Cassie's help in trying to flee the state.
title: The road to Memphis

author: Frisch, Nate
description: Examines the history and geological features of Rocky Mountain National Park, and discusses the park's ecosystem, issues, and animals. Includes an itinerary for visiting, safety tips, color photographs, a glossary, and a map of the park.
title: Rocky Mountain National Park

author: Draper, Sharon M
description: Romiette, an African-American girl, and Julio, a Hispanic boy, discover that they attend the same high school after falling in love on the Internet, but are harrassed by a gang whose members object to their interracial dating.
title: Romiette and Julio

author: Nix, Garth
description: Sabriel, daughter of the necromancer Abhorsen, must journey into the mysterious and magical Old Kingdom to rescue her father from the Land of the Dead.
title: Sabriel

author: Macy, Sue
description: A biography of Sally Ride, the first American female astronaut in space, covering her early years, her personal and professional obstacles and achievements, and her NASA career.
title: Sally Ride

author: Meyer, Marissa
description: Scarlet Benoit and Wolf, a street fighter who may have information about her missing grandmother, join forces with Cinder as they try to stay one step ahead of the vicious Lunar Queen Levana in this story inspired by Little Red Riding Hood.
title: Scarlet

author: Schraff, Anne E.
description: Desperate to find a quick source of income to help his poor grandparents, Kevin decides he will do whatever it takes to make an easy score -- even if it means breaking the law to do it. As he progresses down a dangerous path, those close to him attempt to convince him to walk away and do the right thing.
title: Second chances

author: Holczer, Tracy
description: Twelve-year-old Grace and her mother travel around like gypsies, but Grace wants a permanent home. Shortly after she gets up the courage to, unfortunately angrily, tell her mother what she really wants, Grace's mother dies. Now Grace is living with a grandmother she had never met before, but her beloved mother's influence is not yet done with her life.
title: The secret hum of a daisy

author: Older, Daniel Josâe
description: Teen Sierra Santiago and her friend, a fellow artist named Robbie, discover that someone is murdering the shadowshapers--ancestral spirits who inhabit music and art--in their Latino neighborhood in Brooklyn.
title: Shadowshaper

author: McKissack, Fredrick
description: After Jomo Rodgers figures out that he is just a so-so football player, he wonders whether a little steroid mixed in with juice might make him the great player that others said he could be.
title: Shooting star

author: Bardugo, Leigh
description: Criminal mastermind Kaz Brekker assembles a team of outcasts to break into the world's most secure prison and remove a prisoner with secrets that very powerful people want. Kaz devises a daring plan, but old grudges, mistrust, secrets, and rivalries cause the plan to go horribly awry and the team finds itself caught in the middle of a deadly plot to destroy the world.
title: Six of crows

author: Lee, Darrien
description: Sixteen-year-old Denim Mitchell goes against her parent's wishes and secretly sees Andrâe Patterson, a rising basketball star and budding artist, until one lie, one party, and one bullet change all of their lives forever.
title: Sixteen going on twenty-one

author: Paige, D. M.
description: Ever since her grandmother taught her how to sew clothes, Thea Roberts has loved to make her own clothes. In fact, her designs are turning heads--notably, billionaire Harmon Holt's. Every year it has been Holt's practice to take one student from his former high school and set him or her up with a lucrative, paid internship in one of the many companies he owns. This year he chooses Thea, whose designs soon begin appearing on fashion models. However, now that Thea is becoming rich, she worries that she will lose who she is.
title: Size 0

author: Warren, Rachel Meltzer
description: Offers young adults practical advice for becoming vegetarian. Contains daily meal ideas and recipes, information on finding food away from home, tips for getting enough vital nutrients, and helpful resources.
title: The smart girl's guide to going vegetarian

author: Sanchez, Alex
description: Thirteen-year-old Xio, a Mexican American girl, and Frederick, who has just moved to California from Wisconsin, quickly become close friends, but when Xio starts thinking of Frederick as her boyfriend, he must confront his feelings of confusion and face the fear that he might be gay.
title: So hard to say

author: Wooster, Patricia
description: Provides information on different careers in fashion, personal profiles and interviews with individuals working in each career, quizzes, suggested activities, and a list of further resources.
title: So, you want to work in fashion?

author: Jones, Traci L.
description: As she tries to escape her poor Chicago neighborhood by winning a scholarship to a prestigious boarding school, shy and studious eighth-grader Patrice discovers that she has more options in life than she previously realized.
title: Standing against the wind

author: Meyer, Marissa
description: Compiles nine short stores, five never before published, set in the Lunar Chronicles universe and featuring characters Cinder, Wolf, Princess Winter, Jacin, and others. Includes an excerpt from author Meyer's novel, "Heartless," about the Queen of Hearts from "Alice in Wonderland."
title: Stars above

author: Bowen, Carl
description: Navy SEAL Lieutenant Commander Ryan Cross and his elite Shadow Squadron have a tall order of a mission ahead of them: parachute onto a moving train and secure a group of hostages, all without letting the terrorist hijackers call in back up.
title: Steel hammer

author: Hartley, A. J
description: In a city where dramatically different races and communities live alongside one another, seventeen-year-old Anglet Sutonga makes a living repairing chimneys, towers, and spires. When Ang is supposed to meet a new apprentice, Berrit, she finds him dead, and at the same time the Beacon, a powerful historical icon, is stolen from the city. The Beacon's theft overshadows Berrit's murder, but Ang finds an accomplice in Josiah Willinghouse, a young politician, who thinks the death and theft might be connected.
title: Steeplejack

author: Fradin, Judith Bloom
description: Chronicles the experiences of Solomon Northup after he was kidnapped from New York in 1841 and sold into slavery in the South.
title: Stolen into slavery

author: Murray, Laura K.
description: Explores the story behind the rise of Lululemon Athletica brand. Highlights key players who helped shape the company over the years. Includes a glossary and color photographs.
title: The story of Lululemon Athletica

author: Nolan, Han
description: Set in 1963, fourteen-year-old Esther becomes involved with King-Roy Johnson, a black teenager accused of murder. Together, they learn to stand up for what is most important--finding a way to achieve peaceful change in the face of violence and hate. Explores the tumultuous struggle for civil rights in America as well as themes of family, friendship and loyalty.
title: A summer of Kings

author: Yoon, Nicola
description: Follows teenagers Natasha and Daniel over the course of a single day in New York City. Natasha's family, undocumented immigrants from Jamaica, faces deportation because of her father's drunk driving arrest. Daniel, under pressure from his South Korean parents, is preparing for an interview for a spot at Yale. When the two strangers meet, Daniel convinces Natasha to join him for the day, changing the course of their lives forever.
title: The sun is also a star

author: Myers, Walter Dean
description: Robin "Birdy" Perry is sent to Iraq as part of Operation Iraqi Freedom, but he soon learns that "winning" this war means little more than simply surviving.
title: Sunrise over Fallujah

author: Collard, Sneed B.
description: Examines how the drones and military technology helps protect America from various threats. Examines how these weapons are developed and how they are used in real-world situations. Includes color photographs, a timeline, and a glossary.
title: Technology forces

author: Budhos, Marina Tamar
description: Three immigrant girls from different parts of the world meet and become close friends in a small New Jersey town where their mothers have found domestic work as maids and nannies for their classmates. But their relationships are tested when one girl's mother is accused of stealing a precious heirloom.
title: Tell us we're home

author: Watson, Renâee
description: African American twins Nikki and Maya Younger agree on most things, but as they head into their senior year, they react differently to the gentrification of their Portland, Oregon, neighborhood and the new white family that moves in after their best friend and her mother are evicted.
title: This side of home

author: Lester, Julius
description: Ekundayo, a Dogon spirit brought to America from Africa, inhabits the body of a young African American slave on a Virginia plantation, where he experiences loss, sorrow, and reconciliation in the months preceding the Civil War.
title: Time's memory

author: Wilson, Diane L.
description: An Irish boy and a Chinese boy become friends, despite their mistrust and prejudices, while working on the Transcontinental Railroad in 1866.
title: Tracks

author: Keller, Bill
description: A biography of Nelson Mandela who challenged the system of apartheid in South Africa for which he was imprisoned for twenty-seven years. Describes how he emerged from prison to lead a peaceful revolution and become the leader of a new South Africa.
title: Tree shaker

author: Spilsbury, Louise
description: Investigates the fashion industry and how buying clothing influences the lives of those who make the clothes, put them in stores, and sell them. Explores the concept of Fairtrade and offers advice on limiting one's shopping for clothes.
title: The true cost of fashion

author: Moore, Stephanie Perry
description: Sloan is the youngest of Stanley Sharp's daughters and her dream is to be a reporter. She soon discovers learning the truth is harder than she imagined.
title: Truth and nothing but

author: Moore, Stephanie Perry
description: Sixteen-year-old Slade dreams of being a singing sensation but as the middle daughter of a mayoral candidate and a habitual loner she faces many challenges as she learns just how difficult surviving as an artist can be.
title: Turn up for real

author: Greve, Tom
description: Examines how the U.S. Navy works to prevent and combat threats to America and details the tools and techniques they use to complete this task. Explores the lives of members of the Navy and discusses how readers can begin working toward a position within this branch of the military. Includes color photographs, a timeline, and a glossary.
title: U.S. Navy

author: Garcia, Kami
description: Shortly after her mother is murdered, Kennedy Waters learns the deed was carried out by a spirit, and that her mother was a member of a secret society created to protect the world from a powerful demon. Now that all the members of this group have been killed, Kennedy must join others to remake the group and find a lost weapon with the power to destroy the demon for good.
title: Unbreakable

author: Stone, Oliver
description: Features a collection of little known historical facts about the dark side of American history from the late nineteenth century to the dropping of the atomic bombs on Hiroshima and Nagasaki. First book in a four volume series. Includes a timeline and photographs.
title: The untold history of the United State

author: Jeffrey, Gary
description: Uses a graphic novel format to trace the history of the Vietnam War. Also includes a map, color photographs, and a glossary.
title: The Vietnam War

author: Hutchinson, Shaun David
description: Henry's life is not great: His mom struggles to make ends meet waitressing; his dropout brother got a girl pregnant; his beloved grandmother has Alzheimer's; and Henry's boyfriend took his own life a year ago. So, when aliens give Henry the choice to press a big red button and stop the world from ending in 144 days, it really is hard to choose what to do. Henry decides to weigh the pros and cons, and determine if the world is worth saving.
title: We are the ants

author: McLemore, Anna-Marie
description: Lace Paloma was born into a generation's-long family feud between the Palomas and Corbeaus, families of traveling performers that compete against one another in traveling shows. She has been taught that the Corbeaus are "magia negra," black magic, and that if she even touches one it might mean her death. All that changes, of course, when disaster strikes their small town and Cluck Corbeau saves Lace's life, at the cost of his own family's trust.
title: The weight of feathers

author: Hyde, Natalie
description: Examines what it means to be an entrepreneur and how entrepreneurs take risks to start and run a new business and making it successful.
title: What is entrepreneurship?

author: Myers, Walter Dean
description: Fifteen interrelated stories explore different aspects of love, such as a dying father's determination to help start a family business--a beauty salon--and the relationship of two teens who plan to remain celibate until they marry.
title: What they found

author: Wright, Bil
description: Adopted by white parents and sent to an exclusive Connecticut girls' school where she is the only black student, fourteen-year-old Lahni Schuler feels like an outcast, particularly when her parents separate, but after attending a local church where she hears gospel music for the first time, she finds her voice.
title: When the black girl sings

author: Saeed, Aisha
description: Growing up in Florida, Naila has always known her Pakistani parents would arrange her marriage, but then she falls in love with Saif. Her angry parents take her back to Pakistan to visit relatives and explore her roots. While there, Naila's parents find her a husband and make arrangements for her to marry him. Everything Naila has is taken away from her and she finds herself trapped in a foreign country against her will. Naila can only hope Saif will find her before it's too late.
title: Written in the stars

author: Medina, Meg
description: Amidst searching for the father she has never met, keeping her grades up, and working a part-time job, Piddy Sanchez is faced with the harassment of Yaqui Delgado and her gang. Although Piddy is mostly able to avoid Yaqui and her gang, when the harassment escalates and her personal life begins to suffer, she must reexamine her priorities in order to prevent these bullies from determining the type of person she will be.
title: Yaqui Delgado wants to kick your ass

author: Flake, Sharon
description: Contains a collection of short stories and poems depicting life of urban male teenagers.
title: You don't even know me

author: Cooke, Ti
description: Explores a brief history of Islam from the fifth to the fifteenth centuries, as well as achievements of prominent Muslim leaders and thinkers. Discusses various aspects of Islamic culture including history, learning, medicine, trade, and art. Features art panels, print and digital resources, a glossary of terms and a graphic timeline.
title: Your guide to the Islamic golden age

author: O'Brien, Daniel
description: Presents a collection of facts about U.S. presidents ranging from George Washington to Ronald Reagan that allow the reader to draft a dream team of presidents to handle any imaginary crisis the country might face.
title: Your presidential fantasy dream team

author: Bridgman, Roger Francis
description: Explores 1,000 different inventions and discoveries from three million years ago to the present, arranged chronologically. Includes information on the inventors (when known) and the ways that the inventions and discoveries affected humanity, and covers topics such as mathematics, science, space, technology, language, transportation, and medicine.
title: 1000 inventions & discoveries

author: Asher, Jay
description: When high school student Clay Jenkins receives a box in the mail containing thirteen cassette tapes recorded by his classmate Hannah, who committed suicide, he spends a bewildering and heartbreaking night crisscrossing their town, listening to Hannah's voice recounting the events leading up to her death.
title: 13 reasons why

author: Mosley, Walter
description: Number 47, a fourteen-year-old slave boy growing up under the watchful eye of a brutal master in 1832, meets the mysterious Tall John, who introduces him to a magical science and also teaches him the meaning of freedom.

author: Lecesne, James
description: In the beach town of Neptune, New Jersey, Phoebe's life is changed irrevocably when her gay cousin moves into her house and soon goes missing.
title: Absolute brightness

author: Soto, Gary
description: A senior at East Fresno High School lives on as a ghost after his brutal murder in the restroom of a club where he had gone to dance.
title: The afterlife

author: Karre, Elizabeth
description: Da'Quan has never quite broken into the popular crowd at school, but when a strange dream-character gives him the ability to channel others' thoughts, Da'Quan is surprised by what he can learn from them.
title: All you are

author: Mussari, Mark
description: Explores the evolution of American music from the 1950s through the modern day, detailing the role of music in American culture and explaining how its purpose, content, and sound have changed over the decades.
title: American life and music from Elvis Presley to Lady Gaga

author: Sturman, Jennifer
description: After Delia Truesdale's mother disappears, everyone else believes she is dead. Delia is then sent to New York to live with her two aunts before she begins to search for her mother. Suddenly Delia is confronted by a series of secrets which unravel one by one.
title: And then everything unraveled

author: Brosgol, Vera
description: Anya, embarrassed by her Russian immigrant family and self-conscious about her body, has given up on fitting in at school but falling down a well and making friends with the ghost there just may be worse.
title: Anya's ghost

author: Gordon, Sherri Mabry
description: Provides information about copyrights, presenting arguments for and against the Underground Internet. Includes a glossary, chapter notes, and a list of additional resources.
title: Are you downloading copyrighted stuff?

author: Sâaenz, Benjamin Alire
description: Fifteen-year-old Ari Mendoza is an angry loner with a brother in prison, but when he meets Dante and they become friends, Ari starts to ask questions about himself, his parents, and his family that he has never asked before.
title: Aristotle and Dante discover the secrets of the universe

author: Supplee, Suzanne
description: When she is almost sixteen years old, Rosemary decides she is sick of being overweight, mocked at school and at Heavenly Hair--her mother's beauty salon--and feeling out of control, and as she slowly loses weight, she realizes that she is able to cope with her mother's cancer, having a boyfriend for the first time, and discovering that other people's lives are not as perfect as they seem from the outside.
title: Artichoke's heart

author: Jones, Patrick
description: When Jayson, an African American student, transfers from an inner-city basketball team to the suburbs, racial tension amongst the players and the coach erupts. Jayson gets into a fight and the coach kicks him off the team. Now Cody and his girlfriend Lucy find themselves at the center of a controversy where they must take a stand despite the consequences.
title: At the center

author: Freedman, Russell
description: A biography of Babe Didrikson, who broke records in golf, track and field, and other sports, at a time when there were few opportunities for female athletes.
title: Babe Didrikson Zaharias

author: Myers, Walter Dean
description: A memoir of the author's childhood in Harlem.
title: Bad boy

author: Moses, Shelia P
description: In twentieth-century Occoneechee Neck, North Carolina--an area still affected by its history of slavery--twelve-year-old Leon Curry reflects about whether he wants to give up sinning to be baptized alongside his twin brother.
title: The baptism

author: Krensky, Stephen
description: Chronicles the life of President Barack Obama from his birth in Hawaii through his education in the U.S. and his graduation from Harvard University in 1991. Depicts his career as a civil rights lawyer, an Illinois state senator, and his election as the first African-American president of the United States. Includes an index, photos of his parents and his youth, and presents a timeline of significant events in his life.
title: Barack Obama

author: Chaltas, Thalia
description: A novel in verse that tells the story of a girl who witnesses her father abuse her brother and sister but feels powerless to stop it. Then she gains confidence from playing volleyball at school and tries making changes at home.
title: Because I am furniture

author: Woodson, Jacqueline
description: When Margaret's best friend Maizon returns from boarding school and joins her in the eighth grade, they try to resume their friendship while dealing with personal problems and watching their Brooklyn neighborhood undergo changes.
title: Between Madison and Palmetto

author: Frisch, Nate
description: Examines the history and geological features of Big Bend National Park in Texas, and discusses the park's ecosystem, issues, and animals. Includes an itinerary for visiting, safety tips, color photographs, a glossary, and a map of the park.
title: Big Bend National Park

author: Smith, Jessie Carney
description: Describes the historical accomplishments of over 4,000 African Americans who triumphed over adversity and succeeded in art, entertainment, sports, business, government, education, religion, and more.
title: Black firsts

author: Bodden, Valerie
description: Examines the events that led up to the atomic bombing of Japan and explores the bombs' effects on both cities in Japan, both in 1945 and today. Includes black-and-white and full-color photographs.
title: The bombing of Hiroshima and Nagasaki

author: Desai Hidier, Tanuja
description: Seventeen-year-old Dimple, whose family is from India, discovers that she is not Indian enough for the Indians and not American enough for the Americans, as she sees her hypnotically beautiful, manipulative best friend taking possession of both her heritage and the boy she likes.
title: Born confused

author: Quick, Matthew
description: Finley, an unnaturally quiet boy who is the only white player on his high school's varsity basketball team, lives in a dismal Pennsylvania town that is ruled by the Irish mob, and when his coach asks him to mentor a troubled African American student who has transferred there from an elite private school in California, he finds that they have a lot in common in spite of their apparent differences.
title: Boy21

author: Soto, Gary
description: When nineteen-year-old Eddie drops out of college, he struggles to find a place for himself as a Mexican American living in a violence-infested neighborhood of Fresno, California.
title: Buried onions

author: Bradley, John Ed
description: Growing up in Louisiana in the late 1960s, where segregation and prejudice still thrive, two high school football players, one white, one black, become friends, but some changes are too difficult to accept.
title: Call me by my name

author: Dakers, Diane
description: Explores what carbon is, its role in life on Earth, and the carbon cycle, in which carbon is cycled through the oceans, atmosphere, ecosystems, and geosphere. Also discusses how human activities can disrupt the carbon cycle. Includes an activity, a glossary, color photographs, and a list of additional resources.
title: The carbon cycle

author: Harrington, Janice
description: Keet has always been knows as talkative--until she and her family move from Alabama to Illinois, where Keet feels entirely alone, made fun of for her southern accent. But when Keet's grandfather tells her about her "storyfish," the voice that lives inside her, Keet becomes determined to make a place for herself. Written in verse.
title: Catching a storyfish

author: Graham, Amy
description: Presents brief biographies of a variety of celebrity African-American novelists and poets, highlighting their work and contributions to American society, such as Toni Morrison and Harriet Wilson.
title: Celebrated African-American novelists

author: Karre, Elizabeth
description: Determined to get a girlfriend, nerdy Rashawn asks the mysterious character who appears in his dreams for the power of "attraction detection." However, the power may not help Rashawn in the way he thinks it will.
title: Certain signals

author: Meyer, Marissa
description: As plague ravages the overcrowded Earth, observed by a ruthless lunar people, Cinder, a gifted mechanic and cyborg, becomes involved with handsome Prince Kai and must uncover secrets about her past in order to protect the world in this futuristic take on the Cinderella story.
title: Cinder

author: Corbett, Sue
description: Presents a memoir by Mariano Rivera, a thirteen-time All-Star for the New York Yankees, discussing how he came to be a professional baseball player as well as what his life is like off the field.
title: The closer

author: Divine, L.
description: Jayd struggles to prepare for the Advanced Placement exams but Rah's baby mama draws Jayd into a drama and Jayd fails her pre-test exam. Panicked, Jayd joins a new study group on campus, and becomes part of a whole new crew. Unfortunately, not everyone is happy with Jayd's newfound study habits and friends.
title: Cold as ice

author: Shange, Ntozake
description: Presents a poetic story that explores the life of Coretta Scott King and her accomplishments during the Civil Rights Movement.
title: Coretta Scott

author: Phillips, Linda Vigen
description: Fifteen-year-old Laura, a budding artist growing up in the 1960s, struggles to keep her mother's increasingly severe mental illness a secret.
title: Crazy

author: Myers, Walter Dean
description: Fifteen-year-old Crystal has difficulty trying to reconcile her personal and school life with the sexy, sophisticated persona her career as a quickly advancing high-fashion model has forced upon her.
title: Crystal

author: Sonnenblick, Jordan
description: After devoting his life to baseball, Peter Friedman is devastated when a pitching injury ruins his arm and leaves him unable to play. As he struggles with this personal turmoil, he is also forced to confront the fact that his grandfather may be experiencing the beginning stages of Alzheimer's disease.
title: Curveball

author: Patterson, James
description: As Daniel X continues to hunt for intergalactic aliens, he and his friends go to England searching for Beta, an outlaw who takes the form of fire and who killed Daniel's parents when he was two years old.
title: Daniel

author: Patterson, James
description: In Tokyo, fifteen-year-old Daniel X faces two of the most dangerous aliens on the planet, who are plotting to use video games to control children and turn them into an army of doom.
title: Daniel

author: Grimes, Nikki
description: Alternating poems compare and contrast the conflicted feelings of Ishmael, son of the Biblical patriarch Abraham, and Sam, a teenager in New York City, as they try to come to terms with being abandoned by their fathers and with the love they feel for their younger stepbrothers.
title: Dark sons

author: Frisch, Nate
description: Examines the history and geological features of Death Valley National Park, and discusses the park's ecosystem, issues, and animals. Includes an itinerary for visiting, safety tips, color photographs, a glossary, and a map of the park.
title: Death Valley National Park

author: Burlingame, Jeff
description: Presents a biography of entertainer Demi Lovato from her childhood in Texas, to her start in acting to her future plans for her career.
title: Demi!

author: Fitzpatrick, Anne
description: Explores the history of democracy as a system of government, focusing on the core principles of democracy, how it began in the modern world largely with the United States and the American Revolution, and how modern, twenty-first-century democracies are run.
title: Democracy

author: Cooney, Caroline B
description: The Finches, a Connecticut family, sponsor an African refugee family of four, all of whom have been scarred by the horrors of civil war, and who inadvertently put their benefactors in harm's way.
title: Diamonds in the shadow

author: Abdel-Fattah, Randa
description: Muslim teenager Amal Abdel-Hakim makes a decision to begin wearing the veil full time. When she does, Amal faces an endless string of teasing and bullying from other students at her preppy suburban high school in Australia.
title: Does my head look big in this?

author: Jones, Patrick
description: Puzzling over conflicting advice from family members, seventeen-year-old DeQuin Lewis continually faces trouble in his St. Paul, Minnesota, neighborhood, until a betrayal leads him to fresh start in an alternative school, one confrontation away from losing everything.
title: Doing right

author: LaMarche, Una
description: African American teen Michelle cares for her two siblings in urban Baltimore while their mother is in jail. Leah and her stepbrother Tim, both white, live in a middle-class suburb of Maryland. Michelle and Leah share the same father who abandoned them--Buck Devereaux. When the two learn Buck is dying, the whole group embarks on a road trip to California to see him one last time.
title: Don't fail me now

author: Dinan, Kurt
description: To his great surprise, uncool eleventh-grader Max Cobb is invited to join the Chaos Club, an exclusive group of students responsible for some of the biggest pranks at his high school.
title: Don't get caught

author: Myers, Walter Dean
description: Seeing no way out of his difficult life in Harlem, seventeen-year-old Jeremy "Lil J" Dance flees into a house after a drug deal goes awry and meets a weird man who shows different turning points in Lil J's life when he could have made better choices.
title: Dope sick

author: Estevis, Anne
description: Contains a collection of stories that take place in a Mexican American community in southern Texas.
title: Down Garrapata road

author: Watkins, Steve
description: In a small Florida mining town in 1966, twelve-year-old Dewey faces one worst-day-ever after another, but comes to know that the issues he faces about bullies, girls, race, and identity are part of the adult world, as well.
title: Down Sand Mountain

author: O'Connell, Caitlin
description: Color photographs and accessible text introduce readers to the work of elephant scientist Caitlin O'Connell.
title: The elephant scientist

author: Yoon, Nicola
description: Poor Maddy has one of the rarest conditions in the world, most easily summed up as being allergic to the outside. For seventeen years she has never left her house, seeing only her mother and her nurse--until one day out of a moving truck next door jumps Olly, the boy with whom she quickly falls in love and decides to literally risk her life for by going out of her house.
title: Everything, everything

author: Jackson, Donna M.
description: An overview of the work of extreme scientists featuring many full-page, color photos. Examines how scientists explore hurricanes, deep caves, and the canopies of the redwoods.
title: Extreme scientists

author: Kyi, Tanya Lloyd
description: Examines the nature of online privacy and explores just how many ways personal data is being collected on Internet users. Discusses the current laws about online privacy and questions whether they need to be more strict or better written.
title: Eyes & spies

author: Soto, Gary
description: A collection of short stories featuring adolescent Hispanic characters. In "Where Did I Go Wrong?" Mickey Cortez tries to help a new friend and then realizes he might accidentally be stealing.
title: Facts of life

author: Alvarez, Julia
description: Fifteen-year-old Milly Kaufman is an average American teenager until Pablo, a new student at her school, inspires her to search for her birth family in his native country.
title: Finding miracles

author: Soto, Gary
description: A collection of the author's poems reflecting his childhood in California's Central Valley.
title: A fire in my hands

author: Johnson, Angela
description: Bobby's carefree teenage life changes forever when he becomes a father and must care for his adored baby daughter.
title: The first part last

author: Willey, Margaret
description: Through journal entries required by their social worker at a juvenile detention center, middle-schoolers Katie, Nate, and Renata relate how they came to kidnap their tormentor, Chase, a star athlete from the town's most prominent family, who surprisingly became their willing victim.
title: Four secrets

author: Yomtov, Nelson
description: Describes how scientists mimicked the resurrection plant's ability to stay alive in order to preserve vaccines without refrigeration. Includes color photographs, a glossary, and further resources.
title: From African plants to ... vaccine preservation

author: Smith, Alexander Gordon
description: Cal, Brick, and Daisy are the only three humans that seem unaffected by "The Fury," some sort of terrible disease, or worse, that is turning everyone they ever knew--and millions of other people--into raving murderers out for their blood. They must band together to survive and find out why "The Fury" happened in the first place.
title: The fury

author: Albiges, Luke
description: Offers information and statistics about all of the hottest games, tips and tricks for gamers, and interviews from gaming's biggest personalities, including game developers and pro gamers.
title: Game on! 2017

author: Green, Jen
description: Examines the life of Gandhi and his "Quit India Movement," discussing the timing of his forming the movement--which coincided with the Japanese threat during World War II--and how it affected the movement's outcome.
title: Gandhi and the Quit India movement

author: Heilig, Heidi
description: Sixteen-year-old Nix is more than a world-traveler--she's a time-traveler who's been traversing the great seas from one location and one decade to another on her father's ship "The Temptation" her entire life. But when her father finds the map that will transport them to Honolulu to the time before Nix's birth, which ultimately led to the death of her mother, Nix's very existence is at stake. And Nix realized that helping her father reunite with the love of his life could mean the end of her own.
title: The girl from everywhere

author: Savory, Tanya
description: When Angel McAllister's secret is let out of the bag--she is a lesbian--her best friend, Sharice Bell, doesn't know how to handle it. Now LaDonna Burns is on the warpath to make Angel's life awful. Angel can either play off the rumor as false, or embrace herself for who she truly is and fight.
title: Girls like me

author: Grove, S. E.
description: In 1891, in a world transformed by 1799's Great Disruption--when all of the continents were flung into different time periods--thirteen-year-old Sophia Tims and her friend Theo go in search of Sophia's uncle, Shadrack Elli, Boston's foremost cartologer, who has been kidnapped.
title: The glass sentence

author: Carter, Noni
description: After being kidnapped from her African village, Ayanna Bahati is sent to America to live as a slave. She eventually manages to escape and flee to the North to find freedom and an education, but is unable to completely sever the bonds holding her to the past she hoped to leave behind.
title: Good fortune

author: Stone, Tanya Lee
description: Describes the origin of the Barbie doll, a twentieth-century cultural phenomenon, explores the more than 120 careers Barbie has had over the past fifty years, discusses the influence she has had on generations of young girls, and presents personal anecdotes and memories from people. Includes photographs and an index.
title: The good, the bad, and the Barbie

author: Bowen, Carl
description: Ryan Cross and his Shadow Squadron, a team of elite American soldiers from the best of the best of the U.S. military, are dispatched to the Central African Republic to rescue the Secretary of State when his chopper crashes. They will need all the stealth training they have to get in and out without getting involved with the wars between the Republic's militias.
title: Guardian angel

author: Beckman, Wendy Hart
description: Provides brief biographies for several prominent artists of the Harlem Renaissance including Langston Hughes, Duke Ellington, Bessie Smith, James Weldon Johnson, Zora Neale, and Josephine Baker.
title: Harlem Renaissance artists and writers

author: Hill, Laban Carrick
description: Explores the period of the Harlem Renaissance and introduces the lives and work of many notable figures of the era including Louis Armstrong, W.E.B. Du Bois, and Duke Ellington.
title: Harlem stomp!

author: Thomas, Angie
description: Sixteen-year-old Starr Carter is trying to balance her suburban prep school life with the poor, black neighborhood where she lives when she witnesses her childhood best friend Khalil get shot and killed by a police officer. As tensions mount and her city erupts in protests, the only person who knows the truth of that night is Starr, and what she does or doesn't say can change everyone's lives forever.
title: The hate u give

author: Soto, Gary
description: Ten stories portray some of the struggles and hopes of young Mexican Americans.
title: Help wanted

author: Soto, Gary
description: Features writing and interviews on topics of feminism from people like Mindy Kaling, Laverne Cox, and Wendy Davis.
title: Here we are

author: Farmer, Nancy
description: In a future where humans despise clones, Matt enjoys special status as the young clone of El Patron, the 142-year-old leader of a corrupt drug empire nestled between Mexico and the United States.
title: The house of the scorpion

author: Mooney, Carla
description: Presents the basic anatomy and physiology of the human body, teaching how bones, muscles, organs, and nerves work together to create physical movement. Includes a glossary, a metric conversion chart, digital and print resources, and an index.
title: Human movement

author: Richards, Jon
description: Kid-friendly atlas featuring maps and infographics about trade, oil production, agriculture, pollution, architecture, internet access, and space launches. Includes a glossary, index, and resources for online information.
title: The human-made world

author: Moore, Stephanie Perry
description: Feeling like the untalented one in a family of five sisters, Yuri, the adopted daughter of newly elected mayor Stanley Sharp pursues her love of baking and grows in self-esteem when she takes a courageous stand.
title: Icing on the cake

author: Woodson, Jacqueline
description: After meeting at their private school in New York, fifteen-year-old Jeremiah, who is black and whose parents are separated, and Ellie, who is white and whose mother has twice abandoned her, fall in love and then try to cope with people's reactions.
title: If you come softly

author: Schraff, Anne E.
description: When Jaris hires an attractive young woman for a job, his friend questions whether he hired her simply because of her looks. Although Jaris quickly disagrees, his friend's accusations cause him to question his decision, and he begins to wonder if he has become attracted to the woman -- and what the means for him and his girlfriend.
title: If you were mine

author: Horowitz, Alexandra
description: Outlines the inner workings of canine brains in order to determine how they perceive the world, each other, and humans. Examines what it might be like to be a dog and discusses how dog owners can use this knowledge to better relate to their pets.
title: Inside of a dog

author: Pink, Randi
description: Latoya Williams is one of the only black students in her Montgomery, Alabama, high school, and she feels like her only friend is her older brother Alex. Desperate one night, she prays to be changed and become "anything but black." When somehow her wish comes true, Toya is now white, blonde, and popular, and Toya must figure out if it's really what she wanted.
title: Into white

author: Myers, Walter Dean
description: In May of 1944 Josiah Wedgewood, a recruit for the US Army, sees in the "colored" regimen a black man he thinks he knows. Closer inspection shows the man to be his friend, Marcus Perry, and the two are glad to meet each other again in the fight against the Nazis. However, as the war heats up the future of these two young men is far from certain as they learn what it really means to fight.
title: Invasion

author: Carter, Nikki
description: A novel centering around high school relationships. While Gia Stokes is dealing with boy trouble, she's also facing the bitter plot of Valerie, who hasn't gotten over losing the Homecoming Queen crown.
title: It's all good

author: Cooney, Caroline B.
