description: At college in New York City, Janie Johnson, aka Jennie Spring, seems to have successfully left behind her past as "The face on the milk carton," but soon she, her families, and friends are pursued by a true-crime writer who wants their help in telling her kidnapper's tale.
title: Janie face to face

author: Burlingame, Jeff
description: Presents the life and career of Jay-Z, from his beginnings in the Brooklyn projects to his successful rap career and Rocawear clothing brand. Includes a chronology, glossary, and further resources.
title: Jay-Z

author: Soto, Gary
description: Two Mexican American brothers hope that junior college will help them escape their heritage of tedious physical labor.
title: Jesse

author: Myers, Walter Dean
description: In Five Points, New York, in the 1840s, African American teenager William Henry "Juba" Lane works hard to achieve his dream of becoming a professional dancer but his real break comes when he is invited to perform in England. Based on the life of Master Juba; includes historical note.
title: Juba!

author: Dalrymple, Lisa
description: Tate goes on a school trip to the Amazon River to help build a school and is forced to confront his fear of deep water and what swims within it.
title: Jungle jitters

author: Draper, Sharon M
description: As Kofi, Arielle, Dana, November, and Jericho face personal challenges during their last year of high school, a misunderstood student brings a gun to class and demands to be taken seriously.
title: Just another hero

author: Divine, L
description: Self-employed teenager Jayd looks deep into herself and takes destiny into her own hands when the dramas of high school and friends distract her from her business.
title: Keep it movin'

author: Kindl, Patrice
description: In order to support her family and maintain their ancient castle in Lesser Hoo, seventeen-year-old Althea bears the burden of finding a wealthy suitor who can remedy their financial problems. When rich Lord Boring comes to town, Althea tries to catch his attention but his business manager, Mr. Fredericks, has a plan of his own.
title: Keeping the castle

author: Taylor, Mildred D.
description: After the Civil War, Paul, the son of a white father and an African American mother, finds himself caught between two worlds as he pursues his dream of owning land of his own.
title: The land

author: Herrera, Juan Felipe
description: A collection of poems in Spanish and English about childhood, place, and identity.
title: Laughing out loud, I fly

author: Polak, Monique
description: Eric and his friends learn about gender equality when they attend a new high school with a strict dress code.
title: The leggings revolt

author: Woodson, Jacqueline
description: Thirteen-year-old Lena and her younger sister Dion mourn the death of their mother as they hitchhike from Ohio to Kentucky while running away from their abusive father.
title: Lena

author: Taylor, Mildred D.
description: Four black children growing up in rural Mississippi during the Depression experience racial antagonisms and hard times, but learn from their parents the pride and self-respect they need.
title: Let the circle be unbroken

author: Copeland, Misty
description: Biography of Misty Copeland, the first and so far only African American to dance solo for the American Ballet Theatre. Examines Misty's childhood living in poverty, how she and her dancing talent were discovered, and how she has made history with the Theatre today.
title: Life in motion

author: Old, Wendie C.
description: Provides a biography chronicling the life and achievements of African American jazz musician Louis Armstrong. Includes illustrations, a chronology, and further resources.
title: The life of Louis Armstrong

author: Jaramillo, Ann
description: When fifteen-year-old Miguel's time finally comes to leave his poor Mexican village, cross the border illegally, and join his parents in California, his younger sister's determination to join him soon imperils them both.
title: La lâinea

author: Soto, Gary
description: A collection of thirteen short stories about the everyday lives of Mexican American young people in California's Central Valley.
title: Local news

author: Smith, Alexander Gordon
description: When fourteen-year-old Alex is framed for murder, he becomes an inmate in the Furnace Penitentiary, where brutal inmates and sadistic guards reign, boys who disappear in the middle of the night sometimes return weirdly altered, and escape might just be possible.
title: Lockdown

author: Barraclough, Lindsey
description: When Cora and her younger sister, Mimi, are sent to stay with their great Auntie Ida in an isolated village in 1958, they discover that they are in danger from a centuries-old evil and, along with village boys Roger and Peter, strive to uncover the horrifying truth before it is too late.
title: Long Lankin

author: Farmer, Nancy
description: Fourteen-year-old Matt is a clone, and he knows it, of the man known as "El Patron," the Lord of the Land of Opium. It is the year 2137, and while the rest of the world has become "God's Ashtray," the Land of Opium--where the border of the U.S. and Mexico used to be--is thriving on the growing and using of drugs. Now that El Patron is dead, Matt is supposed to take his place--but he refuses.
title: The lord of Opium

author: Moore, Stephanie Perry
description: After witnessing abusive high school and adult relationships, seventeen-year-old Shelby must decide how to respond, especially considering that one of the abused women is the wife of the man opposing Shelby's father in the mayoral race.
title: Make something of it

author: Senker, Cath
description: Examines the life of Nelson Mandela and his legacy in freeing South Africa from a government that favored apartheid. Discusses the decisions and actions of Mandela and how he influenced others in the Truth and Reconciliation movement to take a stand against injustice.
title: Mandela and Truth and Reconciliation

author: Davis, Tanita S
description: Teenagers Octavia and Tali learn about strength, independence, and courage when they are forced to take a cross-country car trip with their grandmother, who tells them about her experience growing up black in 1940s Alabama, and serving in Europe during World War II as a member of the Women's Army Corps.
title: Mare's war

author: Maxwell, Scott
description: Explores efforts to study Mars using robotic rovers and profiles one such person who gets to drive these rovers. Details the training and responsibilities of rover drivers and includes color photographs and a glossary.
title: Mars rover driver

author: Divine, L
description: When summer arrives, Jayd stays busy with babysitting, cheer camp, a summer writing class, and her friend Mickey's jealousy over Jayd being a debutante. Jayd becomes overwhelmed with all the stress and experiences strange visions and insomnia. Mama believes it's the work of something sinister, and helps Jayd uncover the cause of all Jayd's problems.
title: The meltdown

author: Danforth, Emily M.
description: In the early 1990s, when gay teenager Cameron Post rebels against her conservative Montana ranch town and her family decides she needs to change her ways, she is sent to a gay conversion therapy center.
title: The miseducation of Cameron Post

author: Jazynka, Kitson
description: Presents a full-color magazine-type book from National Geographic on wolves and their rescue. Describes their different breeds, natural history, physical and behavioral traits, habitat, and conservation status. Includes real-life stories, maps, field reports, fact files, activities, infographics, and resources.
title: Missio

author: Flake, Sharon
description: All thirteen-year-old Raspberry can think of is making money so that she and her mother never have to worry about living on the streets again.
title: Money hungry

author: Myers, Walter Dean
description: While on trial as an accomplice to a murder, sixteen-year-old Steve Harmon records his experiences in prison and in the courtroom in the form of a film script as he tries to come to terms with the course his life has taken.
title: Monster

author: Sims, Guy A.
description: While on trial as an accomplice to a murder, sixteen-year-old Steve Harmon records his experiences in prison and in the courtroom in the form of a film script as he tries to come to terms with the course his life has taken.
title: Monster

author: Wilson, G. Willow
description: An Muslim teenager from Jersey City named Kamala Khan transforms into Ms. Marvel and begins learning how to use her new super powers.
title: Ms. Marve

author: Wilson, G. Willow
description: Ms. Marvel crashes the school Valentine's Day dance in order to thwart Loki, the Asgardian trickster god.
title: Ms. Marve

author: Wilson, G. Willow
description: A graphic novel adventure featuring Kamala Khan as Ms. Marvel who joins the Avengers, protects Jersey City from gentrification, and learns she can't create an army of automatons to help her do her job.
title: Ms. Marve

author: Weil, Sylvie
description: In eleventh century Troyes, France, Elvina, the unusual granddaughter of renowned Jewish rabbi Solomon ben Isaac, who prefers studying and writing to activities considered respectable for girls, takes a great risk by helping a young boy who has run away from a group of Christian Crusaders.
title: My guardian angel

author: MacLeod, Sue
description: When modern day teenager Jane Grey discovers the tiny and beautiful "Booke of Prayre" in her library, she wonders how it could have gotten there. Reading a passage of scripture, she is shocked when her namesake, Lady Jane Grey of Tudor England, appears before her eyes. The two Janes become friends, but teenage Jane knows her historical counterpart has only nine days to rule--then she will be imprisoned and executed for treason.
title: Namesake

author: Vanderpool, Clare
description: After his mother dies, Jack Baker is sent to a boys' boarding home in Maine where he meets an unusual boy named Early Auden. Drawn to Early for reasons he can't explain, Jack joins him on a quest to find a legendary black bear in the nearby mountains, a quest that will test their friendship and reveal new truths about one another.
title: Navigating Early

author: Gormley, Beatrice
description: Provides a biography of Nelson Mandela for young adults describing his childhood, civil rights activism, political imprisonment, Nobel Prize, and role as first black president of South Africa. Includes photographs, a glossary of terms, and a timeline.
title: Nelson Mandela

author: Dakers, Diane
description: Provides a biography of Nelson Mandela. Discusses his childhood and education, efforts to fight apartheid, time in prison, and presidency of South Africa. Includes dozens of black-and-white photographs and quotes, sidebars, a glossary, a chronology, and sources of further information.
title: Nelson Mandela

author: Draper, Sharon M
description: After losing her boyfriend, Josh, to a pledge stunt gone wrong, a pregnant November Nelson must deal with the pressures the new baby will bring. Meanwhile, Jericho, Josh's cousin, struggles to cope with the loss of his best friend and turns to a variety of activities to distract himself from the pain.
title: November blues

author: Burgan, Michael
description: Explores the life of Jesse Owens and how his gold-medal winning feats at the 1936 Olympics challenged and undid Hitler's propaganda that the Aryan race was superior to all others.
tags: African American track and field athletes
title: Olympic gold 1936

author: Watson, Cristy
description: After drama class gets cut, Randi thinks her theater dreams are over. When her friend start it up again as an after-school activity, Randi has to balance taking care of her special-needs brother with her desires to become an actress.
title: On cue

author: Carter, Nikki
description: As Sunday Tolliver juggles her first year in college, her potentially award-winning music album, and a long-distance relationship, she finds she needs some help from her friends to keep everything in line and to prevent the drama from getting out of control.
title: On the flip side

author: Burkhart, Kiersi
description: Gamer Paley Dixon is worried about being away from her online games while she is at Quartz Creek Ranch for six weeks. While there, she must find her own confidence and courage if she wants to learn how to ride a horse named Prince. But her newfound courage will be tested when ranch neighbors threaten to steal an exciting discovery that she makes near the ranch.
title: One brave summer

author: Rooney, Anne
description: Discusses how optical engineers study light and vision, as well as how they can create technology like telescopes, microscopes, television, and cameras.
title: Optical engineering and the science of light

author: Jones, Patrick
description: After spending time in a juvenile detention center for a crime related to severe anger issues, seventeen-year-old Jada Robinson is sent to a foster home and enrolled in an alternative high school, and begins to move past her old life.
title: Outburst

author: Zettel, Sarah
description: In 1716 London, an orphaned sixteen-year-old girl from a good family impersonates a lady-in-waiting only to discover that the real girl was murdered, the court harbors a nest of spies, and the handsome young artist who is helping her solve the mystery might be a spy himself.
title: Palace of spies

author: Bobrick, Benson
description: Explores the history of Olympic sport from ancient times to the modern, exploring the changes that have taken place in the Olympic Games while highlighting what has stayed the same.
title: A passion for victory

author: Elkeles, Simone
description: In a high school on the outskirts of Chicago cheerleader Brittany Ellis and gang member Alex Fuentes are assigned to be lab partners. Although they come from completely different worlds, the two teens fall in love.
title: Perfect chemistry

author: Flake, Sharon
description: Autumn, a female wrestler with a reading disability, and Adonis, a brilliant student with no legs, meet each other when Adonis becomes manager of the wrestling team. Although Adonis' distaste for Autumn hinders their early interactions, as they get to know each other they discover the value of accepting one's weaknesses and finding a way to turn them to one's advantage.
title: Pinned

author: Doctorow, Cory
description: In a dystopian near-future Britain, sixteen-year-old Trent, obsessed with making movies on his computer, joins a group of artists and activists who are trying to fight a new bill that will criminalize even more harmless internet creativity.
title: Pirate cinema

author: Doctorow, Cory
description: Presents a collection of poems about emotions along with ideas on how to understand the poems, and tips for writing poems. Includes a glossary of terms and further resources.
title: Poems about emotions

author: Carman, Patrick
description: Upon discovering she possesses the power of telekinesis, Faith Daniels is thrown into a dangerous new world where her powers may be the only thing capable of saving the world from destruction.
title: Pulse

author: Kopp, Megan
description: Explores ways and steps students can take to limit their daily carbon footprint through activities like recycling, buying locally grown food, growing their own food, and building eco-friendly homes.
title: Putting earth first

author: Steele, Philip
description: Explores issues related to race and crime in the United States and around the world. Discusses topics such as "stop and frisk," the role of the media, use of statistics, and causes of hate crimes. Includes a glossary and index.
title: Race and crime

author: Noèel, Alyson
description: After crossing the bridge into the afterlife, a place called Here where the time is always Now, Riley's existence continues in much the same way as when she was alive until she is given the job of Soul Catcher and, together with her teacher Bodhi, returns to earth for her first assignment, a ghost called the Radiant Boy who has been haunting an English castle for centuries and resisted all previous attempts to get him across the bridge.
title: Radiance

author: Vernick, Shirley Reva
description: While reluctantly agreeing to help out with his autistic older cousin during the last summer before high school, Johnny discovers a new friend in his cousin, as well as an appreciation for what really matters in a person.
title: Remember Dippy

author: Black, Jenna
description: Arranged to marry Nathaniel Hayes, heir to the company that pioneered human replication technology, Nadia Lake knows not to expect much from her betrothed, a notorious playboy. When Nathaniel turns up dead, however, his replica awakens, but with no memory of how he died. Together, Nathaniel and Nadia launch a search for answers, one that brings them closer to the buried secrets of those who run their world.
title: Replica

author: Grimes, Nikki
description: Inconsolable at being separated from her older brother, eight-year-old Paris is apprehensive about her new foster family but just as she learns to trust them, she faces a life-changing decision.
title: The road to Paris

author: Magoon, Kekla
description: In 1968 Chicago, thirteen-year-old Sam Childs is caught in a conflict between his father's nonviolent approach to the civil rights movement and his older brother's involvement with the Black Panther Party.
title: The rock and the river

author: Callery, Sean
description: Highlights a variety of rocks, minerals and gems through a collection of color photographs, essential data panels detailing geological information and uses, and varied images to aid in identifying each. Includes a glossary.
title: Rocks, minerals & gems

author: Volponi, Paul
description: While playing in a crucial basketball game on the very court where his best friend was murdered, Mackey tries to come to terms with his own part in that murder and decide whether to maintain his silence or tell J.R.'s father and the police what really happened.
title: Rucker Park setup

author: Kade, Stacey
description: Ariane Tucker is the result of a genetic experiment--cross human and alien DNA, and see what happens. The only thing is, she escaped. Now she is on the run while hiding in plain sight as a teen in a small Wisconsin town. Her adoptive father, the one who helped her escape, has given her rules to follow at all costs in order not to be discovered. One of them is don't fall in love. She has just broken that rule--and it will cost her.
title: The rules

author: Bolden, Tonya
description: Investigates the true story of the life and disappearance of Sarah Rector, who at the turn of the twentieth century was said to have been the richest "colored girl" in America, possibly even the world. Explores how Sarah became so wealthy at such a young age and how she disappeared.
title: Searching for Sarah Rector

author: Daly, Maureen
description: Seventeen-year-old Angie, living with her family in Fond du Lac, Wisconsin, finds herself in love for the first time the summer after high school graduation.
title: Seventeenth summer

author: Shuter, Jane
description: Explores the history of theater during the time of William Shakespeare including the differences between indoor and outdoor theaters, how plays were written, and the life of an actor.
title: Shakespeare and the theater

author: Jones, Patrick
description: Jackson James finds refuge in the MMA Dojo, which he sees as training for his eventual joining of the military, just like his father. Jackson also sees it as a way to help his little brother stay out of the kind of trouble he did when he was younger. However, with the new girl Tyresha Harris in the Dojo, Jackson finds that his goals are slipping, as he only wants to hang out with her more.
title: Side control

author: Flake, Sharon
description: Thirteen-year-old Maleeka, uncomfortable because her skin is extremely dark, meets a new teacher with a birthmark on her face and makes some discoveries about how to love who she is and what she looks like.
title: The skin I'm in

author: Myers, Walter Dean
description: Sixteen-year-old "Slam" Harris is counting on his noteworthy basketball talents to get him out of the inner city and give him a chance to succeed in life, but his coach sees things differently.
title: Slam!

author: Divine, L.
description: As she begins her senior year, Jayd deals with her former best friend, her boyfriend's cheating, and other high school mini-dramas. But she realizes that now more than ever she needs to keep a cool head to avoid a new enemy who's just waiting for her to let down her guard. Includes discussion questions and tips about starting a book club.
title: So, so hood

author: Angus, Sam
description: It is 1914, and the world is on the brink of its first World War. Thirteen-year-old Stanley watches as his brother leaves for combat, leaving him with an angry father for family. All Stanley has are his family's greyhound puppies, but one day Stanley wakes up to find both his father and the dogs gone. With nowhere else to go, Stanely lies his way into the army, and is given the task of training a greyhound named Bones in the army's War Dog School.
title: Soldier dog

author: Schraff, Anne E.
description: Cindy Gibson was very excited to start dating Bobby Wallace and at first their relationship seemed perfect, but soon Bobby started to become physically abusive.
title: Someone to love me

author: Higgins, Nadia
description: Presents a dual-history of the civil rights movement, one side of the book offering the African American and anti-segregationist perspective, the flip-side offering the perspective of the white supremacists in power in the South during the 1960s.
title: The split history of the civil rights movement

author: Higgins, Nadia
description: Presents a collection of poems about sports along with ideas on how to understand the poems, and tips for writing poems. Includes a glossary of terms and further resources.
title: Sports poems

author: LaFaye, A
description: Fourteen-year-old Stella, orphaned just after the Civil War, fights to keep her family's plantation and fulfill her father's desire to turn land over to the people who have worked on it for generations, but first she must find her father's hidden deed and will.
title: Stella stands alone

author: Vande Velde, Vivian
description: A girl finds herself running through the forest at the edge of a village with no memory of anything, even her own name, and later learns that she might be twelve-year-old Isabelle, believed to be stolen by a witch six years before.
title: Stolen

author: Aretha, David
description: Uses primary source photographs to discuss the desegregation of Little Rock Central High School, including the nine African American students that successfully integrated the Arkansas school and the controversy and crisis surrounding the event. Includes a timeline and further resources.
title: The story of the Little Rock nine and school desegregation in photographs

author: Divine, L.
description: The drama continues at South Bay High in the beginning of Jayd's senior year, in which a murder takes place in front of her grandparents' house; her friend Mickey's ex-boyfriend is accused of the murder; the wicked Esmeralda expands her influence over Jayd's friends; and Jayd makes a new college friend over coffee--Keenan--who may turn into more than a friend.
title: Street soldiers

author: Soto, Gary
description: The poet recreates the life he experienced as a Chicano growing up in California's Central Valley.
title: A summer life

author: McCall, Guadalupe Garcia
description: In a Mexican American retelling reminiscent of Homer's "The Odyssey," fifteen-year-old Odilia and her four younger sisters leave Texas on a journey to return a dead man to his family in Mexico. On the return trip home to their grandmother's house, they are aided by the ghost La Llorona who helps them escape a witch and her minions. The trials prepare the girls for life back home in the real world, and show them the importance of family and home.
title: Summer of the mariposas

author: Divine, L.
description: Jayd Jackson much prefers her dreams to reality--reality, where her Mama is back home but not healed, Nellie's boyfriend begins beating her, and Rah, Jayd's ex, comes back into her life in the most personal way.
title: Sweet dreams

author: Bloor, Edward
description: Twelve-year-old Paul, who lives in the shadow of his football hero brother Erik, fights for the right to play soccer despite his near blindness and slowly begins to remember the incident that damaged his eyesight.
title: Tangerine

author: Noyes, Deborah
description: Combines passages from newspaper articles and archival photographs with narrative to highlight Nellie Bly's accomplishments as a pioneer of investigative journalism. Recounts the ten days she spent as a patient at the New York City Lunatic Asylum, and the article she wrote as a result of her time there.
title: Ten days a madwoman

author: Han, Jenny
description: Lara Jean writes love letters to all the boys she has loved and then hides them in a hatbox until one day those letters are accidentally sent and Lara Jean's love life spins out of control.
title: To all the boys I've loved before

author: Felin, M. Sindy
description: Karina immigrated from Haiti to the United States with her mother, stepfather, and sisters. When her father is arrested on charges of child abuse, Karina is hopeful that she can finally focus on improving her grades. Meanwhile, Karina makes a friend at the community center where her stepfather has been assigned to parenting classes.
title: Touching snow

author: Colson, Mary
description: Investigates the true cost of toys, investigating how each level of toy manufacturing plays out in the industry, arguing that Fairtrade should be sought for all workers in the industry.
title: The true cost of toys

author: Lupica, Mike
description: Fifteen-year-old Drew "True" Robinson loves being the best point-guard prospect in high school basketball, but learns the consequences of fame through a former player, as well as through the man who expects to be his manager when True reaches the NBA.
title: True legend

author: Lee, Stacey
description: In 1849 Samantha, a Chinese girl, and Annamae, a runaway slave, disguise themselves as young men named Sammy and Andy and travel along the Oregon Trail to California in hopes of making new lives for themselves.
title: Under a painted sky

author: Marriott, Emma
description: Presents photos and information about violence against women around the world. Discusses human trafficking, missing women, gender-based violence, and combating rape culture. Includes a glossary and index.
title: Violence against women

author: Van Rose, Susanna
description: Photographs and text explain the causes and effects of volcanoes and earthquakes and examine specific occurrences throughout history.
title: Volcano & earthquake

author: Davis, Sampson
description: An account of how three friends helped each other to make it through high school, college, and medical school rather than follow their childhood friends into the criminal life. Now the three doctors work in their home community helping others to have better lives.
title: We beat the street

author: Bachel, Beverly K.
description: Provides ideas for teenagers on how to set goals and achieve success.
title: What do you really want?

author: Hunter, Dru
description: Examines the origins, advancements, and future of the formal sciences, including mathematics and computer science, and the ways in which scientists utilize the scientific method to explore questions. Includes suggestions for activities, color photographs, a glossary, biographical profiles of scientists, and further resources.
title: What is the reason?

author: Santiago, Esmeralda
description: Memoirs of the author's childhood and youth in Puerto Rico and New York City.
title: When I was Puerto Rican

author: Williams, Lori Aurelia
description: Twelve-year-old African-American girl Shayla is shocked to see blood and bruises on her young neighbor Kambia's legs, but she knows she has to do something immediately to protect her from further abuse.
title: When Kambia Elaine flew in from Neptune

author: Green, John
description: When two teens, one gay and one straight, meet accidentally and discover that they share the same name, their lives become intertwined as one begins dating the other's best friend, who produces a play revealing his relationship with them both.
title: Will Grayson, Will Grayson

author: Smith, Jennifer E.
description: Sixteen-year-old Emma Healy has never felt that she fit in with the rest of her family, so when she discovers that she had a twin brother who died shortly after they were born, she takes off on an impulsive road trip to try to discover who she really is.
title: You are here

author: Faris, Stephanie
description: In an effort to ensure that the popular kids aren't the only ones who receive Valentine gifts during the Student Council chocolate rose sale, Mia makes a point to distribute the roses to the less popular students. But her efforts end up putting her in the spotlight and setting off a chain of unintended reactions that Mia is left to sort out.
title: 25 roses

author: Faris, Stephanie
description: Madison Evans, gossip queen of Troy Middle School, is given an ultimatum by her best friend Vivienne--stop gossiping.
title: 30 days of no gossip

author: Beasley, Cassie
description: Inspired by his dying grandfather Ephraim's stories about the magical members of the Circus Mirandus and their special abilities, Micah Tuttle sets off in search of Lightbender, the owner of the circus, in hopes that he can persuade him to save his grandfather.
title: Circus Mirandus

author: Grant, Holly
description: Anastasia, nearly eleven, is snatched from her elementary school and sent to live at a former insane asylum with two great aunts she had never met after being told that her parents died in a tragic vacuum cleaner accident.
title: The league of beastly dreadful

author: Resau, Laura
description: When 11-year-old Teo finds himself without his mother and sister in the barren, desolate hills of Mexico, he feels lost and hopeless. But then a young girl named Esma, who calls herself the Gypsy Queen of Lightening, comes into his life and everything changes. Their journey together will span generations as they move toward their true destiny.
title: The lightning queen

author: Hamilton, Virginia
description: As a slag heap, the result of strip mining, creeps closer to his house in the Ohio hills, fifteen-year-old M.C. is torn between trying to get his family away and fighting for the home they love.
title: M.C. Higgins, the great

author: Peck, Richard
description: A very small mouse of unknown origins runs away from school in the Royal Mews of Buckingham Palace shortly before the celebration of Queen Victoria's diamond jubilee, celebrating her sixty years on the British throne. The mouse becomes involved in a series of adventures while trying to find his own identity.
title: The mouse with the question mark tail

author: Solomons, David
description: Eleven-year-old Luke's brother and his best friend Lara have both become the superheroes Star Guy and Dark Flutter. When Luke, comic book expert, is transported to a spaceship, he learns aliens--who all look like his gym teacher--are filming a reality show and their next episode is the destruction of Earth! With no one listening to Luke's warnings, he must figure out how to save Earth himself--with no superpowers but his own wits.
title: My gym teacher is an alien overlord

author: Parry, Rosanne
description: After a devastating tsunami in Japan, cousins Jet and Kai spend the summer together in Astoria, Oregon, training for the Young's Bay Treasure Island Race and become close friends in the process.
title: The turn of the tide

author: Almhjell, Tone
description: Her premonition that something is wrong with her house is made certain when young Lin receives the "Twistrose" key. Using it, she unlocks the portal in the cellar to the icy world of Sylver, which is populated by every animal that ever loved a child. Together with her old pet Rufus, Lin embarks on a quest to find the Winter Prince and save Sylver.
title: The twistrose key

author: Abbott, Tony
description: Wade leads his family on a search for the next Copernicus relic through the city of San Francisco while being chased by Galina Krause's henchmen. To find the next relic, the Kaplan family must uncover the secrets of an ancient Chinese artifact.
title: Wade and the scorpion's claw

author: Seidler, Tor
description: In the Wainscott woods, a heroic weasel named Bagley saves the small animals, including his beloved Bridget the fish, from the feared osprey.
title: The Wainscott weasel

author: Bachmann, Stefan
description: Bartholomew Kettle, unable to save his sister, Hettie when she was pushed into the faery Old Country, promised he would find her but sinister forces are still at work and he must rely on Pikey, who would do almost anything to escape his past, to help find her.
title: The whatnot

author: Constable, Cathryn
description: While traveling in Russia, Sophie and her two friends are abandoned in a snowstorm and rescued by the mysterious Anna Volkonskaya, who takes them to a forgotten palace nearby. As Sophie begins to wonder how she fits in to the mystery surrounding the palace and Anna herself, she begins to suspect that she has stumbled into a dangerous situation.
title: The wolf princess

author: Neri, Greg
description: Tells the true story of an eleven-year-old gang member from Chicago who shoots a girl and is then shot by members of his own gang.
title: Yummy

author: Gayton, Sam
description: Twelve-year-old Lettie Peppercorn's mother has gone away, leaving Lettie with the warning that leaving the house could be deadly. So Lettie has remained inside the run-down White Horse Inn ever since. But when an alchemist named Blustav comes to the inn and claims to know her mother, Lettie and a boy named Noah find themselves on a dangerous adventure in search of the truth.
title: The adventures of Lettie Peppercorn

author: Bruchac, Joseph
description: After being taught in a boarding school run by whites that Navajo is a useless language, Ned Begay and other Navajo men are recruited by the Marines to become Code Talkers, sending messages during World War II in their native tongue.
title: Code Talker

author: Kimmel, Elizabeth Cody
description: Twelve-year-old Tee and her beagle, Henry, feel stalked by a ghostly animal when they go for walks in the Alaskan wilderness. Tee convinces her friend Quin to help her and Henry gather evidence of this legendary phantom and unravel the mystery surrounding it.
title: Legend of the ghost dog

author: Alender, Katie
description: While in Paris, France on a class trip, Colette Iselin enlists the help of her charming French tour guide to help uncover a possible connection between Marie Antoinette, a series of gruesome murders, and perhaps her own family history, and he also gives her insights into herself.
title: Marie Antoinette, serial killer

author: Haig, Matt
description: Twelve-year-old Barney Willow gets his wish to be a cat but soon discovers that not all felines are cute and cuddly--some are downright evil--and his life is in grave danger, but his missing father may be able to help.
title: To be a cat

author: Vail, Rachel
description: Truly is asked to join the middle school "Popular Table" and couldn't be more thrilled, but in order to do so she will have to abandon her best friend, Hazel. She thinks it is a small price to pay for popularity, but the kids at the table may not have the purest of motives inviting her to sit with them. Embarrassing secrets are about to come to light that will rock Truly's middle school's hierarchy.
title: Unfriended

author: Harlow, Joan Hiatt
description: Kidnapped by her own mother, a Nazi spy, teenaged Wendy is transported from Maine to wartime Berlin, where she secretly supports the resistance movement and learns a family secret.
title: The watcher

author: Weatherford, Carole Boston
description: Documents the creation of the Tuskegee Airmen during World War II through more than forty free-verse poems. Discusses how dozens of African American men learned engineering, mechanics, code communication, flying, and map reading while facing racial discrimination.
title: You can fly

author: Bow, James
description: Examines warfare during the Middle Ages, discussing important military figures, key battles, types of warriors, and the role of castles. Features writing activities, art panels, print and digital resources, fact boxes, a map, quotes, a glossary of terms, and a graphic timeline.
title: Your guide to castles and medieval warfare

author: O'Brien, Cynthi
description: Discusses artists, writers, and architects from Europe and the Middle East from the fifth to the fifteenth centuries. Explores topics including Brunelleschi's cathedrals, Chaucer's poetry, and inventors like Leonardo da Vinci. Features art panels, print and digital resources, a glossary of terms, and a graphic timeline.
title: Your guide to the arts in the Middle Ages

author: Whitehouse, Howard
description: Fifth-grader Larry Mullet discovers zombies at this elementary school and rallies his friends to save their school. Includes zombie tips and facts.
title: Zombie Elementary

author: Chagollan, Samantha
description: Offers kids a list of 101 television shows to watch before growing up. Features action, adventure, drama, animated shows, award winners, and educational shows. Each entry lists the show's genre, audience age, seasons, and cast. Includes a little-known fact about the show, a box to check off, and space for rating and commenting on the show.
title: 101 TV shows to see before you grow up

author: Griffiths, Andy
description: It used to be the Thirteen-Story Treehouse, but now Andy and Terry, two creative boys who write books together, have added on and it is Twenty-Six Stories now, complete with a skate ramp, the Maze of Doom, an ice cream parlor, and even an antigravity chamber--plenty of space to have adventures in.
title: The 26-story treehouse

author: Hasak-Lowy, Todd
description: An epic lunch period leads to a fateful showdown as small, skinny seventh-grader Sam's former best friend--now a popular athlete--promises to beat Sam up at recess in exactly thirty-three minutes.
title: 33 minutes

author: Siegel, Mark
description: Clumsy Sand Dancer student Oona Lee, poor slum kid An Tzu, and beloved star athlete Jax Amboy are thrown together by a devastating attack. They must go on an epic quest across five interstellar worlds full of magic and adventure.
title: 5 world

author: Beckett, Leslie
description: Explores the history of the abolitionist movement in America from the roots of slavery in the early colonies to the ratification of the Thirteenth Amendment. Includes a glossary, a website for further resources, and archival images.
title: Abolitionists and human rights

author: Ibbotson, Eva
description: A century after a yeti captures Lady Agatha Farlingham and takes her to a hidden valley to raise his motherless children, tourism threatens their peaceful existence and young Con and Ellen take these educated and civilized yetis across Europe to Lady Agatha's home in England.
title: The abominables

author: Lawson, Jessica
description: In 1860, eleven-year-old Becky Thatcher, new to St. Petersburg, Missouri, joins the boys at school in a bet to steal from the Widow Douglas in hopes of meeting a promise to have adventures that she made her brother, Jon, before he died.
title: The actual & truthful adventures of Becky Thatcher

author: White, Wade Albert
description: When thirteen-year-old Anne escapes from the orphanage, she finds herself tasked with unraveling the mysteries behind a set of riddles. Anne, her old friend Penelope, and their new friend Hiro only have a few days to solve the unsolvable and defeat the undefeatable--which includes some pretty wicked dragons and a zombie shark.
title: The adventurer's guide to successful escapes

author: Spratt, R. A.
description: After Mr. Green advertises for a nanny, Nanny Piggins, a pig, shows up for the job and provides a year of adventures and surprises that the Green children will never forget. Includes black-and-white illustrations.
title: The adventures of Nanny Piggins

author: Sanderson, Brandon
description: On his thirteenth birthday, foster child Alcatraz Smedry receives a bag of sand which is immediately stolen by the evil Librarians who are trying to take over the world, and Alcatraz is introduced to his grandfather and his own special talent, and told that he must use it to save civilization.
title: Alcatraz vs. the evil librarians

author: Landers, Melissa
description: High school senior Cara Sweeny gets more than she bargained for when she agrees to participate in Earth's first intergalactic high school exchange program. Cara hosts the handsome Aelyx, but soon her classmates become caught up in the anti-alien movement and Cara is threatened. Now Cara is fighting for her life, for Aelyx, and for her planet.
title: Alienated

author: Freedman, Lew
description: Provides a biography of pilot Amelia Earhart describing her early years, fame, historic accomplishments, and disappearance. Includes illustrations, primary source quotes, a glossary, and timelines.
title: All about Amelia Earhart

author: Zuckerman, Elizabeth
description: Provides a biography of Founding Father Benjamin Franklin. Describes his early years, fame, historic accomplishments, and legacy. Includes illustrations, primary source quotes, a glossary, and timelines.
title: All about Benjamin Franklin

author: Carter, Ally
description: Grace Blakely knows her mother was murdered, but no one else will believe her, not even her powerful ambassador grandfather. Disturbingly, the Russian boy next door has been keeping his eyes on her, for reasons Grace doesn't want to think about. While everyone wants Grace to just live and be pretty, Grace knows that if she doesn't act fast her mother's killer may come back.
title: All fall down

author: Lowry, Lois
description: Twelve-year-old Anastasia is horrified at her family's decision to move from their city apartment to a house in the suburbs.
title: Anastasia again!

author: Spence, Kelly
description: Examines the history of ancient China through a number of artifacts that have survived through the centuries, which give insights into ancient Chinese technology, foods, cultural traditions, and important events and conflicts.
title: Ancient China inside out

author: Adamson, Heather
description: Presents an interactive history adventure in ancient Egypt in which the reader can make several choices of how the story should evolve. Offers three story paths, forty-three choices, and twenty-two endings all of which you may choose.
title: Ancient Egypt

author: Malam, John
description: Examines the history of ancient Greece through a number of artifacts that have survived through the centuries, which give insights into ancient Greek technology, foods, cultural traditions, and important events and conflicts.
title: Ancient Greece inside out

author: Rajczak Nelson, Kristen
description: Presents information about the culture of the Inca Empire and its people. Discusses the Inca social system, state religion, architecture, weaving practices, language, and the eventual Spanish conquest of the Inca people. Includes glossary, index, and resources for further reading.
title: Ancient Inca culture

author: Martin, Lisa
description: Cecil and Anton are brother cats, and couldn't be more different: Cecil, black with white patches, loves adventure, especially if it is on the high seas; but Anton, slim and gray, would rather stay on land and listen to sailors sing shanties. Adventure comes to both cats when Anton is taken aboard a ship by mistake to be a rat hunter. Cecil, hoping to find Anton, boards another ship that turns out to be sailed by pirates.
title: Anton and Ceci

author: Sloan, Holly Goldberg
description: A young possum strikes out on her own and winds up trapped in a human house before her brothers can rescue her.
title: Appleblossom the possum

author: Bodden, Valerie
description: Examines the history of the so called Arab Spring of 2010, discussing the origins of the uprisings in Islamic countries in North Africa and the Middle East and what has happened for democracy in those regions since the uprisings.
title: The Arab Spring

author: Hardy, Ralph
description: A reimagining of Homer's classic tale, "The Odyssey," told from the perspective of Odysseus's loyal dog, Argos. While the rest of Ithaka believes Odysseus is dead, only Argos keeps watch of the sea, tracking his master and protecting his family with the help of other animals.
title: Argos

author: Martin, Laura
description: More than a century into the future, an attempt to clone dinosaurs has left Earth overrun with prehistoric creatures, forcing all remaining humans to live underground. When Sky Mundy's father mysteriously flees their family's safe compound, he leaves her with a cryptic message and a mission to deliver a life-saving memory card to somebody above ground. Sky and her best friend Shawn will risk it all to navigate the dangerous, above-ground world and change the fate of the Earth for the better.
title: The ark plan

author: Rodger, Marguerite
description: Features a collection of jokes, riddles, and puns; and provides information about different styles and cultures of humor from around the world. Includes color photographs, a glossary, and further resources.
title: Around the world in jokes, riddles, and games

author: Larson, Kirby
description: In 1910, Audacity Jones is an eleven-year-old orphan living a monotonous life at Miss Maisie's School for Wayward Girls, and wondering why nothing exciting ever happens--but when the mysterious Commodore Crutchfield whisks her away to Washington D.C., she finds herself involved in a sinister and dangerous plot against the president of the United States.
title: Audacity Jones to the rescue

author: Manning, Matthew K.
description: Presents an illustrated biography of Barbara Gordon, also known as Batgirl. Describes her early years, her transformation into Batgirl, the villains she battles, and how the almost gave it all up. Includes a chronology, fast facts, character profiles, and a glossary.
title: Batgirl

author: Armistead, Cal
description: Seventeen-year-old "Hank" can't remember his identity or past when he wakes up in Penn Station with a copy of Thoreau's "Walden" as his only possession. Hank slowly starts to figure out where he's from and why he ran away as memories begin coming back.
title: Being Henry David

author: Doeden, Matt
description: Contains a choose-your-own-path story involving the Berlin Wall. Features three story paths, forty-two choices, and twenty endings.
title: The Berlin Wall

author: Jocelyn, Marthe
description: Being of mixed race and an orphan, Malou wonders just what her true origins are. When she turns sixteen, her quest to find out her origins takes her to Parry Sound, where there are lots of people with skin like hers, but none that seem to want to talk about it. Malou wants to find out why.
title: A big dose of lucky

author: Chan, Crystal
description: Even though Jewel never knew her brother, Bird, before he ran--or flew--away, she has always felt like she was living in his shadow. All that changes one night when she meets a boy in a tree.
title: Bird

author: Elliott, Zetta
description: Bird, an artistic young African American boy, expresses himself through drawing as he struggles to understand his older brother's drug addiction and death, while a family friend, Uncle Son, provides guidance and understanding.
title: Bird

author: Johnson, Kristin F.
description: After screwing up in a speech team competition, all Tyler wants is to get home, but then his team's bus gets stranded in the middle of the desert. His teammates start wandering off and bickering, then a dark, ominous cloud brings a terrible dust storm. Tyler will have to help his team keep it together and survive.
tags: Survival after airplane accidents, shipwrecks, etc.
title: Black blizzard

author: Swallow, Gerry
description: When ill-mannered, eleven-year-old Elspeth Pule awakens in a strange forest where nursery rhyme character dwell, she must both learn compassion and teach the merits of a good temper tantrum in order to return home.
title: Blue in the face

author: Chupeco, Rin
description: Tea has been ostracized from the other witches because her powers to raise the dead make her feared by all. Now she trains underground with an older bone witch, learning to control her great abilities because the others will need her soon--though they don't know it yet.
title: The bone witch

author: Boyer, Crispin
description: Presents brief profiles of a wide range of men--and a few animals--considered to be heroes, from throughout history and also in fiction, such as Superman, Malcolm X, Einstein, Winston Churchill, Captain "Sully" Sullenberger.
title: The book of heroes

author: Tesler, Monica
description: Twelve-year-old Jasper and his friends are the first group of cadets, called Bounders, to be trained as astronauts who use new spaceships to teleport, but soon are forced to go up against an alien society seeking revenge for stealing this brain-sync technology.
title: Bounders

author: Gerber, Alyson
description: When twelve-year-old Rachel learns that her scoliosis has worsened and she will need to wear a back brace to keep her spine straight, she is devastated; afraid that she will not be able to play soccer, and terrified that she will not be able to hide her condition from her friends and classmates--but her mother is determined to spare her the spinal fusion surgery that she herself had as a teenager.
title: Braced

author: Nolen, Jerdine
description: Presents a historical novel based on true accounts of the Civil War. In 1861, the state of Virginia secedes from the Union, but a Union outpost at Fort Monroe offers refuge to escaping slaves. Twelve-year-old Callie Wilcomb follows her family there, starts studying with Mrs. Mary Peake, a teacher at the fort, and learns that she can have a say over her future, a freedom she has never known.
title: Calico Girl

author: Spencer, Octavia
description: Twelve-year-old Randi, unhappy about moving from Brooklyn to Deer Creek, Tennessee, after her mother's death, soon finds new friends and a case to solve surrounding a stolen time capsule and rumors of a centuries-old treasure.
title: The case of the time-capsule bandit

author: Schmidt, Annie M. G.
description: Minou, formerly a cat but now a woman with many cattish ways, helps Tibbs, a newspaper reporter, with information she gets from her many feline friends.
title: The cat who came in off the roof

author: Otfinoski, Steven
description: Highlights key events surrounding the Civil War through informative text and archival photographs. Includes resources for further information, a glossary, a timeline, a list of key players, and maps.
title: The Civil War

author: Turner, Megan Whalen
description: After Sophos, heir to the throne of Sounis, is kidnapped, Eugenides is named king and begins a search for his lost friend. When it seems as though Sophos will never be heard from again, he turns his attentions to the armies of the Mede Empire, which threaten the land. Sophos, meanwhile, bids his time in the shadows, waiting for his moment to strike and change the course of history forever.
title: A conspiracy of kings

author: Wong, Peter Y.
description: After a foodborne illness breaks out on a cruise ship, seventh-grade Galactic Academy of Science trainees Mae and Clinton travel back in time to learn about the history of food safety in order to help everyone aboard the disabled ship.
title: The contaminated case of the cooking contest

author: Dashner, James
description: As the third Trial draws to a close, Thomas and some of his cohorts manage to escape from WICKED, their memories having been restored, only to face new dangers as WICKED claims to be trying to protect the human race from the deadly FLARE virus.
title: The death cure

author: Duey, Kathleen
description: A brother and sister struggle to survive the rigors of Death Valley after their wagon breaks an axle and they set out alone to find help for their stranded family and injured father.
title: Death Valley, California, 1849

author: Tate, Nikki
description: Explores how trees interact with and drive environments, providing food, shelter, fuel, oxygen, and filtered water to their ecosystems.
title: Deep roots

author: Hopkinson, Deborah
description: Presents true stories from sailors and other soldiers who fought by sea during World War II. Includes first-person accounts, archival materials, official U.S. Navy documents, and photographs.
title: Dive!

author: McCaffrey, Anne
description: When his boy soprano voice begins to change, Piemur is drafted by Masterharper Robinton to help with political work and is sent on missions that lead him into unusual and sometimes dangerous adventures.
title: Dragondrums

author: Yep, Laurence
description: The dragon lady Miss Drake is shocked when her new human pet, precocious Winnie, seems to believe that she--the dragon--is her pet. Miss Drake sets about showing Winnie that things are really the other way around--but then Winnie's sketches of San Francisco's fantastic, mysterious creatures come to life and escape into the city's streets.
title: A dragon's guide to the care and feeding of humans

author: Stevenson, Chri
description: In 1775, twelve-year-old orphan Gabriel Cooper is a patriot who lives in the house of a British loyalist. He finds a discarded drum and joins the American colonists' fight for independence.
title: The drum of destiny

author: Shea, John M.
description: Provides a biography of Eleanor Roosevelt that draws on her own words. Describes her childhood, education, marriage to Franklin Roosevelt, work in politics, and legacy. Includes quotes, a timeline, photographs, a glossary, and further resources.
title: Eleanor Roosevelt in her own words

author: Bow, James
description: Describes solar energy and how human beings have been able to harness the power of the sun, a cleaner source of energy than coal or oil, but also explores some of the drawbacks of solar power, such as the fact that the sun isn't always shining.
title: Energy from the sun

author: Godden, Rumer
description: In post-World War II London, two street-tough children attempt to build a hidden garden, an act that awakens hidden courage in the children and profoundly disrupts the neighborhood.
title: An episode of sparrows

author: Rusch, Elizabeth
description: Follows volcanologists Andy Lockhart and John Pallister on their journey to a variety of different threatening volcanoes around the world, searching with the scientists of the Volcano Disaster Assistance Program for ways to detect early warning signs of an eruption.
title: Eruption!

author: Cooke, Tim
description: Describes what it was like to travel with Spanish explorer Francisco Vazquez de Coronado. Highlights where he went, why and how he got there, and what went right and wrong. Includes a timeline, fact boxes, a glossary, resources for further information, and color illustrations.
title: Explore with Francisco Vâazquez de Coronado

author: Probst, Jeff
description: Presents a children's guide to extreme weather such as hurricanes, tsunamis, tornadoes, and monsoons. Includes full-color photographs, facts, trivia, mini-quizzes, a glossary, and an index.
title: Extreme weather

author: Castle, Jennifer
description: Highlights a selection of famous best friends from John Adams and Thomas Jefferson to Taylor Swift and her posse.
title: Famous friends

author: Terrell, Brandon
description: Farm boy Ben Martin wants to make a living as a skater, but whenever he has to skateboard with stranger he seems to freeze up.
title: Fearless

author: Emerson, Kevin
description: When middle schoolers Haley and Dodger both receive a summer research grant from a mysterious foundation, they discover a link between missing persons and extraterrestrials. Haley and Dodger race to stop an alien takeover of Earth before it's too late.
title: The Fellowship for Alien Detection

author: Stephens, John
description: Even though wizard Stanislaus Pym said they would be safe at the Edgar Allan Poe Home for Hopeless and Incorrigible Orphans, Kate, Michael, and Emma are soon found by their enemies, and now the race is on to find the next of the Books of Beginning, the book of fire, before it can fall into the wrong hands.
title: The fire chronicle

author: Green, Tim
description: Brock tries to escape his father's past and his own reputation as a kid from the wrong side of town by succeeding as a quarterback on the school football team.
title: First team

author: Spilsbury, Richard
description: Explores the physical forces and energy at work in space exploration and travel, discussing things like gravity, why astronauts feel heavy when taking off, why rockets are long and thin, and the kinds of forces astronauts would need to use and overcome in order to get to Mars.
title: Fly to Mars!

author: Peterfreund, Diana
description: After humanity is reduced by a genetic experiment gone wrong, technology is outlawed. Elliot North fights to save her family's land in this new society, and risks her own heart with an old love who holds a secret that could benefit or destroy society in this post-apocalyptic reimagining of Jane Austen's "Persuasion."
title: For darkness shows the stars

author: Salinger, J. D
description: Features two stories in which younger sister Franny obsesses about her spiritual impurity by praying a repetitious prayer to Jesus, and she ultimately suffers a mental breakdown. Zooey her older brother in the second story attempts to make her come to her senses by dropping her quest because it makes her more self-centered than she already is.
title: Franny and Zooey

author: Philbrick, W. R
description: Learning disabled Max and his friend Freak, whose birth defect has affected his body but not his brilliant mind, find that when they combine forces they make a powerful team.
title: Freak the Mighty

author: Bright, Michael
description: Traces the journey of food from farms to one's plate. Also discusses organic farming, food preservation, and food safety. Includes color photographs, a glossary, and further resources.
title: From field to plate

author: Colfer, Eoin
description: While en route to an international eco summit in Dublin, just for a publicity stunt, Tony Stark--better known as Iron Man--detects an anomaly on a small island off Ireland's coast. Warned by Friday, his A.I., not to investigate wearing only the Party Pack version of his armor, Tony ignores her advice, and finds himself in a very bad kind of party.
title: The gauntlet

author: Cusick, Dawn
description: Explores the many evolutionary and survival advantages animals get from the snot, spit, and slime they produce, such as protection from predators and harsh environments.
title: Get the scoop on animal snot, spit & slime!

author: Mary-Todd, Jonathan
description: In 1874 Manhattan, Luc, sixteen, at nearly seven feet tall and seemingly impervious to pain, has become a local boxing star but when kangaroos are introduced to the ring, Luc's tender heart leads him to run away to save a joey.
title: The giant

author: Rivers, Karen
description: Desperate to become one of the popular girls at her new school, Kammie Summers agrees to undergo what turns out to be a fake initiation to their club. She falls in a well, and while she doesn't hear any replies from the girls up above, she hopes they have gone to get help. As hours pass her hope fades, even as she remembers some of the best and worst times of her life and wonders where she went wrong. When hunger and thirst make her hallucinate, she is joined by a French-speaking coyote and zombie goats, who actually help her see the light.
title: The girl in the well is me

author: Bond, Gwenda
description: Two rival circus families, the Maronis and the Garcias, compete for the spotlight in the new "Cirque American" circus show. Sixteen-year-old Jules Maroni wants to be a high-wire walker like her father, and once she gets the chance she skyrockets to fame as the girl in the red tutu. Then she finds a peacock feather on her dress--an emblem of bad luck--sending her for help in the most unlikely of places--Remy Garcia, son of her family's rivals.
title: Girl on a wire

author: Henry, April
description: When an impulsive carjacking turns into a kidnapping, Griffin, a high school dropout, finds himself more in sympathy with his wealthy, blind victim, sixteen-year-old Cheyenne, than with his greedy father.
title: Girl, stolen

author: Daniels, Babygirl
description: Asia and best friend Tracey are enjoying their freshman year in high school before they fall for the same boy. When Asia gets the guy, she loses Tracey and clings to her boyfriend. Then she gets pregnant and he drops her.
title: Glitter

author: Freitas, Donna
description: After fourteen-year-old Joey experiences her first kiss and learns that her best friend wants to quit competitive gymnastics, she considers giving up her dream of winning gold medals in order to have a normal life, even as her sister and assistant coach urge her to reach a new level.
title: Gold medal summer

author: Lewis, Gill
description: Two children, captured by rebels in the Congo, discover that an infant gorilla is also a prisoner. When they find out that the soldiers plan to sell the baby gorilla into captivity, they scheme to release it into the wild. But if they are caught, the consequences will be terrible.
title: Gorilla dawn

author: Walden, Mark
description: Swept away to a hidden academy for training budding evil geniuses, Otto, a brilliant orphan, Wing, a sensitive warrior, Laura, a shy computer specialist, and Shelby, an infamous jewel thief, plot to beat the odds and escape the prison known as H.I.V.E.
title: H.I.V.E.

author: Eager, Edward
description: Faced with a dull summer in the city, Jane, Mark, Katharine, and Martha suddenly find themselves involved in a series of extraordinary adventures after Jane discovers an ordinary-looking coin that seems to grant wishes.
title: Half magic

author: Tucci, Paul A.
description: Explores a wide range of facts and trivia about world geography, such as why every two-dimensional map is distorted, who first theorized the Magnetic North Pole, and how many people could be alive on Earth in 2050 and where they will be most concentrated.
title: The handy geography answer book

author: Tarpley, Natasha
description: Jin, Alex, and Elvin, three strangers, join forces after Elvin's grandfather is attacked, seeking to find out why. They discover an enigmatic artist whose missing masterpieces may be the key to saving their beloved neighborhood of Harlem from being bulldozed and developed into a ludicrous historic theme park called Harlem World.
title: The Harlem charade

author: Rowling, J. K.
description: During his third year at Hogwarts School for Witchcraft and Wizardry, Harry Potter must confront the devious and dangerous wizard responsible for his parents' deaths.
title: Harry Potter and the prisoner of Azkaban

author: Larson, Kirby
description: In 1919, seventeen-year-old Hattie leaves the Montana prairie--and her sweetheart Charlie--to become a female reporter in San Francisco.
title: Hattie ever after

author: Yelchin, Eugene
description: Twelve-year-old Prince Lev Lvov travels to take his rightful place as heir to the Lvov family estate. But when Prince Lev's dreams of becoming a Russian hero are interrupted by a dangerous force haunting his new house, his call to courage comes sooner than he thinks.
title: The haunting of Falcon House

author: Zullo, Allan
description: Documents the stories of ten real-life heroes who risked their lives during the attack on Pearl Harbor during World War II.
title: Heroes of Pearl Harbor

author: Phillips, Gin
description: When thirteen-year-old Nell and her best friend, Lydia, are forbidden to see each other, they hatch a plan to spend their summer days in an abandoned miniature golf course, where they soon find others in search of a home.
title: The hidden summer

author: Deuker, Carl
description: When sophomore Shane Hunter's father is arrested for money laundering at his Lexus dealership, the star pitcher's life of affluence and private school begins to fall apart.
title: High heat

author: Sitomer, Alan Lawrence
description: High school student Theresa embraces the hip-hop lifestyle and meets Devon, a strong-willed teen with hidden academic ambitions. Together, they decide to dedicate themselves to conquering the dreaded SAT, but tragedy threatens to destroy their plans.
title: Hip-hop high school

author: Tolkien, J. R. R
description: Bilbo Baggins, a respectable, well-to-do hobbit, lives comfortably in his hobbit-hole until the day the wandering wizard Gandalf chooses him to take part in an adventure from which he may never return.
title: The hobbit, or, There and back again

author: Schulz, Heidi
description: Captain Hook's swashbuckling daughter must avenge her infamous father's death at the jaws of the Neverland crocodile.
title: Hook's revenge

author: Bradford, Chris
description: Young martial arts expert and trained bodyguard Connor Reeves must put his own life at risk in order to save Alicia, the president's daughter, from a kidnapping plot.
title: Hostage

author: Yolen, Jane
description: Aspen is a prince held in the Unseelie Court as a bribe against war. Snail is just a midwife's apprentice, unworthy of even being in the same room as Aspen. Yet fate has decided to pit the two together--a series of chances and misunderstandings finds the two escaping the Court together, and accidentally starting a war. Now if they do not find a way to end it, no one will.
title: The hostage prince

author: Fry, Jason
description: A family of space privateers becomes embroiled in a solar system-wide conspiracy, all while the three siblings compete to determine who will become the next captain of the ship when their mother steps down.
title: Hunt for the Hydra

author: Acampora, Paul
description: When best friends Lucy, Elena, and Michael receive their summer reading list, they are excited to see "To Kill a Mockingbird" included. But not everyone in their class shares the same enthusiasm. So they hatch a plot to get the entire town talking about the well-known Harper Lee classic.
title: I kill the mockingbird

author: Agosâin, Marjorie
description: When her beloved country, Chile, is taken over by a militaristic, sadistic government, Celeste is sent to America for her safety and her parents must go into hiding before they "disappear."
title: I lived on Butterfly Hill

author: Carr, Pat M.
description: When seventeen-year-old, white Berneen O'Brien moves to Tulsa and takes a job at a segregated elementary school, she becomes increasingly involved in the lives of her black colleagues and shares their experiences during the deadly race riot that destroys Greenwood in 1921.
title: If we must die

author: Kaufman, Amie
description: In the year 2575, Kady's planet is invaded and she and her estranged boyfriend Ezra flee with an evacuating fleet. When a zombie-like virus breaks out on the ship, Kady fears the ship's AI may be involved, and hacks into the system to get the truth. Now a comprehensive collection of video transcripts, hacked documents, emails, military files, medical reports, and interviews tells what Kady is forced to do to save her ship and herself.
title: Illuminae

author: Cohen, Marina
description: During a long car trip, best friends Quinn and Kara explore the strange and creepy goings-on at a remote Nevada inn when Kara's family stops for the night.
title: The Inn Between

author: Fantaskey, Beth
description: In the 1920s, a ten-year-old newsgirl who aspires to be a reporter at the Chicago Tribune investigates the murder of a gangster.
title: Isabel Feeney, star reporter

author: Billups, Carla
description: Provides young readers with an introduction to a variety of fungi; describing the helpful, harmful, and scary uses of the organism. Features color photographs, illustrations, a glossary, and activities.
title: It's a fungus among us

author: Wells, Rosemary
description: One hot summer in Nevada, Ivy finds a way to pass the time by helping nearby residents care for their farm animals while they're away. As she learns the ins and outs of working with animals of all sorts and sizes, she also contends with the mishaps of her neighbor, Billy Joe Butterworth, who insists on tagging along and causes no shortage of trouble.
title: Ivy takes care

author: Greenwald, Tom
description: Tired of being forced to participate in sports and take extra lessons and tutoring to become well-rounded in anticipation of college, middle-schooler Jack Strong stages a sit-in on his couch until his parents ease up.
title: Jack Strong takes a stand

author: Gantos, Jack
description: Joey, who is still taking medication to keep him from getting too wired, goes to spend the summer with the hard-drinking father he has never known and tries to help the baseball team he coaches win the championship.
title: Joey Pigza loses control

author: Haddix, Margaret Peterson
description: In this continuation of the Cinderella story, fifteen-year-old Ella finds that accepting Prince Charming's proposal ensnares her in a suffocating tangle of palace rules and royal etiquette, so she plots to escape.
title: Just Ella

author: Cavanaugh, Nancy J.
description: In this story about unlikely friendships and finding your place in the world, three very different girls, adopted as babies from the same Chinese orphanage, spend a week at a summer camp, where the adoption agency coordinator wants them to journal their "bonding" experience.
title: Just like me

author: Korman, Gordon
description: Gecko, Arjay, and Terence, all in trouble with the law, must find a way to keep their halfway house open in order to stay out of juvenile detention.
title: The juvie three

author: Mobley, Jeannie
description: Thirteen-year-old Trina's family left Bohemia for a Colorado coal town to earn money to buy a farm, but by 1901 she doubts that either hard work or hoping will be enough, even after a strange fish seems to grant her sisters' wishes.
title: Katerina's wish

author: Green, Tim
description: When Ryan learns his estranged father left him the Dallas Cowboys in his will, it is all Ryan can do to keep his dad's other son from snatching the team away.
title: Kid owner

author: Dower, Laura
description: Sixth-grade science whiz Kiki is excited to experiment in the kitchen of Daisy's Desserts. But when a super-sized bakery threatens to run Daisy's out of business, Kiki must use her smarts to help Daisy's survive.
title: Kiki takes the cake

author: Divine, L.
description: Jayd Jackson must embrace her legacy of coming from a long line of conjure women in order to keep the peace between two rival families.
title: Lady J

author: Beil, Michael D.
description: Lantern Sam is an intelligent talking cat. Ten-year-old Henry Shipley is one of the only humans who can understand him. One day they meet each other on the Lake Erie Shoreliner train, just when the young heiress Ellie Strasbourg is kidnapped off the same train. Together, Henry and Lantern Sam are on the case.
title: Lantern Sam and the Blue Streak bandits

author: Torday, Piers
description: Feeling barely alive in a world where all animals are endangered, Kester Jaynes, a voiceless inmate in a home for troubled children, discovers that he can communicate with bird and cockroach rescuers that he endeavors to save from extinction.
title: The last wild

author: Gratz, Alan
description: When an alternate 1875 steam-driven America rediscovers electricity, the lifeblood of the Mangleborn monsters, and the secret society to protect humanity from the Mangleborn is compromised, twelve-year-old Archie must assemble a team of seven young heroes to save the world.
title: The League of Seven

author: Schraff, Anne E
description: When Ernesto witnesses a robbery, he thinks he recognizes one of the fleeing thieves and wonders whether to pursue the matter.
title: Leap of faith

author: Hardinge, Frances
description: On an island off the south coast of Victorian England, fourteen-year-old Faith investigates the mysterious death of her father, who was involved in a scandal, and discovers a tree that feeds upon lies and gives those who eat its fruit visions of truth.
title: The Lie Tree

author: Turner, Tracey
description: In this interactive adventure, the reader is lost in the Amazon Rainforest and must make the right choices to survive. Includes scientific facts, true stories, illustrations, a glossary, and sources of further information.
title: Lost in the jungle of doom

author: Karalius, Kimberly
description: Devastated by a "love fortune" indicating that she will be a spinster, fifteen-year-old Fallon decides to take control of her own fate, even if it means working with Sebastian, a notorious heartbreaker.
title: Love fortunes and other disasters

author: McCarthy, Jenna
description: Devastated about having to change middle schools mid-year, Maggie Malone gets a taste of a very different life when the ugly boots Aunt Fi sends for her birthday allow her to spend a day in the life of pop sensation Becca Star.
title: Maggie Malone and the mostly magical boots

author: Woodson, Jacqueline
description: After winning a scholarship to an academically challenging boarding school, Maizon finds herself one of only five African Americans there.
title: Maizon at Blue Hill

author: Baccalario, Pierdomenico
description: Finley McPhee holds the scorpion key, which makes him the Defender of the Emporium in the small town of Applecross, Scotland, but now Aiby Lily and Finley's brother Doug are apparently lost in an other-worldly place called the passages, and the evil Semueld Askell has told him that if he does not surrender the key within twenty-four hours, they will be lost forever--and that is only one of his problems.
title: Map of the passages

author: Johnson, Jaleigh
description: Since her father's death in a factory in the Dragonfly territories, thirteen-year-old Piper has eked out a living as a scrapper in Merrow Kingdom, but the arrival of a mysterious girl sends her on a dangerous journey to distant lands.
title: The mark of the dragonfly

author: Currie, Susan
description: Cass and her mother move into the home left to them by Cass' estranged grandmother. Cass is dealing with a bully at school and her mom just lost her job so they feel this is a fresh start. Cass finds a mysterious mask in her new room that sings her songs, shows her visions, and encourages her to be brave. With the mask's help, Cass rediscovers her Cayuga heritage and finally finds where she belongs.
title: The mask that sang

author: Elton, Sarah
description: Features a history of meat-based diets and explores why and how people choose a vegetarian lifestyle.
title: Meatless?

author: Davis, Barbara J.
description: Explains for young readers how minerals, soil, and rocks are formed. Includes color photographs, maps, charts, and side-bars as well as projects, quizzes, and a time-line.
title: Minerals, rocks, and soil

author: Anderson, John David
description: In a city without a superhero, Michael Morn lives with his dad using his special "gift" to help them get by. So when one day a Super named Comet comes to town, everything changes. Comet threatens the life Michael and his dad have built, and may force Michael to become a Villain.
title: Minion

author: Broach, Elise
description: When brothers Simon, Henry, and Jack move with their parents to Arizona, they are irresistibly drawn to explore the aptly named Superstition Mountain, in spite of warnings that it is not safe.
title: Missing on Superstition Mountain

author: Fiedler, Lisa
description: Hopper the mouse befriends the rats of Atlantia under the streets of New York City, but when he is captured by a rebel tribe of mice who proclaim him the Chosen One, destined to defeat the rats of Atlantia, Hopper must decide where his true loyalties lie.
title: Mousehear

author: Adams, Karin
description: Riley and is bet friend, Finn, are making a zombie movie together in order to win the class film competition. However, when the camera man focuses on Finn's dancing instead of Riley's zombie, Finn goes viral, leaving Riley and the zombies in the dust. Now Riley is competing against Finn for fame, friendship, and the heart of Jasmine, their classmate.
title: My best friend is a viral dancing zombie

author: O'Hara, Mary
description: Through his intense devotion to the colt Flicka, a young boy, living on a Wyoming ranch, begins to learn about responsibility and gain a better understanding of his brusque father.
title: My friend Flicka

author: Schroeder, Lisa
description: Twelve-year-old Nora has always dreamed of going to Paris with her grandmother, but when her grandmother dies it seems like Paris is gone with her--until Nora finds three airline tickets in a trunk, and sets out to persuade her mother to use them.
title: My secret guide to Paris

author: Spratt, R. A.
description: When Mr. Green announces his diabolical plan to remarry, his children are horrified at the thought of losing their beloved Nanny Piggins.
title: Nanny Piggins and the wicked plan

author: Heffernan, John
description: Living in war-torn Afghanistan has forced Naveed to grow up quickly so he can help his widowed mother make ends meet and take care of himself and his younger sister. His truest hope is for peace, and when he meets a street dog named Nasere who has extraordinary abilities, he sees his chance to help make peace a reality. But a friends betrayal might crush his dreams altogether.
title: Naveed

author: Crowder, Melanie
description: Long ago the dam formed, the lively river turned into a swamp, and the wasting illness came to Luna's village, and now that her little sister is sick Luna will do anything to save her, even offer herself to the creature that lives in the swamp on the day of the nearer moon--a lonely and bitter water sprite who was left behind when her people fled through a door to another world.
title: A nearer moon

author: Reichs, Brendan
description: As the Anvil, an enormous asteroid, threatens to end all life on Earth, sixteen-year-old Min begins to uncover a lifetime of lies, a sinister conspiracy involving all students in her sophomore class in Fire Lake, Idaho.
title: Nemesis

author: Weissman, Elissa Brent
description: After a wildfire destroys his sleepaway camp, Gabe's cool stepbrother Zack and the campers that would have gone there instead join Gabe and his nerd friends at Nerd Camp--a war between the cool jocks and the intelligent nerds is about to begin.
title: Nerd camp 2.0

author: Pitchford, Dean
description: Eleven-year-old Sam Brattle is having the most miserable Christmas of his life, and most of the rest of his town of Nickel Bay is having a bad one, too: Nickel Bay Nick, the Good Samaritan that distributes hundred dollar bills each Christmas, has been a no-show. Looking for him, Sam learns that it may be up to him to make this Christmas a good one for everyone.
title: Nickel Bay Nick

author: Auxier, Jonathan
