description: Irish orphans Molly, fourteen, and Kip, ten, travel to England to work as servants in a crumbling manor house where nothing is quite what it seems to be, and soon the siblings are confronted by a mysterious stranger and secrets of the cursed house.
title: The Night Gardener

author: Hiatt, Fred
description: Tenth-graders Ethan and Ti-Anna go to Hong Kong seeking her father, an exiled Chinese democracy activist who has disappeared, and follow his trail to Vietnam and back, also uncovering illegal activity along the way. Includes author's note and the history behind the novel written by the girl who inspired it.
title: Nine days

author: Alexander, Willia
description: Gabe Fuentes has become Earth's ambassador, but he is not on Earth nor on the moon. He is traveling deep into space with the alien ambassador Kaen, who looks completely human, as well as with Nadia, the human ambassador from forty years ago who hasn't seemed to have aged at all. Nadia has spent decades studying the Outlast, an evil alien species determined to wipe out all civilization other than their own. If the three ambassadors cannot work together quickly, then Earth's fate and the Outlast's victory seem certain.
title: Nomad

author: Carter, Nikki
description: Hoping to launch her own musical career, Sunday Tolliver sees her dreams shattered when her mother spends her entire college fund. Now, in order to get to college, Sunday has to work as the personal assistant to her cousin, Dreya, who is on tour with big-name rapper Truth. When Truth begins getting close to Sunday, however, Dreya's jealousy takes over and threatens to end Sunday's dreams.
title: Not a good look

author: Jacobson, Jennifer
description: After the death of their mother, nineteen-year-old Gage and his younger sister eleven-year-old Ari struggle to keep their promise to their mother that they will stay together, but when Gage is unable to find a home for the two of them, Ari is forced to make a difficult decision.
title: Paper things

author: Ellis, Deborah
description: Parvana, disguised as a young boy, continues her journey through the Afghanistan countryside looking for what remains of her family and is joined along the way by three other orphans of the war-torn country.
title: Parvana's journey

author: Jones, Patrick
description: Lucas dreams of getting a basketball scholarship and helping his mom out of poverty. But when his older brother lures him toward a life making "easy" money on the street, Lucas must decide what he wants.
title: Pass it forward

author: Mulder, Michelle
description: Explores ideas for creating a sustainable, environmentally friendly economy, and argues that consumerism as practiced today is not making people happy. Explores how growing a cabbage can help fight poverty or how families can start businesses with just a few dollars.
title: Pocket change

author: Zinn, Bridget
description: In an effort to protect her kingdom the only way she knows how, potions master Kyra attempts to assassinate the king with a poison dart. When her dart misses, Kyra becomes a fugitive and must find another way to get a second chance to kill the king without sacrificing her own life.
title: Poison

author: Airgood, Ellen
description: Homeschooler Prairie Evers is joining a public school for the first time. It is scary. She cannot find a friend among all the seemingly rude kids that populate her new school. Then she meets Ivy, but nothing in her homeschooling has prepared her for what a friendship really means.
title: Prairie Evers

author: Glass, Calliope
description: Presents a biography of the Star Wars character Princess Leia highlighting her journey to becoming the leader of the Resistance. Includes a glossary and a page of "fast facts."
title: Princess Leia

author: Bencastro, Mario
description: Sixteen-year-old Sergio, struggling to honor his grandfather's wish to be buried in El Salvador, undertakes a journey filled with unexpected disasters, triumphs, and the memory of his beloved Abuelo.
title: A promise to keep

author: Green, Dan
description: Explores major scientists' accomplishments as well as failures in brief illustrated biographies. Discusses famous scientific disputes and includes a glossary and index.
title: Rebel science

author: Weyn, Suzanne
description: Kadeem Jones, star quarterback for Southside High, visits Teller College where the school's recruiter gives him money to have fun. When NCAA officials accuse Teller College of breaking the recruiting rules, Kadeem must decide whether or not to help the investigation and risk his chance at playing college football.
title: Recruited

author: Costa, Ben
description: Rickety is a minstrel skeleton who's somehow retained his soul. Along with a bag of squishy jelly named Goo, who only Rickety can understand, Rickety sets out on an adventure to discover his roots.
title: Rickety Stitch and the gelatinous goo

author: Paulsen, Jim
description: A father and son embark on a road trip to a distant animal shelter to save a homeless border collie puppy.
title: Road trip

author: Gier, Kerstin
description: Sixteen-year-old Gwen, the newest and final member of the secret time-traveling Circle of Twelve, searches through history for the other time-travelers, aided by friend Lesley, James the ghost, Xemerius the gargoyle demon, and Gideon, the Diamond, whose fate seems bound with hers.
title: Sapphire blue

author: Gemeinhart, Dan
description: The Slabhenge Reformatory for Troubled Boys is a decaying fortress on a remote island, inhabited only by the fifteen boys sentenced to live there and the adults hired to supervise them. It's also twelve-year-old Jonathan Grisby's home for the next ten weeks, and he accepts the punishment he feels he deserves. When a lightning bolt strikes, killing every adult at the reformatory, the boys are suddenly left to fend for themselves. They are enjoying their freedom until another storm strikes, leaving the boys in danger of dying themselves, and forcing Jonathan to face his past in order to save himself and the others.
title: Scar Island

author: DiTerlizzi, Tony
description: After her underground home is destroyed by a marauder, young Eva Nine flees to the hostile surface to search for other humans she knows exist from a scrap of paper with the word "WondLa" on it. Befriended by a wanderer and a giant water horse, she faces danger on her quest to find others like herself. Combines traditional novel with graphic novel illustrations and includes interactive webcam maps.
title: The search for WondL

author: Cameron, Ann
description: Living in a rural community in Wisconsin during the 1950s, eleven-year-old Amanda gradually and painfully learns a lot about herself, her parents, and her older sister.
title: The secret life of Amanda K. Woods

author: Pierpoint, Eric
description: Seeking justice for his brother's death, for Rebecca's father being held prisoner, and for every rebel American fighting British tyranny, William Tuck sets out to deliver a secret message to George Washington. To do so, Rebecca disguises herself as a boy, and she and William join the American troops on an epic journey.
title: The secret mission of William Tuck

author: Maldonado, Torrey
description: Twelve-year-old boys living in a rough part of New York confront questions about what it means to be a friend, a father, and a man.
title: Secret Saturdays

author: Jonell, Lynne
description: Eleven-year-old Duncan McKay uses his ability to communicate with his companions Fia, a kitten, and Brig, a tiger, to aid him on a journey to claim his rightful place as heir to his island kingdom. Duncan is enlisted to serve a crew of pirates and sent to the far edges of his kingdom in the course of his adventurous quest.
title: The sign of the cat

author: Eddleman, Peggy
description: Twelve-year-old Hope Toriella lives in the world after World War III, a world of disease and danger. Her town, White Rock, is a town of inventors, who must reach a quota of invented things every year. This year, bandits get word of valuable antibiotics in White Rock, and so raid the village, giving them an ultimatum: hand over the antibiotics, or die. However, if they lose the antibiotics, the villagers will also die. The only way to save everyone is for Hope and her friends to cliff jump into the dangerous Bomb's Breath canyon.
title: Sky jumpers

author: Jones, Kar
description: In 1979, Astrid and her family struggle to adjust to life in Ghana, where her father is helping with the country's first democratic election, and where political upheaval has put them at risk.
title: So much for democracy

author: Pla, Sally J.
description: Charlie's simple and predictable life gets complicated when his war-journalist father gets injured in Afghanistan. Now he must live with Gram and take frequent trips to the hospital, and then must travel cross-country when his father moves to Virginia for better treatment. Along the way, Gram tells Charlie that people heal faster when they are happy, and Charlie thinks that if he can spot all the birds he and his father want to spot, then maybe, somehow, things will turn out okay.
title: The someday birds

author: Haydu, Corey Ann
description: Ten-year-old best friends Clover and Danny share a connection that goes beyond friendship--Clover is certain its symbiotic. When Danny starts getting sick and has to undergo trips to the hospital to see specialist who search for a diagnosis, Clove becomes increasingly convince they cannot survive without one another. And as Danny grows sicker, Clover worries time is running out for them to pack the purple suitcase they got for their future trips together.
title: The someday suitcase

author: Lee, Y. S
description: Rescued from the gallows in 1850s London, young orphan and thief Mary Quinn is offered a place at Miss Scrimshaw's Academy for Girls where she is trained to be part of an all-female investigative unit called The Agency and, at age seventeen, she infiltrates a rich merchant's home in hopes of tracing his missing cargo ships.
title: A spy in the house

author: MacHale, D. J.
description: Having escaped from Pemberwick Island, Kent, Tori, Olivia, and Tucker continue to try to get word out about SYLO, the organization that had quarantined them, while trying to avoid being caught in the middle of an inexplicable new civil war.
title: Storm

author: Carbone, Elisa Lynn
description: In 1895, after his mother's death, twelve-year-old Nathan moves with his father and grandfather to Pea Island off the coast of North Carolina, where he hopes to join the all-black crew at the nearby lifesaving station, despite his father's objections.
title: Storm warriors

author: Castaldo, Nancy F
description: Presents the argument that big farms, damaged habitats, genetic modification, and climate change are severely threatening the extinction of many of the world's plants and seeds. Explores steps certain people and groups are taking around the world to prevent the loss of plant biodiversity.
title: The story of seeds

author: Roberts, Willo Davis
description: What they thought would be a dream vacation turns into a nightmare for 12-year-old Lewis and his twin sister Alison, when they accompany their irresponsible new neighbors on a trip to Yellowstone Park and are chased by two mysterious men.
title: Surviving summer vacation

author: Rinaldi, Ann
description: After serving Martha Washington loyally for twenty years, Oney Judge realizes that she is just a slave and must decide if she will run away to find true freedom.
title: Taking liberty

author: Jones, Patrick
description: At odds with his sister, Tina, fourteen, who says their father murdered their mother, Todd, fifteen, who claims it was self-defense, begins to lose faith in their father when he pressures Todd to get Tina to change her story, and being in separate foster homes only makes things harder.
title: Taking sides

author: Saunders, Catherine
description: Provides an introduction to the ninjas who protect the Ninjago Island safe from the special skills unique to each ninja to details about their fiercest foes. Includes a text-related quiz and a glossary.
title: Team ninja

author: Knudsen, Shannon
description: When Kai sneaks into his teacher's classroom to look at an upcoming test, he discovers that his teacher is changing answers to students' standardized tests--and he takes photos to prove it. A classroom conflict forces Kai to reveal what he knows, but no one believes him and he is suspended. Now Kai must prove his photos are legitimate and clear his permanent school record.
title: Testing the truth

author: Dlugos, Jenn
description: Examines nature's strange mating rituals, parasitic pairs, and other strange couplings. Includes photos and trivia questions.
title: Things that make you go yuck

author: McKissack, Fredrick
description: Clayton Banks struggles with his own beliefs and those of his father's while trying to become a part of the civil rights movement.
title: This generation of Americans

author: Gantos, Jack
description: Based on an experience in the author's life, the story describes how fourteen-year-old Jack falls under the spell of a delinquent Florida neighbor and gets way more trouble than he bargained for in the process.
title: The trouble in me

author: Carleson, J. C.
description: When Laila's father, king of an unnamed Middle Eastern country, is killed, she and her mother and brother flee to America to live a life of exile. Only now does Laila learn that her father was not the rightful king, but was seen as a dictator in the American newspapers. She cannot believe it, but she questions the life of ease she enjoyed as a princess--it may have been ill-gotten. When her mother works with the CIA to regain the throne, Laila wonders which side is the right side.
title: The tyrant's daughter

author: Crowder, Melanie
description: In Bolivia in 1999, when their father is unjustly arrested and their mother leaves, Francisco, seventeen, and his sister Pilar, eight, must move to the dirty, dehumanizing, and corrupt prison.
title: An uninterrupted view of the sky

author: Nagelhout, Ryan
description: Chronicles the life and legacy of Vasco Nâuänez de Balboa, the first European to reach the Pacific Ocean from the New World. Discusses his initial voyages, his troubling involvement with torture, slavery, and war, and his downfall and death. Includes a glossary, index, and resources for further information.
title: Vasco Nâuänez de Balboa

author: Behrens, Rebecca
description: When the Secret Service squashes yet another chance for the president's daughter, Audrey, to make any new friends, Audrey discovers former first daughter Alice Roosevelt's hidden diary, which gives Audrey endless ideas for having fun--and more problems than she can handle.
title: When Audrey met Alice

author: Hahn, Mary Downing
description: Sixth grader Brendan Doyle, who is bullied at school and mistreated by his teachers and foster mother, becomes convinced that an elderly man living in the Virginia woods near Brendan's tree house is the mythical Green Man, and befriends him and an unusual girl named Shea.
title: Where I belong

author: Christopher, John
description: Young Will Parker and his companions make a perilous journey toward an outpost of freedom where they hope to escape from the ruling Tripods, who capture mature human beings and make them docile, obedient servants.
title: The White Mountains

author: Jones, Rob Lloyd
description: Abandoned as an infant, a child known only as "Wild Boy" is bought by a cruel man and becomes a sideshow attraction. Developing powerful deduction skills as he ages, Wild Boy finally gets the chance to put his skills to the test when a murder occurs at the fair and he must find the culprit in order to avoid being accused himself.
title: Wild boy

author: Fallenstein, J.
description: After Mackie, a high school football star, dies and it seems to be his best friend Omar's fault, new girl Rosie tries to help Omar get over his grief. Unfortunately, in their town, supernatural things happen frequently, and Mackie's ghost isn't sleeping peacefully.
title: The witching hour

author: Helget, Nicole Lea
description: Lu Wonder, a bright, curious girl who hopes to be a scientist, sets out from her Kansas home in 1855 with her best friend Eustace, a slave, on a journey to Antarctica to protect a mysterious artifact and hide it from the man responsible for her father's death.
title: Wonder at the edge of the world

author: Carlson, Caroline
description: Toby Montrose, an assistant at his uncle's detective business, enters Hugh Abernathy's crime-solving contest in order to prove he doesn't have to stay an apprentice all his life. Together with his friend Ivy--who isn't allowed to compete even though she thinks she is the best detective around--Toby prepares for the challenge. Then, one of the other detectives is found murdered before the contest begins.
title: The world's greatest detective

author: Snicket, Lemony
description: When apprentice Lemony Snicket and his chaperone are hired to find a missing girl, they try to determine where she was last seen and whether she is a runaway or a kidnapping victim. Soon, however, they realize they are going about their investigation in an entirely wrong manner, and shift their focus in order to understand the larger issues at stake.
title: "When did you see her last?"

author: Caldwell, S. A
description: Surveys the lives and personal achievements of 100 women in history who have greatly influenced their world, from Catherine the Great to Anne Frank and her famous diary.
title: 100 women who made history

author: Caldwell, S. A
description: Shares stories and photos from 125 abandoned animals who found forever homes. Includes stories of dogs, cats, pigs, rabbits, and lambs; and features animal facts and ways for children to get involved in animal rescue.
title: 125 pet rescues

author: Harrison, Michelle
description: After the wicked fairies steal her brother, Red strikes a bargain with the fairy court to return him in exchange for the thirteen charms from her friend's bracelet. However, the fairies have hidden the charms and have enchanted their treasures into evil and dangerous curses.
title: 13 curses

author: Marciano, John Bemelmans
description: Twelve-year-old Alexander Baddenfield, the last in a long line of evil men who die young, has his cat's extra eight lives transplanted into his own body, while his caretaker, Winterbottom, strives to keep him safe.
title: The 9 lives of Alexander Baddenfield

author: Clements, Andrew
description: Plain-Jane Jordan Johnston falls about in the middle of short and tall, plump or slim, blonde or brunette, neither gifted in school nor a flunk. She is average, and she hates it. Everyone else is better than she, but by the end of the year she has made a promise to herself--no matter the cost, she will find her talent.
title: About average

author: Perl, Erica S.
description: Eleven-year-old Zelly Fried's parents will not allow her to have a slumber party until she teaches her mischievous puppy, Ace, to behave, but with Grandpa Ace around nothing is ever simple.
title: Aces wild

author: Peterfreund, Diana
description: Sixteen-year-old Persis Blake struggles to balance her life as a socialite and a secret spy in a future where Regs, or regular people, have power over the Reduced--those genetically engineered or drugged into physical and mental impairments.
title: Across a star-swept sea

author: Stokes, Jonathan
description: Twelve-year-old Addison Cook and his friends are on the hunt for a long-lost treasure. But they'll need to outwit a band of thieves, survive booby traps, crocodiles, and a Russian assassin--to name a few of the obstacles standing in their way--in order to secure the three keys needed to unlock the ancient treasure.
title: Addison Cooke and the treasure of the Incas

author: Butcher, Kristin
description: Fifteen-year-old Christine investigates an outbreak of local pickpocket crimes while spending the summer with her eccentric great-aunt Maude in Witcombe, British Columbia.
title: Alibi

author: Freedman, Lew
description: Describes Sir Edmund Hillary's early years, military career, and legacy being the first to conquer Mount Everest. Includes illustrations, timelines, quotes, and a glossary.
title: All about Sir Edmund Hillary

author: Rivkin, Jennifer
description: Presents the greatest teams in the sport of basketball and highlights notable male and female players in each position of the sport today. Also presents rising stars in the game. Includes color photographs, a glossary, and further resources.
title: All ball

author: Cervantes, Angela
description: Allie Velasco is from a family of trailblazers and achievers--her great-grandfather even got the Congressional Medal of Honor--but Allie herself has no accomplishments. When a prestigious school contest is announced, Allie vows to win it and come in first at last--but in doing so, she may make things even worse between her and her former BFF, Sara.
title: Allie, first at last

author: MacColl, Michaela
description: Sisters Emily and Charlotte Brontèe combine their wit and imagination, which has served both so well in their love of writing, to solve a string of mysteries taking place on and around their home on the moors, primarily involving the death--or murder--of a neighbor and the appearance of two handsome but perhaps untrustworthy men.
title: Always Emily

author: Rodger, Ellen
description: Examines the history of ancient Egypt through a number of artifacts that have survived through the centuries, which give insights into ancient Egyptian technology, foods, cultural traditions, and important events and conflicts.
title: Ancient Egypt inside out

author: Moberg, Julia
description: A collection of forty-one true stories of animal heroism throughout history, featuring humorous rhymes, historical facts, and color illustrations.
title: Animal heroes

author: Savit, Gavriel
description: When seven-year-old Anna's father went away on November 6 in 1939, he never returned. Alone in Poland during World War II, Anna is taken under the care of strange man whose name she never knows, but who she calls Swallow Man. Alongside a Jewish man named Reb Hirschl, the three try to survive the horrors of hiding away as a war rages around them and danger lurks at every turn.
title: Anna and the Swallow Man

author: Meloy, Maile
description: Follows a fourteen-year-old American girl whose life unexpectedly transforms when she moves to London in 1952 and gets swept up in a race to save the world from nuclear war.
title: The apothecary

author: Meloy, Maile
description: In 1954, Janie Scott has started boarding school in New Hampshire, but she often thinks about her friends, the apothecary and his son, Benjamin. On the other side of the world, Benjamin has become a doctor and is treating wounded soldiers in jungle warfare. Developing a magical way to communicate with Janie instantly has proved troublesome. More troublesome are the sinister forces moving in on Janie to take control of a new experiment of hers.
title: The apprentices

author: Berk, Sheryl
description: In exchange for tickets on a Caribbean cruise ship, Jenna and her friends in the cupcake club must bake 12,000 cupcakes for a pirate-themed event.
title: Bakers on board

author: Brindle, I. J.
description: As part of his family's magic act, eleven-year-old Balthazar is the only member without real magical powers, but when his family disappears in the middle of a performance, Balthazar must work with with a ragtag crew of misfits to save the day.
title: Balthazar Fabuloso in the Lair of the Humbugs

author: Avi
description: In an effort to fulfill their dying father's last request, Ben and his brother and sister construct a barn on their land in the Oregon Territory.
title: The barn

author: Stuckey, Rachel
description: Features the basics of football including rules and tips for warming up, passing, catching, blocking, and tackling. Highlights the various positions played on the field. Includes a glossary, resources for further information, and color photographs.
title: Be a force on the field

author: Hellisen, Cat
description: When thirteen-year-old Sarah's mother abandons the family, her father takes Sarah to live with her grandparents in the ruins of a castle deep in the woods, where she discovers that her family is cursed to turn into beasts unless Sarah can discover the source of their dark enchantment.
title: Beastkeeper

author: Manzano, Sonia
description: Actress Sonia Manzano, known as "Maria" on the television show "Sesame Street" since the early 1970s, writes about the realities of growing up in an inner-city barrio with a loving yet dysfunctional immigrant family, and pursuing her dream of acting.
title: Becoming Maria

author: Kew, Trevor
description: Hometown pride is on the line when the Helmets and the Gloves are merged against their will by the league. Tensions are high, and Luke and his friends are not happy with it. Nothing goes right for the newly formed team, until a hockey tournament in Vancouver forces them to work together with a hotshot new goalie.
title: Bench brawl

author: Vrettos, Adrienne Maria
description: When Hattie first moves to Trepan's Grove from Brooklyn, she worries the kids at school may not like her for who she truly is so she lies in order to fit in. She and her three best friends make a pact to never lie to one another. Little do they know the pact is magical, and as Hattie unwittingly breaks the pact by keeping up her facade, her friends literally forget who she is. Hattie will have to be true to herself and her friends in order to break the curse created by the magic of the pact.
title: Best friends for never

author: Lane, Kathleen
description: Ever since starting middle school, Maggie has been worried. She sees injustice and danger everywhere, even in her own neighborhood, even in the changes that seem to be happening with her best friend. Well, it seems like it is up to Maggie to make everything right, but when she tries to come up with a plan to control everything in her life, she learns that sometimes it is best to let things go by themselves.
title: The best worst thing

author: Whitby, Adele
description: Beth is excited for her twelfth birthday, when she will receive her great-grandmother's heirloom necklace as a gift, but when her cousin's necklace goes missing, Beth must learn the secrets of her manor house in order to clear the name of her maid and friend, Shannon.
title: Beth's story, 1914

author: Cuevas, Michelle
description: Hatched from an egg his human father found on the sidewalk, Nashville, part-bird and part-boy, has a beak and feathers but no wings. Even as he struggles to fit in among the humans, Nashville can't help pursuing his dream of flying with the other birds.
title: Beyond the laughing sky

author: Hyman, Jeremy
description: Explores the intelligence of a variety of bird species from around the world. Discusses how birds use sound, tricks, tools, adaptations, and migration routes. Includes dozens of color illustrations, a glossary, and further resources.
title: Bird brains

author: Voigt, Cynthia
description: When Max's parents receive a mysterious invitation and leave the country without him, he must rely on his wits to get by, and before long he is running his own--rather unusual--business.
title: The book of lost things

author: Cole, Henry
description: A young apprentice chipmunk in a guild of craftsanimals strikes up an unlikely relationship with a dragon who teaches him the meaning of true friendship.
title: Brambleheart

author: Nobleman, Marc Tyler
description: When Charlie's older brother Joe is called up in 1942, Charlie learns about the tedium and dangers of war through Joe's letters--and his brother's bravery in dealing with a spy as D-Day approaches, finally gives Charlie the strength to stand up to the local bully.
title: Brave like my brother

author: Nall, Gail
description: Kaitlin has given up a lot--even attending school--to pursue her dream of being a champion figure skater, but after she throws a tantrum at a major competition, she is dropped by her coach and prestigious skating club and can only get a spot in the much-ridiculed Fallton Club.
title: Breaking the ice

author: O'Connell, Caitlin
description: Over the course of five days at Zoo Atlanta, author O'Connell describes the animals she encounters and those who care for them. Discusses flamingos, gorillas, meerkats, pandas, and elephants among others. Features color photographs throughout.
title: Bridge to the wild

author: Mezrich, Ben
description: Math genius Charlie Lewis, called "Numbers" by his friends, who call themselves the Carnival Killers, seeks to win every game at Incredo Land amusement park in order to take home lifetime park passes. However, as Charlie and the Carnival Killers begin studying the games, they uncover a dangerous carnival conspiracy.
title: Bringing down the mouse

author: Hunter, Erin
description: A young lion cub named Fearless Gallantpride finds himself on the run after his father, once the leader of their lion pride, is killed by a violent rival. Fearless finds a home with a troop of baboons. One of his baboon friends, Thorn, is determined to change tradition in order to be with the one he loves. Fearless and Thorn make a pilgrimage to seek advice from the Mother of the Bravelands where they meet Sky, an elephant whose unique ability to see the future has the trio working together to change the fate of all the animals of the Bravelands.
title: Broken pride

author: Curtis, Christopher Paul
description: Ten-year-old Bud, a motherless boy living in Flint, Michigan, during the Great Depression, escapes a bad foster home and sets out in search of the man he believes to be his father--the renowned bandleader, H.E. Calloway of Grand Rapids.
title: Bud, not Buddy

author: Galveston, Louise
description: Under twelve-year-old Todd Butroche's bed, a stinky sock has spawned a miniature civilization, the Toddlians, who see Todd as their god. Todd isn't really interested in being their protector until the school bully, Max, puts the Toddlians in danger; then Todd races to save them from extinction.
title: By the grace of Todd

author: Ives, Rob
description: Presents step-by-step instructions for constructing a miniature model of a medieval battle scene, including castle buildings, little knights, and siege engines, out of cardboard, Popsicle sticks, tinfoil, and similar everyday items.
title: Castle attack

author: Rutkoski, Marie
description: Thirteen-year-old Petra, her tin spider Astrophil, and their Roma friends Neel and Tomik are surprised by revelations about Dee, Kit, and Petra's father as they face Prince Rodolfo of Bohemia, who will do anything to possess a powerful object, the Celestial Globe.
title: The Celestial Globe

author: Urban, Linda
description: When Ruby Pepperdine finds her life falling apart around her, she regrets the problems she has caused and searches for a way to set things right. She decides to pin her hopes on Bunning Day, when the town will listen to her read her winning essay, and her twelfth birthday wish, which she hopes will be the key to putting her life back on track.
title: The center of everything

author: Machajewski, Sarah
description: Presents a brief biography of Cesar Chavez and selections from his own words, discussing how he fought against the use of pesticides in food that people eat.
title: Cesar Chavez in his own words

author: Voigt, Cynthia
description: Mina's deep love for a grown-up minister drives her to seek a way to give him an unforgettable remembrance, restoration of his faith.
title: Come a stranger

author: Shaw, Tucker
description: Backup dancer Kelly Kimball discovers the real story behind the lead dancer Darcy Barnes, and she reveals it in her diary.
title: Confessions of a backup dancer

author: Monninger, Joseph
description: When the reporters of "Junior Action News Team" crash-land in the Alaskan wilderness, they must survive with no Internet, cell phones, limited supplies, and little knowledge of wilderness survival.
tags: Survival after airplane accidents, shipwrecks, etc.
title: Crash

author: Croggon, Alison
description: Follows the adventures of orphan Hem as he embarks on a quest to solve the Riddle of the Treesong.
title: The crow

author: Hautman, Pete
description: Nearly a thousand years in the future, a sheltered and spoiled girl named Lah Lia was raised for a single purpose--to be sacrificed into the mysterious spacetime diskos that hovers over the Cydonian Pyramid. Just before she is killed, however, a strange boy appears from the diskos, and helps her escape. Now her fate and the boy's--Tucker Feye--are inextricably linked.
title: The cydonian pyramid

author: Bowen, Carl
description: Based on a tip from CIA agent Bradley Upton, the Shadow Squadron rushes to Yemen in an attempt to apprehend an elusive Iraqi explosives expert, but when the mission goes wrong Ryan Cross finds himself alone, face to face with the Iraqi--and confronting the truth about the CIA agent.
title: Dark agent

author: Schraff, Anne E
description: Despite her boyfriend Clay's violent streak, Naomi sticks with him even when he hits her. When her family finds out, however, her secret can't stay hidden for long.
title: Dark secrets

author: Levenseller, Tricia
description: When an ancient, hidden map is rumored to have fallen into the hands of rival pirates, seventeen-year-old pirate captain Alosa, the daughter of an infamous pirate king, lets herself get captured by her enemies in order to search their ship. Her enemies are no match for her wiles and wit, except maybe for Riden, the attractive first mate, who seems able to see through her tricks and may know more than he is letting on about the map. As her time aboard the ship lengthens, Alosa's game of wits and secrets gets both her and Riden in grave danger.
title: Daughter of the pirate king

author: Gitlin, Marty
description: Presents photos, information, and illustrations about the fall of ancient Chinese civilization. Discusses advancements and recesses, dynasties and overthrowings, important political figures, and China's transition into modernity. Includes a glossary, index, and resources for further information.
title: The decline of ancient Chinese civilization

author: Peebles, Alice
description: Surveys ten ferocious demons and dragons from myth stories around the world, ranking them from least fearsome to the most based on how repulsive, powerful, strong, and terrible they are--from Fafnir the dragon to the sea serpent Illuyanka to the terrible Furies of the Greek underworld.
title: Demons and dragons

author: Fitzmaurice, Kathryn
description: All her life, eleven-year-old Emily Elizabeth Davis has been encouraged to become a poet by her family, just like Emily Dickinson for whom she was named. However, Emily is not convinced she even likes poetry, much less could write a poem herself. What she really wants to be when she grows up she cannot reveal to anyone, for fear of disappointing her English-professor mother. When she loses a volume of Dickinson poetry given to her at birth, she is told that that book held a valuable family secret--now Emily and her friends are on the hunt for the book, and learn a little about destiny on the way.
title: Destiny rewritten

author: Staniszewski, Anna
description: Eighth-grade Rachel stole from her college fund and now she has to work with her mom cleaning people's houses on Saturdays to pay it back. However, cleaning for the popular people in school has given her access to all kinds of secrets that she relates in her diary. When her crush wants Rachel to spy on his girlfriend, Rachel must decide what she will do with the secrets she collects.
title: The dirt diary

author: Peppas, Lynn
description: Analyzes primary and secondary sources as evidence of how native peoples have been displaced throughout the history of the United States and Canada, discussing government relations, residential schools, loss of culture, and reservations. Also examines how to find reliable sources, analyze sources, and consider audience and bias. Includes modern examples of displacement today, illustrations, a timeline, a glossary, and sources of further information.
title: The displacement of native peoples

author: Pyron, Bobbie
description: Brought to Moscow in 1990s Russia by his mother's abusive boyfriend, five-year-old Mishka is forced by a gang of homeless children to lie and steal until he finds comfort and love with a pack of dogs. Includes historical note.
title: The dogs of winter

author: Scott, Elaine
description: Presents advice for students on managing money, making it, spending and saving it wisely.
title: Dollars and sense

author: Neilsen, David
description: Three young friends--Gail, Nancy, and Jerry---must defeat the mysterious Dr. Fell who builds an irresistible and dangerous playground in their neighborhood and then uses his power to heal children who get injured on the playground, stealing some of their life essence in the process.
title: Dr. Fell and the playground of doom

author: Snyder, Zilpha Keatley
description: A group of children entranced with Egypt play their own Egypt game, are visited by a secret oracle, become involved in a murder, and befriend the Professor before they move on to new interests, such as Gypsies.
title: The Egypt game

author: Gier, Kerstin
description: Since learning she is the Ruby, the final member of the time-traveling Circle of Twelve, nothing has gone right for Gwen and she holds suspicions about both Count Saint-German and Gideon, but as she uncovers the Circle's secrets she finally learns her own destiny.
title: Emerald green

author: Berry, Julie
description: When her stubborn cow, Alfalfa, runs away, young dairymaid Begonia chases after it. Meanwhile, a couple of ancestral spirits decide to teach the twenty-one-year-old bully of an Emperor a lesson, sending him fleeing his castle on an ostrich. Begonia encounters the Emperor, whose bedraggled appearance makes him unrecognizable, as well as Key, a farmer boy who thinks he is a hero and Begonia is a damsel in distress. Before long, Begonia, Key, and the Emperor find themselves on a quest to save the kingdom from a villainous nobleman who took the Emperor's place.
title: The emperor's ostrich

author: Belleza, Rhoda
description: Rhee is the sole surviving heir to a powerful dynasty. Aly is the dashing star of a DroneVision show. When Aly is falsely accused of killing Rhee, they are forced to work together to prove Aly's innocence and confront a ruthless evil that threatens the fate of the entire galaxy.
title: Empress of a thousand skies

author: O'Brien, Cynthi
description: Describes what it was like to travel down the Mississippi River with French explorers Father Jacques Marquette and Louis Jolliet. Highlights where they went, why and how they got there, and what went right and wrong. Includes a timeline, fact boxes, a glossary, resources for further information, and color illustrations.
title: Explore with Marquette and Jolliet

author: Mahaney, Ian F.
description: Explores the capabilities of a number of off-road vehicles and the jobs they are used for, such as logging trucks, farm tractors, military tanks, and hovercraft.
title: Extreme off-road vehicles

author: Bertrand, Diane Gonzales
description: Sophomore intellectual Javier Avila lands a position as an anchorman for his school, St. Peter's High School. He soon discovers that he has a special talent for public speaking, writing scripts, and editing video. But he still longs for the confidence to approach his co-anchor Pat Berlanger's drop-dead gorgeous sister, Feliz.
title: The F factor

author: Hardinge, Frances
description: The people in the underground city of Caverna live their lives with expressionless faces, and must be taught how to express emotions by Facesmiths, who charge a steep price for the ability. A young girl named Neverfell, who has no memory of her past, must wear a mask at all times because of her natural ability to express herself--an ability that makes her dangerous to the people of Caverna.
title: A face like glass

author: Kogge, Michael
description: Offers a comprehensive character guide to the film, "Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them." Discusses character background, clothing and possessions, relationships, and other facts. Also discusses the film's magical beasts.
tags: Characters and characteristics in motion pictures.
title: Fantastic beasts and where to find the

author: Arnold, Elana K.
description: Odette Zyskowski, a girl who likes keeping lists, starts a new one: Things That Aren't Fair. At the top is having to live on the road in a cramped RV with her annoying young brother, Rex, while they and their parents go on a long road trip to Grandma Sissy's. However, when they arrive, Odette learns what it truly means for something to be unfair, and learns that even though some things are out of her control, she can still try to make things right.
title: Far from fair

author: McBride, Lish
description: Ava is the top hitman for the Coterie, a magical mafia run by Venus, the woman who had Ava's mother killed. Ava rebels from the mafia and Venus when she is asked to eliminate a family friend, escaping with two of her fellow mafia friends.
title: Firebug

author: Napoli, Donna Jo
description: A young mermaid is on display in a boardwalk aquarium. She longs for life with two legs like the girl named Livia she's made friends with. With a little help from an octopus and some magic, she'll find a way to have the life she dreams of.
title: Fish Girl

author: Federle, Tim
description: Now on Broadway as second understudy for E.T., Nate Foster keeps in close contact with his best friend, Libby, as he faces his nemesis, Jordan Rylance, and his own insecurities as the cast member with the least training and experience.
title: Five, six, seven, Nate!

author: Rocklin, Joanne
description: In Pittsburgh in 1952, Franny Katzenback, a teen recovering from polio, strikes up a friendship with a loquacious flea named Fleabrain.
title: Fleabrain loves Franny

author: Turner, Matt
description: Introduces different kinds of flying insects, including birdwing butterflies, hummingbird hawk moths, bees, paper wasps, dragonflies, blow flies, robber flies, mosquitoes, and shorthorn grasshoppers.
title: Flying creepy crawlers

author: Yasuda, Anita
description: Explores the history and field of forensics, and profiles three women who work in forensics, discussing their education, hiring, training, and daily job duties. Includes a timeline, reflection questions, a glossary, and resources.
title: Forensics

author: Steele, Michael Anthony
description: Jack Turner and his friend seek new ways to keep their skateboarding videos fresh and unique when a rival steals their ideas.
title: Fresh

author: Baker, E. D.
description: After reluctantly kissing a frog, an awkward, fourteen-year-old princess suddenly finds herself a frog, too, and sets off with the prince to seek the means--and the self-confidence--to become human again.
title: The frog princess

author: Bright, Michael
description: Explores the origins of oil, and the history of searching, extracting, transporting, and refining oil for use. Lists the things oil is used for, and discusses the future of oil. Includes color photographs, a glossary, and further resources.
title: From oil rig to gas pump

author: McClintock, Norah
description: Rennie Charbonneau travels to Argentina to investigate whether his grandfather was a spy who helped a Nazi war criminal escape capture.
title: From the dead

author: Haddix, Margaret Peterson
description: Becca's life seems like it is ending when her father is sent to jail for embezzlement. The worst thing is that he claimed he was doing it for her, so she could go to college someday. Becca and her mother leave for a new town and swear never to talk about their pasts--but as Becca's high school career comes to an end, it becomes harder to hide the past, especially when she applies for scholarships. One scholarship may undo all her life.
title: Full ride

author: Gout, Leopoldo
description: Three underprivileged teen prodigies from around the world--an expert computer programmer and hacker, an engineering genius, and an activist blogger--become involved in an international competition hosted by India's youngest CEO called "The Game" that pits 200 geniuses against each other and where nothing is as it seems.
title: The game

author: Bearce, Stephanie
description: Offers a collection of stories and facts about the 1920s with a focus on gangsters and bootleggers. Discusses Prohibition, flappers, speakeasies, the Untouchables, female bootleggers, the invention of NASCAR, and Al Capone. Includes several activities, quotes, photographs, and sidebars.
title: Gangsters and bootleggers

author: Poston, Ashley
description: Geek girl Elle Wittimer enters a cosplay contest sponsored by the makers of "Starfield," her favorite sci-fi show to watch with her dad growing up. The prize is a chance to attend the ExcelsiCon Cosplay Ball and meet the heartthrob actor slated to play Federation Prince Carmindor, Darien Freeman. Darien used to love conventions, but recently he has been chaffing under the judgment of the fans, who say he doesn't really know anything about "Starfield"--until he meets Elle.
title: Geekerella

author: Thompson, John
description: When Abbey's father falls into a coma and is accused of a crime he didn't commit, Abbey sets out to prove his innocence and repay a century-old debt.
title: The girl from Felony Bay

author: Zappa, Shana Muldoon
description: With Rancora bent on destroying the Star Darlings' world, the girls dive deep into Rancora's past to search for answers.
title: Good wish gone bad

author: Hale, Marian
description: In Canton, Texas, seventeen-year-old Mercy's dreams of a different life than her mother's are postponed by harsh circumstances, including the influenza epidemic of 1918-19, which forces her into doing domestic work for a loving, if troubled, family.
title: The goodbye season

author: Paterson, Katherine
description: An eleven-year-old foster child tries to cope with her longings and fears as she schemes against everyone who tries to be friendly.
title: The great Gilly Hopkins

author: Lawson, Robert
description: Eighteen-year-old Conn leaves Ireland and sails to America, where he helps build the first Ferris wheel for the World's Columbian Exposition of 1893.
title: The great wheel

author: Acioli, Socorro
description: Having arrived in Candeia, Brazil, starving and footsore, after walking sixteen days to fulfill his dying mother's last wishes, young Samuel takes up residence in an enormous, broken statue of Saint Anthony and finds that he can hear the prayers of the townspeople, despite his lack of faith.
title: The head of the saint

author: Wood, Maryrose
description: Fifteen-year-old Miss Penelope Lumley, a governess trained at the Swanburne Academy for Poor Bright Females, takes the three Incorrigible Children of Ashton Place to London, England, and learns they are under a curse.
title: The hidden gallery

author: Staniszewski, Anna
description: Lena is a soul reaper, not your average eighth-grade kid, meaning she collects souls that are about to die. At a party she accepts a dare to kiss the dorky but adorable Marcus, crossing off "First Kiss" from her teenage to-do list. What she didn't know is that Marcus is also extraordinary, being a supernatural matchmaker, with the power to make people fall in love. Their kiss switches their powers, and now Lena and Marcus must take over each other's tasks.
title: I'm with Cupid

author: Anniss, Matt
description: Explores the technological innovations that have happened in the world of sports including the creation of carbon fiber composite materials for para-athletes, the use of motion analysis to help performance, and the pneumatic recovery unit to help athletes recover faster from injuries.
title: The impact of technology in sports

author: Flood, C. J.
description: After her mother leaves and her brother and father grow increasingly distant, thirteen-year-old Iris finds solace and friendship in Trick, a fourteen-year-old gypsy boy.
title: Infinite sky

author: Elkins, Elizabeth
description: Explores how much damage hurricanes can cause in a short amount of time--toppling trees and buildings easily. Explores some of the worst hurricanes in history and offers advice for surviving in a hurricane.
title: Investigating hurricanes

author: Dahl, Roald
description: A young boy escapes from two wicked aunts and embarks on a series of adventures with six giant insects he meets inside a giant peach.
title: James and the giant peach

author: Burgan, Michael
description: Contains a choose-your-own-path story involving the Korean War. Features three story paths, forty choices, and twenty-three endings.
title: The Korean War

author: Polak, Monique
description: Dreaming of rising to the top of her career in the circus, Mandy enters the prestigious Montreal Circus College summer program, where she makes new friends but also rivals, and soon the summer camp's magic turns into a matter of life and death.
title: Learning the ropes

author: Alcott, Louisa May
description: Chronicles the joys and sorrows of the four March sisters as they grow into young ladies in nineteenth-century New England.
title: Little women

author: Flitcroft, Jean
description: Longing to continue her mother's cryptid research, Vanessa travels to Scotland to search for the secrets of the Loch Ness monster.
title: The Loch Ness monster

author: Peabody, Erin
description: Uses easy-to-read text and illustrations to discuss the facts and mythology behind the Loch Ness Monster. Features anecdotes, sidebars, and factual data using a scientific, myth-busting lens to examine historical sightings and evidence.
title: The Loch Ness monster

author: Bowen, Carl
description: When a video of a man making terrorist demands surfaces, Shadow Squadron discovers that the man is a former American soldier and a member of the original Shadow Squadron. They set out to capture the traitor, but discover the situation is more complex than it seems.
title: Long shadow

author: Donoghue, Emma
description: Nine-year-old Sumac Lottery is happily living with four parents (one lesbian couple and one gay couple), six siblings from multicultural backgrounds, and five rescue pets. But when Grandpa Grumps, who Sumac has never met because he's been estranged from the family, comes to live with them, his disapproving attitude toward the life Sumac loves is hard to take.
title: The Lotterys plus one

author: Jakubowski, Michele
description: Astrid, Rowan, Quinn, and Jace hear about a local legend involving a buried treasure, then work to determine its location.
title: Mick's buried treasure

author: Henry, Marguerite
description: Captivated by the story of "Misty of Chincoteague," a woman with a horse farm in Florida raises one of Misty's descendants to become a champion show horse.
title: Misty's twilight

author: Murray, Martine
description: Ten-year-old Molly is embarrassed by her weird mother, who collects herbs and brews strange potions. Only Pim, the oddest boy in Molly's class, might understand how she's feeling. And as the two set out on an unexpected adventure, they realize that sometimes standing out is the right choice.
title: Molly & Pim and the millions of stars

author: Novak, Ali
description: After her family dies in a car accident, perfectionist Jackie Howard must move across the country to live with her new guardians, the Walters--a family with eleven sons who are loud, annoying, and have no concept of personal space.
title: My life with the Walter boys

author: Divine, L.
description: Jayd Jackson's mama continues to fall in and out of a dangerous dream state, leaving Jayd only her burgeoning powers and her wits to deal with her problems. Those include Misty and Esmeralda's evil brood; Rousseau taking over the drug business; and the more mundane cares of her friends and new boyfriend.
title: No mercy

author: Fleischner, Jennifer
description: George, a young slave living in St. Louis, Missouri, wrestles with the injustices he sees around him as he decides whether or not to flee his accustomed life and seek freedom.
title: Nobody's boy

author: Canasi, Brittany
description: Defying her family's expectations for a young lady, Hope gets involved in her father's successful watch factory rather than looking for a husband. But when Hope discovers something awful occurring right under her father's nose, she must choose between her family's beliefs and her own. Includes historical background information, activity prompts, and online resources for further information.
title: Not on my watch

author: Draper, Sharon M
description: After losing her boyfriend, Josh, to a pledge stunt gone wrong, a pregnant November Nelson must deal with the pressures the new baby will bring. Meanwhile, Jericho, Josh's cousin, struggles to cope with the loss of his best friend and turns to a variety of activities to distract himself from the pain.
title: November blues

author: Peterfreund, Diana
description: Seeking to prove her father is not a mad conspiracy theorist, Gillian Seagret, her brother Eric, best friend Savannah, and NASA-obsessed schoolmate Howard uncover the secret doomsday bunker of Dr. Alysius Underberg, a Cold War-era rocket scientist. Exploring the bunker, which is called Omega City, the four friends learn they are not alone, and before they know it they are in a race to find the answers to Dr. Underberg's questions, before Gillian's father's enemies get a hold of them first.
title: Omega City

author: O'Connor, Barbara
description: Sherman, a one-legged pigeon, sets everyone aflutter in a small southern town.
title: On the road to Mr. Mineo's

author: Alpine, Rachele
description: Grace Shaw is thrilled to win the lead role in her school's production of "Snow White," however she is terrified that Prince Charming will have to kiss her in the play--especially since it will be her first kiss.
title: Operation pucker up

author: Bond, Michael
description: Paddington tries his hand as a chimney sweep, washing barrels in a marmalade factory, frightening visitors in a wax museum, and playing cricket.
title: Paddington marches on

author: Sage, Angie
description: Young PathFinder Alice TodHunter Moon sets off on a quest to find her friend Ferdie, who has been kidnapped by an evil sorceress known as Lady.
title: Pathfinder

author: Furstinger, Nancy
description: Profiles twenty-two heroic dogs who have helped humans and saved their lives, such as Layka, who served in Afghanistan; Mas, who jumps from choppers to save people from drowning; Rocky and Rosdas, protectors of elephants in Tanzania; and Bretagne, who helped rescuers find trapped survivors after 9/11.
title: Paws of courage

author: Wein, Elizabeth
description: Fifteen-year-old Julia Beaufort-Stuart wakes up in a hospital not knowing how she was injured, and soon befriends Euan McEwen, the Scottish Traveller boy who found her. Later, when a body is discovered, she experiences the prejudices his family has endured and tries to keep them from being framed for the crime.
title: The pearl thief

author: Bachmann, Stefan
description: After humans win the faery wars in England, a half-human, half-faery child, scorned by both races, finds himself at the center of a web of intrigue and danger when he is stalked by a sinister faery.
title: The Peculiar

author: Platt, Richard
description: The fictional diary of a ten-year-old boy who, in 1716 sets off from North Carolina to become a sailor, but ends up a pirate instead.
title: Pirate diary

author: Krokos, Dan
description: On a routine voyage aboard an Academy spaceship, thirteen-year-old Mason Stark and his fellow cadets are attacked by the Tremist, an alien race who have been at war with humanity for the last sixty years.
title: The planet thieves

author: Christopher, John
description: Thirteen-year-old Luke has no reason to suspect that anything will ever change in the primitive society of the future in which he lives.
title: The prince in waiting

author: Lee, Darrien
description: Seventeen-year-old Patience is the leader of a gang but now she wants to get out. Then Denim Mitchell overhears that Patience is being set up by her sisters who are upset with her decision.
title: Queen of the yard

author: Swendson, Shanna
description: In 1888 New York City, sixteen-year-old governess Verity Newton agrees to become a spy, whatever the risk, after learning that the man for whom she has feelings sympathizes with rebels developing non-magical sources of power, via steam engines, in hopes of gaining freedom from British rule.
title: Rebel mechanics

author: Nielsen-Fernlund, Susin
description: After his older brother uses their father's rifle to shoot the bullies that have long tormented him and then shoots himself, thirteen-year-old Henry and his family relocate to a new home where no one knows their past. Henry writes in his journal to deal with his grief, and gradually makes new friends -- but wonders if he should let them know about his family's past.
title: The reluctant journal of Henry K. Larsen

author: Loughead, Deb
description: Fifteen-year-old Dylan is making a short film about zombie scarecrows, but Halloween pranksters are making his progress difficult.
title: Rise of the zombie scarecrows

author: Cushman, Karen
description: A twelve-year-old Polish American girl is boarded onto an orphan train in Chicago with fears about traveling to the West and a life of unpaid slavery.
title: Rodzina

author: Taylor, Mildred D.
description: Young Cassie Logan endures humiliation and witnesses the horrors of a KKK cross-burning rampage before she fully understands the importance her family places on having land of their own.
title: Roll of thunder, hear my cry

author: Dickinson, Peter
description: When the magic that protects their Valley starts to fail, Tilja and her companions journey into the evil Empire to find the ancient magician Faheel, who originally cast those spells.
title: The ropemaker

author: Humphrey, Anna
description: Ruby is determined to win the gold with her fifth-grade science fair project, a Rube Goldberg machine to help her grandfather, but the real prize turns out to be something completely unexpected.
title: Ruby Goldberg's bright idea

author: Bascomb, Neal
description: Chronicles Nazi Germany's occupation of Norway during World War II. Tells the story of a group of young Norwegian commandos tasked with destroying Hitler's atomic bomb and how their mission led to the war's greatest act of sabotage.
title: Sabotage

author: Duncan, Alexandra
description: After Ava, one of the few teenage girls on a male-dominated spaceship, is faced with banishment and death as a result of her attempt to pursue a romance, she flees to a floating island of scrap and garbage in the Pacific Ocean of a post-apocalyptic Earth to survive.
title: Salvage

author: Hughes, Dean
description: Recent high school graduate Rick Ward, undecided about his future and eager to escape his unhappy home life, joins the army and experiences the horrors of the war in Vietnam.
title: Search and destroy

author: Gill, Jennifer Duddy
description: Just as twelve-year-old Ferrell Savage is beginning to think of Mary Vittles, his life-long friend, as a potential girlfriend, a new boy at school blackmails them with a family secret--that one of Ferrell's ancestors ate one of Mary's.
title: The secret of Ferrell Savage

author: Watkins, Steve
description: Taking a battered navy peacoat from World War II and a mysterious letter inside its pocket home with him, Anderson and his friends Greg and Julie discover the ghost of the man who wore the coat in the Battle of Midway. If they want to help the ghost cross over to the other side, they will have to find out who he is by following clues in the old letter.
title: The secret of Midway

author: McKinlay, Megan
description: In a dystopian world, fourteen-year-old Jena has spent her entire life preparing for her role in her community as the leader of the tunnelers--seven girls chosen at birth due to their small size to squeeze through the small crevices of the nearby mountain to harvest the mica their village needs to survive. The girls spend their lives deprived of food, and their limbs are wrapped to decrease growth. It is a revered but difficult life. When Jena meets Lia, a girl from a village on the other side of the mountain who lives a more peaceful existence, both girls question everything they've ever been told.
title: A single stone

author: Howard, J. J
description: Before Cecilia Murray can adopt a cute pug named Potato, the arrogant, popular, but cute Eric Chung adopts the dog first. When Eric decides to turn Potato into a show-dog, Cecilia is horrified, and vows to sabotage his plans. However, as she spends more time with Potato and Eric, Cecilia realizes that she may have gotten Eric all wrong. She may even be falling for him.
title: Sit, stay, love

author: Sayre, April Pulley
description: Compiles facts from a variety of fields about anything slow, including slow animals, slow-growing plants, and slow natural processes. Includes slow activities to try.
title: The slowest book ever

author: Hutton, Keely
description: Presents the true story of Ricky Anywar who was kidnapped by Joseph Kony and forced to fight as a child soldier in the Ugandan civil war. Details his life as a soldier, his struggles to escape, and as an adult, working to rehabilitate other former child soldiers. In alternating chapters, the author presents a fictional story about a young boy named Samuel, also a child soldier, and how he faces the horror of war.
title: Soldier boy

author: Samuels, Charlie
description: Describes daily life for soldiers of World War II. Discusses recruitment, training, morale, and medical care. Includes photographs, eyewitness accounts, color maps, biographical sketches, a World War II timeline, a glossary, and further reading.
title: Soldiers

author: Donwerth-Chikamatsu, Annie
description: Eleven-year-old Emma's life in Tokyo changes for the worse when she and her American mother, who is pregnant, must move in with her Japanese grandmother the summer before 9/11 changes the world.
title: Somewhere among

author: Riordan, Rick
description: Demigod Percy Jackson, still with no memory, and his new friends from Camp Jupiter, Hazel and Frank, go on a quest to free Death, but their bigger task is to unite the Greek and Roman camps so that the Prophecy of Seven can be fulfilled.
title: The son of Neptune

author: Kerrin, Jessica Scott
description: When a new book arrives at the library with a secret code written inside, Derek, with the help of his friends, follows the clues from one novel to the next and makes a discovery that may help him get past a terrible loss.
title: The spotted dog last seen

author: Lin, Grace
description: An innkeeper's chore boy discovers that a visitor's stories hold the key to returning the moon to the Starry River of the Sky.
title: Starry River of the Sky

author: Hartley, A. J
description: In a city where dramatically different races and communities live alongside one another, seventeen-year-old Anglet Sutonga makes a living repairing chimneys, towers, and spires. When Ang is supposed to meet a new apprentice, Berrit, she finds him dead, and at the same time the Beacon, a powerful historical icon, is stolen from the city. The Beacon's theft overshadows Berrit's murder, but Ang finds an accomplice in Josiah Willinghouse, a young politician, who thinks the death and theft might be connected.
title: Steeplejack

author: Kacer, Kathy
description: After her orphanage burns to the ground in 1964, Sara journeys to Germany determined to explore her newly discovered Jewish heritage and solve the mystery of her parentage.
title: Stones on a grave

author: Angleberger, Tom
description: Sixth-grader Tommy and his friends describe their interactions with a paper finger puppet of Yoda, worn by their weird classmate Dwight, as they try to figure out whether or not the puppet can really predict the future. Includes instructions for making Origami Yoda.
title: The strange case of Origami Yoda

author: Heos, Bridget
description: Examines the work of Randy Lewis and how he has bred transgenic goats whose milk contains spider silk proteins, which can be spun into material stronger than Kevlar.
title: Stronger than steel

author: Hunter, Erin
description: Determined to find a home with more plentiful food and water, the leader of a tribe of cats leads his group down their mountain and into a nearby forest, where new dangers await.
title: The sun trail

author: Hunter, Erin
description: Collects a series of folktales from Norway, Japan, Scotland, and Sudan with female protagonists who exhibit great courage, achievement, and wit.
title: Tatterhoo

author: Chase, Paula
description: As Mina Mooney prepares to compete alongside the rest of the varsity cheer squad at the Extreme Nationals, her friends Lizzie, Kelly, and Jacinta each deal with personal problems of their own. Meanwhile, Mina's enemy, Jessica, calls a truce in order to hide what she is really planning for Mina.
title: That's what's up!

author: Shelton, Dave
description: When Jack enters the deserted house in his neighborhood, he finds a group of people who invite him to take the thirteenth chair in the room and share a story--in the house where the ghosts meet.
title: Thirteen chairs

author: Crowder, Melanie
description: Marin has only known life in the foster care system. Her constant companions have been the Chinese "I Ching," the "Book of Changes," and three pennies always in her pocket. Lately, though, she feels like she has found a place she could stay forever--which rubs against her dream of finding her birth mother to convince her that they belong together. Then, Marin gets unwelcome news.
title: Three pennies

author: Lewis, Ali
description: Danny Dawson's family is falling apart: There is a drought ravaging their Australian cattle station; his fourteen-year-old sister Sissy is pregnant; Danny is suffering from asthma attacks; and the family is grieving the loss of Danny's brother Johnny six months ago. Remarkably, healing comes to Danny in the form of Liz, a clueless English backpacker hired to help out at the station, whose good humor and willingness to learn help Danny open up about Johnny at last.
title: Timber Creek Station

author: Carter, Nikki
description: Sunday Tolliver, popular singer and songwriter, has had enough of her boyfriend Sam, and the boy drama that's affecting her relationship with her two best friends. Meanwhile, Sunday's jealous cousin Dreya tries to boost her own career at the expense of Sunday's reputation.
title: Time to shine

author: Brown, Skila
description: Traveling west by wagon train with her family, nineteen-year-old Mary Ann Graves is hopeful for her family's new life in California. But when her family is trapped in early snowstorms alongside the Donner and Reed families in Nevada, she learns the true meaning of perseverance.
title: To stay alive

author: Arntson, Steven
description: In 1963, when twins Henry and Helen and their best friends, Alan and Nicki, try to find Alan's missing brother, Carl, they stumble into the knowledge of their "subtle forms" that can separate from their physical bodies, and into a criminal's plot to make himself immortal--at any expense.
title: The trap

author: Steinkellner, Teddy
description: Middle school is coming for four teenagers who will have to navigate their new pubescent bodies and hormones among the other social dangers of seventh grade and above. For Jake Schwartz it means figuring out how to feel about his best friend, Danny, and his crush on his older sister, Hannah. For Dorothy Wu, it means keeping her head down and continuing to write epic stories in her bedroom.
title: Trash can days

author: Dowell, Frances O'Roark
description: When an eleven-year-old African American girl named Callie sets out to find the owner of an old yellow dog, she crosses paths with a white boy her age named Wendell. Their segregated town isn't happy when the two become friends. Meanwhile, two boys who are ghosts are stuck in a cabin by a river, unable to cross to the other side. Callie and Wendell's quest brings them to the cabin in the woods--and to the boys--just as flames of prejudice, anger, and hate ignite the town.
title: Trouble the water

author: Vigilante, Danette
description: Overwhelmed by grief and guilt over her brother's death and its impact on her mother, and at odds with her best friend, thirteen-year-old Dellie reaches out to a neglected boy in her building in the projects and learns from a new neighbor to have faith in herself and others.
title: The trouble with half a moon

author: Yeh, Kat
description: Twelve-year-old GiGi and her junior-high-dropout sister DiDi have just won a million dollars in prize money, meaning they can move from their trailer park in South Carolina up to the North Shore of Long Island, where along with a better life they also uncover secrets about their family's past.
title: The truth about Twinkie Pie

author: Coleman, K. R.
description: Recent graduates of Middleton High test their bravery in the woods where legend says a girl was kidnapped by the Midnight Man, so when one of their friends does not return they become increasingly scared.
title: Truth or dare

author: Babbitt, Natalie
description: The Tuck family is confronted with an agonizing situation when they discover that a ten-year-old girl and a malicious stranger now share their secret about a spring whose water prevents one from ever growing any older.
title: Tuck everlasting

author: Goldblatt, Mark
description: In Queens, New York, in 1969, twelve-year-old Julian Twerski writes a journal for his English teacher in which he explores his friendships and how they are affected by girls, a new student who may be as fast as Julian, and especially an incident of bullying.
title: Twerp

author: Friedman, Aimee
description: Two possible futures face Summer: either she will spend the summer in Provence with her father, uncovering family secrets, and exploring the old world, or she will stay in upstate New York, coping with her mother, and dreaming of her long time crush--and which future unfolds will depend on whether or not she answers a phone call.
title: Two Summers

author: Salisbury, Graham
description: Tomikazu Nakaji's biggest concerns are baseball, homework, and a local bully, until life with his Japanese family in Hawaii changes drastically after the bombing of Pearl Harbor in December 1941.
title: Under the blood-red sun

author: Fitzgerald, Laura Marx
description: Her grandfather's dying words lead thirteen-year-old Theodora Tenpenny to a valuable, hidden painting she fears may be stolen, but it is her search for answers in her Greenwich Village neighborhood that brings a real treasure.
title: Under the egg

author: Paulsen, Gary
description: After finally obtaining the girl of his dreams, Kevin Spencer fears he may lose her to Cash Devine, who has his eye on her and is running for class president. Determined to prove his mettle, Kevin decides to run against Cash, realizing he will have to pull out every trick in his arsenal to have a chance of winning.
title: Vote

author: Bennett, Holly
description: Cuchulainn returns from war injured, teaching his daughter,Luaine, that nobody is invincible. Luaine seeks the protection of a powerful druid and offers to care for his falcon.
title: The warrior's daughter

author: Armer, Laura Adams
description: Younger Brother, a Navaho Indian boy, undergoes eight years of training in the ancient religion of his people and the practical knowledge of material existence.
title: Waterless mountain

author: Vail, Rachel
description: Eighth-grade student Gracie Grant has a huge crush on handsome, popular AJ Rojanasopondist. The only problem is, AJ likes her best friend, Sienna. Grace quickly overcomes the tinge of jealousy she feels upon learning the news, and happily helps Sienna craft responses to AJ's surprisingly funny text messages. Unbeknownst to the girls, there's a good reason the messages seem out of character for AJ--his buddy Emmett is writing them on his behalf.
title: Well, that was awkward

author: Hays, Tommy
description: A boy finds solace in his art and community after his mother dies and his father retreats into himself.
title: What I came to tell you

author: Griffin, Paul
description: Life has been difficult for Ben Coffin and he doesn't make friends easily, so he spends most of his time with his favorite characters from science fiction books. One day he rescues a scruffy dog on the way home from the library. The dog, who he names Flip, then leads Ben to befriend Halley, a girl who dresses in crazy colors. Ben nicknames her "Rainbow Girl," and together Ben and Halley decide to write a novel. In doing so, Ben's life unravels. If he wants to keep his new friend, he will have to figure out what friendship really means.
title: When friendship followed me home

author: Friend, Natasha
description: After her mother's attempted suicide, thirteen-year-old Anna goes to live with her father and his new family, and learns to navigate the shifting loyalties of middle school friendships.
title: Where you'll find me

author: Meyer, Carolyn
description: In 1921 in Dillon, Texas, twelve-year-old Rose Lee sees trouble threatening her black community when the whites decide to take the land there for a park and forcibly relocate black families to an ugly stretch of territory outside the town.
title: White lilacs

author: Saunders, Kate
description: Eleven-year-old twins Oz and Lily are recruited by a talking cat to assist her and M16 in foiling the dastardly plans of their great-great-uncle, a chocolatier who used magic to make a candy that bestows immortality.
title: The Whizz Pop Chocolate Shop

author: Cushman, Karen
description: In 1599 England, twelve-year-old lying, thieving Will Sparrow runs away, meets many colorful characters on the road, and then reluctantly joins a traveling "oddities" exhibit, where he learns to see beyond appearances.
title: Will Sparrow's road

author: Kerr, Philip
description: Fleeing the persecution of the Nazis, Ukrainian Jew Kalinka, an orphan with no family or friends, finds herself with only her loyal dog in the dead of winter. Out on the Ukrainian steppe she meets two seemingly wild horses, Przewalski's horses, which may be the last of their breed. Preserving the horses becomes Kalinka's purpose in survival.
title: The winter horses

author: Barnhill, Kelly Regan
description: When a Bandit King comes to take the magic that Ned's mother, a witch, is meant to protect, the stuttering, weak boy villagers think should have drowned rather than his twin protects his family and community. Meanwhile, in the woods, the Bandit's daughter puzzles over a mystery that ties her to Ned. The two must find a way to trust each other if they want to stop the oncoming war between their two kingdoms.
title: The witch's boy

author: Pixley, Marcella Fleischman
description: Fifteen-year-old Lizzie Cohen recalls what it was like growing up with her imaginative but disturbed older sister Tess, and how she is striving to reclaim her own life since Tess died.
title: Without Tess

author: Parry, Rosanne
description: Pearl, a young girl in a Pacific Northwest Native American tribe in the 1920s, deals with the death of her father and the loss of her tribe's traditional ways with courage and determination.
title: Written in stone

author: Chapman, Lara
description: Eleven-year-old Hallie Simon's dream of becoming the best kind of witch like her great-great-grandmother begins to splinter when her abilities seem geared towards the darker side of witchcraft--perhaps brought on by her roommate and friend-turned-enemy, Kendall.
title: The XYZs of being wicked

author: Rodman, Mary Ann
description: When her FBI-agent father is transferred to Jackson, Mississippi, in 1964, eleven-year-old Alice wants to be popular but also wants to reach out to the one black girl in her class in a newly-integrated school.
title: Yankee girl

author: Vande Velde, Vivian
description: When fifteen-year-old Zoe steps into the bank to get out of the rain, she never imagines she's walking into a crime scene. In the midst of robbery spiraling out of control, Zoe finds her strange ability to travel back in time twenty-three minutes a possible way of preventing the ultimate horrible outcome. But she only has a certain number of tries to get it right, and the fear that she could be living the final twenty-three minutes of her life becomes very real.
title: 23 minutes

author: Bajaj, Varsha
description: Astonished to learn that the father she never knew is actually Bollywood's biggest celebrity, Abby travels to Mumbai to meet her father and struggles with cultural differences, the challenges of her identity, and her changing sense of self.
title: Abby Spencer goes to Bollywood

author: Okorafor-Mbachu, Nnedi
description: Not fitting in anywhere, twelve-year-old Sunny lives in Nigeria but was born in America and although her features are African her skin is albino white. But when she discovers she has magical powers, she joins three others to study, learn, and change reality especially when it comes to outsmarting a career criminal who knows magic too.
title: Akata witch

author: Shofner, Corabel
description: When her mother's boyfriend commits a crime and her mother is wrongly imprisoned for it, twelve-year-old Ruby Clyde Henderson's life changes forever. She and her pet pig, Bunny, hide out and make their way to her estranged Aunt Eleanor's home on Paradise Ranch in a peach orchard. Aunt Eleanor has secrets, though, which may make Ruby Clyde's life even harder--but, exploring those secrets may allow Ruby Clyde and Eleanor to heal old wounds and come to trust each other.
title: Almost paradise

author: Yelchin, Eugene
description: Twelve-year-old orphan Arcady copes with his difficult life in a Soviet children's home by spending as much time as possible playing soccer. When Ivan Ivanych, a man who lost his wife to the Stalinist purges, takes Arcady in and offers to coach him, it transforms both of their lives in profound ways.
title: Arcady's goal

author: Weston, Carol
description: When ten-year-old Ava uses her writing talents to help her older sister overcome her shyness, both girls learn the impact their words and stories can have on the world around them.
title: Ava and Pip

author: Roberts, Willo Davis
description: A baby sitter and her three willful charges make a formidable team to outwit their surprised kidnappers.
title: Baby-sitting is a dangerous job

author: Clark, Platte F.
description: Max Spencer is an underachiever but when a carnivorous unicorn, Princess the Destroyer, and an evil wizard, Rezormoor, bring him, the only one who can read the legendary Codex of Infinite Knowability, to their magical realm, he must find the courage to save himself, his friends, and the entire human race.
title: Bad unicorn

author: Wolk, Lauren
description: Twelve-year-old Crow has no memory of her mother. Her life with Osh, the man who found Crow as an infant washed ashore in a small boat near his island home, is all she's ever known. But when Crow spots a fire across the sea on the nearby Penikese Island, it ignites a flame inside of her that propels Crow on a journey to discover her roots.
title: Beyond the bright sea
