author: Poulin, Andrâee
description: Thomas Gagne's mother made him poutine for his fifth birthday and then the next day she abandoned him and his father. On his twelfth birthday, Thomas comes up with a plan to make the world's biggest poutine and get his name in the "Guinness World Records" to get his absent mother to notice. In the process, he learns about himself, his mother, and the power of dreams and friendship.
title: The biggest poutine in the world

author: Lester, Joan Steinau
description: Twenty miles from Oakland, California, where fires have led to racial tension, multi-racial fifteen-year-old Nina faces the bigotry of long-time friends, her parents' divorce, and her brother's misbehavior, while learning of her great-great grandmother Sarah's escape from slavery.
title: Black, white, other

author: Sedgwick, Marcus
description: Inspired by real-life children's book writer, Arthur Ransome, presents historical facts through a fictionalized plot. Leaving England, and an unhappy marriage, behind to work as a British correspondent in Russia during the Russian Revolution. However, he never expects to become the key piece in a game of espionage. Now suspected of being a double agent, Ransome would like nothing more than to flee and leave the turmoil behind him, but the Russian woman he's fallen in love with can't walk away so easily.
title: Blood red snow white

author: Coelho, Rogâerio
description: Wordless pictures convey the story of an old man and a young boy, who may or may not be the same person, separated by distance and perhaps also by time, who meet and bond over an image of a boat the old man drew and set out to sea, which the boy finds and draws himself and his pet cat on board.
title: Boat of dreams

author: Cooper, Susan
description: In this companion volume to "The Boggart," the invisible and mischievous spirit living in the Scottish Castle Keep sets out to help save Nessie the Loch Ness Monster, one of its few remaining cousins.
title: The Boggart and the monster

author: Hatfield, Ruth
description: When his parents disappear after a fierce storm, eleven-year-old Danny, unaccustomed to acts of bravery, comes to their rescue after finding a valuable shard of wood that enables him to talk to plants and animals and battle terrifyingly powerful enemies, including the demonic Sammael.
title: The Book of Storms

author: Cadnum, Michael
description: In twelfth-century England, after his master, a maker of coins for the king, is brutally punished for alleged cheating, seventeen-year-old Edmund finds himself traveling to the Holy Land as squire to a knight crusader on his way to join the forces of Richard Lionheart.
title: The book of the lion

author: Ellis, Deborah
description: After her father is arrested for the crime of having a foreign education, Parvana must transform herself into a boy and earn money for her family in Afghanistan.
title: The breadwinner

author: Rollins, Daniell
description: When Charlotte's best friends Ariel and Devon appear to commit suicide within one month of each other, she's certain their deaths are not so simple. And when she finds clues left behind by her friends, she uncovers a deadly secret about the prep school the girls attended together.
title: Breaking

author: Draper, Penny
description: Robin, who is better known for his pranks than his discipline, is shockingly cast as Puck in the dance company's production of "A Midsummer Night's Dream," a role which actually makes sense for the roguish teen. However, when the principal dancer is injured and Robin is called on to take over, he fears he doesn't have what it takes.
title: Breaking big

author: Wilson, John
description: Steve McLean's vacation in Barcelona, Spain, is cut short when his deceased grandfather is accused of being involved in an international conspiracy involving nukes, spies, the Russian mob, and secret codes.
title: Broken arrow

author: Collins, Suzanne
description: By winning the annual Hunger Games, District 12 tributes Katniss Everdeen and Peeta Mellark have secured a life of safety and plenty for themselves and their families, but because they won by defying the rules, they unwittingly become the faces of an impending rebellion.
title: Catching fire

author: Deedy, Carmen Agra
description: A community of mice and a cheese-loving cat form an unlikely alliance at London's Cheshire Cheese, an inn where Charles Dickens finds inspiration and Queen Victoria makes an unexpected appearance.
title: The Cheshire Cheese cat

author: Nesbet, Anne
description: One day, Noah Keller's ordinary American life is totally overturned when his parents reveal his name isn't actually Noah and that they are taking him to live in East Berlin, behind the Wall. Secrets become deadly. Surprisingly, Noah makes a new friend, Cloud-Claudia, the girl downstairs who lives with her mean grandmother and who has a love for codes and puzzles. Together, Noah and Cloud-Claudia try to find their way in their dangerous, walled new world.
title: Cloud and Wallfish

author: Rex, Adam
description: Scottish Play Doe, known as Scott to the world, is shocked when one of his quirky hallucinations actually tries to steal his backpack. Learning about this hallucination--whose name is Mick, and he is a leprechaun--Scott discovers the evil designs of the Goodco Cereal Company. Together with his genius and supergenius friends Erno and Emily, and a host of strange monsters and silly creatures, Scott and Mick begin their war against Goodco.
title: Cold cereal

author: Jones, Patrick
description: Justin, a bully at his high school in Pearl Harbor, Hawaii, is confused and angry when his father, a respected Navy SEAL returning home from duty, admits he's gay.
tags: Gays and lesbians in the military
title: Combat zone

author: Larson, Hope
description: After escaping the Black Hook Gang in 1860 New York City, twelve-year-old twins Alexander and Cleopatra flee to New Orleans, become separated, and try to find each other in San Francisco, while being followed by pirates who think they hold the key to treasure.
title: Compass south

author: Lisle, Janet Taylor
description: Thirteen-year-old Joelle has always wondered about her life before being adopted by the woman she calls Aunt Louise and her husband Vernon, and she makes some surprising discoveries after Aunt Louise dies.
title: The crying rocks

author: Troupe, Thomas Kingsley
description: When Alex Hanes discovers an odd lens and holds it up to the sun, he accidentally activates the cryptic inscription on it. He and a friend are transported to a shadow world full of ghouls--and it is their feeding time.
title: The dark lens

author: Coleman, K. R.
description: Kendal hopes to reconnect with her distant father on their mountain-climbing trip, but a suspicion that the mountain might be cursed turns their getaway dangerous.
title: Deadman anchor

author: Johnson, Kristin F.
description: During an ice fishing trip with his father, the heat goes out in Zach's family cabin. Zach and his dog are forced out into a massive blizzard and have to fight their way through the storm to find help and Zach's dad before they freeze to death.
title: Deep freeze

author: Schraff, Anne E
description: When Naomi gets a job at the local frozen yogurt shop, everything seems to be going well until she realizes her new boss sees her as more than just a new employee. Meanwhile, she must also contend with the stalking behavior of her former boyfriend.
title: Deliverance

author: Price, Charlie
description: In the California desert, fourteen-year-old Angel is on the run from the man who abused her, killed her mother, and intends to kill her too.
title: Desert Angel

author: Bodeen, S. A
description: Seventeen-year-old Livvy Flynn, a bestselling author of YA fiction, is kidnapped by a woman and her apparently manic daughter who have no intention of letting her go.
title: The detour

author: Murray, Victoria Christopher
description: In Los Angeles, California, four fifteen-year-old best friends, Diamond, Aaliya, Veronique, and India, form a gospel singing group in order to compete in a talent contest that could take them all the way to New York City and a quarter of a million dollar prize.
title: Diamond

author: Reedy, Trent
description: Danny Wright, seventeen, joined the Idaho Army National Guard to serve the country as his father had, but when the Guard is sent to an anti-government protest in Boise and Danny's gun accidently fires, he finds himself at the center of a conflict that results in the federal government declaring war on Idaho.
title: Divided we fall

author: Carter, Nikki
description: Sunday Tolliver is a smash success, but trouble is brewing. Her cousin Dreya and bad-boy rapper Truth are determined to undermine her, she has a new collaborator on her follow-up album, and a new reality show about her causes problems with her love life.
title: Doing my own thing

author: Armentrout, Jennifer L.
description: Seventeen-year-old Sam seems to have everything until she and her best friend, Cassie, disappear one night and now Sam has returned with amnesia, striving to be a much better person and aware that her not remembering may be the only thing keeping Sam alive.
title: Don't look back

author: Van Dolzer, Krista
description: Roped into running for class president against the most popular girl in school, sixth-grader David discovers another side to his opponent when they also get paired up for the spring musical recital.
title: Don't vote for me

author: Marsh, Katherine
description: Happy to be adopted at last, twelve-year-old orphan Mary Hayes soon learns a terrifying secret about her new mother, the mysterious Madame Z.
title: The door by the staircase

author: Raschka, Christopher
description: Contains ten short stories set at 777 Garden Avenue--a mysterious apartment building in New York City where a new doorman takes up his post and watches a variety of eccentric characters come and go.
title: The doorman's repose

author: Pearce, Jackson
description: Overweight and non-athletic, twelve-year-old Hale may have been born and raised to be a spy for the Sub Rosa Society but it seems he is unlikely to become a Field Agent until his parents are captured by the evil League and Hale sets out on a solo mission to save them.
title: The doublecross

author: McCaffrey, Anne
description: Pursuing her dream to be a Harper of Pern, Menolly studies under the Masterharper learning that more is required than a facility with music and a clever way with words.
title: Dragonsinger

author: Sonnenblick, Jordan
description: When his younger brother is diagnosed with leukemia, thirteen-year-old Steven tries to deal with his complicated emotions, his school life, and his desire to support his family.
title: Drums, girls & dangerous pie

author: Chapman, Elsie
description: In a world where everyone has an Alt -- an identical twin -- only one of the pair is allowed to live to adulthood. West Grayer has just received a notice to kill her Alt, and must carry out this task before her Alt eliminates her first.
title: Dualed

author: Christopher, John
description: In a future world where civilization has collapsed, fourteen-year-old Ben sets out on a journey to discover his birthright, and meets members of a technologically advanced remnant, who use machines to foster belief in Demons among the people of Ben's homeland.
title: A dusk of Demons

author: Lassieur, Allison
description: An interactive, choose-your-own adventure depicting life during the Dust Bowl in the United States. Includes three story paths, fifty-three choices, and nineteen endings.
title: The Dust Bowl

author: Jones, Diana Wynne
description: Although an orphan, Earwig has always enjoyed living at St. Morwald's, where she manages to make everyone do her bidding, but when she is taken in by a foster parents who are actually a witch and a demon, she has a hard time trying to turn the situation to her advantage.
title: Earwig and the witch

author: Salerni, Dianne K.
description: One day after his thirteenth birthday, Jax Aubrey awakes to find the world completely empty of all other human beings--except for Riley, his clueless, eighteen-year-old guardian, and Evangeline. This is the Eighth Day, an extra day between Wednesday and Thursday that only a few people on Earth can live in--except Evangeline lives solely in the Eighth Day and nowhere else. Soon Jax is caught up in an ancient, Arthurian conspiracy, as strange men want to use Evangeline to make the Eighth Day the only day at all--thereby destroying everyone who lives only in the seven other days.
title: The eighth day

author: Burgan, Michael
description: Presents an interactive history adventure in which the reader can learn about life for an immigrant arriving at Ellis Island in the 1900s. Offers three story paths, thirty-two choices, and nineteen endings. Also includes a timeline, a glossary, and further resources.
title: Ellis Island

author: Woods, Brend
description: Monterey, Savannah, Jamal, and Eddie have never had much to do with each other until Emako Blue shows up at chorus practice, but just as the lives of the five Los Angeles high school students become intertwined, tragedy tears them apart.
title: Emako Blue

author: Dickmann, Nancy
description: Examines the history of water energy, such as wave power, tidal energy, or hydroelectricity, how it works, and how it could viably replace more polluting sources of energy such as oil and coal.
title: Energy from water

author: Jayne, Hannah
description: Avery, the police chief's daughter, risks her life to uncover the truth about the murder of a friend, Adam, who disappeared during a hike in the woods with his neighbor, Fletcher, whom she later found covered in blood and with no memory of what happened.
title: The escape

author: Lasky, Kathryn
description: Estrella is a filly, daughter of the lead mare, one of a shipment of horses bound for the new world, but when the ship is becalmed and the horses are dropped overboard to lighten the load, Estrella finds that it is up to her to lead the herd to land and safety.
title: The escape

author: Carriger, Gail
description: In an alternate England of 1851, spirited fourteen-year-old Sophronia is enrolled in a finishing school where, she is surprised to learn, lessons include not only the fine arts of dance, dress, and etiquette, but also diversion, deceit, and espionage.
title: Etiquette & espionage

author: Herr, Melody
description: Presents interactive adventures with famous explorers who arrive in the New World. Allows young readers to side with the explorers or with the Native Americans in making decisions.
title: Exploring the new world

author: Franklin, Miriam Spitzer
description: Pansy feels guilty about chickening out on her best friend, Anna, and not going with her to summer camp. She feels even worse when Anna comes home in a wheel chair, having contracted meningitis at camp. Pansy vows to help Anna recover from a surgery that may cure her, bring her back to normal, and when she recovers, Pansy promises to be as crazy and extraordinary as Anna wants her to be.
title: Extraordinary

author: Langan, Paul
description: Martin Luna is in real trouble and his world is falling apart. Frankie, the neighborhood bully is hunting for him with a gun and Martin needs to make a decisive choice before it's too late.
title: The fallen

author: Salten, Felix
description: A young rabbit named Hops, a little ball of gray wool, and his fifteen rabbit friends face many trials and adventures in their first year of living in the busy forest--there are many amazing places to see, but also dangers, like hunters, to avoid.
title: Fifteen rabbits

author: Duffy-Stone, Heather
description: Will's father is running for mayor of New York City on the promise of stamping out corruption and the seedier elements of their home. So the fact that Will has been secretly boxing for the underground Woodrat tournament is a potential election-breaker--and someone wants to expose Will.
title: Fighter's alley

author: Scott, Victori
description: Tella's brother Cody is sick and getting worse, so when she finds instructions on how to become a contender in the dangerous Brimstone Bleed race where she can win a cure for him, she jumps at the chance--but there is no guarantee that she will win, or even survive.
title: Fire & flood

author: Levesque, Haude
description: Explores a range of fish with unique abilities and exhibit unique behavior, such as the archerfish which catches food by spitting water jets at land insects, pufferfish, grunting and whistling male toadfish, and tuskfish and triggerfish that seem to make use of tools.
title: Fish tricks

author: Ahern, Cecelia
description: In a future society where perfection is paramount, Celestine North leads a perfect life, in a perfect body, being a model daughter, sister, and not least the girlfriend of the charming Art Crevan. Then, she makes one instinctive decision, and breaks a rule. Now she faces imprisonment, branding, and being outcast as Flawed.
title: Flawed

author: Breathed, Berke
description: After being framed by a jealous poodle, a dachshund is left for dead, but comes back with a group of mutts from the National Last Ditch Dog Depository to disrupt the prodigious Westminster Kennel Club dog show and exact revenge on the Cassius poodle.
title: Flawed dogs

author: Trevayne, Emma
description: In nineteenth-century London, ten-year-old Jack Foster steps through a doorway and discovers a mysterious world with metal fairies, clockwork dragons, and people with goggles and mechanical limbs. The ruler--the Lady--has chosen Jack to be her flesh-and-blood child and his only chance to escape lies with the Gearwing, a clockwork bird that is currently broken.
title: Flights and chimes and mysterious times

author: Young, Alexa
description: Riley and Maya, Best-Friends-Forever, are tackling seventh grade. Riley develops a crush on new-boy Lucas, Maya forces her to actually talk to him, and a class assignment to give up smartphones for a day brings Riley and Lucas together beyond simple text messages. However, Missy has her eye on Lucas also, which will force Riley to either compete for his attention, or simply win his heart with true friendship.
title: Follow your heart

author: Park, Linda Sue
description: Twelve-year-old Raffa Santana is a prodigy apothecary who has always loved the Forest of Wonders for all the mysterious and potentially magical vegetation he finds there. But when he saves an injured bat using a mysterious red vine that he finds deep in the forest, he is faced with a magic that is both life-saving and dangerous. Intent on warning his uncle and cousin, who are also apothecaries, of the plant's potentially dangerous effects, Raffa travels to Gilden where he realizes the botanical research going on there could threaten the very creatures he hopes to protect.
title: Forest of wonders

author: Gaiman, Neil
description: While picking up milk for his children's cereal, a father is abducted by aliens and finds himself on a wild adventure through time and space.
title: Fortunately, the milk

author: Hilton, Marilyn
description: Eleven-year-old River Rose, bullied at school and missing her older brother, Theron, makes friends with a strange new classmate, Meadow Lark, and the two search for a miracle by floating wishes down the river.
title: Found things

author: Jones, Patrick
description: Paige is excited to have her mom home after serving her final tour with the Air Force, but she's not the mom Paige remembers. Addicted to pain pills, this version of Paige's mother is irritable and disconnected. Paige will do anything to help her mom overcome her addiction, even if it means sacrificing her own ROTC dreams.
title: Freedom flight

author: Young, Alexa
description: Riley sneaks out to a college party but is wracked with guilt afterwards. Then news of Riley and Lucas's first kiss gets out and their friends pressure them into being a couple.
title: Friend power

author: Fitzgerald, Laura Marx
description: In 1929 New York City, twelve-year-old housemaid Martha O'Doyle suspects that a wealthy recluse may be trying to communicate with the outside world through the paintings on her gallery walls.
title: The gallery

author: Lowry, Lois
description: Lame and suddenly orphaned, Kira is mysteriously removed from her squalid village to live in the palatial Council Edifice, where she is expected to use her gifts as a weaver to do the bidding of the all-powerful Guardians.
title: Gathering blue

author: Rooney, Anne
description: Explores genetic engineering and the eight-step development process. Provides an overview of how genes work, the history of genetic engineering, the skills involved in working in genetic engineering, and ethical questions raised in current real-life projects. Includes a glossary, career spotlights, resources for further information, and color photographs.
title: Genetic engineering and developments in biotechnology

author: Valente, Catherynne M.
description: Twelve-year-old September's ordinary life in Omaha turns to adventure when a Green Wind takes her to Fairyland to retrieve a talisman that the new and fickle Marquess wants from the enchanted woods.
title: The girl who circumnavigated Fairyland in a ship of her own making

author: Dorset, Skylar
description: Seventeen-year-old Selkie Stewart is targeted for destruction by her mother, an evil fairie, and the powerful Seelie Court after a prophecy reveals that Selkie will end the Seelie's rule. When Selkie's protector, Ben, is captured, she must face off against her mother and the Seelie Court to rescue him.
title: The girl who never was

author: Albiges, Luke
description: Presents a full-color guide to the best mobile games, including puzzle games, Japanese games, augmented reality games, action games, sports games, and adventures. Features tricks and tips, facts and statistics, and hundreds of ideas to try.
title: Go gaming!

author: Naylor, Phyllis Reynolds
description: Thirteen-year-old Buck Anderson is sad when his best friend moves away and he is bullied for his stuttering. His only joy comes in caving, which he used to do with his friend, but now does alone. He takes a job doing errands for a retired doctor who tells Buck he might be able to cure him of his stuttering. However, before Buck can be cured, he is forced to defend himself against his bully and the retribution puts Buck in danger. Now the only thing that can save him is his knowledge of caving.
title: Going where it's dark

author: Dubosarsky, Ursula
description: In Australia during the Vietnam War, eleven young girls accompany their teacher on a secret field trip to a seaside cave where they meet a mysterious man. When their teacher goes missing, the girls keep silent about what happened and their lives are forever changed.
title: The golden day

author: Westwood, Chris
description: In an alternative London, thirteen-year-old Ben Harvester is recruited by the Ministry of Pandemonium, a secret organization responsible for shepherding lost souls to the afterlife, but soon learns there is another, more sinister soul-hunting organization that now considers him an enemy.
title: Graveyard shift

author: Cooper, Constance
description: Sixteen-year-old orphan Yonie Watereye pretends to be a "pearly," a person endowed with the ability to sense and find "guile," a powerful substance that has the magic to change whoever and whatever it touches, good or ill. It is really Yonie's cat who detects guile--Yonie just profits from it. Rejected by her father's swamp-dwelling family, Yonie investigates her mother's upper-class background, only to uncover a magic conspiracy involving some unknown, malevolent figure, using guile-changed things for greed and power.
title: Guile

author: Vermond, Kira
description: Examines the scientific and social implications of lies from the reasons we lie to when a lie can be a good thing.
title: Half-truths and brazen lies

author: Snow, Alan
description: While gathering food to bring to his grandfather, young Arthur becomes trapped in the city of Ratbridge, where he and some new friends try to stop a plot to shrink the monsters of Arthur's home, the Underworld, for a nefarious purpose.
title: Here be monsters!

author: Jinks, Catherine
description: In 1870s London, a young orphan girl becomes the apprentice to a man who traps monsters for a living.
title: How to catch a bogle

author: Lackey, Mercedes
description: After Joy leaves home to join the legendary Hunters, she discovers that all is not as it seems in her world and her life is in danger from not only the monsters that hunt her world, but also her "allies."
title: Hunter

author: Tanner, Lian
description: For 300 years the massive icebreaker ship "Oyster" has been sailing around the world on the same course. Its residents, born and raised onboard, make up three warring tribes and have forgotten the ship's original purpose. Petrel, a girl without a tribe, lives alone in the ship's hidden places. When a mysterious boy stranded on an iceberg is brought aboard, Petrel hides him before the tribes can execute him. Although the boy has forgotten his own name, he knows he must destroy a terrible secret on the ship.
title: Icebreaker

author: Carter, Ally
description: As a sophomore at a secret spy school and the daughter of a former CIA operative, Cammie is sheltered from "normal teenage life" until she meets a local boy while on a class surveillance mission.
title: I'd tell you I love you, but then I'd have to kill you

author: Gaiman, Neil
description: At nearly fifteen years of age, Joey Harker learns that he is a Walker, able to travel between dimensions, and soon joins a team of different versions of himself, each from another dimension, to fight the evil forces striving to conquer all the worlds.
title: Interworld

author: Vegas, Peter
description: When he arrives in Egypt on what is supposed to be a vacation with his uncle Jasper, Sam Force learns that Jasper is missing and wanted by the police. Sam sets off, following a trail of clues Jasper left behind, but he must compete with the mysterious group of men following close on his uncle's trail. Sam and his new friends Hadi and Mary use Egyptian history to lead them to Jasper before it's too late.
title: The Iron Tomb

author: Chapman, Fern Schumer
description: Based on the author's mother's experience, tells the story of Edith a young Jew who is sent in 1938 by her parents to Chicago, Illinois, where she lives with an aunt and uncle and tries to assimilate into American culture, while worrying about her parents and mourning the loss of everything she has ever known. Includes information about a program that brought twelve hundred Jewish children to safety during World War II.
title: Is it night or day?

author: Miller, Kirsten
description: Ananka Fishbein enters a sinkhole near her New York City apartment and discovers Shadow City, a long-forgotten civilization beneath New York's streets. She meets a mysterious girl named Kiki Strike, who seems to appear and disappear as if by magic.
title: Kiki Strik

author: Kirby, Matthew J.
description: When Owen tries to clear his father of a crime using an Animus--a device that reveals genetic memory--Owen gets more than he bargained for. After uncovering the Trident of Eden, a relic that was long considered a mere legend, two secret organizations are after the Trident, putting Owen in grave danger.
title: Last descendants

author: Lupica, Mike
description: Twelve-year-old Tommy Gallagher is the bravest on his football team, thanks to his firefighter-father who taught him everything he knows. But when Tommy watches an ambulance race away from a fire toward the hospital with his dad inside, Tommy's battles suddenly have nothing to do with a football field.
title: Last man out

author: Bailey, Kristin
description: A orphaned sixteen-year-old servant in Victorian England finds love while unraveling the secrets of a mysterious society of inventors and their most dangerous creation.
title: Legacy of the clockwork key

author: Spalding, Esta
description: Kim Fitzgerald-Trout and her three siblings live in an old car on a tropical island and have no problem driving wherever they need to go. When the kids decide to search for a real home, however, their crafty skills and family trust will be put to the test.
title: Look out for the Fitzgerald-Trouts

author: George, Madeleine
description: Two high school girls, one an anorexic poet and the other an obese loner, form an unlikely friendship.
title: Looks

author: Fry, Erin
description: Tired of being obese and reeling from his father's recent stroke, thirteen-year-old Bennett joins the cross country team to find out if there is more to life than French fries.
title: Losing it

author: Turner, Tracey
description: In this interactive adventure, the reader is lost in the Pacific Ocean and must make the right choices to survive. Includes scientific facts, true lost-at-sea stories, illustrations, a glossary, and sources of further information.
title: Lost in the sea of despair

author: Searles, Rachel
description: Chase Garrety wakes up on the planet Trucon behind a fence he never should have been able to cross. He has a blaster wound on the back of his head, and his memory is completely gone, except for his name and a message he knows he has to deliver to someone: "guide the star."
title: The lost planet

author: Rivers, Karen
description: Ish dreams of going to Mars, a place where she feels like she belongs. But when she gets an unexpected diagnosis, the news threatens to rewrite her whole future.
title: Love, Ish

author: Bayard, Louis
description: With her mother recently deceased and her father gone since her birth, Amelia suddenly finds herself in charge of not only her younger brother and sister, but also the family gas station. The Great Depression is in effect and things are tough. When Harley Blevins, of the rival Standard Oil, comes to buy the station, Amelia bravely refuses. The only way to save the family business is to find herself a father, real or fictional, who can hold off Blevins and keep her siblings out of foster care until she comes of age.
title: Lucky strikes

author: Hapka, Cathy
description: Maddie loves her pony, Cloudy, but Cloudy's previous owners now want her back to give to their daughter. Maddie and her friends Nina, Brooke, and Haley, hatch a plot to save Cloudy from her old owners.
title: Maddie's dream

author: Ryan, Carrie
description: The Map to Everywhere is highly sought for obvious reasons. Master thief Fin wants it so he can find his mother. Suburban schoolgirl Marrill needs it to get back to her world after becoming trapped in the Pirate Stream. Marrill and Fin band together to find the map before the evil captain of a ghost ship can get it first.
title: The map to everywhere

author: Clements, Andrew
description: Sixth-grader Alton Barnes loves maps, and when his portfolio of secret maps is stolen, he begins getting notes with orders that he must obey to get the maps back but, with the help of a popular classmate, he just might succeed before his teacher, principal, or someone else learns he has been studying and mapping things about them.
title: The map trap

author: McCaffrey, Laura Williams
description: Sixteen-year-old Lyla Northstrom finds herself marked as a criminal which means she has no hope of attending the university and she's destined to live in the shadowy underground of her controlling society. But when she's offered a chance to erase her mark, she'll have to decide if it's worth the cost of sacrificing those she loves.
title: Marked

author: Seidler, Tor
description: Margaret, a mean, cranky, terrifyingly loud human child, is chucked out of the house by her eight other siblings. Taken in by Phoebe and Fred the woodchucks, Margaret finds a new home--however, she is just as loud and obnoxious in her new one as in her old. It will take the help of all of Phoebe and Fred's animal friends to teach and tame the little human child.
title: Mean Margaret

author: Schraff, Anne E.
description: When Mona Lisa is asked out by Julio Avila, track team star, she at first thinks he must be crazy. Mona Lisa suffers from low self-esteem and thinks she is only an average beauty. Then her mother forbids her from dating Julio, and her mind changes.
title: Misjudged

author: Wilson, John
description: Steve goes with his grandfather on a birthday trip to a remote lake, which seems boring at first. Then Steve discovers the tale of the death of Tom Thomson and sets about the quest to find his missing skull--which may be a part of his grandpa's plans, or else something more sinister.
title: The missing skull

author: Collins, Suzanne
description: Two-time Hunger Games survivor Katniss Everdeen is targeted by a vengeful Capitol that vows to make Katniss and all of District 12 pay for the current unrest.
title: Mockingjay

author: Wegelius, Jakob
description: Sally Jones is a loyal friend, a top-notch engineer, and an excellent chess player. She is also a gorilla. She never speaks, but she understands everything humans say. Together with her human friend, Chief, Sally works aboard the "Hudson Queen," a cargo ship, but her content and safe life is upended when a deal goes wrong and Chief is falsely convicted of murder. Now Sally Jones is on a mission to clear her friend's name and stop powerful forces who would do anything to keep their secrets hidden.
title: The murderer's ape

author: McClintock, Norah
description: In 1964 Indiana, aspiring reporter Cady investigates a murder connected to her past, and uncovers racism, dirty politics, police corruption, and family secrets.
title: My life before me

author: Hobbs, Will
description: Fifteen-year-old half-Inuit Nick and his white brother, Ryan, meet and share an adventure on the Firth River in the Canadian Arctic, facing white water, wild animals, and fierce weather as Ryan documents the effects of climate change on caribou for National Geographic magazine.
title: Never say die

author: Houston, Julian
description: As a new sophomore at an exclusive boarding school, a young black man is witness to the persecution of another student with bad acne who is also Jewish.
title: New boy

author: Xu, Ru
description: Blue is an orphan girl who's been dressing up as a boy to keep her job as a newsboy at a local paper. Soon Blue befriends Crow, a boy who is also not what he seems, and together they seek the freedom to be their true selves.
title: Newsprints

author: Weintraub, Robert
description: Explores the true story of Frank Williams, an air force technician, and Judy, a purebred pointer, who met in a POW camp during World War II. Frank and Judy bonded together to survive and inspire fellow prisoners in the camp.
title: No better friend

author: Fitzhugh, Louise
description: Through a series of family disagreements over her seven-year-old brother's efforts to become a dancer and her own determination to be a lawyer, eleven-year-old Emma realizes that it is up to children to take the initiative since parents rarely change.
title: Nobody's family is going to change

author: Hautman, Pete
description: After thirteen-year-old Tucker Feye's parents disappear, he suspects that the strange disks of shimmering air that he keeps seeing are somehow involved. When he steps inside of one, he is whisked on a time-twisting journey, trailed by a shadowy sect of priests, and haunted by ghostlike figures.
title: The obsidian blade

author: Horvath, Polly
description: In a small fishing village in British Columbia, twelve-year-old Primrose tries to be a matchmaker for her Uncle Jack, befriends Ked, a new foster child, tries to decide if she is willing to go to jail for her convictions, and together with Ked, publishes a cook book to raise money for the Fisherman's Aid. Includes recipes.
title: One year in Coal Harbor

author: Schmidt, Gary D.
description: When Jack meets his new foster brother Joseph, he never imagines the bonds the two will form as they work together to find Joseph's daughter Jupiter. They will journey into a brotherhood that will rip open old wounds and require sacrifices from them both.
title: Orbiting Jupiter

author: Smith, Sherri L.
description: In this futuristic tale, the Gulf Coast has been quarantined after a string of deadly hurricanes and epidemic of Delta Fever. Years later, Fen de la Guerre is a member of the O-Positive primitive tribe living in the Delta. When her people are ambushed, Fen is left responsible for a newborn. She is determined to get the baby over the wall before its blood is tainted by the Delta Fever. Her only hope for her and the baby's survival is Daniel, a scientist from the Outer States searching for a cure.
title: Orleans

author: Fandel, Jennifer
description: Explores the life and work of artist Pablo Picasso, featuring many examples of his paintings. Discusses his early life, career, and the world events that shaped his art. Includes a timeline, glossary, index, and excerpt of Picasso's own writing.
title: Pablo Picasso

author: Frost, Mark
description: A fifteen-year-old boy who has spent his entire life trying to avoid attention finds himself in the middle of a millennia-old struggle between titanic forces when he is simultaneously recruited by an exclusive prep school and followed by sinister agents.
title: The Paladin prophecy

author: Hyde, Catherine Ryan
description: Young Trevor McKinney tries to change the world by doing favors for three people and then asking those three people to "pay it forward" by doing favors for others, but his first three attempts seem doomed to failure, until fame comes knocking.
title: Pay it forward

author: Alexander, Kwame
description: Features positive stories, inspirational quotes from famous athletes, and fifty-two rules for a successful life.
title: The playbook

author: Courtenay, Bryce
description: Follows Peekay, a white British boy in South Africa during World War II, between the ages of five and eleven, as he survives an abusive boarding school and goes on to succeed in life and the boxing ring, with help from a chicken, a boxer, a pianist, black African prisoners, and many others.
title: The power of one

author: Paquette, Ammi-Joan
description: Despite having the Queen's basin safely in her control, Princess Juniper must contend with the chaos surrounding the attacks on the Kingdom of Thor which has led to her father's captivity. As she sets out to do what she can to help her father and regain the horses that have been stolen from Basin, she finds herself and her companions in the presence of the Anju, the tribe that shunned her mother before Juniper's birth. This could be the opportunity she's been waiting for to command an army and prove herself as a brave and strong leader.
title: Princess Juniper of the Anju

author: Smith, D. J.
description: The further adventures and misadventures of twelve-year-old Paolo, his six-year-old brother Georgie, and their nine-year-old deaf cousin Billy as they try to find their missing dog, cope with a new paper route, and discover romance in their small California town in 1951.
title: Probably the world's best story about a dog and the girl who loved me

author: Lu, Marie
description: June and Day make their way to Las Vegas where they join the rebel Patriot group and become involved in an assassination plot against the Elector in hopes of saving the Republic.
title: Prodigy

author: Moore, Stephanie Perry
description: Perry Skky Jr. faces more challenging tests such as a run-in with a violent gang, his sick grandmother, temptation, and the impending National Championship football game during the start of the New Year.
title: Promise kept

author: McVoy, Terra Elan
description: Fifteen-year-old Tabitha and her four best friends all wear purity rings to symbolize their pledge to remain virgins until they marry, but when one admits that she has broken the pledge each girl must reexamine her faith, friendships, and what it means to be pure.
title: Pure

author: Castillo, Gary D
description: David loves to sing and hopes to compete in a local competition at an African American church, but he needs the help of the community to overcome the obstacles of racism and his father's disapproval.
title: Quesadilla moon

author: Tintera, Amy
description: After being shot and killed and then brought back to life 178 minutes later, Wren Connolly discovers she is a Reboot, a powerful soldier for the Human Advancement and Repopulation Corporation. Left less than human, Wren finds a connection to her lost life when she is ordered to train a new Reboot, Callum, whose lingering humanity convinces her to try and regain what she has lost.
title: Reboot

author: Bradford, Chris
description: As the son of a British bodyguard who sacrificed his life in the line of duty, teenage kickboxing champion Connor Reeves is proud to join the ranks of a top-secret young bodyguard squad, but his first assignment, to guard the First Daughter, may test his limits.
title: Recruit

author: Cherry, Alison
description: In Scarletville, the only thing that matters in society is having red hair. Felicity St. John seems to have it all--a hot boyfriend, artistic talent, a good shot at winning the Miss Scarlet pageant, and good friends. It is all a sham--her hair is the product of a bottle. Her true hair color is her secret--and that secret is discovered. Felicity will go to any lengths to keep it, but in the process she may discover she has issue with Scarletville's prejudices after all.
title: Red

author: Gratz, Alan
description: Follows the stories of three refugee children from different eras. Josef is a young Jewish boy escaping from the threat of concentration camps in the 1938; Isabel escapes the violence in Castro's Cuba in 1994; and Mahmoud, Syrian boy sneaking into Europe in 2015. Follows each of their journeys and the harrowing, dangerous obstacles that stood in their way as they searched for a better life.
title: Refugee

author: Walters, Eric
description: Before an asteroid collides with Earth, sure to destroy life as they know it, sixteen-year-old Billy Phillips and 100 young recruits are tasked with surviving on board a space station under the guidance of Dr. Joshua Fitchett, a scientific genius. After the dangers of the asteroid have dissipated, Billy and his friends will return one day to repopulate the world, and hopefully do civilization better this time around. However, before getting back to Earth, Billy and his friends will have to survive space, which proves just as difficult as surviving on the planet.
title: Regenesis

author: Korman, Gordon
description: Chase does not remember falling off the roof, in fact he does not remember anything about himself, and when he gets back to middle school he begins to learn who he was through the reactions of the other kids--trouble is, he really is not sure he likes the Chase that is being revealed, but can he take the opportunity amnesia has provided and restart his life?
title: Restart

author: Jones, Patrick
description: When Xavier's father returns to Boston after serving ten years in federal prison, tensions quickly mount and Xavier's anger explodes on the baseball field, making it less likely that he will achieve his dream of playing in the major leagues than that he will follow his father's path.
title: Returning to normal

author: Croggon, Alison
description: The further translation of a manuscript from the lost civilization of Edil-Amarandah which chronicles the experiences of sixteen-year-old Maerad, a gifted Bard, as she seeks the answer to the Riddle of the Treesong and continues to battle the Dark forces.
title: The riddle

author: Sanderson, Brandon
description: As Wild Chalklings threaten the American Isles and Rithmatists are humanity's only defense, Joel can only watch as Rithmatist students learn the magical art that he would do anything to practice.
title: The Rithmatist

author: Brouwer, Sigmund
description: When Webb moves to Nashville to make his mark as a singer-songwriter, he finds out how tough the music business can be.
title: Rock the boat

author: Tintera, Amy
description: Emelina Flores witnessed the brutal murder of her parents and the kidnapping of her sister before she was left with nothing. Driven by her thirst for revenge, Em sets out to infiltrate the royal family in the enemy kingdom in an attempt to save her sister. Marrying the prince was all part of her plan, but when love begins to seep into her hate, it could cost her everything.
title: Ruined

author: Fallenstein, J.
description: A teenaged boy who has trouble sleeping loves to read in bed, but things take an unexpected turn when weird lights begin to flash S.O.S. through his window.
title: S.O.S.

author: Stiles, Martha Bennett
description: In the mid-eighteen hundreds, while serving as cook's apprentice on his uncle's schooner with his pet monkey, Allie, twelve-year-old Ray discovers that they are transporting a fugitive slave to the free north.
title: Sailing to freedom

author: Macdonald, Fiona
description: Nine-year-old Willow and her classmates put on a production of "The Nutcracker" to celebrate their friend Samira's garden.
title: Samira's garden

author: Bowen, Carl
description: Part way through integrating their first female member into the Shadow Squadron, Lieutenant Commander Ryan Cross and his team are called upon to investigate the possible kidnapping of a powerful senator's son in Mali--and find themselves confronting an infamous slaver called the Spider.
title: Sand spider

author: Dashner, James
description: After surviving horrific conditions in the Maze, Thomas is entrapped, along with nineteen other boys, in a scientific experiment designed to observe their responses and gather data believed to be essential for the survival of the human race.
title: The Scorch trials

author: Vernick, Audrey
description: Twelve-year-old Casey lives with his father and grandfather at their family-run umpire school, and as he deals with middle school and his mother's unwelcome return, he stumbles on a sensational story that has him questioning his dream of becoming a journalist.
title: Screaming at the ump

author: Jakubowski, Michele
description: Astrid, Rowan, and Quinn are determined to get to the bottom of the mystery surrounding the new residents of Somerville, a boy named Jace and his mom. Includes a glossary, discussion questions, and writing prompts.
title: Secrets in Somerville

author: Hunter, Erin
description: In a troubled time for the Clans, three young cats, grandchildren of the legendary Firestar, begin their training as warriors and, in the course of many adventures, discover their true destiny.
title: The sight

author: Hartnett, Sonya
description: Two young sisters find an injured soldier, temporarily blinded by his battles in World War I, and decide to help care for him, bringing him stolen food and comforting items. The sisters soon become fascinated with a tiny silver donkey the solder holds in his hand.
title: The silver donkey

author: Van Draanen, Wendelin
description: Seventh-grader Dave Sanchez and his talking gecko sidekick Sticky decide they must rescue an odious science teacher who has been kidnapped by the even more villanous Damien Black, who is masquerading as a substitute teacher in order to steal Dave's magic Aztec armband.
title: Sinister substitute

author: Cowan, Brad V.
description: When Cale receives a mysterious letter from his dad, the Seven Stair Crew learns of three super-secret skateboard sites where they can skate on some gnarly set-ups. For Cale the quest to find these sites is also a chance to find out more about the dad he never knew.
title: The sinkhole

author: Paulsen, Gary
description: Six misfit children who find themselves stuck in a middle school bathroom during a horrible storm with a stuffed cat find unexpected friendship.
title: Six kids and a stuffed cat

author: Crutcher, Chris
description: Billy, recently deceased, keeps an eye on his best friend, fourteen-year-old Eddie, who has added to his home and school problems by becoming mute, and helps him stand up to a conservative minister and English teacher who is orchestrating a censorship challenge.
title: The sledding hill

author: Castaldo, Nancy F
description: Profiles different types of working dogs who use their sense of smell to help humans, by accomplishing tasks such as locating missing persons, explosives and narcotics, and human remains, and by identifying medical ailments. Includes a list of additional resources, suggestions on how to get involved, and a glossary.
title: Sniffer dogs

author: Auxier, Jonathan
description: When a mysterious boy arrives at her father's bookshop with his companions and a rare and mysterious book, twelve-year-old Sophie finds herself in an adventure beyond anything she has read about in her father's books.
title: Sophie Quire and the last Storyguard

author: Samuels, Charlie
description: Describes the role of espionage in World War II. Discusses national security, civil defense, and code breaking. Includes photographs, eyewitness accounts, color maps, biographical sketches, a World War II timeline, a glossary, and further reading.
title: Spying and security

author: Rhodes, Jewell Parker
description: In 1870, Reconstruction brings big changes to the Louisiana sugar plantation where spunky ten-year-old Sugar has always lived, including changes to her friendship with Billy, the son of her former master, and the arrival of workmen from China.
title: Sugar

author: Verdi, Jessica
description: When her recently widowed mother finds out that seventeen-year-old Lexi is a lesbian, she wants to send Lexi to a fundamentalist Christian summer camp designed to make her straight. Lexi agrees, determined to help her grieving mother and pull her family back together. But when she falls for a fellow camper, Lexi discovers that denying who she is is much harder than she thought.
title: The summer I wasn't me

author: Moore, Stephanie Perry
description: Payton Skky is finally headed in the right direction with her life, especially with the help of Tad, but they may not be able to patch up their broken hearts since things around them are still too unsettled.
title: Surrendered heart

author: Riordan, Rick
description: Magnus Chase, a homeless boy living in Boston, finds out he is the son of a Norse god.
title: The sword of summer

author: MacHale, D. J.
description: When a secret branch of the U.S. Navy known as SYLO quarantines Pemberwick Island, Maine, claiming it has been struck by a deadly virus, high schooler Tucker is wrapped up in the ensuing chaos. Knowing there is more to the story, Tucker investigates and uncovers clues that could reveal the truth behind this perplexing mystery.
title: Sylo

author: Green, Roger Lancelyn
description: Retells twenty stories of magic, adventure, and mythology first told in ancient Egypt.
title: Tales of ancient Egypt

author: Womack, Darryl
description: Nat dreams of growing up to become a knight. When one day he stumbles across a giant dragon egg in the forest, it hatches an unexpected companion for Nat, and the two embark on adventure after adventure to keep their kingdom safe.
title: Tales of Westerford

author: Montgomery, Sy
description: Details the efforts of field scientist Pati Medici to locate Brazil's lowland tapir and lead efforts to protect this rare creature. Outlines the technology Pati and her team use to achieve their goal and features color photographs throughout.
title: The tapir scientist

author: Senker, Cath
description: Examines the plants, animals, people, and weather of temperate climates. Also discusses how climate change is threatening this environment. Includes fact boxes, sidebars, color photographs, a glossary, and further resources.
title: Temperate climates

author: Turner, Megan Whalen
description: Gen flaunts his ingenuity as a thief and relishes the adventure which takes him to a remote temple of the gods where he will attempt to steal a precious stone.
title: The thief

author: Baccalario, Pierdomenico
description: When a reunion of the Enchanted Emporium's shopkeeper families turns out to be a trap, Finley McPhee races to find out where the meeting is being held and rescue his friend Aiby Lily, all while fending off the evil Semueld Askell.
title: The thief of mirrors

author: Dlugos, Jenn
description: Examines how some of the world's roughest, meanest, weirdest, craziest, and creepiest species in both the plant and animal kingdoms adapt and survive, including barking and super-sized spiders, zombie ants, parasitic mistletoe, and other species. Includes color photographs, fact boxes, and quizzes.
title: Things that make you go yuck

author: McVoy, Terra Elan
description: After Fiona's journal is stolen and read aloud on the bus and her best friend does nothing about it, Fiona finds herself spending the summer without friends and learning more about herself.
title: This is all your fault, Cassie Parker

author: Herrick, Amy
description: When the Time Fetch's foragers are accidentally released to gobble up time, they cause the fabric of the universe to unravel and the boundaries between worlds and dimensions to blur. Now eighth-grader Edward and his classmates Feenix, Danton, and Brigit must band together to save the day.
title: The time fetch

author: Nix, Garth
description: Presents a collection of nineteen short science fiction, realistic fiction, fantasy, paranormal, mystery, and adventure stories.
title: To hold the bridge

author: Hausman, Gerald
description: In 1813, a fourteen-year-old British navy lieutenant records in his logbook a perilous journey as he and his men attempt to return a group of slaves to the Jamaican plantation from which pirates stole them; pirates who are determined to reclaim their booty.
title: Tom Cringle

author: Jones, Patrick
description: While Hector trains for his first amateur MMA fight, his is set back by unresolved issues within his personal life. In order for him to have a chance to succeed, Hector must first confront his personal demons and set things right with himself.
title: Triangle choke

author: Lee, Stacey
description: In 1849 Samantha, a Chinese girl, and Annamae, a runaway slave, disguise themselves as young men named Sammy and Andy and travel along the Oregon Trail to California in hopes of making new lives for themselves.
title: Under a painted sky

author: Porter, Sarah
description: In Vassa's enchanted Brooklyn neighborhood, where the nights are mysteriously growing longer, the working class go about their days trying to avoid magic. Vassa keeps a magical wooden doll, Erg--a gift from her deceased mother--cleverly hidden from the prying eyes of her stepmother and awful stepsister. And when she finds herself in the clutches of the evil shop owner, Babs Yagg, who has a penchant for beheading anyone she suspects of shoplifting, Erg's magic might be her only hope for survival.
title: Vassa in the night

author: Feinstein, John
description: After moving to a new town his freshman year in high school, Alex Myers is happy to win a spot on the varsity team as a quarterback but must deal with idea of not playing for two years since the first-string quarterback is not only a local hero, he is also son of the corrupt head coach.
title: The walk on

author: Blakemore, Megan Frazer
description: Moving into an inherited mansion in Maine with their mother and stroke-afflicted father, three siblings uncover a mystery involving hidden passageways, family rivalries, and healing waters.
title: The Water Castle

author: Pratchett, Terry
description: A young witch-to-be named Tiffany teams up with the Wee Free Men, a clan of six-inch-high blue men, to rescue her baby brother and ward off a sinister invasion from Fairyland.
title: The Wee Free Men

author: Gantos, Jack
description: Joey tries to keep his life from degenerating into total chaos when his mother sends him to be home-schooled with a hostile blind girl, his divorced parents cannot stop fighting, and his grandmother is dying of emphysema.
title: What would Joey do?

author: Macy, Sue
description: Discusses how the invention of the bicycle allowed women to take charge of personal transportation and set the stage for women's future battles for rights equal to men. Discusses how the bicycle has evolved throughout the ages and features photographs and illustrations, a timeline, and further reading sources.
title: Wheels of change

author: Hill, Susan
description: In a small Missouri town during the 1920s, Clem is torn between family responsibility and the life he wishes to lead when he must begin working in the lead mine on his thirteenth birthday to help pay for his sister's medical care.
title: Whistle in the dark

author: Pierce, Tamora
description: The mage Numair, the knight Alanna, and Queen Thayet enlist thirteen-year-old Daine's help to battle the dreadful immortal creatures that have recently begun to attack the kingdom of Tortall.
title: Wild magic

author: Kortâe, Steven
description: Presents information about the fictional history of Wonder Woman, Princess Diana of the magical island of Themyscira, including information on her allies, enemies, and powers.
title: Wonder Woman

author: Arntson, Steven
description: In a world of Deaths--tall, glimmering grey creatures, with gills--which follow their humans around, and must stand in line for coffee just like everyone else, sixteen-year-old Gabriela has received the worst letter possible: her Death has given her seven days. She has too many things left to do, like a first kiss with dreamy Sylvester Hale would be nice. Humans are allowed to make requests in their "Wrap-up List" they get to write, and so Gabriela writes for her first kiss, and the first kiss for a few of her friends as well.
title: The wrap-up list

author: McDaniel, Lurlene
description: Eighteen-year-olds Ciana Beauchamp, Arie Winslow, and Eden McLauren of Tennessee rely on their close friendship as they face serious problems the summer before they start college, from parents' illnesses, to cancer, to two loving the same cowboy.
title: The year of luminous love

author: Rissman, Rebecca
description: Highlights the history and benefits of yoga. Contains a selection of yoga poses with step-by-step, illustrated instructions. Includes a glossary and resources for further information.
title: Yoga for you

author: Gardner, Whitney
description: When Julia's attempt to cover up a slur about her best friend painted on the gymnasium walls at her deaf school results in her being expelled after the same friend rats her out, she finds herself feeling like an outcast in the mainstream school in her suburb. As she tries to ease her angst by painting graffiti around her town, she finds herself in a turf war with another artist. Expressing herself through her art might land her in even hotter water if she's not careful, but her graffiti is the only part of her identity that makes sense to her now that she's the only deaf kid in her class so it's a risk she's willing to take.
title: You're welcome, universe

author: Higgins, Nadia
description: When Rotfield Middle School students start turning into zombies, Leo and his friends are the only ones who can discover the cause of the outbreak and save them before it's too late.
title: Zombie field day

author: Murray, Victoria Christopher
description: A gospel quartet of girls, the Divine Divas, are in the finals of a competition that could win them a recording contract. The group is given a professional mentor and Diva Aaliyah is upset that their mentor is superstar Zena, the mother who abandoned her as a baby to pursue her career.
title: Aaliyah

author: McClintock, Norah
description: After Derek disappears during a snow storm, his girlfriend Jordie finds herself under suspicion.
title: About that night

author: Frederick, Heather Vogel
description: Unusually tall twelve-year-old Truly Lovejoy moves with her family to the tiny town of Pumpkin Falls, New Hampshire, and uncovers a mysterious letter in an old book at her family's bookstore that leads her and her friends on a dangerous treasure hunt around town.
title: Absolutely Truly

author: Dickinson, Peter
description: Before the war in Nagala ended, carrying an AK-47 and fighting alongside other young boys was the only life twelve-year-old Paul had ever known. With no family and the mind of a warrior, Paul tries to integrate into "normal" life. When his adoptive father is arrested and violence breaks out in the capital, Paul leaves behind any hopes of childhood and sets his sights on surviving.
title: AK

author: Terrill, Cristin
description: Sometime in an undetermined future, Em languishes in her cell, captive of a sadistic madman who calls himself a doctor. Taped inside the drain of her toilet is a list of instructions for building a time machine that could destroy all reality--a time machine she has had to use to go back in the past and attempt different ways to undo it. If she does not find the correct way of disassembling the machine, war will consume all of her timelines, and then who knows what the future will hold.
title: All our yesterdays

author: Howe, James
description: While his friends Bobby, Joe, and Addie are spending the summer on exciting adventures, thirteen-year-old Skeezie Tookis--also known as Elvis--must get a job and help around the house, and things only get worse when his long-lost father appears. Now Skeezie has a decision to make that could change his life.
title: Also known as Elvis

author: La Bella, Laura
description: Focuses on the governments and geography of the civilizations in the ancient Mesopotamian region of the Near East. Discusses the different empires and how government and geography shaped culture; what a civilization is; where exactly Mesopotamia was located; their greatest achievements; the Fertile Crescent, and life along the river and in the desert; and the governments, city-states, and religions. Includes color photographs and illustrations, maps, a glossary, and sources for more information.
title: Ancient Mesopotamian government and geography

author: Blake, Kendare
description: Thousands of years after people have stopped believing in her, the ancient Greek goddess Athena discovers she has come down with a strange illness: feathers are sprouting underneath her skin, and could puncture her lungs. Hermes finds her and informs her about his blazing fever that is burning him up, literally. Desperate to preserve their immortality, Athena and Hermes seek the help of the still-living prophetess Cassandra, who informs them that a war has begun between them and Hera, who seeks to prolong her own life by taking theirs.
title: Antigoddess

author: Sonnenblick, Jordan
description: Rich, a fifteen-year-old guitar player, takes his dad's prized possession--a guitar signed by Jimi Hendrix--and finds himself magically transported to Woodstock in 1969 where he encounters his dad and uncle as teens and learns truths that change his life forever.
title: Are you experienced?

author: Dooley, Sarah
description: After her Mama Lacy dies, twelve-year-old Fella is forcibly taken away from her other mother, Mama Shannon, and her sister, Zany, by the court, who think she will be better off with a blood relation. Now Fella has to adjust to life with her grandmother, Mrs. Madison, whose home has many comforts Fella was not used to. Then one night Zany shows up unexpectedly and plans to run away with Fella in order to scatter the ashes of Mama Lacy and discover their true selves.
title: Ashes to Asheville

author: Vernon, Ursula
description: When ninja frogs try to kidnap the new foreign exchange student at Danny Dragonbreath's school, Danny steps up and uses his kung fu moves to defeat them.
title: Attack of the ninja frogs

author: Schraff, Anne E.
description: When Naomi's trouble-making cousin comes to live with her and her parents, Naomi is shocked at her cousin's bad behavior--she refuses to do chores or homework, and being responsible is not in her nature. Naomi will have to help her behave, or else her cousin will get in more trouble than she can get out of.
title: Bad blood

author: Jennings, Jazz
description: The author, Jazz Jennings, shares her journey from being a girl toward becoming a young woman as a transgender teen.
title: Being Jazz

author: Fontes, Justine
description: When Benny's father, Xavier, returns from being in Iraq for more than a year, he suffers from post-traumatic stress disorder that causes him to yell constantly. He causes a scene at a school function and embarrasses Benny so much that Benny decides to run away, but in his attempt to run away is mugged. Benny knows he must learn to deal with his dad both in good times and bad.
title: Benito runs

author: O'Sullivan, Joanne
description: In Bayou Perdu, Louisiana, lives sixteen-year-old Evangeline Riley, a girl who holds two titles in the under-sixteen fishing rodeo and loves nothing more than being on her skiff between the bayou water and the open sky. Her peaceful life is totally changed by Hurricane Katrina. Chaos tears her world apart, but it also causes her to meet Tru, an attractive boy her age. However, love is hard to develop when neither of them seems to have a home anymore.
title: Between two skies

author: McQuerry, Maureen
description: When mythical creatures appear, a mystery of unparalleled proportions begins to unfold for Timothy, his sister Sarah, and school bully Jessica, who must defeat the powers of the Darkness.
title: Beyond the door

author: Smith, Dan
description: While performing a coming-of-age ritual in his remote mountain village, thirteen-year-old Oskari comes across the crashed Air Force One plane containing the President of the United States, who has survived the crash. Oskari must help the president outwit the mysterious enemies who are attempting to assassinate him.
title: Big game

author: Swallow, Gerry
description: When ill-mannered, eleven-year-old Elspeth Pule awakens in a strange forest where nursery rhyme character dwell, she must both learn compassion and teach the merits of a good temper tantrum in order to return home.
title: Blue in the face

author: Wilson, John
description: While visiting a dinosaur dig in Drumheller, Alberta, friends Sam and Annabel learn that an unsavory collector of stolen goods named Humphrey Battleford is attempting to steal a scientifically significant find, and they set out to stop him.
title: Bones

author: Boyne, John
description: Bored and lonely after his family moves from Berlin to a place called "Out-With" in 1942, Bruno, the son of a Nazi officer, befriends a boy in striped pajamas who lives behind a wire fence.
title: The boy in the striped pajamas

author: Schmidt, Tiffany
description: Jonah Prentiss's life in Cross Point is so different from what it was in his old town, which is just down the road. This has made him jaded and aloof, which is the reason why he is the only person who won't give Brighton Waterford the time of day--and that drives Brighton crazy. She is beautiful, well respected, and nice, and won't give up on Jonah.
title: Bright before sunrise

author: Milford, Kate
description: When Sam Noctiluca learns of an evil force seeking to harness the power created by the crossroad at the intersection of the Brooklyn Bridge and the East River, he races to find a way to stop it from attacking New York City.
title: The Broken Lands

author: Koja, Kathe
description: Justin spends time with Jinsen, the unusual and artistic new student whom the school bullies torment and call Buddha Boy, and ends up making choices that impact Jinsen, himself, and the entire school.
title: Buddha boy

author: Forrest, Tim
description: Features dozens of bug-themed activities and experiments for children accompanied by hundreds of color photographs. Includes tips for rearing, collecting, and keeping insects.
title: Bug camp

author: Lassieur, Allison
description: Presents a choose-your-own-adventure story about the building of the Great Wall of China, as readers choose to live out the stories of a peasant forced to work on the Wall, a bricklayer during the Ming Dynasty, or an architect designing the Ming towers and battlements.
title: Building the Great Wall of China

author: Campbell, L. A.
description: Sixth-grader Hal gets a year-long journal-keeping assignment in his least favorite class, history, much to the delight of his history buff father.
title: Cartboy and the time capsule

author: Rinaldi, Ann
description: In South Carolina in 1780, fourteen-year-old Caroline sees the Revolutionary War take a terrible toll among her family and friends and, along with a startling revelation about her own background, comes to understand the true nature of war.
title: Cast two shadows

author: Lu, Marie
description: June and Day are on the brink of triumph. Their efforts have brought into existence a new Republic of freedom and equality. June is Princeps-Elect, and Day is in one of the highest positions the military can offer. The carpet is yanked from their feet when a deadly plague breaks out, the fear of which threatens to plunge the nation back into chaos. To stop it, June and Day may have to give up everything they have worked for--even each other.
title: Champion

author: Greenfield, Amy Butler
description: Lucy, a young girl living in isolation on an island, hears beautiful music one day. Singing to it, she discovers herself suddenly in London--she is a Chantress, a singer of magic spells. Only she is untrained and does not know the danger she is in from the Lord Protector, who eradicated all Chantresses he could find when he came to power. Teaming up with Nat and his Invisible College, Lucy finds her heart throbbing for him--but it may cost her her life.
title: Chantress

author: Cummings, Priscilla
description: Thirteen-year-old Kate Tyler must figure out how far she is willing to go to help and protect her beloved brother, J.T., when he returns from a year in juvie and becomes the victim of bullying and is ostracized, and the Tyler house is threatened.
title: Cheating for the chicken man

author: Otfinoski, Steven
description: Presents a choose-your-own-path adventure set in the 1800s. The reader is a child laborer, who must work for a living to keep his or her poor family from starving. The reader can choose to work in an English factory, a New England cloth mill, or as a newspaper seller in New York City.
title: The child labor reform movement

author: Barden, Stephanie
description: Cast off by her old friends, Cinderella agrees to help a new student deal with the stepsisters she will soon have, and meantime, a former friend tries to prevent Cinderella from dancing the lead in their tap recital.
title: Cinderella Smith

author: Jones, Patrick
description: Ty is very proud of his father's accomplishments as a U.S. Army sargeant, but when a brain injury and partial paralysis send his father home from Afghanistan in a wheelchair, Ty finds it hard to balance schoolwork, basketball, a girlfriend, and friends with the time and effort required to care for him.
title: Collateral damage

author: Doherty, Berlie
description: Ellie is ready to run away from home after her mother's wedding to her new stepfather, but instead she is taken in by her friend Morag and her family. She heads to a mysterious island with the family for a vacation, but circumstances arise that cause Ellie to be left alone on the island. Soon Ellie becomes aware that there are ghosts on the island trying to tell her something. As Ellie races to solve the mystery, she puts her own life in grave danger.
title: The company of ghosts

author: Lennon, M. T
description: Charlie C. Cooper, reformed bully, gifted hacker, and middle child wants to make "cool" friends at her new school in Los Angeles, but her psychologist tasks her with becoming friends with the school's "biggest loser."
title: Confessions of a so-called middle child

author: Liu, Owen R.
description: Anita and Benson find themselves on a mission around the world to uncover the origins and effects of climate change. They'll have to put their minds together to find a way to fight the global crisis.
title: The confounding case of the climate crisis

author: Weston, Robert Paul
description: Elliot von Doppler and his friend Leslie are bored with Bickleburgh--except for the rather amazing building of the DENKi-3000, the world's eighth-largest factory for electronics. The secret of the factory is that all its great inventions come from a mansion deep in the heart of the building. When Uncle Archie lets Elliot and Leslie into the mansion, they discover the magical secret behind all the inventions--a magic threatened by an impatient DENKi-3000 executive.
title: The Creature Department

author: Watts, Gillian
description: Features close-up photography of creatures from the Madagascar rainforest. Showcases frogs, insects, spiders, lizards, and endangered species. Includes an index.
title: Creatures close-up

author: Vernon, Ursula
description: After Danny Dragonbreath's school lunch hot dog bites his friend Wendell, Wendell starts behaving in a most unusual manner.
title: Curse of the were-wiener

author: Skrypuch, Marsha Forchuk
description: Young lovers Ali and Zeynep are separated when war breaks out in Anatolia in 1914. Ali flees to Canada, where he is interned as an enemy alien, while Zeynep struggles to find a way to escape Turkey and reunite with Ali.
title: Dance of the banished

author: Adler, Iren
description: While on summer vacation at the seaside, twelve-year-old Irene Adler meets the young Sherlock Holmes, and his friend Arsáene Lupin--and when a dead body floats ashore the three young friends set out to solve the mystery.
title: The dark lady

author: Jennings, Garth
description: Eleven-yer-ld Nelson is crushed when his best friend, who happens to be his sixteen-year-old older sister, disappears. When his parents go searching for her, Nelson is left with his uncle Pogo, a crazy plumber who works at a cathedral in London. And when Nelson stumbles upon a machine that turns his own seven deadly sins into monsters, he has exactly what he needs to join the hunt for his sister.
title: The deadly 7

author: Gephart, Donna
description: Contest-crazed twelve-year-old Ben uses his wits and way with words in hopes of winning a prize that will keep his family from being evicted until his mother can pass her final CPA examination.
title: Death by toilet paper

author: Torres, Jennifer
description: In the town of Briny Deep, what most teens consider a safe, quiet town, Tim, Max, Emily, Luke, and Nina uncover a paranormal mystery.
title: The disappearing

author: Lean, Sarah
description: Fifth-grader Cally Louise Fisher stops talking, partly because her father and brother never speak of her mother who died a year earlier, but visions of her mother, friendships with a homeless man and a disabled boy, and a huge dog ensure that she still communicates.
title: A dog called Homeless

author: Vernon, Ursula
description: When Danny and his friend Wendell get an up-close underwater tour of the Sargasso Sea encountering giant squid and mako sharks, they learn to stand up to bullies.
title: Dragonbreath

author: Sutherland, Tui
description: Clay, a MudWing dragonet, sees war coming to his mountain and fellow dragons. What he does not know is that he and four other dragonets are part of a prophecy of the five chosen dragonets, but it may be that they don't want to be part of a prophecy. They may instead choose freedom over fate.
title: The dragonet prophecy

author: Castellano, Peter
description: Describes myths about dragons, and examines the truth behind alleged sightings of the creature. Includes color photographs, a glossary, and further resources.
title: Dragons

author: Sutcliff, Rosemary
description: A young centurion ventures among the hostile tribes beyond the Roman Wall to recover the eagle standard of the Ninth, a legion which mysteriously disappeared under his father's command.
title: The eagle of the Ninth

author: Duey, Kathleen
description: When two young strangers meet by chance on the day of the San Francisco earthquake, they struggle to survive the terror of crumbling buildings, fire, looting, and chaos.
tags: Survival after airplane accidents, shipwrecks, etc.
title: Earthquake

author: Platt, Richard
description: In ancient Egypt, Nakht records his experiences as his family moves from small town Esna to the big, exciting city of Memphis, where he studies to be a scribe like his father and helps discover who has been robbing graves. Includes nonfiction information about Egyptian culture.
title: Egyptian diary

author: Vance, Ashlee
description: This authorized biography traces the life, times, and inventions of Elon Musk, the man behind such innovative companies as Paypal, SolarCity, Tesla, and SpaceX. Also discusses his visions for the space, automotive, and energy industries. Includes black-and-white photographs and a timeline.
title: Elon Musk and the quest for a fantastic future

author: Stephens, John
description: Kate, Michael, and Emma have passed from one orphanage to another in the ten years since their parents disappeared to protect them, but now they learn that they have special powers, a prophesied quest to find a magical book, and a fearsome enemy.
title: The emerald atlas

author: Card, Orson Scott
description: Andrew "Ender" Wiggin thinks he is playing computer simulated war games at the Battle School; he is, in fact, engaged in something far more desperate.
title: Ender's game

author: Lee, Fonda
description: For a century now, Earth has been a peaceful colony of an alien race, and Donovan Reyes is a loyal member of the security forces, while his father is the Prime Liaison--but when a routine search and seizure goes bad Donovan finds himself a captive of the human revolutionary group, Sapience, terrorists who seem to prefer war to alien rule, and killing Donovan just might be the incident they are looking for.
title: Exo

author: Stuckey, Rachel
description: Describes what it was like to travel with Spanish explorer Hernando de Soto. Highlights where he went, why and how he got there, and what went right and wrong. Includes a timeline, fact boxes, a glossary, resources for further information, and color illustrations.
title: Explore with Hernando de Soto

author: Yancey, Richard
description: Through a series of dangerous and violent misadventures, teenage loser Alfred Kropp rescues King Arthur's legendary sword Excalibur from the forces of evil.
title: The extraordinary adventures of Alfred Kropp

author: Turner, Matt
description: Highlights a selection of strange facts about a variety of insects. Includes diagrams to indicate size, statistics, color photographs, and a glossary.
title: Extraordinary insects

author: Bond, Gwenda
description: For most of her childhood and teen years, Lois Lane has been an Army brat, moving around with her father, General Sam Lane. However, now they seem to have settled permanently in Metropolis, where Lois in her new high school may finally make a friend. However, what she finds instead is a mystery, involving a group called the Warheads and the high-tech video game they play, seemingly messing with her mind. Together with her online friend, SmallvilleGuy, Lois investigates the mystery.
title: Fallout

author: Boyer, Crispin
description: Examines stories from history of famous people and projects that failed, and how those failures turned into successes, such as Albert Einstein being told as a kid that he wouldn't amount to much, or the fact that the Leaning Tower of Pisa wasn't supposed to lean.
title: Famous fails!

author: Karre, Elizabeth
