description: When Bella learns that a bullied boy from her school has been found dead, she decides to take action to prevent bullying in her school and help those in need.
title: The fight

author: Baldacci, David
description: Until Vega Jane's friend Quentin disappears, she believes that life outside of her village is very dangerous. After he disappears, she begins to question all she has been told.
title: The finisher

author: Engle, Margarita
description: Presents the thoughts of Fredrika Bremer as she describes her journey to Cuba and the women she came to know that transformed the life of this nineteenth century women's rights pioneer.
title: The firefly letters

author: Savage, J. Scot
description: Even though technology and creative inventions have been outlawed in the steam-powered mountain city of Cove, in order to save the city, young Trenton and Kallista must follow a set of mysterious blueprints to build a creature to protect them from the dragons outside their door.
title: Fires of invention

author: George, Sam
description: Jonathan Stone is a young man living in Boston in 1776. After the Declaration of Independence is read, Jonathan sees tensions rise between those who are excited for independence from England and those who are still loyal to King George. And Jonathan will have to make some difficult decisions about what he truly believes in.
title: Flames of freedom

author: Green, Tim
description: When Joey has to compete against his best friend, Zach, for a single spot on an elite baseball team, he is forced to decide how far he is willing to go to win.
title: Force out

author: Carter, Caela
description: Eleven-year-old Flora and her younger brother have been bounced from one foster home to the next as long as they can remember. Their memories of childhood are so scattered, they lack a sense of history. Without this sense of permanence. Flora struggles to comprehend that her adoption by her new family means she's found her forever home--what does forever mean to a child who feels as if she were dropped into the world without roots? Understanding this, their adoptive mother takes them back in time to their former foster homes so they might be able to embrace their future.
title: Forever, or a long, long time

author: Goebel, Jenny
description: Even in the town of Fortune Falls, a place where superstitions about things like four-leaf clovers and rabbits feet really are true, Sadie Bleeker cannot catch a break. She is an Unlucky, and since her luck will only get worse as she grows up, she is to be sent away on her thirteenth birthday to prevent harm to her family. However, Sadie loves Fortune Falls, and in order to stay in town she vows to reverse her bad luck in any way possible--to hilarious results.
title: Fortune Falls

author: Anders, Lou
description: Instead of taking over his family's farm in Norr²ngard, Karn would rather play the board game Thrones and Bones, until half-human, half-frost giantess Thianna appears and a family crisis sends them on an adventure, chased by a dragon, undead warriors, an evil uncle, wyverns, and various trolls and giants.
title: Frostborn

author: Farley, Christopher John
description: When Dylan Rundee is sucked in to the world of his favorite video game, his dull real life is replaced by monsters, storytelling spiders, and flying Iron Lions, and he will have to figure out how to be a hero to get out again.
title: Game world

author: Haines, Kathryn Miller
description: In 1942 New York City, fifteen-year-old Iris grieves for her mother who committed suicide and for the loss of her life of privilege, and secretly helps her father with his detective business since he, having lost a leg at Pearl Harbor, struggles to make ends meet.
title: The girl is murder

author: Durst, Sarah Beth
description: Sophie's parents run a secret shop that collects and sells dreams, although Sophie is forbidden to dream because her dreams become real. When the shop's dreams are stolen and her parents go missing, Sophie and her pet Monster have no choice but to befriend a boy troubled by nightmares, and go after them.
title: The girl who could not dream

author: Durst, Sarah Beth
description: Contains essays and testimonials from sixteen young adult authors who provide their own interpretations of the events and characters from the "Hunger Games" series.
title: The girl who was on fire

author: Schraff, Anne E.
description: As an aspiring young gymnast with Olympic dreams, fourteen-year-old Keely Wayne begins to feel pressure from her father and her coach about losing weight.
title: Going for gold

author: Temple, Bob
description: Traces the life and times of pirates. Features an interactive story, full-color illustrations, a glossary, a time line, and a list of resources for further study.
title: The golden age of pirates

author: Richards, Natalie D.
description: When high school senior Piper Woods finds a notebook with mutilated photographs and a list of student sins, she is sure the book is too gruesome to be true, but when a student from the list dies, and although everyone thinks it is a suicide, she suspects something much worse, and her fears are confirmed when she receives an anonymous text daring her to make things right.
title: Gone too far

author: Stead, Rebecca
description: As Bridge makes her way through seventh grade on Manhattan's Upper West Side with her best friends, curvaceous Em, crusader Tab, and a curious new friend--or more than friend--Sherm, she finds the answer she has been seeking since she barely survived an accident at age eight: "What is my purpose?"
title: Goodbye stranger

author: Tashjian, Janet
description: Seventeen-year-old Josh, a loner-philosopher who wants to make a difference in the world, tries to maintain his secret identity as the author of a web site that is receiving national attention.
title: The gospel according to Larry

author: Fallenstein, J.
description: It's said that any couple who writes their names on the bridge at midnight must stay together forever or suffer from a horrible curse. Lucia's never believed the legend before. But when couples who have broken up around town begin having freak accidents, Lucia starts to wonder. And when her best friend goes through her own breakup, Lucia will have to get to the bottom of what's really going on before something awful happens.
title: Graffiti

author: Lapointe, Stâephanie
description: Presents an illustrated novel about a young girl and her grandfather, Adrien, who is devastated after the loss of his wife. The young girl then goes on an adventure, sure that he will be proud, but the journey takes a surprising turn.
title: Grandfather and the moon

author: Hopkinson, Deborah
description: Eel, an orphan, and his best friend Florrie must help Dr. John Snow prove that cholera is spread through water, and not poisonous air, when an epidemic sweeps across their London neighborhood in 1854.
title: The Great Trouble

author: Amato, Mary
description: Tripp, who plays guitar only for himself, and Lyla, a cellist whose talent has already made her famous but not happy, form an unlikely friendship when they are forced to share a practice room at their high school.
title: Guitar notes

author: Lord, Cynthia
description: In rural Maine, twelve-year-old Lily begins a friendship with Salma, the daughter of migrant blueberry pickers, but their friendship is put to the test when both girls decide to compete in a local Blueberry Queen pageant.
title: A handful of stars

author: Rowling, J. K.
description: When the Chamber of Secrets is opened again at the Hogwarts School for Witchcraft and Wizardry, second-year student Harry Potter finds himself in danger from a dark power that has once more been released on the school.
title: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

author: Murdock, Catherine Gilbert
description: Fourteen-year-old Sarah keeps a journal of her pilgrimage to Rome with her eccentric grandmother, Z, her evolving relationship with best friend Curtis, and daily conversations with Curtis's sister and star athlete, D.J.
title: Heaven is paved with Oreos

author: Childress, Alice
description: The life of a thirteen-year-old Harlem black boy on his way to becoming a confirmed heroin addict is seen from his viewpoint and from that of several people around him.
title: A hero ain't nothin' but a sandwich

author: Terrell, Brandon
description: After seeing her best friend, Kat, kissing another girl, Dessa keeps the secret but her anger over Kat not confiding in her causes trouble.
title: High drama

author: McClintock, Norah
description: After his mother's death, fifteen-year-old Mike goes to live with his irresponsible Uncle Billy, who looks the other way when Mike starts making bad decisions. But when Mike's history teacher, a former cop named John Riel, uncovers new information about the death of Mike's mother, Mike and Riel join forces to get to the bottom of the mystery surrounding her death.
title: Hit and run

author: Averbeck, Jim
description: Eleven-year-old Jack Fair races against time through San Francisco to rescue his kidnapped Aunt Edith, with the help of none other than Alfred Hitchcock.
title: A Hitch at the Fairmont

author: Balliett, Blue
description: On a cold winter day in Chicago, Early's father disappeared, and now she, her mother and her brother have been forced to flee their apartment and join the ranks of the homeless--and it is up to Early to hold her family together and solve the mystery surrounding her father.
title: Hold fast

author: Sitomer, Alan Lawrence
description: Teddy Anderson plans revenge when his sister Tina is killed in a drive-by shooting. Teddy is caught and put on house arrest, where he is ordered to mentor a twelve-year-old named Micah. Teddy continues to plan his revenge, but Micah presents an opportunity to heal.
title: Homeboyz

author: Keating, Jess
description: When twelve-year-old Ana's zoologist parents move the whole family into the zoo, the Sneers--the clan of carnivorous female predators in her class--have even more ammunition to make her life miserable, although she tries to act like a chameleon and fade into the background.
title: How to outrun a crocodile when your shoes are untied

author: Cummings, Judy Dodge
description: Examines the likely migration of humans from their common roots in Africa to various locations around the world. Includes a timeline, travel tips, text-related questions and activities, comic-style illustrations, maps, color photographs, and a glossary.
title: Human migration

author: Velasquez, Crystal
description: When Ana is sent to an exclusive boarding school, she soon realizes her ancestry has ties to magical powers she never imagined. After an evil force is unleashed, she must use her newly discovered ability to transform into a jaguar and uncover the true intentions of a dangerous group known as the Brotherhood of Chaos.
title: Hunters of chaos

author: Woodson, Jacqueline
description: Marie, the only black girl in the eighth grade willing to befriend her white classmate Lena, discovers that Lena's father is doing horrible things to her in private.
title: I hadn't meant to tell you this

author: Baron, Jeff
description: With the help of his "manager," a thirteen-year-old boy sells a movie idea to a major Hollywood studio.
title: I represent Sean Rosen

author: Gansworth, Eric L.
description: Seventh-grader Lewis "Shoe" Blake from the Tuscarora Reservation has a new friend, George Haddonfield from the local Air Force base, but in 1975 upstate New York there is a lot of tension and hatred between Native Americans and Whites--and Lewis is not sure that he can rely on friendship.
title: If I ever get out of here

author: Lloyd-Jones, Emily
description: After a vaccine to a terrible virus causes superpowered side-effects in some teenage Americans, the new superheroes are given an ultimatum by the government: serve the country with their amazing abilities, or be declared traitors. Some, however, have decided on a third way: a life of crime. Ciere Giba is one such superpowered teenage criminal, who teams up with others to discover the formula to the vaccine that gave them their powers.
title: Illusive

author: Ellsworth, Loretta
description: On the eve of her sixteenth birthday, Erin receives her long-dead mother's diary, which reveals that she too revered Harper Lee's "To Kill a Mockingbird" and wanted to be a writer, and Erin impulsively decides to take the Greyhound bus from St. Paul, Minnesota to Monroeville, Alabama, to visit the reclusive author.
title: In search of Mockingbird

author: Cameron, Erica
description: When her clan forces her to make a decision that could cost her brother's life, Khya turns her back on the clan, seeking help from Tessen, her lifelong rival and the boy who challenges her at every turn.
title: Island of exiles

author: English, Karen
description: In 1965, twelve-year-old Sophie is the only black child in an all-white neighborhood. Her sister Lily encourages Sophie to make friends, even by doing things she might be uncomfortable with, like playing tennis. But when trouble erupts in a nearby town, Sophie finds out how complicated her life really is.
title: It all comes down to this

author: Heos, Bridget
description: Presents arguments in favor of the theory of manmade global warming, discussing data that climatologists use to determine how the planet's climate has changed throughout history compared with how it has been changing since the advent of fossil fuels. Offers warnings that if humankind as a whole does not stop polluting the atmosphere, the future of the planet will be very different from what it is now.
title: It's getting hot in here

author: Adams, Alane
description: After freeing Orkney from the Red Sun, Sam Baron finds himself trapped by Catriona, leader of the Volgrim Witches, and enchanted to embrace his half-witch heritage and lead an army of monstrous men against Skara Brae. His only hope are his three best friends, Keely, Leo, and Howie, and their quest to find the mystical artifact known as the Moon Pearl.
title: Kalifus rising

author: Stabler, David
description: Presents true stories about the childhood experiences of artists, including adjusting to blended families, enduring bullying, developing crushes, and being the new kid. Includes facts about the artists and color cartoon illustrations.
title: Kid artists

author: Roberts, Willo Davis
description: No one believes eleven-year-old Joey, who has a reputation for telling tall tales, when he claims to have witnessed the kidnapping of the class bully outside their expensive New York City private school.
title: The kidnappers

author: West, Hannah
description: Sixteen-year-old Bristal discovers she is a shapeshifter, one of three remaining elicromancers tasked with guarding the realm of Nissera against dark magic while manipulating three royal families to promote peace.
title: Kingdom of ash and briars

author: Derby, Sally
description: Kyle, almost thirteen, spends much of the summer yearning to explore a nearby island, striving to be a good brother, fishing with an elderly neighbor, and fuming at his parents over their separation that is forcing his mother to sell the family's cabin on a Michigan lake.
title: Kyle's island

author: Fforde, Jasper
description: In a world where magic is beginning to fall by the wayside, fifteen-year-old Jennifer Strange has a hard time keeping Kazam Mystical Arts Management open. When she receives a vision foreshadowing the death of the world's last dragon by an unknown Dragonslayer, Jennifer decides she must act to keep her world from changing forever.
title: The last dragonslayer

author: Turner, Tracey
description: In this interactive adventure, the reader is lost in the Sahara Desert and must make the right choices to survive. Includes scientific facts, true stories, illustrations, a glossary, and sources of further information.
title: Lost in the desert of dread

author: DiCamillo, Kate
description: When ten-year-old orphan Peter Augustus Duchene encounters a fortune teller in the marketplace one day and she tells him that his sister, who is presumed dead, is in fact alive, he embarks on a remarkable series of adventures as he desperately tries to find her.
title: The magician's elephant

author: Nicholson, Simo
description: Young Harry Houdini's efforts to perfect his magic tricks are put on hold when his mentor, Herbie, disappears, prodding Harry and his two best friends, Arthur and Billie, to embark on a dangerous investigation that pushes their skill and their friendship to the limits.
title: The magician's fire

author: Coats, J. Anderso
description: Jane's been looking after her baby brother ever since her father was killed in the war. Now, she's accompanying a trip taking unmarried women and widows out west to Seattle. Jane hopes for a new life, but when the city isn't at all what she expected, the only person she can rely on is herself.
title: The many reflections of Miss Jane Deming

author: Cle, Troy
description: Thirteen-year-old Louis Proof receives a mysterious letter inviting him to the local junkyard where he finds an underground amusement park. Then suddenly Louis falls into a coma and when he wakes up three months later he finds the world has changed dramatically for the worse. Louis soon discovers it is his destiny to put things right again.
title: The marvelous effect

author: Gerhardt, Jake
description: The charming and beautiful Miranda Mullaly has three of her eighth grade classmates vying for her attention--Sam, the class clown; Duke, the intellectual; and Chollie, the athlete. The problem is, she doesn't seem to know any of the boys exist, but the three will stop at nothing to get her attention and win her affection.
title: Me & Miranda Mullaly

author: Sutherland, Tui
description: Logan Wilde is let in on the secret Menagerie of Xanadu, Wyoming, when he wakes up to find a mythical griffin cub under his bed. This discovery leads him into contact with the strangest girl in seventh grade--Zoe Khan. The Khan family have guarded the Menagerie for centuries, but now someone is sabotaging them, and Zoe asks Logan for help to get the six griffin cubs back.
title: The menagerie

author: Lowry, Lois
description: In this novel that unites characters from "The Giver" and "Gathering Blue," Matty, a young member of a utopian community that values honesty, conceals an emerging healing power that he cannot explain or understand.
title: Messenger

author: Patterson, James
description: When Rafe Kane enters middle school, he teams up with his best friend, "Leo the Silent," to create a game to make school more fun by trying to break every rule in the school's code of conduct.
title: Middle schoo

author: Sedgwick, Marcus
description: When a stranger arrives on the island known only as Blessed, where people are rumored to never age and no children are born, he sets off a chain of events that involves the stories of various individuals on the island.
title: Midwinterblood

author: Khorana, Aditi
description: Tara, an Indian-American junior at Brierly prep school, feels her world dramatically change when a mirror planet to Earth is discovered and she, in this new era of scientific history, reconsiders her self and possible selves.
title: Mirror in the sky

author: Blackwood, Sage
description: Chantel is a student at Miss Ellicott's School for Magical Maidens, where she is learning Spells, Potions, Wards, Summonings, and Deportment in order to safeguard the city. Chantel has attitude problems, and more often than not is in trouble with Miss Ellicott--but when she and all the other sorceresses in charge of the city vanish, the Marauders are given free reign to attack. Chantel and her friends must step up and use their battle spells to save the Kingdom, or die trying.
title: Miss Ellicott's school for the magically minded

author: Hughes, Dean
description: While his father is missing in action in the Pacific during World War II, twelve-year-old Jay moves with his mother to small-town Utah, where he sees prejudice from both sides, as a part-Navajo himself and through an unlikely friendship with Japanese American Ken from the nearby internment camp.
title: Missing in action

author: Goodman, Michael E.
description: Explores the different types of modern day spies from the use of drones to Lindsay Moran's book about her time in the CIA. Includes a timeline, a glossary, resources for further information, and color photographs.
title: Modern spies

author: Dashner, James
description: Time has gone wrong, and best friends Dak Smyth and Sera Froste, together with the young Hystorian Riq, must use the infinity ring to travel back to one of the Great Breaks--a mutiny on the Santa Maria--to correct history and defeat the SQ.
title: A mutiny in time

author: Pennell, Christopher
description: Eleven-year-old Carly Bean Bitters, an orphan, can only sleep during the day and feels very lonely until she meets a rat, Lewis, and sets off on an adventure to figure out what is threatening the woods and its inhabitants.
title: The mysterious woods of Whistle Root

author: Banks, Anna
description: Princess Sepora of Serubel is the last Forger who can create energy for all. But when her father wants to weaponize her power and start a war, she flees but is captured in the rival kingdom of Theoria and made a slave of the young king Tarik. The king and Sepora form an unlikely bond and although her gift could save his kingdom from a deadly plague, she hides it. Her feelings grow for her nemesis, but an unexpected development puts their relationship, and peace between their kingdoms, at risk.
title: Nemesis

author: Strasser, Todd
description: Dan, a popular basketball star with a beautiful girlfriend, experiences a major upheaval when his family loses their home and is forced to move into the local tent city where the homeless live. Dan copes with his new situation by joining with other homeless residents to fight for better conditions, but his problems get even bigger when he learns that someone will stop at nothing to destroy the tent city.
title: No place

author: Kessler, Liz
description: After her grandfather suddenly and inexplicably vanishes, Mia and her mother go to help out her grandmother. She finds a new pen pal in the form of Dee, a local girl, but when Dee seems unusually distant, she attempts to figure out who she really is while simultaneously trying to figure out where her grandfather has gone.
title: North of nowhere

author: Hughes, Alison
description: For his eighth-grade science project, J.J. Murphy studies the jerky behavior of different classmates and family members, and learns a lot about himself and the people around him in the process.
title: On a scale from idiot to complete jerk

author: Jones, Patrick
description: Mercedes Morgan could set a state record for three point shots and perhaps earn a place on a college basketball team if she can keep up the good work on the court. But when her sister winds up in a coma as a result of her gang activity, and her brother seems to be following the same path, Mercedes will have to make challenging decisions to help her family while trying to maintain her focus on her sport.
title: On guard

author: Palmer, Robin
description: When sixteen-year-old Zoe Brenner jumps thirty years into the future, she is everything she wasn't before - popular, clad in pink, and dating the high school jock. Now all she wants to do is get back to her old life in the past, but the only person who can help her is her best friend Jonah who refuses to speak to her in the future.
title: Once upon a kiss

author: Unsworth, Tania
description: In a near future world of heat, greed, and hunger, Devin earns a coveted spot in a home for abandoned children that promises unlimited food and toys and the hope of finding a new family, but Devin discovers the home's horrific true mission when he investigates its intimidating Administrator and the zombie-like sickness that afflicts some children.
title: The one safe place

author: Mather, Melissa
description: A journalistic account of the impressions and introspections of a southern Negro college girl spending the summer as a mother's helper to an unusual family in Vermont, where a perceptive eleven-year-old daughter, a father who is both architect and farmer, and an enriched family life all contribute to her own growth and to the sociological observations she is making for a college course.
title: One summer in between

author: Brezenoff, Steven
description: With three story paths and twelve different endings, readers can help four middle school detectives solve a mystery on their field trip to the Greater River City Air Force Base where aliens are rumored to be kept.
title: The outlaw from outer space

author: Anderson, R. J
description: In Tarreton, where the rich have all the magic they wish and the poor can barely afford a spell to heat their homes, twelve-year-old Isaveth's father is accused of murdering an influential citizen and Isaveth, aided by eccentric street boy Quiz, tries to solve the magical murder mystery before her father is executed.
title: A pocket full of murder

author: Divine, L.
description: After completing the AP exams, Jayd tries to focus on her spirit lessons and hair braiding business but finds that all the drama taking place around her is keeping her from focusing on her goals.
title: Pushin'

author: Liss, David
description: When twelve-year-old Zeke Reynolds is chosen to join a four-person applicant team to work toward membership in the Confederation of United Planets, he stumbles across conspiracies resembling the science fiction he's loved his entire life. His sci-fi knowledge may just save himself, his friends, and the Earth.
title: Randoms

author: Bradford, Chris
description: Young bodyguard Conner Reeves is tasked with protecting the twin daughters of Australian media tycoon Maddox Sterling aboard their luxury yacht. But when pirates take over the yacht in the middle of the Indian Ocean, and demand a ransom for the twins' safe return, Conner must stop the pirates before anyone gets hurt.
title: Ransom

author: Gottesfeld, Jeff
description: After getting wrapped up in the dark underside of gang life in his neighborhood, Robin is forced to steal to stay afloat. Once her realizes the severity of his position, however, he begins searching for a way out and hopes he can succeed in time.
title: Robinson's hood

author: Lawrence, Lisa J
description: With her unstable, alcoholic mother, sixteen-year-old Isabelle moves from one dingy apartment to the next while trying to care for her younger siblings. Things go from bad to worse when Isabelle gets on the wrong side of a popular girl at her new school. And although she doesn't really have time for romance, she realizes she's falling for a boy named Will, which only complicates things.
title: Rodent

author: Velâasquez, Gloria
description: As high school senior Rudy adjusts his attitudes toward the elderly when his senile grandmother has to move in with his family, his girlfriend encourages him to talk with a friend's mother who has similar problems with her own mother.
title: Rudy's memory walk

author: Walters, Eric
description: Sixteen-year-old Adam Daley's suburban neighborhood bands together for its own survival in a world stricken by a catastrophic blackout.
title: The rule of thre3

author: Moore, Stephanie Perry
description: As Payton leaves high school and goes on to college, she and her friends learn to deal with racism and other difficult issues.
title: Saved race

author: Senzai, N. H.
description: Twelve-year-old Ariana is worlds apart from her proper Afghan cousin Laila, who just moved into their California home. Ariana is a tomboy; Laila cooks, sews, and sings. When a revival Afghan grocery store opens in their town, Laila and Ariana fall on opposite sides of an ancient feud, only to realize that they might be the only ones to end it.
title: Saving Kabul Corner

author: Knight, Mar
description: Having lost most of his family to coal mining accidents, Curley Hines lives with his grandfather in the Appalachian Mountains of Wonder Gap, Kentucky. When the local mining company prepares to destroy their mountain, Curley muse use his voice, and the words his grandfather taught him, to speak up, even if it means losing the life he loves.
title: Saving Wonder

author: Hawkins, Rachel
description: Fifteen-year-old Izzy, who comes from a long line of monster hunters, investigates a series of hauntings at her new high school.
title: School spirits

author: Nickerson, Sara
description: In order to earn money, twelve-year-old Missy and her older brother Patrick spend the summer working on a blueberry farm, where they learn lessons about life and growing up.
title: The secrets of blueberries, brothers, Moose & me

author: Bardugo, Leigh
description: Orphaned by the Border Wars, Alina Starkov is taken from obscurity and her only friend, Mal, to become the protegâe of the mysterious Darkling, who trains her to join the magical elite in the belief that she is the Sun Summoner, who can destroy the monsters of the Fold.
title: Shadow and bone

author: Ruby, Laura
description: In an alternate New York City, three kids race to solve a puzzle that will save their homes from a land developer by finding clues hidden in the buildings of the city.
title: The shadow cipher

author: Wallace, Kali
description: After waking in a shallow grave, Breezy, a high school senior, crosses the country seeking answers about her death and resurrection, discovering along the way a host of supernatural creatures, as well as a human cult determined to "free" them at any cost.
title: Shallow graves

author: Sloan, Holly Goldberg
description: When Julia gets cast as a munchkin in a local production of "The Wizard of Oz," she has even more reason to hate her short stature. But as she gets to know the show's enthusiastic director and eccentric cast, Julia's summer might become worthwhile after all.
title: Short

author: Engle, Margarita
description: Fourteen-year-old Mateo and other Caribbean islanders face discrimination, segregation, and harsh working conditions when American recruiters lure them to the Panamanian rain forest in 1906 to build the great canal.
title: Silver people

author: Raasch, Sara
description: Meira, a warrior in training and one of eight free citizens of the Kingdom of Winter following the kingdom's defeat sixteen years ago, sets out on a dangerous journey to uncover a magic talisman that can restore the kingdom's power.
title: Snow like ashes

author: Peel, Kit
description: Wyn, an orphan in the British village of Pateley Bridge, is the only person who doesn't feel the biting cold of the endless winter caused by extreme climate change. When mysterious villagers appear in her village insisting that she has the power to restore order, she must look to her own past and face secrets she's been keeping from herself.
title: Snow summer

author: Weston, Carol
description: Missing her mother who died last year, fourteen-year-old Sofia finds an anonymous outlet for her personal questions and deep, dark secrets in the Dear Kate advice columnist until, much to her horror, Sofia's father starts dating Kate.
title: Speed of life

author: Oh, Ellen
description: Twelve-year-old Harper Raine suspects her house is haunted. And when her four-year-old brother begins acting strangely, she gets a strange sense of dâejáa vu and realizes she must unlock certain memories to understand and stop the dangerous sensations in the house.
title: Spirit hunters

author: Carbone, Elisa Lynn
description: A novel based on the events in the life of a young slave girl from Maryland who endures all kinds of mistreatment and cruelty, including being separated from her family, but who eventually escapes to freedom in Canada.
title: Stealing freedom

author: Cooper, Abby
description: Born with the strange disease--or curse--of having descriptive words appear on her arms and legs whenever they are used of her, Elyse has had a strange life. Nice words make her feel good, but mean words, like "loser," itch like a rash and make her feel awful. Thankfully she made good friends who accepted her as she was--then middle school happened, and they drifted away. In her despair, Elyse receives an anonymous message, whose sender claims to know who and what she is, and who says there is help on the way.
title: Sticks & stones

author: Sutherland, Kari
description: Moana grows up loving the ocean and it loves her back, choosing her to save the island that's slowly dying because the shape-shifting demigod Maui stole the heart of the mother island, Te Fiti. Moana sets off on a quest to find Maui and return the heart of Te Fiti, thereby saving her island. Along the way, Moana learns who she is and who her people are--voyagers. Includes tattoos.
title: The story of Moana

author: Wallace, Becky
description: The Keepers, a race of people with magical abilities, are seeking a supposedly-dead princess to place her on the throne and end political turmoil but girls who look like the princess are being murdered and Johanna Von Arlo, forced to work for Lord Rafael DeSilva after her father's suspicious death, is a dead-ringer.
title: The storyspinner

author: Schraff, Anne E.
description: Ernesto Sandoval is forced to move in his junior year of high school and start over. However, at his new school he meets the beautiful Naomi Martinez and vows to woo her away from her abusive boyfriend.
title: The stranger

author: Oppel, Kenneth
description: When his grieving father orders the destruction of the Dark Library, Victor retrieves a book in which he finds the promise of not just communicating with the dead, but entering their realm, and soon he, Elizabeth, and Henry are in the spirit world of Chateau Frankenstein, creating and growing a body.
title: Such wicked intent

author: Wallace, Daniel
description: Provides a biography of Superman describing his arrival on Earth; his friends, family members, and foes; the development of his powers; and his transformation into a superhero. Includes a chronology, facts about Superman, and a glossary.
title: Superman

author: Berk, Sheryl
description: Sadie is an MVP largely due to her beloved Coach Walsh's spot-on advice and encouragement. So, when the Coach gets sick and has to miss a lot of school, Sadie is at a loss, wishing she could do something to help. She and her Cupcake Club friends use the power of Peace, Love, and Cupcakes--selling cupcakes--to raise money to help their Coach out.
title: Sweet victory

author: Raf, Mindy
description: Izzy Skymen is a hypochondriac, has impressively large boobs, and has a date with a hot jock, who has spilled Gatorade on her just recently. Something is also up with her mother, her best friend who seems to have gotten a new, uncool personality, and the people closest to her are keeping secrets from her.
title: The symptoms of my insanity

author: Peppas, Lynn
description: Explores the use of tanks in both world wars, modern conflicts today, and the future. Includes color photographs, a glossary, and further resources.
title: Tanks at war

author: Rodkey, Geoff
description: An oral history that reports, through transcribed recordings, text messages, photographs, illustrations, screenshots, and more, an epic prank war between twelve-year-old twins Reese and Claudia Tapper of New York City.
title: The Tapper twins go to war (with each other)

author: Shanker, Tarun
description: In 1882 Evelyn goes to London in search of her missing sister Rose. Accompanied by Mr. Kent, she encounters Sebastian Braddock who is also searching for Rose and claims that both sister possess magical powers to heal. Soon Evelyn realizes her sister is in greater danger than she ever imagined.
title: These vicious masks

author: Polsky, Sara
description: Sophie has worked hard her whole young life to keep her mother's mental illness a secret--she would rush home from school to cook dinner, pay the rent, and make sure her mom kept up on her medication. However, one day Sophie's mother has a crisis, the secret lets out, and Sophie finds herself living with another family until her situation can stabilize. She feels like she is letting her mother down; but at the same time she feels free, and wonders if she can ever go back to how things were.
title: This is how I find her

author: Evans, Sandra
description: Raul quietly watches over the other children at his boarding school. Since his mom disappeared and his father stopped coming to get him, Raul has taken to the woods on the weekends when the other children go home. While in the woods, he becomes a wolf, a secret he keeps tightly hidden. But as mysteries surrounding his mother come to light, Raul's own secrets may have to be revealed.
title: This is not a werewolf story

author: Levy, Dana Alison
description: Although not thrilled when her summer plans are upended for a surprise cross-country train trip with her family and embarrassed because one of her moms is writing a tell-all book about the trip, twelve-year-old Sara Johnston-Fischer finds herself changing along with the landscape outside the train windows.
title: This would make a good story someday

author: McAllister, Cameron
description: When thirteeen-year-old Angelo sees that his father's job as an automobile executive is at risk, he decides to try his hand at inventing an automobile designed for the average working class people in the hopes that it might save his dad's career. But when war is declared and the Nazi's decide to try and steal Angelo's design, he finds himself working with his father and the residents of his town to prevent the Nazis from confiscating the vehicles. Based on the true story of the creation of the Citroen 2CV.
title: The Tin Snail

author: Scott, Victori
description: Astrid Sullivan is given the chance of entering a race on an early model Titan--highly advanced, mechanized horses programmed to be lifelike. Deciding to risk it all, Astrid enters, and bets everything she has on herself in a bid to hold on to everyone she holds dear.
title: Titans

author: LaBan, Elizabeth
description: While preparing for the most dreaded assignment at the prestigious Irving School, the Tragedy Paper, Duncan gets wrapped up in the tragic tale of Tim Macbeth, a former student who had a clandestine relationship with the wrong girl, and his own ill-fated romance with Daisy.
title: The Tragedy Paper

author: DeLano, L. E.
description: When a character from one of Jessa's dreams steps into her real world, she learns she's a Traveler who slips into alternate realities through reflections and dreams. But in each reality Jessa is dying over and over again, and this time Finn is determined to save her.
title: Traveler

author: Roberts, Willo Davis
description: Fourteen-year-old Cici hopes for a romantic summer at the beach but instead finds herself trying to solve a murder which had occurred there the previous year.
title: Twisted summer

author: Stowe, Harriet Beecher
description: The story of American slavery and a black man who never lost dignity under the most inhumane circumstances.
title: Uncle Tom's cabin, or, Life among the lowly

author: Sutherland, Suzanne
description: Vic Mahler is sent to stay with her grandmother while her rock-star mom leaves for a tour in Japan. Away from her mother's looming shadow of fame and success, Vic finally starts to become her own person, until her mother returns with a new boyfriend in tow. Vic must come to terms with her mom's career, their changing relationship, and her own new-found sense of self.
title: Under the dusty moon

author: Maxwell, Lisa
description: Gwendolyn Allister has always moved around, never having a home, because her mother believed that monsters were hunting them. Then one day Gwen and her friend, Olivia, are kidnapped and brought to a world of sea hags, dangerous Fey, and an island that physically changes before their eyes. To stay safe, Gwen will have to figure out who to trust--the charming fairy-tale hero who says all the right things, or the roguish young pirate who says he can keep her safe.
title: Unhooked

author: Wells, Robison E.
description: After years in foster homes, seventeen-year-old Benson Fisher applies to New Mexico's Maxfield Academy in hopes of securing a brighter future, but instead he finds that the school is a prison and no one is what he or she seems.
title: Variant

author: Carson, Rae
description: After a terrible tragedy, Leah Westfall takes her magical secret and travels from Georgia to California during the Gold Rush.
title: Walk on Earth a stranger

author: Paver, Michelle
description: Returning to his homeland, Hylas knows the fate of the world rests on finding the prophesized dagger of Koronos and keeping it from falling into the Crows' hands. However, Hylas also must rescue his lost sister, Issi, and feels torn between destiny and family. Deciding to split up, Hylas and his friend Pirra go after their two goals, and together with Havoc the lioness and Echo the falcon they must defeat the Crows once and for all.
title: Warrior bronze

author: Frost, Helen
description: Claire and Abi have always loved summers at the lake house, but a pregnant stepmother and Abi's intense new interest in boys have changed everything.
title: When my sister started kissing

author: Healey, Karen
description: When sixteen-year-old Tegan is killed in the year 2027, she is put in a frozen state from which she wakes up 100 years later. The future that Tegan wakes up to is not how she imagined it would be, and soon she discovers information that forces her to make a choice between staying quiet and living in this new world or fighting for a new one.
title: When we wake

author: Fabiny, Sarah
description: Explores a range of facts and fun trivia about the Amazon, such as the fact that it may have as many as 400 billion trees, fifty tribes of indigenous peoples, and the fact that there is more water in the Amazon River than the Nile, Mississippi, and Yangtze combined.
title: Where is the Amazon?

author: McIntosh, Fiona
description: Lute and Griff couldn't be more different--Lute is a prince, while Griff is just a poor carnival worker. However, Griff is special. He can hear the thoughts of others--and when one day he and Lute's mind begin to connect, miles apart, Griff learns that he may be the only one who can save Lute's life.
title: The whisperer

author: London, Jack
description: The adventures in the northern wilderness of a dog who is part wolf and how he comes to make his peace with man.
title: White Fang

author: Bradbury, Jennifer
description: Seventeen-year-old Agnes Wilkins is about to make her debut into 1815 London society at a lavish party, where she meets Lord Showalter, a wealthy and eligible man who collects Egyptian antiquities and who is hiding a dangerous secret.
title: Wrapped

author: Snicket, Lemony
description: Thirteen-year-old Lemony Snicket begins his apprenticeship with S. Theodora Markson of the secretive V.F.D. in the tiny dot of a town called Stain'd By The Sea, where he helps investigate the theft of a statue.
title: "Who could that be at this hour?"

author: Acton, Vanessa
description: Four friends on the brink of giving up on their friendship are thrust into a situation that requires them to depend on one another when an earthquake strikes. Now their lives depend on sticking together.
tags: Survival after airplane accidents, shipwrecks, etc.
title: Aftershock

author: Dairman, Tara
description: For years little Gladys Gatsby has been cooking gourmet dishes without her microwave-loving parents ever knowing. Her longing is to become a restaurant critic, and when a newspaper emails her about a food essay she wrote, Gladys is offered a job as a reviewer with the paper. The only thing is she has to hide her new job from her parents.
title: All four stars

author: Carter, Nikki
description: Gifted singer Sunday Tolliver is ready to start recording music as soon as her tour with her cousin Dreya is over; but the tour goes badly and the behind-the-tour reality show is capturing a humiliated Sunday. Sunday has one more chance to stand up to Dreya and prove herself to the world.
title: All the wrong moves

author: Jones, Patrick
description: After eighteen years in the Marines, Rosalita Alvirde's father is struggling with civilian life, but when he decides to rejoin the military, Rosie's life starts to come apart--and it soon show up in her school work and behavior.
title: Always faithful

author: Velâasquez, Gloria
description: When she begins dating a wealthy white senior, Ankiza must face the reactions and prejudices of other students, parents, and school officials.
title: Ankiza

author: Hunter, Erin
description: Young apprentice Alderpaw of ThunderClan embarks on a dangerous quest, inspired by his visions, that will shape the fate of all the warrior Clans.
title: The apprentice's quest

author: Silberberg, Alan
description: A weird web site provides Kilgore Junior High students and best friends Matt and Craz the opportunity to make their cartoons become real, which has some unexpected and dire consequences.
title: The awesome, almost 100% true adventures of Matt & Craz

author: Gottesfeld, Jeff
description: Determined to get back at the Ninth Street Rangers, Robin spies his chance when he notices a valuable Mustang in his neighborhood. He must decide, however, whether revenge is worth his life.
title: The bank of badness

author: Pierce, Tamora
description: Three mages--Briar, Rosethorn, and Evvy--are invited by the emperor of Yanjing to come and see his magnificent gardens. However, they see much more than gardens in Yanjing, things like the emperor's massive army and his extreme cruelty. When the three get wind of the emperor's plan to invade their beloved land of Gyongxe--where their First Temple of the Living Circle sits--the mages split up, hoping to get warning to Gyongxe in time.
title: Battle magic

author: Leavitt, Amie Jane
description: Presents an interactive history adventure set during the Battle of the Alamo. Offers two paths for the reader to take when the conflict arises: uphold the laws of Santa Anna as a Mexican soldier; or become a Texan rebel and fight for freedom from Mexico. Features numerous photographs, illustrations, and a timeline of the battle.
title: The Battle of the Alamo

author: Kortâe, Steven
description: Follows Beast Boy, the shape-shifting trickster, on three adventures in which he loses his powers, becomes a manly man, and is forgotten on his birthday.
title: Beast boy bro-down

author: Garcia, Kami
description: In a small South Carolina town, where it seems little has changed since the Civil War, sixteen-year-old Ethan is powerfully drawn to Lena, a new classmate with whom he shares a psychic connection and whose family hides a dark secret that may be revealed on her sixteenth birthday.
title: Beautiful creatures

author: Warman, Jessica
description: Eighteen-year-old identical twin sisters, Alice and Rachel, are united by a psychic bond that even gives physical wounds to one when the other is injured. When one twin is abducted, the other must use their bond to uncover the truth behind the mysterious disappearance.
title: Beautiful lies

author: Leonard, M. G
description: Darkus Cuttle has taken care of his father ever since his mother died, but one day his father vanished from a locked vault at the Natural History Museum, and now he lives with his eccentric uncle--but one day he finds a large and unusually intelligent and self-aware beetle, and soon he and his two friends are caught up in a struggle to protect an intelligent super species of beetles.
title: Beetle boy

author: Vance, Alexander
description: Seventh-grader Claudia Miravista loves art, but socially she is always the odd girl out--but on a trip to the local art museum she sees a boy in a painting, who moves from painting to painting, and soon she embarks on an adventure behind the canvas, determined to free the boy Pim from the artistic prison he has endured for over three hundred years.
title: Behind the canvas

author: Philbrick, W. R
description: During one of the most spectacular Northern Lights in memory, a massive solar flare hits the Earth, knocking out the power grid. Charlie Cobb and the residents of a remote New Hampshire village at first band together to share food and resources, but quickly chaos and a breakdown of authority makes life dangerous. Charlie must go on a perilous journey to rescue his mother, stalked by wild animals and armed citizens alike, and find a way to survive.
tags: Survival after airplane accidents, shipwrecks, etc.
title: The big dark

author: Roy, Carter
description: Out of nowhere, thirteen-year-old Ronan Truelove's mom snatches him out of school, and before he knows it he is in a car chase and being told that his nerdy dad has been kidnapped--and the whopper, that his mother is part of an ancient order known as the Blood Guard, who are sworn to protect the thirty-six noble and righteous souls on Earth who must survive, or else the Earth is doomed. Now Ronan must take his place in the order, or perish.
title: The blood guard

author: London, C. Alexander
description: Cory, a member of the Navy Marine Mammal Program, works with a search-and-recovery dolphin named Kaj to locate a lost U.S. submarine carrying secrets through enemy waters.
title: Blood in the water

author: Murrie, Matthew
description: A collection of open-ended questions for young people encouraging creative exploration. Also features historical sidebars, activities, and quotes from real kids and teens.
title: The book of what if ... ?

author: Bertman, Jennifer Chambliss
description: After moving to San Francisco, home of Garrison Griswold, the creator of the hit online game Book Scavenger, twelve-year-old Emily becomes caught up in investigating an attack on Garrison while following the clues of his latest scavenger hunt.
title: Book Scavenger

author: Boyne, John
description: In 1936, a French boy named Pierrot must leave his Paris home to live with his aunt, Beatrix, who is a servant in a lavish household in Austria. This is no ordinary wealthy Austrian family, either--it is the home of Adolf Hitler. Pierrot adopts the German name Pieter, and finds himself becoming friends with the enigmatic Nazi leader, in spite of warnings from his aunt. Pierrot never thought there would be such consequences.
title: The boy at the top of the mountain

author: Whyman, Matt
description: Two thirteen-year-old boys, blood brothers and best friends, get drawn into a dangerous, violent world on the streets of a troubled Colombian city.
title: Boy kills man

author: Wilson, Nathan D.
description: When his stepfather moves them to Taper, Florida, in the Everglades, twelve-year-old Charlie discovers a secret world hidden within the sugar cane fields, as well as new family connections and friendships.
title: Boys of blur

author: Unsworth, Tania
description: When her mother disappears and a menacing stranger tries to claim her home, Brightwood Hall, for himself, Daisy must use her wits, courage, and help from her imaginary friends to survive.
title: Brightwood

author: Lyons, CJ
description: When Scarlet finds out she has a terminal heart condition, she requests to be able to attend high school to discover what it is like to have a normal life. As she adjusts to the norms of her new school, however, she realizes there is a shocking secret waiting to be unearthed, and learning more about it may prove more fatal than her heart.
title: Broken

author: Bruchac, Joseph
description: Two young men on opposing sides of a war learn about themselves and the meaning of being a part of a country. In 1874 the Red River War is raging. Private Washington Vance Jr., an African American cavalry man, is sent to fight. Meanwhile a Cheyenne warrior named Wolf meets him in battle, and an unlikely friendship forms.
title: Brothers of the buffalo

author: Foster, Stewart
description: Eleven-year-old Joe lives in a hospital due to his autoimmune disease, only interacting with his sister, the medical staff, and an American boy with the same illness. He can't leave his room due to the risk of life-threatening germs, but when a new nurse offers Joe the possibility of going outside, Joe must decide if the adventure is worth the risk.
title: Bubble

author: Snow, Carol
description: After sixteen-year-old Freesia learns--and tells her friends--that their perfect life on a luxurious tropical island is not real, she is banished from her virtual world to the "mainland," where people are ugly, school is hard, and families are dysfunctional.
title: Bubble world

author: Friedman, Laurie B.
description: Turning thirteen has been a catastrophe for April Sinclair. After being humiliated in front of the hot new boy next door, she just wants to go to camp with her best friends Brynn and Billy (who she just might have feelings for). But her parents cancel camp and take April and her annoying little sisters on a summer road trip in their broken-down RV instead.
title: Can you say catastrophe?

author: Angus, Sam
description: In 1915, Billy is sailing with British troops to fight in Gallipoli. The other soldiers make fun of him for not being old enough to drink or shave, but the truth is Billy lied about his age--he's not old enough to be a soldier. Billy meets a refugee boy named Captain, together with his donkey, Hey-ho, who helps him understand bravery, loyalty, and friendship.
title: Captain

author: Ellis, Deborah
description: When normal American middle-school student Clare dies and comes back as a cat in the middle of conflict between Israelis and Palestinians, she wonders if she should even try to do what she can to help since, after all, she is just a cat.
title: The cat at the wall

author: Paul, Naomi
description: To the outside world, teenager Lian is a devoted student of the violin, destined for becoming a professional concert violinist. To those in her inner circle, however, she is known as Komiko, part of the 06/04 cyber-investigation group, which exists to expose injustice and corruption. When a dead body washes up in Big Wave Bay, Lian's secret and public life come crashing together and everyone on the 06/04 team is put in danger.
title: Code name Komiko

author: Everheart, Chris
description: When his friend Keena goes missing before her big art show, fellow graffiti artist Xriss knows he has to find her before her abusive father and a local gang do.
title: Concrete gallery

author: Divine, L.
description: Jayd encounters more drama at South Bay High when her ex, Jeremy, tries to join a basketball game with some of Jayd's friends. They tell him that white boys can't play ball, but Jeremy proves them wrong. Now he wants to join them for an important game but it's not clear whether his game will be enough for them.
title: Courtin' Jayd

author: Crutcher, Chris
description: A high school athlete, frustrated at being handicapped after an accident, runs away from home and is helped back to mental and physical health by a black benefactor and the people in a special school where he enrolls.
title: The Crazy Horse Electric game

author: Bolden, Tonya
description: Freed from slavery, Mariah and her young brother Zeke join Sherman's march through Georgia, where Mariah meets a free black named Caleb and dares to imagine the possibility of true love, but hope can come at a cost.
title: Crossing Ebenezer Creek

author: Fogelin, Adrian
description: Twelve-year-old Cass meets her new African-American neighbor, Jemmie, and despite their families' prejudices, they build a strong friendship around their mutual talent for running and a pact to read "Jane Eyre."
title: Crossing Jordan

author: Hardinge, Frances
description: In post-World War I England, eleven-year-old Triss struggles to come to terms with the disturbing changes she undergoes after she nearly drowns in a local pond.
title: Cuckoo song

author: Rabb, Margo
description: Fifteen-year-old Mia's mother is diagnosed with cancer only to die twelve days later. Heartbroken, Mia has to figure out how to keep her mother's presence alive in the wake of an unfathomable loss.
title: Cures for heartbreak

author: Coville, Bruce
description: When Angus, a mischievous brownie with a temper problem, enters the modern world, an ancient curse causes him to be bound to a messy girl named Alex. As the two get to know each other, they become involved in a mystery that could break the ancient curse.
title: Cursed

author: Palmer, Erin
description: Twins Eliza and Leander Bentley pack up with their adventurous parents and head out on the Oregon Trail to the west for a new life, but when a wild night causes Eliza to lose her most prized possession, the entire Oregon Trail could become cursed.
title: Cursed journey of the peculiar Bentleys

author: Hoena, B. A.
description: Lei Tian has been made fun of for preferring a longboard to a skateboard, but now she just wants to be herself and have fun the way she wants.
title: Daring

author: Martin, R. T.
description: A group of high school students take an extra-credit field trip to the bluffs outside of their town to watch a midnight meteor shower. Things take an eerie turn when the students start disappearing.
title: Dark star

author: Levine, Gail Carson
description: When orphaned Dave is sent to the Hebrew Home for Boys where he is treated cruelly, he sneaks out at night and is welcomed into the music- and culture-filled world of the Harlem Renaissance.
title: Dave at night

author: Wrede, Patricia C.
description: Bored with traditional palace life, a princess goes off to live with a group of dragons.
title: Dealing with dragons

author: Seiple, Samantha
description: Chronicles the true story of Theodore Roosevelt's 1913 tour of South America that led him deep into the Amazon rainforest, charting an unmapped river with his son and a renowned Brazilian explorer. Includes photos and documents from the trip.
title: Death on the river of doubt

author: Peacock, Shane
description: Adam investigates his grandfather's mysterious past in Bermuda, where he meets up with an enigmatic girl named Angel Dahl and uncovers evidence of espionage.
title: Double you

author: Fixmer, Elizabeth
description: Fourteen-year-old Eva, who has grown up in a cult known as the Righteous Path, goes into town to sell jewelry to "heathens" to make money to feed the other members. When she befriends a college student named Trevor soon after learning of the cult leader's plans to marry her, Eva is prompted to reexamine her participation in the Righteous Path and her own beliefs.
title: Down from the mountain

author: Bowen, Carl
description: When Carter Howard, an ally of a CIA traitor, is located in Iran, the Shadow Squadron is tasked with bringing him in for questioning. With Howard deep under cover, Shadow Squadron will have to get through two terrorist factions to get him into their custody.
title: Dragon teeth

author: McCaffrey, Anne
description: Forbidden by her father to indulge in music in any way, a girl on the planet Pern runs away, taking shelter with the planet's fire lizards who, along with her music, open a new life for her.
title: Dragonsong

author: McCaffrey, Anne
description: Presents a collection of artistic works, including essays, short stories, poetry, photographs, paintings, and drawings, by Native Americans from the United States and Canada.
title: Dreaming in Indian

author: Clark, Catherine
description: When Frances and her friends compete in a bike race, Frances works her way through a list of ten crazy, out-of-character things her best friend, Stella, came up with her to complete before the race is over. But when Stella suffers an accident that leaves her broken, Frances works through the list alone while she struggles to keep her promise not to tell anyone what really happened to Stella.
title: Eleven things I promised

author: Standish, Ali
description: After an accident takes his best friend and his family moves from Boston to Palm Knot, Georgia, Ethan must figure out who he is and who he wants to be. Meeting Coralee, a girl with a large personality, may just be what Ethan needs, but can he help Coralee when she needs him the most.
title: The Ethan I was before

author: Powell, William Campbell
description: Tania, a human girl in a world largely populated by teknoids, sophisticated androids manufactured by Oxted Corporation after global fertility drastically declined, sets out to discover what sets humans and teknoids apart.
title: Expiration day

author: Dashner, James
description: In the future video games are played on the VirtNet, a virtual world which offers fully integrated mind and body immersion. Michael is a gamer and also a hacker--because it is more fun to break the game world's rules. When another hacker finds a way to hold people hostage inside the VirtNet, while their bodies slowly die in the real world, the government hires Michael to become their counter-hacker and figure out the hostage-taker's motives. However, to do that Michael will have to go off the VirtNet grid into a confusing maze of virtual underworlds, where the mind makes the body vulnerable.
title: The eye of minds

author: Fletcher, Susan
description: Eleven-year-old Renzo must teach himself to blow glass with the help of a girl who has a mysterious connection to her falcon. Accompanying the girl, however, is a group of outcast children like her who are accused of being witches, and Renzo finds his situation growing ever-more dangerous as he looks after the children and protects them from the authorities.
title: Falcon in the glass

author: Bunker, Lisa
description: Thirteen-year-old Felix Yz chronicles the final month before an experimental procedure meant to separate him from the fourth-dimensional creature, Zyx, with whom he was accidentally fused as a young child.
title: Felix Yz

author: Banks, Angelica
description: When Tuesday McGillycuddy and her beloved dog, Baxterr, discover that Tuesday's mother--the famous author Serendipity Smith--has gone missing, they set out on a magical quest to find her. Along the way, they discover the mysterious place where stories originate.
title: Finding Serendipity

author: Frederick, Shane
description: Examines a number of top-five record holders and their statistics in professional football, such as comparing quarterbacks Andrew Luck, Aaron Rodgers, Drew Brees, and past players like Y.A. Tittle and Joe Montana.
title: Football stats and the stories behind them

author: Polak, Monique
description: While attending a forensics summer camp, thirteen-year-old Tabitha finds herself caught in the middle of a real-life mystery when her dog is dognapped. Determined to use her newly acquired forensic skills, Tabitha convinces her campmates to help her unravel the mystery surround a dog theft ring in their city. But solving real crimes proves to be more dangerous than she imagined.
title: Forensics squad unleashed

author: Howland, Leila
description: When their parents, a screenwriter and a film editor, go off on summer projects, Marigold, twelve, Zinnia, eleven, and Lily, five, must visit their Great Aunt Sunny in Cape Cod, where they learn much about themselves and each other and grow closer than ever.
title: The forget-me-not summer

author: Cameron, Sharon
description: Residents of Canaan are destined to forget their personal memories every twelve years during the Forgetting, a day when all memories not written down are lost forever. But Nadia has never forgotten, and as the day of Forgetting approaches, she finds herself in a desperate race to stop an unseen force that could destroy her city and those within it before all is forgotten.
title: The Forgetting

author: Fandel, Jennifer
description: Presents full-color photos and information about the life and work of architect Frank Lloyd Wright. Discusses his childhood in the Midwest, education, first successes, greatest accomplishments, and later life. Includes excerpts from Wright's own writing, a timeline, glossary, and index.
title: Frank Lloyd Wright

author: Schraff, Anne E
description: When Julian Holland escapes slavery, he has a hard time getting a job, learning that freedom does not guarantee equality.
title: Freedom knows no color

author: Nix, Garth
description: Princess Anya has the magical ability to break curses with a kiss. She lives with her evil stepmother's new husband, and finds out her step-stepfather has plans to make the kingdom all his own. Anya is forced onto a quest--with a talking dog, a boy thief in the body of a newt, and a few mischievous wizards--to free her land and, perhaps, learn a thing or two about power, kisses, and how to find friends.
title: Frogkisser!

author: Mafi, Tahereh
description: Alongside a boy named Oliver, Alice has set out to find her missing father in a mystical and dangerous land known as Furthermore. With danger at every turn, Alice will have to rely on her wits and her undying love to carry her through.
title: Furthermore

author: Lee, Jen
description: In a post-apocalyptic wasteland, a dog named Simon and his two best friends, a raccoon and deer, wait each day for "Garbage Night," which never comes. But when a mysterious stranger shows up in town and tells the three friends of humans in a neighboring town, they must join forces to brave the dangerous wasteland.
title: Garbage night

author: Hurley, Tonya
description: After dying, high school senior Charlotte Usher is as invisible to nearly everyone as she always felt, but despite what she learns in a sort of alternative high school for dead teens, she clings to life while seeking a way to go to the Fall Ball with the boy of her dreams.
title: Ghostgirl

author: Grimes, Nikki
description: A pregnant teenager finds support and forgiveness from God through a book of poetry presented from the Virgin Mary's perspective.
title: A girl named Mister

author: Moss, Miriam
description: In the summer of 1970, fifteen-year-old Anna is traveling back to her English boarding school from Jordan. But when her plane is hijacked and then stranded in the desert under the control of Palestinian guerillas, she'll be lucky to make it out alive.
title: Girl on a plane

author: Valente, Catherynne M.
description: After returning to Fairyland, September discovers its inhabitants are losing their shadows to Fairyland-Below, a dark realm ruled by September's own shadow. Now, she must find a way into this nether world to fight her own shadow and free the other shadows from its influence.
title: The girl who fell beneath Fairyland and led the revels there

author: Scattergood, Augusta
description: Gloriana June Hemphill's birthday happens to be on the Fourth of July, so every year it is filled with celebration of fireworks and iced tea in Hanging Moss, Mississippi. In the summer of 1964 she is turning twelve, but she wishes she could go back a year all the same and not have to deal with a new girl in town--who wears black socks--or her questions about why the town wants to close down the segregated public pool. As she turns twelve, Glory determines to find out the truth about everything she can.
title: Glory be

author: Ryan, Amy Kathleen
description: Part of the first generation to be conceived in deep space, fifteen-year-old Waverly is expected to marry young and have children to populate a new planet, but a violent betrayal by the dogmatic leader of their sister ship could have devastating consequences.
title: Glow

author: Holt, K. A.
description: Buck is a huge fan of the fantasy book series Triumphant Gnome Syndicate. But when the series' author, Harold Macinaw, goes missing, and then Buck's own little sister, Willy, disappears into a bottomless dumpster, Buck realizes the series is more fact than fiction. He soon finds himself racing through a terrifying world he thought was only make-believe alongside his best friend, Lizzie. Together, the two hunt the Troll Vanquishing Mace in order to save Willy and Macinaw--and the world in the process.
title: Gnome-a-geddon

author: Alexander, Willia
description: Hoping to find his lost brother, Rownie escapes the home of the witch Graba and joins a troupe of goblins who perform in Zombay, a city where humans are forbidden to wear masks and act in plays.
title: Goblin secrets

author: Neimark, Gillian
description: Flor Bernoulli--a fashion geek from New York--and Lucy Moon--a farm girl and lover of horses--team up with the power of their two magic keys to take down the villain Square Man, who seeks to get rid of every round and curved thing in the universe.
title: The golden rectangle

author: Hale, Shannon
description: On her way to marry a prince she's never met, Princess Anidori is betrayed by her guards and her lady-in-waiting and must become a goose girl to survive until she can reveal her true identity and reclaim the crown that is rightfully hers.
title: The goose girl

author: Buckley, Andrew
description: Living with his grandmother in a small town called Elkwood isn't exactly Colin's dream come true. One fateful night, Colin sneaks out and takes his grandmother's car for a ride around town. But when he can't remember what happened that evening, he begins to wonder if his lapsed memory could have anything to do with his classmate who was horrifyingly eaten on the night in questions. Soon he uncovers the startling truth about the residents of Elkwood which makes the fact that Colin's morphing into a werewolf a little less weird.
title: Hair in all the wrong places

author: Sanders, Ted
description: Horace F. Andrews, Keeper of the Box of Promises, and his new friend Chloe prepare to battle a new threat to the Keepers, the Riven. Meanwhile, a mysterious girl named April, with a damaged Ravenvine talisman, travels to the Warren for help while being pursued by evil hunters.
title: The harp and the ravenvine

author: Rowling, J. K.
description: Fourteen-year-old Harry Potter joins the Weasleys at the Quidditch World Cup, then enters his fourth year at Hogwarts Academy where he is mysteriously entered in an unusual contest that challenges his wizarding skills, friendships and character, amid signs that an old enemy is growing stronger.
title: Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire

author: Vance, Alexander
description: Seventh-grader Quentin starts his own business as a "Heartbreak Messenger" who delivers breakup messages for a fee. Quentin's business is doing well until his messages begin affecting his own heart.
title: The heartbreak messenger

author: Leavitt, Martine
description: Abandoned by his mother, thirteen-year-old Heck tries to survive on his own as his mind bounces between the superhero character he imagines himself to be and the harsh reality of his life.
title: Heck, superhero

author: Kelly, Erin Entrada
description: When Chet "the Bull" Bullens pulls an unthinkable prank on shy, misunderstood Virgil, which also affects Gulliver--Virgil's pet hamster--Valencia Somerset and Kaori Tanaka find their lives and Virgil's and Chet's colliding in surprising ways.
title: Hello, universe

author: Kontis, Alethea
description: Saturday Woodcutter, sibling to sisters named for the other six days of the week, doesn't have any magical talent--only a sword and a mirror--until she accidentally calls the sea to her backyard. She sets sail on a dangerous adventure to fix the world she broke, and meets a man under a witch's spell that only Saturday can break.
title: Hero

author: Spinelli, Jerry
description: Ever since they were Snotsippers, Jack and the girl have fought, until one day she steals his bike and as he and the Amigos try to recover it, Jack realizes that he is growing up and must eventually leave the "goodlands and badlands of Hokey Pokey."
title: Hokey Pokey

author: Cozzo, Karole
description: When Jordyn's autistic brother joins her at her elite school her junior year, she is determined not to let anyone know they are related, even if that means closing herself off to her closest friends Erin, Tanu, and Alex, the football captain she secretly loves.
title: How to say I love you out loud

author: Schusterman, Michelle
description: When Holly starts seventh grade, she's looks forward to band most of all but the first day offers more than a few surprises with a new band director, new rules, and new chair placements. Then Holly discovers that her best friend Julia has replaced her with another girl. Holly vows to do whatever it takes to get her friendship with Julia back on track.
title: I [heart] band!

author: Vail, Rachel
description: Seventh-grader Zoe, who comes from a big family where she's never had anything all to herself, desperately wants CJ for a best friend, but when CJ reveals that she likes the boy Zoe likes, she must make a choice.
title: If you only knew

author: Woolf, Alex
description: Explores how technology has impacted the fields of history and archaeology by helping to find, date, and examine bodies and artifacts. Includes a timeline, a glossary, resources for further information, and color photographs.
title: The impact of technology in history and archaeology

author: Christopher, John
description: Dom's hunting tribe and Va's farming tribe can't stop the two from falling in love. And when the two manage to escape battle, they find themselves lost on the stark landscape of their past.
title: In the beginning

author: Daswani, Kavita
description: Fifteen-year-old Indie Konkipuddi will do anything to land an internship with a popular fashion magazine, even babysit the publisher's two-year-old son. When Indie discovers some interesting news about a Hollywood star, she is sure her story will lead to an internship. But Indie's idea does not go the way she planned and now she wonders if the publisher will ever notice her real talents.
title: Indie girl

author: Falls, Kat
description: Beyond the Titan wall lies the Feral Zone, and the only people who break quarantine and venture there are the "fetches", who are paid exorbitant sums to bring back items that were left behind when the wall went up--but Delaney McEvoy's father is there and she is being forced to find him and bring him back.
title: Inhuman

author: Eamer, Claire
description: Presents information about the microbes that live in the human body and their roles in health. Uses illustrations to describe the symbiotic relationship between humans and microbes and discuss the different types of microbes that thrive in the body.
title: Inside your insides

author: Collier, Kristi
description: In 1957, when her preacher father accepts a post in Jericho, Alabama, Jo wants to fit in but her growing friendship with a black boy forces her to confront the racism of the South and to reconsider her own values.
title: Jericho walls

author: Paterson, Katherine
description: While living on a Vermont poor farm during 1855 and 1856, Jip learns his identity and that of his mother and comes to understand how he arrived at this place.
title: Jip

author: Sloan, Holly Goldberg
description: The happily-ever-after that teenagers Sam and Emily envisioned for themselves is turned on its head when Sam's unstable father makes a jailbreak and comes after his sons and Emily for revenge.
title: Just call my name

author: Caterer, Claire
description: While visiting Hawkesbury, England, eleven-year-old Holly Shepard, her younger brother, Ben, and new friend Everett, travel to a parallel universe where she learns that the adventures she has always dreamed of can be messy and dangerous.
title: The key & the flame

author: Brown, Jennifer
description: Twelve-year-old Arcturus Betelgeuse Chambers' quest to find life on other planets seems at an end when his parents decide to move to Las Vegas, but while they look for a house he stays with his neighbor, an astronaut who soon becomes a friend.
title: Life on Mars

author: Johnson, Angela
description: A thirteen-year-old girl struggles to cope with the loss of her beloved older brother, who disappeared four months earlier off the coast of Cape Cod.
title: Looking for Red

author: Raabe, Emily
description: After their mother falls mysteriously ill, eleven-year-old twins Gus and Leo and their mute younger sister, Ila, learn that they share their mother's ability to transform into animals, and to defeat the evil King of the Black Lakes, they must harness this newfound power.
title: Lost children of the far islands

author: Riordan, Rick
description: Jason, Piper, and Leo, three students from a school for "bad kids," find themselves at Camp Half-Blood, where they learn that they are demigods and begin a quest to free Hera, who has been imprisoned by Mother Earth herself.
title: The lost hero

author: Hughes, Alison
description: Flynn will have nothing to do with the outdoors if he can help it, preferring to leave that stuff to his little sister and his parents. So, one day when Flynn gets lost in the wilderness, after going off path, he will have to rely on a stick of gum, some lichen, and snow to stay alive in the hopes of rescue.
title: Lost in the backyard

author: Turner, Tracey
description: In this interactive adventure, the reader is lost in the Andes Mountains and must make the right choices to survive. Includes scientific facts, true stories, illustrations, a glossary, and sources of further information.
title: Lost in the mountains of death

author: Turner, Tracey
description: Lost in the alligator-infested swamps of the Florida Everglades, the reader's decisions determine if survival is possible.
title: Lost in the swamp of terror

author: Welch, Jenna Evans
description: Sixteen-year-old Lina is honoring her mother's dying wish by spending the summer in Tuscany getting to know the father she's never met. And when she's given her mother's diary from her own time in Tuscany, a world of romance and art inspires Lina to follow in her mother's footsteps and uncover a secret that could change everything she ever thought she knew.
title: Love & gelato

author: Karalius, Kimberly
description: Teenage love-charm maker Hijiri enters a charm-making contest with her friends, but the stakes are high. If Hijiri doesn't win the competition, disaster will surely follow. And when Love itself drops a perfect boy on Hijiri's doorstep, she must figure out how to win both the contest and the heart of the mysterious new boy.
title: Love charms and other catastrophes

author: Kopp, Megan
description: Introduces kids to gardening and landscaping, and offers three step-by-step projects kids can do to learn about the topic themselves. Includes color photographs, a glossary, and further resources.
title: Maker projects for kids who love greening up spaces

author: Skovron, Jon
description: Boy is a sixteen-year-old hacker and techno geek who has never left the confines of the secret enclave hidden deep beneath a Broadway theater. Boy's father is Frankenstein and his mother is Frankenstein's Bride. Deciding to run away from home, along with the granddaughters of Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde, Boy embarks on a madcap journey deep into the heart of America, falling in love along the way and coming to terms with being both a man and a monster.
title: Man made Boy

author: Travers, P. L
description: An extraordinary English nanny blows in on the East Wind with her parrot-headed umbrella and magic carpetbag and introduces her charges, Jane and Michael, to some delightful people and experiences.
title: Mary Poppins

author: Hamilton, K. R
description: The Amazing Automated Inn is the home of Wally Kennewickett, a twelve-year-old genius, and his loyal dachshund Noodles. When the Mesmers, a group of evil hypnotists bent on world domination, show up at the Inn, they never expected their plans to be challenged by a twelve-year-old.
