title: The Mesmer menace

author: Rusch, Elizabeth
description: Explores the story of the Spirit and Opportunity Mars Rovers and the man at NASA who headed the mission, Steven Squyres.
title: The mighty Mars rovers

author: Ruby, Lois
description: When Miriam develops bone cancer, she finds herself the focus of a battle between the medical and legal establishments and the small Christian sect to which she and her family belong.
title: Miriam's well

author: Levy, Dana Alison
description: Relates the adventures of a family with two fathers, four adopted boys, and a variety of pets as they make their way through a school year, Kindergarten through sixth grade, and deal with a grumpy new neighbor.
title: The misadventures of the family Fletcher

author: Toor, Rachel
description: Explores the fun and joy the author has in keeping rats as pets, arguing that rats are misunderstood and poorly characterized as disgusting creatures, and that actually, with rats' intelligence and personalities, they can actually make very good pets--such as her own pet rat named Iris.
title: Misunderstood

author: Dessen, Sarah
description: Emaline and Luke have been together all through high school, and Emaline thinks it is perfect. However, this is the summer before college, and things are changing in her small town of Colby on the beach. For one is Theo, the super-ambitious, handsome, smart New York boy who has come to town to help on a documentary--and he thinks Emaline is pretty. Then there is Emaline's dad, who thinks she ought to go to an Ivy League school and leave Luke behind.
title: The moon and more

author: Voorhoeve, Anne C.
description: Before the start of World War II, ten-year-old Ziska Mangold, who has Jewish ancestors but has been raised as a Protestant, is taken out of Nazi Germany on one of the Kindertransport trains, to live in London with a Jewish family, where she learns about Judaism and endures the hardships of war while attempting to keep in touch with her parents, who are trying to survive in Holland.
title: My family for the war

author: Wood, Maryrose
description: Fifteen-year-old Miss Penelope Lumley, a recent graduate of the Swanburne Academy for Poor Bright Females, is hired as governess to three young children who have been raised by wolves and must teach them to behave in a civilized manner quickly, in preparation for a Christmas ball.
title: The mysterious howling

author: Croggon, Alison
description: A manuscript from the lost civilization of Edil-Amarandah chronicles the experiences of sixteen-year-old Maerad, an orphan gifted in the magic and power of the Bards, as she escapes from slavery and begins to learn how to use her Gift to stave off the evil Darkness that threatens to consume her world.
title: The naming

author: Jobin, Matthew
description: The inhabitants of Moorvale are terrified when the evil Nethergrim, thought to have been destroyed by two heroes ages ago, returns and begins snatching away livestock and children. Wizard-in-training Edmund vows to get his brother back, but as a poor student of magic he doesn't know what he can do. His friends Katherine and Tom vow to help him in any way they can to defeat the ancient evil.
title: The Nethergrim

author: Green, Tim
description: Brock's father is on the run, forcing him to constantly adjust to new towns and new identities. When Brock accepts a dare to throw a rock through the window of a travel-team coach's window in an effort to fit in with the local kids, Coach Hudgens surprises him by deciding to encourage Brock's baseball skills.
title: New kid

author: Beil, Michael D.
description: Andy witnesses a bank robbery and then is recruited by a secret organization that finds and eliminates evil.
title: A new recruit

author: Tanquary, Kathryn
description: When thirteen-year-old Saki Yamamoto unintentionally invokes a death curse, she must enter the dangerous spirit world at the Night Parade and attempt to perform deeds that can break the curse.
title: The night parade

author: Brandes, Wendy L.
description: All her camper friends think that Nina is crazy about boys, which she denies--but she does find her friend Emily's brother, Zac, attractive and likes to hang out with him, even though she knows the other girls will tease her.
title: Nina's NOT boy crazy! (she just likes boys)

author: Busby, Cylin
description: Jacob Tibbs was the runt of the litter of kittens, and although Captain Natick thought it better not to bring the scrawny kitten to sea with him, he relented and let the cat come along. Now Jacob Tibbs is on the adventure of a lifetime braving the high seas, surviving on a desert island, and remaining loyal to his captain and crew through it all.
title: The nine lives of Jacob Tibbs

author: Baskin, Nora Raleigh
description: A few days before September 11, 2001, four middle schoolers in different parts of the country are going about their lives. Sergio, in Brooklyn, struggles with his hatred for his often absent father while living with his beloved grandmother. Will, meanwhile, cannot come to terms with the car accident that took his father's life. Naheed begins to feel uncomfortable about being Muslim, especially when she approaches the age of wearing a head scarf. Aimee, who has just started going to a new school, misses her mom, who is on a business flight to New York. Then, on 9/11, the lives of the four children intersect and are affected by the terrorist attacks.
title: Nine, ten

author: Cooney, Caroline B.
description: Not long after starting their summer vacation, the Allerdons are faced with a nightmare--Lander, the oldest girl, begins dating a handsome young man, and shortly afterwards is accused of murder. Her little sister, Miranda, cannot believe Lander is guilty, and thinks her new boyfriend has something to do with the false accusations. However, the more she investigates, the more Miranda wonders if Lander really could have committed such a heinous crime.
title: No such person

author: Blount, Patty
description: Amanada is a foster child and a Junior Cadet volunteering the the local firehouse. When her boss's son leaves, she's hesitant to get involved because she fears losing her position. And when a string of arsons seem to point directly at her foster brother, everything she cares about most could be at stake.
title: Nothing left to burn

author: Lieberman, Leanne
description: After enrolling in a contemporary dance camp when her summer ballet classes are canceled, Meg finds herself clashing with another dancer and struggling to learn the moves. She must find a way to succeed at the camp or her entire summer will be a disaster.
title: Off pointe

author: Staniszewski, Anna
description: Ainsley's mother lands a job directing a summer fairy-tale cruise ship's festivities, which means Ainsley will be spending the summer by the pool on the ocean--or not. Ainsley finds she is expected to help her mother, which means being in a hundred places at once and stressed out of her wits. Ainsley starts to think her fairy-tale cruise is under a wicked spell.
title: Once upon a cruise

author: Barr, Emily
description: Seventeen-year-old Flora Banks has retrograde amnesia, which leaves her unable to make new memories. That is, until she kisses her best friend's boyfriend, Drake, the night before he leaves town--a memory that breaks through her fractured mind, convincing her that he is the only one who can restore her memory. She sets off on a journey to the Arctic to find him using messages written on her skin, her phone, and a diary-like notebook to fill in the details of recent history.
title: The one memory of Flora Banks

author: Sheldon, Dyan
description: Having only ever had about two dates her whole life, Hildy had almost given up on love--then Connor walks into her dull-as-toast summer and turns it into her first summer of love. However, none of the romantic movies and songs could have prepared Hildy for the jealousy that her guy friends arouse in Connor, so that he almost loses his mind.
title: One or two things I learned about love

author: Hyde, Catherine Ryan
description: A middle grade edition of the story of twelve-year-old Trevor McKinney, a California boy who takes on a school extra credit challenge by doing good deeds for others and asking them to "pay it forward" to others in need.
title: Pay it forward

author: Riordan, Rick
description: Percy Jackson, son of Poseidon and modern-day demi-god, offers his unique viewpoint and retelling of a range of ancient Greek myths, including the stories of heroes like Jason and Theseus, as well as Perseus, Atalanta, and Bellerophon. Presents companion material to the "Percy Jackson" series of books.
title: Percy Jackson's Greek heroes

author: Hamilton, Virginia
description: Already a leader in New York's underground world of homeless children, Buddy Clark takes on the responsibility of protecting the overweight, emotionally disturbed friend with whom he has been playing hooky from eighth grade all semester.
title: The planet of Junior Brown

author: Gregg, Stacy
description: Modern day Jordanian Princess Haya Bint Al Hussein's life is transformed in amazing ways after her father buys her a foal to console her following the tragic death of her mother.
title: The princess and the foal

author: Homzie, Hillary
description: After posting a "selfie" to a popular picture posting site, Karma Cooper becomes a social media celebrity and is asked by the Bees, the most-popular clique of girls at school, to be Spirit Week's seventh-grade social media chair. However, Karma becomes addicted to her smartphone, and after she breaks the rules her parents take it from her. Suffering from withdrawals, Karma has to find a way to live without technology.
title: Queen of likes

author: Probst, Jeff
description: Presents a children's guide to plants with unique qualities. Features fun facts about dangerous, valuable, and strange plants and includes full-color photographs, mini-quizzes, a glossary, and an index.
title: Remarkable plants

author: Birch, Beverley
description: When Ella discovers that her sister Charly, a British journalist, and three teenagers go missing while camping at the base of the Chomlaya Rocks, she flies to Africa to help Inspector Murothi investigate the disappearances. Joe, one of the missing teenagers, reappears with no recollection of his disappearance, and the three must work quickly to save the others.
title: Rift

author: Birch, Beverley
description: Contains hundreds of color photographs portraying a variety of natural and man-made oddities from around the world.
title: Ripley's believe it or not!

author: Starmer, Aaron
description: Alistair Cleary is the kind of kid everyone trusts, who never reveals anyone else's secrets. His neighbor girl is Fiona Loomis. One day Fiona shows up on Alistair's doorstep and asks him to write her biography, detailing her adventures in a magical world where a creature known as the Riverman is stealing the souls of children. Alistair worries Fiona has gone insane, but on the other hand if she is telling the truth, then he has to help her.
title: The Riverman

author: Stone, Phoebe
description: Flissy Budwig has grown accustomed to life in Bottlebay, Maine, especially living with the attractive boy her aunt and uncle adopted--Derek. He likes her back--but when a mysterious man comes to the door claiming to be Derek's true father, Flissy worries he will take Derek away. However,the man is asking all the wrong questions--questions about Flissy's parents, spies working for the Allies over in Europe for World War II.
title: Romeo blue

author: Zimmerman, Virginia
description: After receiving an ancient and allegedly magical book, which may have been owned by Shakespeare himself, friends Rosemary and Adam discover Adam's sister has vanished, and their memories of her are fading, too. An obscure spell involving rosemary, the flower for remembrance, may be the only thing that can bring her back.
title: The rosemary spell

author: Jacques, Brian
description: The Sable Quean is holding the Redwallers' young Dibbuns in her plot to conquer Redwall Abbey. The fate of the young ones may rest with Buckler, Blademaster of the Long Patrol, and the clever Dibbuns themselves.
title: The Sable Quean

author: Nix, Garth
description: Sabriel, daughter of the necromancer Abhorsen, must journey into the mysterious and magical Old Kingdom to rescue her father from the Land of the Dead.
title: Sabriel

author: Miranda, Megan
description: For seventeen years, Kelsey's mother hasn't stepped foot outside her house, not since she escaped her kidnappers, one of their babies growing inside her--Kelsey. Kelsey has been coached to fear every scenario her whole life, everything that might happen to put the kidnappers back on their trail. One day, Kelsey is in an accident and is rescued by classmate and volunteer firefighter Ryan Baker, but when the two return to her home, Kelsey finds her mother missing--a scenario she hadn't planned for. Now someone is coming after her, too.
title: The safest lies

author: Haugaard, Erik Christian
description: In turbulent sixteenth-century Japan, orphaned Taro is taken in by a general serving the great warlord Takeda Shingen and grows up to become a samurai fighting for the enemies of his dead family.
title: The samurai's tale

author: Hedrick, Gail E.
description: At the bed and breakfast where fourteen-year-old Emily works with her friend, Mary, strange incidents keep happening that threaten the reputation of the inn owned by Mary's grandmother. Emily, Mary, and the neighbor boy Alex investigate and find themselves in grave danger.
title: The scent of something sneaky

author: Stroud, Jonathan
description: Follows three young operatives of a Psychic Detection Agency as they battle an epidemic of ghosts in London.
title: The screaming staircase

author: Cottman, Michael H.
description: The author, a journalist and former reporter for the Washington Post, traces the route of the ill-fated slave ship, the Henrietta Marie, which sank off the coast of Key West, Florida in the early 1700s. And as an African American, he comes to better understand his own heritage in the process. Includes resources for further information.
title: Shackles from the deep

author: Diehn, Andi
description: Explores four Shakespeare plays and examines their effects on today's books, music, and movies. Discusses "Romeo and Juliet," "Hamlet," "Twelfth Night," and "A Midsummer Night's Dream." Meets Common Core standards and includes a glossary, index, and resources for further information.
title: Shakespeare

author: Mull, Brandon
description: On Halloween, sixth-grader Cole Randolph watches as his friends are whisked through a portal to the Outskirts, an in-between world. He dives in after them and discovers that the balance of power in the five kingdoms of the Outskirts has been upset. Now Cole must set things right, rescue his friends, and find his way back home.
title: Sky Raiders

author: Grant, Vicki
description: After her orphanage burns down in 1964, Dot gets a job as a seamstress at a lakeside resort where she enlists the aid of a local boy in her search for clues about the parents who abandoned her as a newborn.
title: Small bones

author: Hughes, Dean
description: Two boys, one German and one American, are eager to join their respective armies during World War II, and their paths cross at the Battle of the Bulge.
title: Soldier boys

author: McKernan, Victoria
description: Hardened survivor Aiden Lynch's luck continues to serve him when he wins a ship in a high-stakes poker game. The ship is well-fitted and ready for trade, and so Aiden becomes a trader between California and Peru. However, nothing in his past prepared Aiden for the cruelty and savagery he sees in Peru, particularly in the mines--and when Aiden meets a Chinese miner who claims to be a captured nobleman, his loyalties come into question.
title: Son of fortune

author: Van de Ruit, John
description: In 1990, thirteen-year-old John "Spud" Milton, a prepubescent choirboy, keeps a diary of his first year at an elite, boys-only boarding school in South Africa, as he deals with bizarre housemates, wild crushes, and embarrassingly dysfunctional parents.
title: Spud

author: North, Phoebe
description: For all of her sixteen years, Terra has lived on a city within a spaceship that left Earth five hundred years ago seeking refuge, but as they finally approach the chosen planet, she is drawn into a secret rebellion that could change the fate of her people.
title: Starglass

author: Garlick, Nicholas
description: Orphaned and living on his uncle's remote island farm, Flip doubts he'll ever feel at home in his new life. But when one day, a sinking ship leaves a horse drowning in the waves, Flip saves the animal, hoping this new friendship will save him, too.
title: Storm horse

author: Dagg, Carole Estby
description: In 1934, eleven-year-old Terpsichore's father signs up for President Roosevelt's Palmer Colony project, uprooting the family from Wisconsin to become pioneers in Alaska, where Terpsichore refuses to let rough conditions and first impressions get in the way of her grand adventure.
title: Sweet home Alaska

author: Finneyfrock, Karen
description: Celia Door begins her high school freshman career with thick eyeliner, Goth boots, and a chip on her shoulder against Sandy Firestone--the former-friend who humiliated her in eighth grade. She has planned all the ways she wants to get revenge, but all those plans seem petty when Drake, the cool, cute new kid from New York, walks into her life. Celia's quest for revenge threatens to strain a tenuous new friendship with Drake, and she must weigh what she wants more--revenge, or relationship.
title: The sweet revenge of Celia Door

author: Moore, Stephanie Perry
description: During her freshman year in college, African-American teenager Payton adjusts to being away from home, deals with problems with boys and girlfriends, and discovers that her value is found in her relationship with Christ.
title: Sweetest gift

author: Hunter, Erin
description: Presents three stories featuring dogs as the main characters. In the first, a half-wolf runt is transformed into a cruel pack leader. In the second, Sweet rises through the ranks to become Beta of the Wild Pack. In the third, Moon abandons the pack that raised her.
title: Tales from the packs

author: Shusterman, Neal
description: A new house and a new attic hold untold mysteries for fourteen-year-old Nick, his younger brother, and new friends Mitch, Caitlin, and Vincent. The attic, it seems, was the genius Nikola Tesla's storehouse for his final invention, which needs to be assembled before use--unfortunately a garage sale scatters Tesla's individual items before Nick finds out. Now Nick must reassemble the items and keep them safe before they fall into the wrong hands.
title: Tesla's attic

author: Dlugos, Jenn
description: Offers real-world examples of mutations in animals and plants, including ten-legged spiders, two-toned lobsters, and albino redwood trees. Includes color photographs, fact boxes, and quizzes.
title: Things that make you go yuck

author: Nadol, Jen
description: High school junior Riley and his friends discover a pair of binoculars in the woods that contain disturbing visions of the future. When the visions begin coming true, Riley becomes determined to find out who is behind them.
title: This is how it ends

author: Kephart, Beth
description: When a super-storm devastates the small island Mira lives on, she is injured and alone. As she searches for her missing friends and tries to survive without her mother and brother, Mira finds herself facing a mysterious and emotional journey of survival, hope, and friendship.
tags: Survival after airplane accidents, shipwrecks, etc.
title: This is the story of you

author: Schraff, Anne E
description: Abel Ruiz struggles to overcome his family's pessimism and follow his dreams. He finally finds a job and begins saving for a car, but an incident at work threatens to derail his dreams and cost him the affections of a beautiful girl.
title: To catch a dream

author: Jones, Patrick
description: Randy takes being team captain seriously, trying to help himself and his teammates be the best they can be--so when he finds some of his players cheating in school, he has to make the choice of exposing their wrongdoing, or keep them on the team for the sake of an upcoming tournament.
title: To the point

author: Dennard, Susan
description: Emperors, princes, mercenaries, unsavory sorts--all would love to get their hands on a Truthwitch, a witch who can tell fact from fiction. Safiya is just such a Truthwitch, but she has hidden her magical ability from all, save for Iseult her friend. Iseult, a Threadwitch, can see the hidden ties that bind the lives of those around her. With war coming to the Witchlands, Safiya and Iseult recruit the help of Prince Merik, a Windwitch and ship's captain, to escape and live life on their own terms.
title: Truthwitch

author: Avi
description: Oliver Cromwell Pitts wakes up to find his father missing and his home flooded in the seaside town of Melcombe Regis, England, 1724. With no money, Oliver decides to loot a wrecked ship, which is illegal. He finds money, but soon is caught and sent to the poorhouse. He manages to escape from the cruel master there, then discovers his father has gone to London to look for his sister, Charity, who is in some kind of trouble.
title: The unexpected life of Oliver Cromwell Pitts

author: Fombelle, Timothâee de
description: Becoming a fugitive when he is wrongly accused of murder, an aspiring young priest embarks on a transcontinental journey by train, boat, and airship in search of answers about his shrouded past.
title: Vango

author: Wooding, Chris
description: Best friends Casica and Shiara are total opposites, but their differences work to their advantage when the two are racing cars together. With their sights set on the biggest, deadliest race of the year, it's not just their lives that are in danger--their friendship could get hurt, too.
title: Velocity

author: Farrey, Brian
description: Jaxter Grimjinks is the youngest of the Grimjinx clan, the swiftest and smartest thieves in Vengekeep. However, Jaxter is neither of those things, and in his first heist he gets his whole family into the gaol. Then in Vengekeep there arises a prophecy foretelling the Grimjinx family will be the heroes of the land. The townspeople let the Grimjinx out of the gaol, but into a frying pan of fire, flood, skeletons, and prophetic danger.
title: The Vengekeep prophecies

author: Roberts, Willo Davis
description: Rob admits having seen a murder, but no one believes him--except the murderer.
title: The view from the cherry tree

author: Fayers, Claire
description: Found alone in a rowboat as a child, twelve-year-old Brine Seaborne now works keeping house for an irritable magician and his annoying apprentice, Peter. But when Brine and Peter get themselves into trouble and must flee, they somehow find themselves on the path of the legendary pirate ship "Onion." Soon, they're thrown into the pirates' quest to find the Magical North, a place so secret most people think it doesn't exist.
title: The voyage to Magical North

author: Daly, Stuart
description: Caspan abandons his life of theivery on the streets to serve the King in a secret order called the Brotherhood. As the invading army of the Roon close in, it's up to Caspan and his fellow recruits to stop them before it's too late.
title: The wardens

author: Moriarty, Chris
description: In early twentieth-century New York, as thirteen-year-old Sacha Kessler, the Inquisitor's apprentice, faces enemies old and new that threaten him and his family, he changes his mind about learning magic.
title: The watcher in the shadows

author: Marsden, Carolyn
description: As American bombs fall on Baghdad during the Iraq War, ten-year-old cousins Nouri and Talib witness the growing violence between Sunni and Shiite Muslims.
title: The White Zone

author: Kittscher, Kristen
description: When their game of neighborhood spying takes a dark turn one night, pre-teen sleuths Sophie Young and Grace Yang find themselves caught in a dangerous cat-and-mouse game with their bizarre guidance counselor, who may be hiding something sinister.
title: The wig in the window

author: Cody, Matthew
description: In the late 1100s, thirteen-year-old Will, the future Lord of Shackley, is exiled to Sherwood Forest, where he meets Robin Hood and the Merry Men and bands with them to try retake Shackley Castle.
title: Will in scarlet

author: Frank, E. R.
description: After a car accident seriously injures her best friend and kills her brother's girlfriend, sixteen-year-old Anna tries to cope with her guilt and grief, while learning some truths about her family and herself.
title: Wrecked

author: Gewirtz, Adina
description: All that eleven-year-old Annie and her brother Rew know about their father is what their Gran tells them--that he was killed by an angry man, and now that angry man is in prison. Annie and Rew would make up stories about what their father might have done for a living--be a pirate, secret agent, maybe even a pilot--but all that is undone when an escaped convict holds them and Gran hostage in their own home. Now Annie and Rew are about to learn the truth.
title: Zebra forest

author: Higgins, Nadia
description: Leo, Chad, and the rest of the Zombie Zappers arrive at summer camp and must solve the mystery of the Smellerd zombies at Lake Moan.
title: Zombie camp

author: Wyatt, Chris
description: Ant-Man joins the Avengers in battling a deadly virus that is spreading through the ants of New York City and turning humans into zombies.
title: Zombie repellent

author: Francis, Suzanne
description: When bunny Judy Hopps, a new member of the Zootopia police department, has to team up with a con artist fox name Nick Wilde, she only hopes he'll help her find a missing Zootopia resident. But the pair uncovers a conspiracy and a friendship they never imagined.
title: Zootopia

author: Otfinoski, Steven
description: Highlights the creation and evolution of 3D printing from its inception in 1983 to potential uses in the future. Includes a glossary, career statistics, resources for further information, and color photographs.
title: 3D printing

author: Eland, Lindsay
description: Adam, Perk, Pearl, Ray, and Dutch decide it is time they do something about the school bully and his father, the school principal.
title: 5 times revenge

author: Plum, Amy
description: When seventeen-year-old Juneau, who lives with a small group in the Alaskan wilderness in the wake of a nuclear war, wakes up to find her entire clan missing, she sets out to rescue them and learns in the process that everything she thought she knew is a lie.
title: After the end

author: Seven, John
description: Living in the twenty-fifth century, young Dawkins and Hypatia Faraday take time travel and technology like the NeuroNet for granted but in Prague in 1648, they are startled to find a rogue alchemist who is using advanced technology to change mercury into gold.
title: The alchemist war

author: Condon, Robin L.
description: Provides a biography of abolitionist and African American social reformer Frederick Douglass. Describes his early years, relationships with historic figures, accomplishments, and legacy. Includes illustrations, primary source quotes, a glossary, and timelines.
title: All about Frederick Douglass

author: Kaurin, Marianne
description: It is October, 1942, and fifteen-year-old Ilse Stern is waiting in a park in Oslo, Norway, for boy-next-door Hermann Rod, who has finally asked her on a date. What Ilse doesn't know is that Hermann cannot make it, because he is secretly part of the Resistance helping Norwegian Jews flee the country--Jewish families like Ilse's. The time for inaction is over.
title: Almost autumn

author: Khan, Hena
description: Amina, a Pakistani American Muslim, has entered middle school. She is happy hanging with her friend, Soojin, a Korean American, but things have started changing, especially when Soojin starts hanging out with popular Emily. When Soojin says she might change her name to something more American, Amina starts to wonder if she will have to change to fit in, too. However, when her local mosque is vandalized, Amina realizes that it is better to be herself.
title: Amina's voice

author: Morrow, Paula
description: Focuses on the cultures found along the Yellow River, the cradle of Chinese civilization. Discusses the geography, history, dynasties, ethnic groups, cities, societies, economics, technologies, governments, languages, art, literature, religions, achievements, and daily life in this region. Includes color photographs and illustrations, maps, a glossary, and sources for additional information.
title: Ancient Chinese culture

author: Schwab, Victoria
description: Within the Archive, Librarians can read the Histories contained inside the bodies of the dead. As a Keeper, it is Mackenzie Bishop's job to keep violent Histories from awakening and escaping the archive. When someone begins deliberately changing Histories, however, Mackenzie must find out who is behind the plot before their actions destroy the Archive.
title: The archived

author: Frank, Steven
description: When Armstrong Le Rois gets signed up to be bussed to an all-white school in a different neighborhood, he's not sure what to think. And when he meets his deskmate, Charlie Ross, they're an unlikely pair. But as the year goes on, the two learn that there's nothing worth fighting for more than a true friend.
title: Armstrong & Charlie

author: Walker, Meliss
description: Sixteen-year-old Callie McPhee, a ghost existing in the Prism between Earth and the next dimension, is torn between Nick, the boyfriend she left behind when she died, and Thatcher, the sprit who is teaching her how to haunt.
title: Ashes to ashes

author: Bodden, Valerie
description: Explores the events leading up to and surrounding the assassination of John F. Kennedy, and discusses the fallout of that event and how it changed America.
title: The assassination of John F. Kennedy

author: Ahiers, Sarah
description: In the land of Lovero, nine rival Families of assassins conduct killings lawfully, for a price. Seventeen-year-old Lea is a member of the Saldana family, and therefore forbidden from romance with Val Da Vias, from a rival family, but she cannot stay away. Then, Lea wakes up to find her family murdered and her home in flames. Thinking Val betrayed her, Lea vows vengeance on the entire Da Vias family.
title: Assassin's heart

author: Lowry, Lois
description: When her father goes to fight in World War II, Elizabeth goes with her mother and sister to her grandfather's house where she learns to face up to the always puzzling and often cruel realities of the adult world.
title: Autumn street

author: Acton, Vanessa
description: Elijah thinks that this summer will be the worst ever after being both grounded and losing his summer job--but it gets worse than that. A wildfire breaks out, heading straight for his town. Elijah must act quickly and make the choice of evacuating or staying to help his friends.
title: Backfire

author: Shell, Robbie
description: Seventh-grader Sam needs to find a science fair project and a way to save the restaurant where his father works so he recruits three friends to raise bees on a hotel roof in New York City. However, the group must overcome lots of obstacles, including bee stings and a rival team's cheating. Includes facts about bees and Colony Collapse Disorder.
title: Bees on the roof

author: Guillain, Adam
description: Bella lives with her adoptive family in London but she is using her magical powers to find her biological father whom she believes is still alive. Her quest leads her to a mysterious tapestry in Ethiopia, an American tycoon, and a band of medieval knights.
title: Bella Balistica and the African safari

author: Peabody, Erin
description: Presents an overview of the science and mythology behind the cryptid Bigfoot. Explores the sightings and evidence people have used to prove its existence, and the historical impact of how Bigfoot became a major figure in popular culture. Features illustrations, sidebars, and suggestions for further reading.
title: Bigfoot

author: Vernick, Shirley Reva
description: While staying alone at an old inn called the Black Butterfly on the coast of Maine during Christmas break, Penny encounters a female spirit who wants her dead and meets the handsome son of the inn's owner, who refuses to believe in ghosts.
title: The black butterfly

author: Sedgwick, Julian
description: Talented magician Danny, who is half-Chinese, half-British, and dwarf strongman Zamora try to find the connection between the disastrous end of the circus Mysterium, where Danny's performer parents were killed, and the disappearance of his guardian aunt, who is investigating sinister gangs in Hong Kong.
title: The Black Dragon

author: Kreie, Chris
description: When Mateo and his friends set off on a road trip to see the blood moon eclipse, they find themselves in a sinister nightmare of horrific proportions.
title: Blood moon

author: Clary, Julian
description: The Bolds, a family of hyenas who have gone undercover as humans, shock their neighbors with their actions--Mr. Bold scavenges in neighbors' garbage, Mrs. Bold makes hats from egg boxes and chicken bones, Bobby always is chewing on table legs, and Betty chases her brother while he is doing so and laughs with a cackle. Of course, no family is ordinary, but their neighbors don't seem to pick up on the ruse.
title: The Bolds

author: Newquist, H. P
description: Traces the history and popularity of chocolate from its origins to today. Discusses how chocolate is made from the cocoa bean, major candy brands and their origins, and today's chocolate culture. Includes photographs throughout and a glossary of terms.
title: The book of chocolate

author: Alexander, Lloyd
description: Taran, Assistant Pig-Keeper to a famous oracular sow, sets out on a hazardous mission to save Prydain from the forces of evil.
title: The book of three

author: Allen, Becky
description: Jae is a young slave in a once-fertile world now dying from drought. When Jae stumbles upon a powerful new source for water, her estate owner's son Elan begs her to use it to save everyone, but Jae has revenge in mind. And when Elan's father discovers her plans, he'll stop at nothing to keep Jae from rising up.
title: Bound by blood and sand

author: Curtis, Christopher Paul
description: Deeply involved in his cold and manipulative mother's shady business dealings in Flint, Michigan, fourteen-year-old Luther keeps a sense of humor while running the Happy Neighbor Group Home For Men, all the while dreaming of going to college and becoming a philosopher.
title: Bucking the Sarge

author: Collier, Peter
description: Presents true accounts of the heroic actions of men and women who have been recognized by the Congressional Medal of Honor Foundation. Includes black-and-white photographs throughout.
title: Choosing courage

author: Rinaldi, Ann
description: Fourteen-year-old Luli and her family face tragedy after failing to tell their slaves that President Lincoln's Emanicipation Proclamation made them free.
title: Come Juneteenth

author: Coville, Katherine
description: Presents a twist on the classic story of "Goldilocks and the Three Bears" told by young Teddy's governess, who came to work at the Vaughn family cottage shortly before a golden-haired girl, ragged and dirty, entered the home and soon became a beloved foster child until evil characters tried to take her away.
title: The cottage in the woods

author: Walsh, Pat
description: In 1347, when fourteen-year-old orphan William Paynel, an impoverished servant at Crowfield Abbey, goes into the forest to gather wood and finds a magical creature caught in a trap, he discovers he has the ability to see fays and becomes embroiled in a strange mystery involving Old Magic, a bitter feud, and ancient secrets.
title: The Crowfield curse

author: Carriger, Gail
description: Sophronia is excelling at her second year at Mademoiselle Geraldine's Finishing Academy for Young Ladies of Quality. Training in espionage, she uses her newly acquired skills to learn the true reason behind the school trip to London, one that includes boys. What she uncovers is a whirl-wind London season, full dance cards, and conspiracy involving a technology that will affect vampires, werewolves, and humans alike.
title: Curtsies & conspiracies

author: Brown, Herman
description: Chace has become accustomed to the bullying he has to endure at school, but when one of the bullies begins to taunt him because his mother is dating an Iranian man, he makes a decision to stand up to the harassment that gets him suspended. Left looking like the bad guy, he searches for a way to overcome the battle he can't seem to win.
title: A cut too far

author: Hale, Shannon
description: When aspiring astronaut Maisie Danger Brown, who was born without a right hand, and the other space camp students get the opportunity to do something amazing in space, Maisie must prove how dangerous she can be and how far she is willing to go to protect everything she has ever loved.
title: Dangerous

author: Kehret, Peg
description: Sixth-grader Emmy and her classmates start a secret community service project to help a hungry family, but soon Emmy finds herself involved in a home burglary ring operated by the family's neighbor.
title: Dangerous deception

author: Burgan, Michael
description: Explores the deadly 1970 Kent State protest of the Vietnam War through an iconic black-and-white photograph. Describes the background of the event, the impact of the photograph, and the aftermath. Includes photographs, a timeline, a glossary, and further resources.
title: Death at Kent State

author: Larson, Sara B.
description: Seventeen-year-old Alexa's parents were killed by a sorcerer during a raid, so she has disguised herself as a boy, joined Antion's army, and earned a place on Prince Damian's guard--but Antion is ruled by an evil king, and "Alex" must find a way to defeat him and protect her prince.
title: Defy

author: Hannigan, Kate
description: In 1859, eleven-year-old Nell goes to live with her aunt, Kate Warne, the first female detective for Pinkerton's National Detective Agency. Nell helps her aunt solve cases, including a mystery surrounding Abraham Lincoln, and the mystery of what happened to Nell's own father.
title: The detective's assistant

author: Mathieu, Jennifer
description: Rachel Walker is devoted to God and her large family, but as her curiosity about the world her parents turned from grows and she finds that neither Calvary Christian Church nor her home school education has the answer she craves, she considers leaving her sheltered life.
title: Devoted

author: Dakers, Diane
description: Presents a brief photographic biography of Dian Fossey, an animal rights activist and the woman largely responsible for protecting and preserving mountain gorillas. For her activism Dian made enemies, and she was found murdered in her cabin in Rwanda in 1985.
title: Dian Fossey

author: Brezenoff, Steven
description: With three story paths and twelve different endings, readers can help four sixth-grade detectives solve the theft of a rare fruit at the River City Conservatory.
title: The disappearing fruit

author: McKinley, Robin
description: When Jake Mendoza, who lives in the Smokehill National Park where his father runs the Makepeace Institute of Integrated Dragon Studies, goes on his first solo overnight in the park, he finds an infant dragon whose mother has been killed by a poacher.
title: Dragonhaven

author: Walden, Mark
description: When alien vessels arrive at Earth, countless people are taken -- save for Sam, a young man living in London. Within six months, Sam has begun to believe he is the only person left, but the discovery that there are other survivors launches Sam on a journey that will decide the fate of his world.
title: Earthfall

author: Halpern, Jake
description: Wren lives on Edgeland, an island near a whirlpool thirty miles wide and a hundred miles around called the Drain where the dead are sent. Wren dreams of escaping Edgeland and with the help of her friend Alec, Wren plans on looting a boat before it enters the Drain. When the boat--with Wren and Alec onboard--is sucked into the whirlpool, they discover an unimaginable world.
title: Edgeland

author: Maguire, Gregory
description: The life of Elena Rudina, a poor teenager living in the Tsar-era Russian countryside, is transformed when a noble family with a daughter named Ekaterina arrives in town on their way to visit the Tsar, and the fates of Elena and Ekaterina become intertwined.
title: Egg & spoon

author: Hoena, B. A.
description: Explores predator animals of all kinds, from orca whales to snowy owls to black widow spiders to mantis shrimp.
title: Everything predators

author: Brumbach, Andrew
description: Cousins William and Maxine arrive on the doorstep of Battersea Manor in May of 1929, to stay the summer with their grandfather, whom they hardly remember. Before they even get settled in, though, Grandpa, or Colonel Battersea, receives a cryptic telegram and takes them to New York to pick up a mysterious parcel. Before they get the parcel, Grandpa disappears, and the cousins meet Nura, a girl from Turkey who seems to know a lot about Colonel Battersea and the importance of the parcel--and she needs their help to stop a secret society of assassins and a group of cold-blooded gangsters from getting the parcel first.
title: The eye of midnight

author: Salisbury, Graham
description: Following orders from the United States Army, several young Japanese American men train K-9 units to hunt Asians during World War II.
title: Eyes of the emperor

author: Sonnenblick, Jordan
description: Harassed at her middle school, not taken seriously at home, and with a "perfect" older brother, Matthew, to live up to, thirteen-year-old Claire has always felt like her life was cursed--then one morning, when she and her beloved father are talking at breakfast, her father suddenly falls over with a stroke, and suddenly everything changes.
title: Falling over sideways

author: Paulsen, Gary
description: When fourteen-year-old Kevin takes charge of a double wedding in his family--held in his own backyard--things go comically awry with a house full of wacky relatives.
title: Family ties

author: Ward, Matthe
description: Everyone in the Whipple family has broken a world record at least once. Everyone, that is, except Arthur. He has not broken or even tied one world record in all his life--but soon, if things do not change, his family's records, and possibly more, will be lost. Suddenly they are losing contests left and right, and Arthur strongly suspects that two clowns, who always appear at these events, are the cause. It is up to him to find out and stop them.
title: The fantastic family Whipple

author: Gregory, Jo
description: Presents information on the Field Museum of Natural History in Chicago, Illinois, including its history, founders, treasures, collection management and conservation, and possible future directions. Includes a timeline, biographical sketches, color photographs, an activity, a quiz, and a list of key words.
title: The Field Museum of Natural History

author: Withers, Pam
description: Rex, a kayak enthusiast, travels to South America to make a first descent down an unconquered river and enlists the aide of Myriam Calambâa, an indigenous young girl. When they get caught up in the clash between the paramilitaries who work for the wealthy landowners and the native guerillas, they realize the real danger is not in the river at all.
title: First descent

author: Hardinge, Frances
description: Mosca Mye and her homicidal goose, Saracen, travel to the city of Mandelion on the heels of smooth-talking con-man, Eponymous Clent.
title: Fly by night

author: Wexler, Django
description: When her father is lost at sea shortly after meeting a very unusual visitor, Alice must leave her home to live with an "uncle" whose rural Pennsylvania estate includes a massive and mysterious library that holds much more than books.
title: The forbidden library

author: Wambach, Abby
description: Explores the life of U.S. Olympic women's soccer star Abby Wambach.
title: Forward

author: Krumwiede, Lana
description: After a traumatic accident removes his telekinetic ability, or psy, twelve-year-old Taemon is exiled to the "dud farm," where he is surprised to find kind, open people who enjoy using their hands but there are also mysteries at the colony and when Taemon unwittingly leaks one of the secrets he must find the courage to repair the damage, even if it means returning to the city from which he was banished.
title: Freakling

author: Frank, E. R.
description: When a new girl at Alex's private school starts rumors about her favorite teacher, Alex and her eighth-grade classmates are not sure how to act around him or with each other.
title: Friction

author: Kladstrup, Kristin
description: Princes Adela would rather spend time in her garden than try to find a husband, much to the chagrin of her step-mother. When she is invited to a garden party by Lady Hortensia, Adela cannot refuse--but there is something strange about Lady Hortensia's garden. It is in full bloom even in October, and there is a strange talking magpie that seems bent on stealing the guests' jewelry.
title: Garden princess

author: Armstrong, Kelley
description: Sixteen-year-old Maya suspects there may be a relationship between her paw-print birthmark, her connection with wild animals, and strange events occurring in her tiny Vancouver Island community, where a medical research facility harbors big secrets.
title: The gathering

author: Carter, Nikki
description: While attempting to jump start her singer-songwriter career, Sunday is stuck wondering how to proceed when her friendship with a video star becomes something more. Later, Sunday helps her cousin salvage her record deal and puts both their careers on the line.
title: Get over it

author: Schraff, Anne E.
description: Jaris Hart finds a picture in a forty-year-old high school yearbook of a boy who looks exactly like him. When he asks his grandmother about it, she becomes evasive and Jaris determines to uncover the mystery of James Webster.
title: The ghost who looked like me

author: Zuravicky, Orli
description: As a brand-new ghost, Lucy attends her first day at Limbo Central Middle School, still not able to take full form. But when the cute (ghost) boy turns out to be her own personal school guide, she thinks being a ghost may not be such a bad thing.
title: Ghostcoming!

author: Henry, April
description: Olivia was only three-years-old when her mother was murdered and her father went missing. For fourteen years, everyone assumed her father was the killer. But when new evidence comes to light that shows her father was murdered on the same day as her mother, the realization that her parents's killer is still on the loose has Olivia determined to uncover the truth. But the killer is just as determined to stop her.
title: The girl I used to be

author: Meyer, Carolyn
description: Young Margaret Bourke-White was different from most of her peers and dreamed of becoming a herpetologist. But while still in college, she became fascinated with photography. Her skill with the camera grew, and her fascination with nature expanded to a fascination with landscapes, architecture, trains, and bridges. Before long, Bourke-White became a sought-after photographer, traveling the United States and Europe, and eventually becoming the first female war photojournalist in World War II.
title: Girl with a camera

author: Fleming, Anne
description: Kid and her family move to an apartment building in New York City, whose eccentric residents include a skateboarding fantasy writer, a guinea pig hoarder, and possibly a goat who lives on the roof.
title: The goat

author: Thompson, Lis
description: Twelve-year-old Matthew Corbin has struggled with a severe obsessive-compulsive disorder since the death of his baby brother five years ago--a tragedy he blames on himself. In self-imposed isolation, Matthew stays in his bedroom all day long, watching the neighbors come and go and keeping notes about their daily routines. When a toddler goes missing next door, Matthew starts his own investigation with the help of his neighborhood friends. And in the process of uncovering the truth, Matthew just might be able to break free from his own demons.
title: The goldfish boy

author: Lowry, Lois
description: While learning to bestow dreams, a young dream giver tries to save an eight-year-old boy from the effects of both his abusive past and the nightmares inflicted on him by the frightening Sinisteeds.
title: Gossamer

author: Cascone, Annette
description: There is a pet cemetery in Amanda Peterson's backyard. Amanda has buried their family's pets there throughout the years, but this time, burying a dead squirrel, Amanda and her friends dig up an occupied grave, dug by the scary old lady nextdoor.
title: Grave secrets

author: Lèusted, Marcia Amidon
description: Explores what life was like for people living in the United States during the Great Depression of the 1930s, discussing why the Depression happened, how it impacted everyday American citizens, and how people and politicians took steps to end it.
title: The great depression

author: O'Connor, Barbara
description: In North Carolina's Great Smoky Mountains, a troubled boy and his mother, a happy family seeking adventure, a man and his lonely daughter, and the widow who must sell the run-down motel that has been her home for decades, meet and are transformed by their shared experiences.
title: Greetings from nowhere

author: Morrison, Megan
description: Rapunzel believes she is the luckiest person in Tyme, because Witch tells her so, but when Jack climbs into her tower to steal an enchanted rose, he hints that Witch is not telling the whole truth and Rapunzel, driven by her anger and fear, descends to the ground for the first time.
title: Grounded

author: Castro, Adam-Troy
description: Fernie What, an adventurous young horror fan, moves into the house across the street from the dark mansion of a mysterious boy whose residence is haunted by evil shadows.
title: Gustav Gloom and the People Taker

author: Walden, Mark
description: Still trapped at the Higher Institute of Villainous Education, or H.I.V.E., evil-genius-in-training Otto Malpense is nearly assassinated and must now not only try to escape, but also find out who murdered his best friend--and save himself.
title: H.I.V.

author: Cross, Julie
description: A secret relationship develops between eighteen-year-old Eve, a former model who is trying to forge a career as a photographer, and Alex, a model frustrated with his sleazy agent's schemes to drum up press for Alex. Both Alex and Eve struggle to keep their integrity intact--and their romance steady--amid a variety of obstacles.
title: Halfway perfect

author: Marsham, Liz
description: Profiles Harley Quinn from the DC Comics' universe, discussing her early life, how she decided to become a therapist, how she met and became friends with Poison Ivy, went insane under the Joker's influence, became his sidekick, and eventually joined the Suicide Squad.
title: Harley Quinn

author: Rowling, J. K.
description: Rescued from the outrageous neglect of his aunt and uncle, a young boy with a great destiny proves his worth while attending Hogwarts School for Wizards and Witches.
title: Harry Potter and the sorcerer's stone

author: Poblocki, Dan
description: Since eighth-grader Gabriel Ashe moved into his grandmother's house he has been spending a lot of time playing in the woods with his new friend Seth, but the games Seth invents involve a child-eating monster called the Hunter, and Gabriel is not sure how much is imagination and how much real.
title: The haunting of Gabriel Ashe

author: Landman, Tanya
description: The mixed race son of a puppeteer, Caleb tries to clear his father's name when the latter is accused of theft, but this quest ensnares Caleb in a net of deceit, conspiracy, and intrigue in mid-eighteenth century Devon.
title: Hell and high water

author: Bradford, Chris
description: Connor Reeves is a martial arts expert even at his young age, which makes him the perfect bodyguard, able to blend in with the crowd--no one suspects a kid to be a bodyguard. His latest assignment is on a luxury yacht, protecting the twin daughters of an Australian tycoon. What seems like a vacation soon turns deadly when heavily armed pirates launch a rocket attack in a desire for revenge.
title: Hijack

author: Patterson, James
description: Sammy Hayes-Rodriguez enrolls his talking robot E in fifth grade with him, bringing a new level excitement and drama to elementary school. Things get even more interesting when Sammy discovers the extraordinary secret E's been keeping about Sammy's family.
title: House of robots

author: Collins, Suzanne
description: In a future North America, where the rulers of Panem maintain control through an annual televised survival competition pitting young people from each of the twelve districts against one another, sixteen-year-old Katniss's skills are put to the test when she voluntarily takes her younger sister's place.
title: The Hunger Games

author: Divine, L
description: Jayd is determined to stay focused as things at home and South Bay High begin to swirl with excitement and drama.
title: Hustlin'

author: George, Jean Craighead
description: In 1848, ten-year-old Toozak, a Yupik Eskimo, sees a whale being born and is told by a shaman that he and his descendants must protect that whale, which Toozak names Siku, as long as it lives.
title: Ice whale

author: Schwartz, Virginia Frances
description: After Phoebe, Liney and her two small children decide to escape from slavery to freedom, they catch the "underground railroad" and elude slave catchers and other dangers until they finally reach Canada and liberty.
title: If I just had two wings

author: Gish, Melissa
description: Explores the behaviors, anatomy, and habitats of iguanas. Also discusses their relationship with humans and conservation status. Features color photographs and a glossary.
title: Iguanas

author: Voorhees, Coert
description: Persuaded by her teacher to seek Cortez's long-lost treasure during a school trip to Mexico, Annie Fleet, master scuba diver and history buff, finds that her plans to get Josh to notice her are not the only thing in danger as rival treasure-hunters try to do away with her.
title: In too deep

author: Walters, Eric
description: When Betty, a teen displaced by a fire that destroyed her orphanage, goes to work as a maid in the Remington home, she stumbles upon the secrets from her past that she never knew existed. After she learns her mother, who was once a maid in the same home, was murdered by her father, who now serves a life-sentence at the local prison, she visits him. But his denials of guilt will send her into a whirlwind of mystery and danger that threaten to consume her if she doesn't follow her heart to find the truth.
title: Innocent

author: Moriarty, Chris
description: In early twentieth-century New York, Sacha Kessler's ability to see witches earns him an apprenticeship to the police department's star inquisitor, Maximillian Wolf, to help stop magical crime. With fellow apprentice Lily Astral, Sacha investigates who is trying to kill Thomas Edison, whose mechanical witch detector could unleash the worst witch-hunt in American history.
title: The inquisitor's apprentice

author: Jones, Diana Wynne
description: Aileen, who despite her lack of proven abilities hails from a lineage of powerful magicworkers, relies on the assistance of her Aunt Beck, an invisible cat, and a wise parrot to help her fulfill a quest that takes her across the Islands of Chaldea.
title: The islands of Chaldea

author: Blackwood, Sage
description: A young boy named Jinx encounters magic and danger as he grows up in the deep, dark forest known as the Urwald and discovers that the world beyond--and within--the Urwald is more complex than he could imagine.
title: Jinx

author: Gutman, Dan
description: Johnny Thyme, a stuntkid known in the movie business as Johnny Hangtime, stunt-doubles for teen superstar Ricky Corvette, but what will he do when his favorite director asks him to perform the super-dangerous stunt that killed his father?
title: Johnny Hangtime

author: Stanley, Diane
description: A young girl named Joplin finds a beautifully painted broken platter in her grandfather's home and wishes the girl from the painting could come to life. The next day, the girl appears and offers to grant wishes if Joplin will help her get back to her seventeenth-century home.
title: Joplin, wishing

author: Krull, Kathleen
description: Offers brief biographies of America's First Ladies, discussing the role, the causes the women advocated for, and the challenges they faced. Includes sidebars, quotes, a timeline, anecdotes, and humorous illustrations.
title: A kids' guide to America's First Ladies

author: Barrett, Tracy
description: When sixteen-year-old Telemachos and his two best friends, one a centaur, leave their life of privilege to undertake a quest to find Telemachos's father Odysseus, they learn much along the way about what it means to be a man and a king.
title: King of Ithaka

author: Lu, Marie
description: Fifteen-year-old June, a prodigy being groomed for success in the Republic's highest military circles, and fifteen-year-old Day, born into the slums, are brought together when June's brother, Metias, is murdered, and Day becomes the prime suspect. June seeks to avenge Metias' death, but she soon uncovers the truth about her country and the lengths it will go to keep its secrets.
title: Legend

author: Veness, Kimberley
description: Explores unique and sustainable farming techniques. Chapters discuss urban gardening and farming, problems with current agricultural systems, and benefits of small-scale farming operations. Includes a glossary, index, and resources for further information.
title: Let's eat

author: Lyons, Mary E
description: A fictionalized look at the life of Joseph Jacobs, son of a slave, told in the form of letters that he might have written during his life in pre-Civil War North Carolina, on a whaling expedition, in New York, New England, and finally in California during the Gold Rush.
title: Letters from a slave boy

author: Goodman, Gabriel
description: Hiram, a Jewish immigrant kid, is tired of being bullied, so he begins taking bareknuckle fighting lessons from a former slave at the Woodrat Club in 1870s New York City.
title: Lightning's run

author: Abdel-Fattah, Randa
description: Michael, a boy who likes playing with graphic design software and often gets dragged to his parents' anti-immigration rallies, meets Mina, a beautiful Muslim refugee from Afghanistan. Mina is funny and smart, and she challenges everything Michael has been taught to believe.
title: The lines we cross

author: Morpurgo, Michael
description: In 1915, Alfie and his fisherman father, working in the waters around the Scilly Islands, discover a girl on an uninhabited rock. She has no memory of who she is or how she got there, and can only say one word--"Lucy." She could be a mermaid, the victim of a German U-boat attack, or a German spy. Lucy begins to open up when Alfie plays music on his gramophone, drawing the two together and changing their lives forever.
title: Listen to the moon

author: Vivian, Siobhan
description: When Ruby's divorced father shows up unexpectedly on her sixteenth birthday, the week that follows is full of confusing surprises, including discovering that her best friend has been keeping secrets from her, her mother has not been truthful about the past, and life is often complicated.
title: A little friendly advice

author: Hemphill, Helen
description: When Harlan Q's grandfather dies, the will leaves Harlan a chunk of money and a Cadillac convertible but stipulates that grandfather's body must be buried in Las Vegas. Harlan Q convinces his father, Paps, to help him transport the body, and along the way they pick up Warrior, a Hollywood-bound actor-in-training. Though the trip is long and has its ups and downs, Harlan Q opens up to Warrior about his father while Paps questions his own feelings about his long gone daddy and his rebellious son.
title: Long gone daddy

author: Horvath, Polly
description: Madeleine and her hippie parents travel to England to run a candy shop they inherited, hoping it will solve all their money problems. Meanwhile, Mr. and Mrs. Bunny also travel to England, where Mrs. Bunny tries to weasel her way into the ranks of royalty.
title: Lord and Lady Bunny -- almost royalty!

author: Schraff, Anne E.
description: When a stranger starts following her around, her sister disappears, and a threatening note is left on her desk at school, Darcy Wills does not know where to turn for help.
title: Lost and found

author: Powell, Patricia Hruby
description: Presents in blank verse the story of Mildred Loving, an African American girl, and Richard Loving, a Caucasian boy, who fell in love and challenged the Virginia law forbidding interracial marriages in the 1950s.
title: Loving vs. Virginia

author: McGowan, Jennifer
description: In 1559 England, Meg, an orphaned thief, is pressed into service and trained as a member of the Maids of Honor, Queen Elizabeth I's secret all-female guard, but her loyalty is tested when she falls in love with a Spanish courtier who may be a threat.
title: Maid of secrets

author: Buckley-Archer, Linda
description: When Stella Park takes a summer job organizing the archives at John Stone's estate, she never imagines the secrets she'll uncover through the journals she's cataloging. And even more startling than her discovery that Stone is over three centuries old is the fact that she is his reason for living.
title: The many lives of John Stone

author: Furstinger, Nancy
description: Highlights the life, career, contributions, and legacy of Henry Bergh, the founder of the ASPCA. Includes a timeline and photographs.
title: Mercy

author: Riggs, Ransom
description: While sixteen-year-old Jacob's grandfather Abe lies dying from a mysterious attack, he pleads with Jacob to travel to a remote island off the coast of Wales to find the orphanage where Abe grew up and discover its peculiar inhabitants who appear to be trapped in time.
title: Miss Peregrine's Home for Peculiar Children

author: Crowe, Chris
description: In Mississippi in 1955, a sixteen-year-old finds himself at odds with his grandfather over issues surrounding the kidnapping and murder of a fourteen-year-old African American from Chicago.
title: Mississippi trial, 1955

author: Kerr, Philip
description: Billy Shivers can usually be found hiding away at the Hitchcock Public Library with his nose in a book. When the Haunted House of Books announces a competition daring readers to spend the night inside the old haunted mansion the bookstore is housed in, Billy is compelled to participate. The stories he finds inside are even creepier than the creaky walls and dark hallways, and Billy will have to be very brave to make it through the evening.
title: The most frightening story ever told

author: Dionne, Erin
description: Moxie Fleece is in trouble--she is given two weeks to find the missing art of the Gardner Museum in Boston, or else gangsters who think she has some of it will come for her and her family. To solve the mystery, Moxie will have to have the help of Ollie, her best friend; Gramps, her memory-challenged grandpa; and a geometry proof she has set up to help her solve real-life mysteries.
title: Moxie and the art of rule breaking

author: MacLean, Jill
description: Fifteen-year-old Nix Humbolt both loathes and adores his older sister, Roxy. He loves her vibrancy, but hates her choices, especially her latest one--going after scumbag Bryan Sykes. She won't listen to him, and that seems like the end of the matter. Needing to fight a battle he can win--besides ones on his video games--Nix decides to rescue Twig, a neglected dog.
title: Nix minus one

author: Joyce, William
description: In Toy World, there is magic to becoming a child's "favorite." Billy's mother handmade Ollie, a stuffed rabbit who became Billy's favorite toy very quickly. They did everything together. Then Zozo the clown came with his henchmen, the Creeps, outcast toys, jealous of Ollie and all toys who become children's favorites, and toynapped Ollie. Now Billy must rescue his beloved favorite from Zozo's Dark Carnival Place.
title: Ollie's odyssey

author: Auch, Mary Jane
description: Seventh-grader Basil's rank as class loser may be in jeopardy after meeting a bossy new girl who, like Basil, has synesthesia.
title: One + one = blue

author: Dance, Jennifer
description: In the late 1800s, a young Lakota boy finds an orphaned mustang foal and takes her to his people's camp. Naming her Paint, the boy and mustang grow up together, learning to hunt buffalo--however, when the U.S. Cavalry attacks, the boy and Paint are separated. Paint winds up with settlers in the grasslands, who unwittingly set the stage for environmental disaster, before ending up with English pioneers on the Canadian Prairie, where man and horse will have to work together to survive a terrible dust storm.
title: Paint

author: Roberts, Willo Davis
description: After her mother's death and her father's suicide, fourteen-year-old Teddi finds some stability when she moves in with Mamie, her good-hearted next-door neighbor--until the arrival of a woman claiming to be the pregnant wife of Mamie's son who recently died in a plane crash.
title: Pawns

author: Baker, Kimberly
description: Using a bogus name, the League of Picklemakers, sixth-grader Ben and three recruits start a prank-pulling club and receive funding from their middle school's PTA.
title: PICKLE

author: Rosoff, Meg
description: Twelve-year-old Mila travels with her father to upstate New York to visit friends and family, who may lead them to clues to the whereabouts of her father's best friend, who has gone missing.
title: Picture me gone

author: Zindel, Paul
description: Haunted by the memory of a dead friend, two teenagers join an old man in a series of misadventures.
title: The pigman's legacy

author: Stevens, Robin
description: In 1930s England, schoolgirl detectives Daisy Wells and Hazel Wong are at Daisy's home for the holidays when someone falls seriously, mysteriously ill at a family party, but no one present is what they seem--and everyone has a secret or two--so the Detective Society must do everything they can to reveal the truth, no matter the consequences.
title: Poison is not polite

author: Childs, Tera Lynn
description: Kenna, an ordinary teen surrounded by superheroes with special powers, tracks down a group of villains attempting to steal research secrets from the lab in which she works. When one of the villains ends up saving her life during a standoff and later teams up with her, Kenna is forced to question everything she thought she knew.
title: Powerless

author: Krishnaswami, Uma
description: Complications ensue when Bollywood star Dolly Singh premieres her new movie at the Smithsonian Institution in Washington D.C., and super fan Dinni and her best friend Maddie present a dance at the grand opening.
title: The problem with being slightly heroic

author: Kocek, Sara
description: Olive Barton is unlike any of Reyna's other friends: she is headstrong, impulsive, and never apologizes for her honesty and bluntness. She is a refreshing change of a friend to Reyna, until Olive reveals to her her big secret. Now Reyna has to decide what really matters in a friendship, or else lose Olive.
title: Promise me something

author: Turner, Megan Whalen
description: Forsaken by the gods and left to his own devices, Eugenides, Royal Thief of Eddis, summons all his wit and wiles in an attempt to conquer the rival Queen of Attolia.
title: The Queen of Attolia

author: Lee, Darrien
description: Fifteen-year-old Kane Alexander runs away from home when the responsibility of caring for her younger siblings becomes too much for her. However, not only does her escape not solve her problems, it creates new ones as well.
title: Raising Kane

author: Jordan, Sophie
description: When an eclipse plunged the kingdom of Relhok into darkness seventeen years ago, an evil chancellor murdered the king and queen, took control, and locked Princess Luna in a tower in the Black Woods. An archer named Fowler stumbles upon the princess and they escape together when the tower is attacked. Now they are on the run, hunted by deadly creatures, and hiding dangerous secrets from each other.
title: Reign of shadows

author: Stewart, Martin J.
description: Wull's father is Riverkeep, the person charged with caring for the wild Danâek river. But when he gets pulled under the surface one day, Wull's father returns possessed by a dark spirit from the river's depths. Thrust into the role of Riverkeep, Wull learns of a cure for his father hidden in the body of a sea-dwelling beast and sets out to retrieve it.
title: Riverkeep

author: Paratore, Coleen
description: Fourteen-year-old Willa Havisham is shocked when her family moves from Cape Cod to New York. However, as she works through unfamiliar situations, attends a new school, and even meets a cute boy, Willa is determined to stay true to herself.
title: Roar like a girl

author: Arno, Ronni
description: Ruby Miller hates living in the shadow of her supermodel and TV-famous mother and her star athlete father. Her friends are not really her friends--they only like her to be close to her parents. So, Ruby convinces her parents to let her go to a boarding school in Maine, where she sort of accidentally tells new friends she is an orphan in the hopes of being liked simply for herself.
title: Ruby reinvented

author: Hesse, Karen
description: While teen Radley is in Haiti volunteering, the American People's Party takes over in the U.S. and soon after, the new president is assassinated. Radley rushes home to find a new America and its vigilante groups, looters, and police raids. Her parents are missing, and Radley has no money or travel papers to cross state lines; so Radley begins walking from her home in Vermont to safety in Canada.
title: Safekeeping

author: Hulme-Cross, Benjamin
description: Still on a quest to release the spirits of ancient warriors from the museum of their great-grandfather, time-traveling brothers Arthur and Finn are transported to medieval Japan, where they will have to defeat a power-hungry tyrant and save a samurai warrior.
title: The samurai's assassin

author: Gaughen, A. C.
description: Will Scarlet shadows Robin Hood, with an unerring eye for finding treasures to steal and throwing daggers with deadly accuracy, but when Gisbourne, a ruthless bounty hunter, is hired by the sheriff to capture Robin and his band of thieves, Robin must become Will's protector risking his own life in the process.
title: Scarlet

author: Bellin, Joshua David
description: Fifteen-year-old Queery Genn did his part to fight off the nest of aliens that threatened to eat everyone in his survival colony. Now his mother is moving the colony to the mountains, hoping to find resources and protection. Instead, she has accidentally led them into the hands of tribe whose intentions are less than honorable. It's up to Querry and a girl from the compound named Mercy to save what remains of his colony.
title: Scavenger of souls

author: McCullough, Kelly
description: Evan Quick is a superhero geek in a world where superheroes are real. He longs to wake up one day with superpowers, but everyday the same thing happens--nothing. Then one day on a class field trip, Evan manages to survive a supervillain death ray, and is taken to the Academy for Metahuman Operatives to become a real hero--or so he thought. It turns out the Academy is more for Sidekicks than the real heroes, but it is not without its dangerous secrets.
title: School for sidekicks

author: Shusterman, Neal
description: Six teenagers, each tormented by what seems to be an exaggerated adolescent affliction, come together to try to stop the "beasts" that threaten to destroy them and the world.
title: Scorpion shards

author: Farmer, Nancy
description: After Jack becomes apprenticed to a Druid bard, he and his little sister Lucy are captured by Viking Berserkers and taken to the home of King Ivar the Boneless and his half-troll queen, leading Jack to undertake a vital quest to Jotunheim, home of the trolls.
title: The Sea of Trolls

author: Mobley, Jeannie
description: In Colorado during World War I, a young, romantically minded girl and an old, bitter woman suffragist debate a local legend and examine the role of women in a time of war and prejudice.
title: Searching for Silverheels

author: Farrey, Brian
description: A princess and a peasant girl, who hides a sorrow in a town where everyone lives with unending joy, embark on a dangerous quest to outwit a centuries-old warning foretelling the fall of the Monarchy.
title: The secret of Dreadwillow Carse

author: Leaver, Trisha
description: After the death of her twin sister Maddy, Ella decides to take on Maddy's identity in an effort to give her sister a kind of second chance at life. But while posing as Maddy, Ella realizes that her sister has been keeping some very dangerous secrets, and soon Ella is faced with the decision to reveal who she really is, or risk ending up just like Maddy.
title: The secrets we keep

author: Jayne, Hannah
description: One day Riley finds a birth certificate for a girl called Jane Elizabeth O'Leary in her own baby book. Her parents seem over-protective, and it may be because she is not actually their daughter. This thought spurs her on a journey of self discovery, and danger.
title: See Jane run

author: Sargent, Pamela
description: Hundreds of years ago, a group of survivors from a dying earth are transported by Ship to another planet they call Home. The colony soon split into rival settlements: the Dome Dwellers and the River People. When a light appears in the sky, the River People think it might be Ship returning like promised; but the Dome Dwellers are silent. Seventeen-year-old Bian, from a small river village, sets out to discover what the Dome Dwellers know. Bian worries that the Dome Dwellers are either waiting for a judgment on the River People or lying to Ship to turn Ship against her people.
title: Seed seeker

author: Peacock, Shane
description: While on a trip to Sweden with his grandfather, Adam finds himself alone in Stockholm and worried that he is being followed.
title: Separated

author: De Lint, Charles
description: Sarah Jane Dillard discovers and helps an injured 'sangman fairy in the Tanglewood Forest, putting herself, her six sisters, and friends Aunt Lillian and the Apple Tree Man in the middle of a fairy feud.
title: Seven wild sisters

author: Marillier, Juliet
description: Fifteen-year-old Neryn is alone in the land of Alban, where the oppressive king has ordered anyone with magical strengths captured, but when she sets out for Shadowfell, a training ground for a rebel group, she meets a mysterious soldier and the Good Folk, who tell her that she, alone, can save Alban.
title: Shadowfell

author: Sedgwick, Marcus
description: A London teenager who is blind and her younger brother travel to New York to find their missing father, using clues from his notebook.
title: She is not invisible

author: Lowry, Lois
description: Katy, the precocious ten-year-old daughter of the town doctor, befriends a boy who doesn't talk and is regarded as "touched in the head."
title: The silent boy

author: Peyton, V
description: Ten-year-old Silo Zyco has lost everyone he ever loved--his family was killed in a tragic disaster, his best friend was killed in a hunting accident, and the man who's probably his father is wanted for a list of crimes including theft and starting fires and is no where to be found. All Silo has are his strange webbed feet, a wanted posted for his dad, and the ability to see into the future. But that might be all he needs.
title: Silo and the Rebel Raiders

author: Alpert, Mark
description: Adam, crippled by muscular dystrophy, and five other terminally ill teenagers sacrifice their bodies and upload their minds into weaponized robots to battle a dangerously advanced artificial intelligence program bent on destroying humanity.
title: The Six

author: Stein, Tammar
description: Twelve-year-old Motti discovers that there are many types of heroes as his tiny young nation of Israel fights for survival in the Six-Day War of 1967.
title: The six-day hero

author: Townley, Rod
description: In New York City in 1959, fifteen-year-old Alec Schuyler, at odds with his widowed father over his love of music, finds a mentor and friend in a blind, Black jazz musician.
title: Sky

author: Briner, K. H
description: Ever's parents disappeared nine years ago, leaving her to live with an inventor named Doc while she attends the School for Children of Gifted Parents. When Doc vanishes, Ever turns to Harry Snowize and Snitch, a pair of detectives, to help her. In their search for answers to the disappearances, the three uncover secrets that reveal things about themselves they never imagined.
title: Snowize & Snitch

author: Moore, Stephanie Perry
description: Preparing for their debutante ball, Payton and her three friends struggle with the temptations of alcohol, despite their Christian faith.
title: Sober faith

author: Moss, Marissa
description: Nineteen-year-old Sarah masquerades as a man during the Civil War, serving as a nurse on the battlefield and a spy for the Union Army, escaping from the Confederates, and falling in love with one of her fellow soldiers. Based on the life of Sarah Emma Edmonds.
title: A soldier's secret

author: Barnaby, Hannah Rodgers
description: After the death of Tallie McGovern's brother, she's tried to hold it together and put on a happy front. But when she finds out he was an organ donor, she sets out to find the people who were saved by his death, hoping in some way to hang on to him a bit longer.
title: Some of the parts

author: Fforde, Jasper
description: In an alternate United Kingdom, King Snodd tries to control the world by controlling magic and only sixteen-year-old Jennifer Strange, acting manager of an employment agency for sorcerers, stands between Snodd and his plans.
title: The song of the Quarkbeast

author: Castellucci, Cecil
description: When Pearl runs away from her abusive father, she has nowhere to go--until she stumbles onto a disguise. Reborn as a boy named Soupy, she joins up with a hobo named Ramshackle and the two take a train-hopping journey across America that helps them both heal.
title: Soupy leaves home

author: Schow, Betsy
description: After the crown princess of Emerald makes a wish upon a cursed star, all the rules of fairy tale disappear along with the king and queen.
title: Spelled

author: Alvarez, Jennifer Lynn
description: Star, a black pegasus foal, is prophesied to become the most powerful winged horse in Anok on his first birthday, but he must first overcome his malformed wings that make him unable to fly, and deadly threats from the leaders of the five herds who will do anything to stop the prophecy.
title: Starfire
