author: Whitney, Daisy
description: Seventeen-year-old Julien falls in love with the muse, Clio, as he tries to save her and the Musâee d'Orsay's collection of Impressionist art after learning the paintings are reacting to a curse set by Renoir that trapped Clio in his painting.
title: Starry nights

author: Catmull, Katherine
description: In the world of Down, young sisters Summer and Bird are separated and go in very different directions as they seek their missing parents, try to vanquish the evil Puppeteer, lead the talking birds back to their Green Home, and discover the identity of the true bird queen.
title: Summer and Bird

author: Polisner, Gae
description: Four years after her brother, Simon, drowned while in her charge, Francesca, now fifteen, begins to move on after a summer caring for Frankie, who seems to be Simon reincarnated, and getting closer to her best friend's boyfriend.
title: The summer of letting go

author: Bellin, Joshua David
description: Querry Genn, a member of one of the last human survivor groups following global war, is targeted by the monstrous Skaldi, who take over a person's body and then shed the corpse. Querry doesn't understand why he is a target because an accident robbed him of his memory. Querry races to recover his lost memories because he knows they are the key to humanity's future.
title: Survival Colony 9

author: Winston, Sherri
description: Shy ten-year-old Cadence Jolly makes a promise to God to share her beautiful singing voice with the world by the time she turns eleven--or at least with her church. Her birthday is fast approaching, and she still hasn't sung for anyone except herself in a recording. Cadence wonders if she can take a promise back, even a promise to God--her shyness is just too painful--but then the recording somehow gets out and her whole church hears it. Now she has a decision to make: deceive everyone and say it is someone else, or break out of her shell and into the spotlight.
title: The sweetest sound

author: Rocco, John
description: After his father disappears in a fishing accident, Jake works as a quahogger to earn money to save the family diner.
title: Swim that rock

author: Kirby, Matthew J.
description: After her face is horribly disfigured in a matchstick factory, Evelyn finds work in the London Hospital as maid to the Elephant Man, wanting only to be locked away from the filth and danger of the streets. However, Joseph Merrick, the Elephant Man's true name, longs for a life outside, and when the ghosts of Jack the Ripper's victims start appearing to them and asking for help, Joseph and Evelyn are set on a path to face their fears and confront humanity's nightmares.
tags: Jack the Ripper murders, London, England, 1888
title: A taste for monsters

author: Cross, Julie
description: After his girlfriend Holly is fatally shot during a violent struggle, nineteen-year-old Jackson uses his supernatural abilities and travels back in time two years, where he falls in love with Holly all over again, learns that his father is a spy, and discovers powerful enemies of time who will stop at nothing to recruit him for their own purposes.
title: Tempest

author: Dessen, Sarah
description: During the summer of her divorced father's remarriage and her sister's wedding, fifteen-year-old Haven comes into her own by letting go of the myths of the past.
title: That summer

author: Cornwell, Betsy
description: When Noah Gallagher and her sister, Lo, save a girl from drowning in the waters near their island home, they try to befriend the girl but soon learn she is hiding secrets about her family and her past -- secrets that would put Noah and Lo in danger.
title: Tides

author: Venkatraman, Padma
description: In India, a girl who excels at Bharatanatyam dance refuses to give up after losing a leg in an accident.
title: A time to dance

author: Brouwer, Sigmund
description: While investigating his grandfather's role in the Vietnam War, teen Jim Webb unearths a sinister cover up and is forced to go on the run in the Deep South with a Vietnam vet determined to help him expose the truth.
title: Tin soldier

author: Schraff, Anne E.
description: When a homeless man is found murdered, members of Chavez High begin to feel guilty for teasing the poor man only hours earlier, and are shocked when one of their own is implicated in the man's death.
title: To die for

author: McCafferty, Megan
description: On the first day of seventh grade, Jessica discovers she has remained largely the same while her friend has become cute and popular. Worried she will be left behind as he friend embarks on a new path, Jessie wonders what she should do and eventually learns the value of being oneself.
title: The (totally not) guaranteed guide to popularity, prettiness & perfection

author: Velâasquez, Gloria
description: Angry and troubled when his alcoholic father abandons the family, high school senior Tyrone gives up his plans to become an engineer, drops out of school, and takes a full-time job, refusing help from his girlfriend, school counselor, and a psychologist with problems of her own.
title: Tyrone's betrayal

author: Hillenbrand, Laura
description: A young adult adaptation of the account of American lieutenant Louis Zamperini's experiences as a prisoner of war during World War II after his plane crashed in the Pacific ocean and he was captured by the Japanese. Includes black-and-white photographs and a transcript of a conversation between author Lauren Hillenbrand and Zamperini.
title: Unbroken

author: Murray, Victoria Christopher
description: Fifteen-year-old Veronique's unhappiness at home increases her desire to find her father in New York, but when she goes there with her best friends, The Divas, and secretly meets someone who has been helping her online, she finds herself in real trouble.
title: Veronique

author: Meyer, Carolyn
description: Through diary entries, reveals the life of Britain's strong-willed and short-tempered Queen Victoria from the age of eight through her twenty-fourth birthday, up to her third wedding anniversary with her beloved Albert in 1843.
title: Victoria rebels

author: La Valley, Josanne
description: Life has been hard for fourteen-year-old Mehrigul, a member of the Uyghur tribal group scorned by the Chinese communist regime, so when an American offers to buy all the baskets she can make in three weeks, Mehrigul strives for a better future for herself and her family despite her father's opposition.
title: The vine basket

author: Messner, Kate
description: When four teens with similar head injuries wind up in a brain-science center in the Florida Everglades, they believe they are receiving treatment that will return their lives to normal. It soon becomes apparent that a top-secret experiment is changing them in unforeseen ways, and they must work together to escape the facility lest they lose themselves for good.
title: Wake up missing

author: Spinelli, Jerry
description: Cammie O'Reilly is an unusual kid with an even more unusual home life. She hangs out with a flamboyant black shoplifter named Boo Boo, her housekeeper is a sullen arsonist named Eloda Pupko, and she lives above the entrance of a prison where her dad is the warden. Trying to cope with the death of her mother, who died saving Cammie's life, causes Cammie to become a depressed, angry tween, driven mad by her life in prison. The more Cammie tries to figure out who she is, the more she spirals into depression, until someone close to her makes the ultimate sacrifice to free Cammie from her past.
title: The warden's daughter

author: Christopher, John
description: Fourteen-year-old Laurie and his family attempt to flee England when the Tripods descend from outer space and begin brainwashing everyone with their hypnotic Caps.
title: When the Tripods came

author: Struyk-Bonn, Christina
description: In a future society where anyone with a disability is killed or abandoned, Whisper, a girl with just such a disability, finds herself ripped from her relatively safe home in the forest and forced to work as a slave. Her only love is music, but soon she is sent to Purgatory Palace, where other societal rejects gather into a possible family.
title: Whisper

author: Beckhorn, Susan Williams
description: Kai, a boy living in prehistoric times, is outcast from his tribe due to a clubfoot. Raised by wolves, Kai proves he has value, and when he takes in an abandoned infant wolf, Kai saves her and brings her into the pack. Together they must survive a journey to find a place for themselves in the danger of winter.
title: The wolf's boy

author: Malone, Jen
description: After putting together some of the best parties of the summer, the girls of RSVP are hired to plan an important wedding but a hurricane threatens to ruin everything.
title: You're invited too

author: Higgins, Nadia
description: Leo's post about his strange neighbor on his zombie website gets Leo in big trouble. However, while he and Chad are trying to make things right, they discover a big secret that puts them in grave danger.
title: The zombie next door
